title: Amtrak Announces Rail Cutbacks in Northeast and Plan for Higher Fares
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Amtrak, the national rail passenger system, announced today that it would make major cutbacks in its Northeast Corridor area, eliminating an average of 22 trains a day of the 120 now serving such centers as New York, New Haven, Boston and Washington. The changes are to become effective Oct 30.

description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Aug. 31 (Reuters)The new Prime Minister of Bermuda, David Gibbons, has named to his cabinet four members of his United Bermuda party Who had instigated the unseating of his predecessor.

title: Tandy and Cronyn Play Gin for Money;
description: DESPITE THE FACT that Hume Cronyn and Jessica Tandy have worked together on stage for 35 years, they do not regard themselves as an acting couple; they are actors who sometimes work in tandem. In fact, some of their greatest successes have been achieved separately, such as Miss Tandy's original Blanche DuBois in A Streetcar Named Desire and Mr. Cronyn's Polonius in Richard Burton's Hamlet.

title: The Rag Rug Goes Urban
description: RAG rugs are upwardly mobile. Like wicker furniture and oak floors, they're moving from country homes into chic urban and suburban settings. A few decorators are in the vanguard, appreciating the earthy, functional look of the homespun product, and using it in contemporary as well as traditional rooms.

title: A Hartford Station Gives Prime Time To Public Comment
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 31A CBS affiliate in Hartford preempted all of its primetime broadcasting Monday night to conduct a threeandahalf hour program in which live audiences in three cities and home viewers offered their opinions of current problems in Connecticut and southern New England.

title: Iranian Oil Company Sets Target Of 70 Million Tons Crude Exports
description: TEHRAN, Aug. 31 (UPI)The National Iranian Oil Company announced today that it had set a target of 70 million tons for direct crude exports during 1977 to beat the decline in purchasing by traditional buyers and a continuing world market slump. Iran's direct sales abroad amounted to 55.4 million tons in 1976.

title: CITIBANK'S ROME BRANCH INVESTIGATING A FRAUD
description: ROME, Aug. 31 (Reuters)Citibank of New York said today that it was investigating a possible fraud of up to $3 million involving its Rome branch.

title: Alaska Oil in Panama Canal
description: BALBOA, Canal Zone, Aug. 31 (AP)The supertanker Washington Trader entered the Panama Canal today carrying 39,500 tons of oil from the terminal of the TransAlaska pipeline. The Panama Canal Company said that it expected tankers to bring 200,000 barrels a day through the canal to refineries in Gulf of Mexico ports.

title: ULSTER LEADERS APPLAUD CARTER'S PEACE APPEAL
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 31President Carter's carefully worded call yesterday for a peaceful settlement between Northern Ireland's Protestant majority and Roman Catholic minority has received a generally favorable but muted reaction here.

title: France Allots $1 Billion In AddedAid to Economy
description: PARIS, Aug. 31Faced with rising unemployment and a crucial parliamentary election next spring, the French Government of President Valery Giscard d'Estaing announced today its second package of expansionary economic measures this year.

title: Aide Says Carter Campaign Did Not Pay for 5 Flights
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP)The White House said today that the Carter campaign committee, through an oversight, failed to pay for rides by Jimmy Carter on corporate and stateowned planes on a campaign swing through the Carolinas in April 1975.

title: Screen: Love Package
description: YOU'RE VERY PRETTY," says the dazzlingly handsome man to the sweet young girl he has just brought home with him. "No I'm not," she replies shyly. "Yes you are," says he. "You don't have to say that," she counters. "I wouldn't say it if I didn't mean it," he wispers. Then they kiss, the strings swell and the camera very discreetly averts its eye.Amazingly enough, "You Light Up My Life" gets away with this kind of bushwah, and usually gets away with it in style. Joseph Brooks, who wrote, produced and directed the film, and also arranged, composed and conducted its score, has taken a number of conventtional, even cloying elements and scrambled them just enough to make things fresh and interesting, in a horrifyingly contemporary way. At its best, Mr. Brooks's film captures both the longing for and the infeasibility of romance in the world of show biz, a world so glossy that surface and substance are virtually interchangeable."You Light Up My Life" attempts to tell several stories at once, perhaps too many of them. Laurie, the girl (played very movingly by Didi Conn), is engaged to a stuffy, self-absorbed tennis instructor (Stephen Nathan) with whom she already seems to have a bad marriage, and part of the film is about the garish wedding they have planned. The bride and bridegroom will be hauled down the aisle inside a giant clam.Laurie's father (Joe Silver) is a borscht-belt comedian who has trained his daughter to follow in his footsteps, but during the course of the film she discovers she would be better off as a musician, the audience discovers this too, during an exceptionally touching sequence in which Laurie, having been summoned to audition for a movie that  coincidence of coincidences  is being directed by the same dazzling Lothario with whom she has had an affair, (Michael Zaslow), and she performs the title song. The number is an instant hit, and so is Laurie's unexpectedly full, throaty voice, which does not happen to be Miss Conn's own.Mr. Brooks's previous experience has been in composing orchestral-sounding commercials. (The "You've got a lot to live, and Pepsi's got a lot to give" was perhaps his best known). His songs have this same anthemlike sound. His experience with commercials has helped him to create, in the film's best moments, smart and talented people who have become so hopelessly adept at packaging themselves that they've lost track of what they're selling.Mr. Brooks isn't always this delicate; in fact, when he takes on the advertising business directly by parodying the ways in which commercials are made, he gets downright mean. But his film, though often too tangled and ambitious for its own good, benefits enormously from the uncommon innocence and vulnerability of Miss Conn's manner, the delightful eccentricity of her timing and the air of invincible hopefulness she brings to even the most heartbreaking of situations."You Light Up My Life" is rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), perhaps because, though in only one instance, the character played by Miss Conn goes pretty far on a first date. But the rating is misleading; she really isn't that type of girl.

title: 2 in Wisconsin Are Charged in Plot To Kill Husband With Cobra Venom
description: MADISON, Wis., Aug. 31 (UPI)The estranged wife of a wealthy businessman and a man she allegedly hired were charged today with plotting to kill the woman's husband with cobra venom so it would look like a heart attack.

McLean, chairman, said the move was taken because of reduced earnings caused by startup problems associated with the relocation of the Poison Rubber Company's principal manufacturing facility.

title: New Haven Water Granted Rise
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 31 (AP)The New Haven Water Company was granted state permission to raise its rates by $2.47 million, less than half of what the company had sought. The concern, which serves 90,000 customers in 12 New Havenarea communities, had sought a 28 percent increase, or $5.4 million. The rise approved by the Public Utilities Control Authority amounted to an increase of 12.6 percent in annual revenues.

title: Backgammon:
description: Barclay Cooke is widely respected as a senior member of the backgammon establishmentexpert player, backgammon author, backgammon teacher. He has been a backgammon enthusiast for more than 30 years, and is a regular player at New York's Racquet & Tennis Club. Although the game has, for some, become ruthlessly competitive in recent years, Cooke has remained an exemplary sportsman. He and his late son Walter once formed the most famous fatherson team in backgammon. Barclay is known for his steady, conservative playing style; Walter transformed traditional backgammon strategy with his bold, creative plays.

title: Hill Waived by Dolphins; Played 14 Years With Jets
description: MIAMI, Aug. 31 (AP)Winston Hill, former New York Jets offensive tackle, has been waived by the Miami Dolphins. Hill, traded to Miami this year after 14 years with the Jets, was released on waivers. Since he didn't make the team, the Jets won't receive a draft choice that was to be theirs in the conditional trade.

title: 3 Solid Black Composers Performed
description: THE CELEBRATION OF Black Composers moved to Avery Fisher Hall on Tuesday night, with Paul Freeman conducting the New York Philharmonic. This concert took a look at three composers, one active in the 18th century, one spanning the 18th and 19th, and one from the 19th.

title: Carter Names Arms Control Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (UPI)President Carter said today he would nominate Charles. R. Van Doren to be assistant director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency. Mr. Van Doren, 53 years old and acting assistant director for the NonProliferation Bureau, is to replace Amrom Katz, who has resigned.

title: EXCONVICT WHO SHOT SON TERRIFIED WIFE
description: EAST HARTFORD, Aug. 31Frank Daniel DeCorleto, the convicted murderer who killed his wife and 4yearold son and then committed suicide yesterday, had won custody of the child from a previous marriage because the child's mother was too afraid of him to fight for the boy, according to the lawyer who represented her in the custody fight.

title: Israel Agrees to Admit UNESCO Investigators To Occupied Territories
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 31 (AP)After a threeyear dispute, Israel has agreed to allow UNESCO to send a factfinding mission to Israelioccupied Arab territories to investigate cultural freedom among the Arabs. the Foreign Ministry said today.

title: USE OF U.S. JOB FUNDS BY CITIES IS STUDIED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Secretary of Labor Ray Marshall announced today that his department was investigating a number of cities, including New York, after finding that Chicago had illegally misused Federal public service employment funds.

title: U.S. Grants Will Aid Insulation Of 1,854 Homes in New Jersey
description: NEWARK, Aug. 31 (AP)A $721,000 Federal Energy Administration grant will enable 1,854 New Jersey families to insulate their homes, state officials said yesterday.

title: Notes on People
description: 'THEY MADE ME an offer I couldn't refuse, was the way Paul Conrad, whose acerbic political cartoons landed him on Richard M. Nixon's enemies list, explained his acceptance of an endowed lectureship at Whittier College, the former President's alma mater. Mr. Conrad, as a Nixon Scholar, will conduct an undergraduate seminar in the history, purpose and techniques of editorial cartooning from Sept. 7 to Oct. 5. Mr. Conrad, 53 years old, who has been on the staff of The Los Angeles Times since 1964, has won two Pulitzer Prizes. Whittier backers started the endowed lectureship in the 197273 academic year, when Mr. Nixon was President, to honor the 1934 graduate.

title: 2 Park Workers Penalized
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Aug. 31 (AP)  A Middlesex County park foreman and his soninlaw, also a park worker, have been suspended and demoted for misusing county material. The foreman, Edmund Pickering, was suspended for six months and demoted by two pay grades. His soninlaw, Joseph Ogonowsky, was suspended for 16 weeks and demoted by one pay grade.

title: People and Business
description: Representative Al Ullman, the chairman of the House taxwriting committee, suggested yesterday that if the slow economic recovery faltered, the nation might need a tax cut even more in the forthcoming attempt to overhaul the basic tax laws.

title: SUPPLIES OF GASOLINE OFF; DISTILLATE OIL STOCKS UP
description: Supplies of motor gasoline were down while stocks of distillate oil, used mainly for home heating purposes, increased significantly in the week ended Aug. 26, according to the latest weekly supply statistics released by the American Petroieum Institute.

title: Companies Call for Energy Action
description: Although a great many Americans remain skeptical of the energy problem's acuteness, blue ribbon corporate America is taking it seriously to the tune of $280,000.

title: The Shirred Look: Soft Edges in the Bathroom
description: WHILE A lucky few have the luxury of sunken tubs, skylit sinks and marblewalled bathrooms, many people have to deal with the reality of old plumbing and unsightly walls to match. For years, wallpaper has been the standard reaction to bathroom walls with tiles that stop four feet off the floor. But, perhaps because escalating costs of wallpaper and paperhanging (especially where lumpy walls are involved), or simply because of boredom, we are seeing a proliferation of shirredfabric camouflage on bathroom walls.

title: ExChief of Gambling Board to Run Hughes Casinos
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 31Philip P. Hannifin, Nevada's former chief gambling law enforcement officer, was named today to run the seven casinos and five hotels owned by the Howard R. Hughes estate. All but one of the establishments are in Nevada.

title: Ramirez and Cox Upset in U.S. Open
description: It was supposed to be Dullsville at Forest Hills yesterday. No Jimmy Connors. No Bjorn Borg. No Renee Richards. No sun.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP)The crew leader of a North Carolina farm labor camp and six of his assistants were indicted today on Federal charges of holding migrant workers in involuntary servitude and peonage.

title: Soviet Lofts Another Satellite
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 31 (UPI)The Soviet Union has launched another of its Molnia 1 communications network satellites into orbit. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said, that the latest satellite was placed into orbit yesterday and was aimed at insuring the operation of longrange telephone and telegraph radio communications as well as beaming programs of the central television of the U.S.S.R. to points cn the Orbita network in the extreme north, Siberia, Far East and central Asia.

title: Jersey Clinic to Counsel Men on Birth Control
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Aug. 31 (AP)A male reproductive health clinic will be opened here next month to counsel young men on responsible sexual attitudes.

title: Deaths
description: CARTONNettle, beloved wife of the late David, devoted and beloved mother of Dr. Charles and Phyllis Conlini, sister of Rose Livingston, grandmother of Laurie and Lisa Carton and Daniel and Steve Shapiro. Service Friday, 12:30 P.M. at The Riverside, 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: Oh Catches Up to Aaron at 755
description: TOKYO, Aug. 31 (Reuters)Sadaharu Oh hit his 755th career home run tonight to the delight of his fans who insist his feat equals Henry Aaron's major league home run record.

title: Money
description: Wednesday, August 31. 1977

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Excerpt, from The Fairy Doll Ballet, Bayer Etude No. 11, VillaLobos; Zampa Overture, Herold; Polonaise, Popper; Sinfonia in D, J. C. Bach.

title: EDWARD F. HUBER, LAWYER WITH NEW YORK FIRM, 71
description: Edward F. Huber, a public utility lawyer and the senior partner in the New York law firm of Huber Magill Lawrence & Farrell, died yesterday in Hartford. He was 71 years old and lived in Larchmont, N. Y., at 11 South Drive.

title: Australia's 2 Extra Races Attest to Yachting Fair Play
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 31The history of the America's Cup has in it many examples of the defender, the New York Yacht Club, ganging up on the challenger and making the competition unfair. That has changed in the last two decades with an easing of the rules and today the tide continued to turn.

title: Design Notebook
description: MY ADMIRATION for Waterside, the housing complex___of four towers atop a platform in the East River at___25th Street, has always been tempered___somewhat by the vast stretch of concrete in the towers' midst. It is a plaza,___obviously, but it is not what Waterside___needs, since its own harshness only___exaggerates the similarly rough qualities of Davis, Brody & Associates'___otherwise handsome towers. What the___place really needs is some landscaping.

title: APlant Foes Say Rise of Casinos Negate Study on Offshore Reactors
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 31Opponents of a plan to put the world's first floating nuclear power plant in the ocean here said today that studies on the safety and impact of the plant were not valid because they did not take into account the increased population that gambling casinos would bring here by the time a plant could go into operation in the next decade.

title: InterestRate Cut on City Bond Sale Buoys Paterson
description: PATERSON, Aug. 31Officials of this Passaic County community of 150,000 were elated today over a record $19.4 million bond sale yesterday at an interest rate of 5.65 percent.In the city's last bond sale in early 1974, the rate was 6.25 percent.

title: Nadjari's Candidacy in Primary Upheld by State Court of Appeals
description: ALBANY, Aug. 31The State Court of Appeals ruled today that Maurice H. Nadjari, who was dismissed as special prosecutor last year by Governor Carey, is eligible to run in the primary as a Republican candidate for District Attorney of Queens. The seven judges of the court, the state's highest, issued a brief unsigned memorandum affirming rulings favoring Mr. Nadjari made by lower courts.

title: Tallman, Trot Driver, Killed
description: James Tallman, a leading harness racing driver in the New York area, and his pilot, Dwayne Johnson, were killed yesterday morning when their plane crashed moments after taking off from the Westchester County Airport. Details on Page C3.

title: YONKERS COUNCIL ASKS SUIT AGAINST BEAME AND BANKS
description: YONKERS, Aug. 31The Yonkers City Council directed the city last night to bring a suit for damages against Mayor Beame, six New York City banks and others named in the recent Securities and Exchange Commission report cirticizing their actions in handling New York's fiscal crisis.

title: Poll Finds Doubt On Energy Crisis
description: Too few people believe the nation's energy problems are serious enoughand even fewer understand them well enough to provide broad support for the Administration's energy program.

title: Kurtz & Tarlow Win Account at Cuisinarts
description: Dick Tarlow and Donald Kurtz. who joined forces about two months ago to form Kurtz and Tarlow, were included among the 62 agencies that made a bid for the Cuisinarts food processor account over the last month. And having been informed last week by Cuisinarts Incthe American distributor of the Frenchmade product that has sold briskly in this country despite a high price tagthat it won the account, the pair are bubbling over with plans for a new magazine campaign.

title: BRITISH STOCKS RISE TO HIGHEST LEVELS SINCE JANUARY 1973
description: LONDON, Aug. 31British stock prices soared today to their highest levels since January 1973, with the widely followed Financial Times index piercing the 500 mark just before brokers began picking un their umbrellas to go home.

title: Late Selling Erases Increases in Prices on Soybean and Corn Futures
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 31 (AP)A late spurt of speculative selling erased substantial gains in soybean futures and dictated a slightly lower close on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: 1909 Map May Hold Part of Key to ThaiCambodian Border Clashes
description: BANGKOK. Thailand, Aug. 31An obscure 1909 map of the ThaiCambodian border may hold at least part of the key to the increasingly violent clashes between troops of the two countries in the volatile frontier region.

title: Levitt Doubts Need for Port Authority's SelfAudit on Expense Padding
description: Arthur Levitt, the New York State Comptroller, yesterday questioned the need for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to hire its own auditors at an unspecified cost for a study of possible expenseaccount padding by officials.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHILE I am always surprised to discover how unsophisticated some writers can be hundreds of years after such examples as, say, Shakespeare or John Donne, there are, on the other side, many who behave as if no one ever had a profound thought or a complex feeling earlier than yesterday. What Rollo May calls pseudoinnocence guarantees the originality of such writers. One might say that they are guilty of innocence.

title: New Lottery in Jersey Begins Next Wednesday; Will Offer More Prizes
description: TRENTON, Aug. 31A new 50cent weekly lottery ticket, replacing one of the early models that was introduced into New Jersey's legal lottery in November 1974. will en on sale next Wednesday.

title: Fifth Horseman for Peace in Ulster
description: With heartening courage, four leading American Catholic politicians have dared in recent months to speak out against the violence in Northern Ireland. On the eve of St. Patrick's Day, Governor Carey, Senators Moynihan and Kennedy and Speaker O'Neill urged IrishAmericans to stop sending money and arms to the Irish Republican Army. In April, from a platform in Dublin, Governor Carey went even further, denouncing one wing of the I.R.A. as nothing more than the Irish killers and the other wing as the Irish Marxists. All four have been subjected to strident criticism from those who remain passionate about a long history of oppression and discrimination; to some American supporters of the I.R.A., they are the four ignorant horsemen. But they are hardly ignorant, and how they have recruited a fifth to their side, a Baptist Sunday school teacher named Carter.

title: No Study by Carter Of Wages Seen Now
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (Reuters)The White House said today that President Carter was not studying possible voluntary wage and price standards. White House spokesman, Jody Powell, said: There is absolutely no such proposal being considered by the White House. The President has given no instruction to develop such standards.

title: Dock Payoffs Reported Found In Undercover Inquiry by F.B.I.
description: About two years ago, agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Miami obtained a court order to place a wiretap in the office of Joseph Teitelbaum, one of Miami's busiest shipping agents.

title: Werblin Role: Byrne Issue?
description: TRENTON, Aug. 31The announcement yesterday that David A. (Sonny) Werblin was a principal partner in a group that planned to build a $70 million gambling casinohotel on the Atlantic City Boardwalk could pose a serious political problem for Governor Byrne in his campaign for reelection. Mr. Werblin's position as chairman of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority that controls the Meadowlands Racetrack and Giants Stadium in East Rutherford resulted in sharp questioning o? Mr. Byrne at a news conference on whether there was a conflict of interest.

title: Rep. Quie to Run for Governor
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 31 (Reuters)United States Representative Albert H. Quie said today that he would seek the Republican nomination for Governor of Minnesota next year to run against the Democratic incumbent, Rudy Perpich. Mr. Quie, 54 years old, has served in Congress since 1958 from the First District of Minnesota.

title: Arafat and Gromyko End Talks; Criticize U.S. Mideast Stand
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 31 (AP)Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader, today ended three days of talks with Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko. A joint communique indirectly criticized United States mediation efforts in the Middle East.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 31The International Business Machines Company of Canada is negotiating a licensing arrangement with the Xerox Corporation that, if finally agreed, would permit I.B.M. to continue marketing copying machines that have been found to contain infringements on Xerox patents.

title: Sound
description: THE CURRENT BOOM IN cassette decksnow the fastestselling audio itemprompts me to expand my comments on these remarkable devices that have made home recording practical and commonplace. In addition to the basic performance factors discussed last week (frequency response, flutter and signaltonoise ratio) you should cast a critical eye on the operating features and conveniences of any particular model you may want to buy.

title: Deaths
description: BERNIERMilton, devoted husband of Yvonne, beloved father of Howard, Odette Penman, dear brother of Abe and Martha, adored grandfather. Services Thursday, 12:15 at Schwartz Bros. Forest Park Chapels, Queens Blvd. and 76th Rd., Forest Hills.

title: Federated Stores Consents To Order on Tris Garments
description: Federated Department Stores and the Consumer Products Safety Commission announced yesterday that they have agreed on a consent order settling the commission's complaint against Federated involving Tristreated children's garments. The chemical has been banned for use in clothing since a commission directive of last April.

title: GARDENING
description: ROLL UP your sleeves and set aside one precious day of the upcoming threeday weekend to tend the lawn. This will be the chance to set everything right if all the greenswards on the block are the envy of the neighborhood except yours.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: MontrealRalph Racine, Niagara Falls, Ontario, knocked out Jean Lapointe, Montreal, 3 rounds, lightweights; Vito Antuofermo, NewYork, knocked out Ramon Beras, Dominican Republic, 6, middleweights.

title: NEW FIGHTING IN LEBANON KILLS 10 AND INJURES 20
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 31In an outbreak of intense fighting today in southern Lebanon, 10 persons were killed and 20 were wounded, according to official Lebanese sources.

description: Arthur Levitt, the New York State Comptroller, yesterday questioned the need for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to hire its own auditors at an unspecified cost for a study of possible expenseaccount padding by officials.

title: U.S. Grand Jury Secretly Indicts Tongsun Park
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31Justice Department and Congressional sources said tonight that a Federal grand jury handed up a sealed indictment last Friday against Tongsun Park, who was allegedly the South Korean Government's principal agent in an influencebuying operation here.

title: Film: Buford Pusser Reprised
description: "FINAL CHAPTERWalking Tall" is the third film about Buford Pusser, the late Tennessee sheriff whose fight against moonshiners, backwoods pimps and bleeding-heart liberals provided the material for "Walking Tall" (1974) and "Part Two, Walking Tall" (1975).The new film, which opened yesterday at the Cinerama One and other theaters, is full of the desperation of the moviemakers who are perfectly aware that they've already used up all of the cinematic facts of Pusser's life but are unwilling to let a good thing go without getting the last bleeding buck out of it.This they do by having Buford (Bo Svenson) remembering (in flashback) how his wife was murdered in an ambush set for him (material covered in the first film) and by having him speak long, tear-stained monologues to his wife's tombstone to bring us up to date on what's gone before."Final Chapter," which was directed by Jack Starrett and written by Howard B. Kreitsek and Samuel A. Peeples, is a thin, tired movie even when the screen is awash in blood.It's the conceit of this movie that Buford didn't die in a simple accident of the fancy automobile he'd bought with money received from Hollywood for rights to his life, but that the car was sabotaged by underworld figures. The movie covers rather prissily Buford's great good fortune in selling his story to the movies. It's not the sort of thing that happens to most people and it makes this man-of-the-people suddenly too special to fit in with the image created in the first picture. Maybe that's why we are never told how much money he did make, though the writers don't hesitate to speculate (lamely, I think) about the circumstances surrounding his death in 1974.The writing, direction and acting are dreadful. The only reasons to acknowledge such a film at this length are that the first two movies were so popular and also one might now hope that this is the absolute end of the merchandising of Buford Pusser.

title: For City Council
description: With the Board of Estimate on one side and the State___Legislature on the other, the New York City Council has___little room to act although the recent City Charter revision may enlarge its scope. In the Sept. 8 primary, voters___will be nominating candidates to fill fouryear terms in___the 43seat Council. Of these, 33 represent specific districts (three of which overlap borough lines). Two___councilmen are elected at large from each borough; they___must represent different political parties. We offer here___some recommendations in races of more than usual___interest.

title: Another Count Dracula Flies Onto the Scene
description: Count Dracula may become the man theatergoers most love to hate this season.

title: U.D.C., Once Broke, Still Building Through a Financial Rescue Plan
description: In the two and a half years since the New York State Urban Development Corporation collapsed financiallyproviding a sort of curtain raiser for the New York City fiscal crisisthe state agency has been quietly working to complete its unfinished projects while also seeking modest involvement in new undertakings.

title: Construction Contracts
description: Construction contracts in July at $11.2 billion exceeded the value of contracts in July 1976 by only 1 percent despite a 32 percent gain in residential building, according to the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information System Company. Page D9.

title: A Tour of Chinese Dances
description: THE BEAUTIFUL BAIT was clearly a prophetic title for a brief selection of Chinese dances that was more appetizer than main course. Four young women under the direction of Alan Chow, himself an impressive performer, conducted a minitour through Chinese regional and classic dance at the fountain, Lincoln Center Plaza, Tuesday afternoon.

title: 171 Interdicto First on Belmont Turf
description: New York Racing Association officials learned again yesterday that attendance at Belmont Park can be made to mushroom if the price is right. They also discovered that a bigger turnout on a freeadmission day (to the grandstand) does not automatically mean much bigger betting.

description: HoHoKus, N. J.

title: Bureaucracy Friendly Foe To Predator
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP)The Government banned today the export of bobcat pelts, and as a result the small predator now has the distinction of having one Government agency trying to protect it while another is trying to kill it.

title: CONSTRUCTION VALUE IN JULY ROSE ONLY1%
description: July construction contracts at $11.2 billion were only 1 percent ahead of the value of contracts in July 1976 despite a 32 percent gain in residential building commitments, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: Advertising
description: After several years of study and effort, the American Hospital Association approved this week its first guidelines on the acceptable use of advertising.

title: Farmers Prices for Raw Products Fall 3% for Third Straight Decline
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP)The prices farmers get for raw products dropped 3 percent between July 15 and Aug. 15, the third consecutive monthly decline, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: H.C.POTTER,DIRECTOR OF PLAYS AND FILMS
description: H. C. Potter, tile director whose urbane wit characterized major films as well as plays on the Broadway stage for nearly 30 years, died yesterday after a brief illness. He was 73 years old and lived in recent years in New York City and Southampton, L.I.

title: About New york
description: The mayoral campaign veered pleasantly into metaphysics for a moment yesterday when Barry Farber owned up to his opponent's accusation of blowing smoke at the voters in the form of campaign rhetoric. Mr. Farber construed the accusation of State Senator Roy M. Goodman as a compliment and sought to state the question positively: What's wrong with blowing smoke?

title: Jury Rules in Jockey's Death
description: PASADENA, Calif., Aug. 31 (AP)A Superior Court jury has ruled that the family of Alvaro Pineda, a jockey killed at Santa Anita racetrack in January 1975, should not receive $25 million for his death. After a threemonth trial, the jury's verdict yesterday was 93 against the suit filed by Mrs. Donna Pineda, his widow. Pineda was 29 years old. Mrs. Pineda had charged the Los Angeles Turf Club and McHall Enterprises with the wrongful death of her husband.

title: 747 Engine Explodes, Debris Falls on L.I.
description: An engine on a Trans World Airlines Boeing 747 jetliner bound for Rome with 240 passengers exploded over Valley Stream, L.I., shortly after it took off last night, and forced the plane to return to Kennedy International Airport.

title: Events Today
description: NEW YORK CITY OPERA, New York State Theater, Lincoln Center, Pucclnl's Turandot, 8.

title: Anheuser Plans Use Of Sun in Brewing
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 31 (AP)AnheuserBusch Inc., the nation's leading beer producer, says it will soon become the first brewery in the country to use solar energy in its beermaking process.

Home Beat

title: For Renee, the Number Is 3
description: Renee Richards will he playing tennis in Forest Hills stadium today against the Wimbledon champion, Virginia Wade, but she's been there before. Or at least Richard Raskind was there in 1960 against Neale Fraser, then the Wimbledon men's clrmoion. Richard Raskind lost that openinground match, 60, 61, 61, and Neale Fraser, now the Austmlian Davis Cup captain, recalls, The only thing I remember about that match is that there wasn't anything in hisher grme that could hurt me. I wasn't concerned about winning. And now Renee Richards, the transsexual, will be playing the Wimbledon women's champion. Most unofficial oddsmal:crs at the United States Open doubt that 43yearold Renee Richards will win more than three games over two sets with Vir?inia Wademake the number 3 if you want to avoid a push. But there are those, including Neale Fraser, who cons:der Virginia Wade the most nervous player cn circuit.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: New Jersey may not have enough natural gas for another severe winter, but the cost of fuel is not likely to rise, according to a forecast yesterday by State Energy Commissioner Joel R. Jacobson and I. David Bufkin, president of the Texas Eastern Gas Pipeline Company.

title: HelpWanted Index At 3Year Record
description: A helpwanted advertising index issued by the Conference Board rose in July to 121 percent of the 1967 average, the highest in three and a half years, the board reported yesterday.

description: One of the strange truths about the investment business is that Wall Street stockbrokers use both technical and fundamental analysts and that hardly anyone is surprised when they disagree as they often do.

title: Hers
description: MANY PEOPLE have found it necessary in these last weeks to say something profound about the death of Elvis Presley. I am just as anxious to say something profound as the next person, but a frantic search has turned up nothing, which would not be the case with my friend Katie O'Reilly, wherever she is.

title: Some on Gulf Coast Flee Homes as Hurricane Nears
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 31The slow but relentless buildup of Hurricane Anita in the Gulf of Mexico sent thousands of Louisiana and Texas Gulf Coast residents fleeing to higher ground today in anticipation of the storm's assault on the coastline.

title: Scenes and Echoes of Torture in Brazil
description: ALTAMONT, N.Y.Its has become widely accepted that the violation of human rights in Brazil has greatly diminished; that in comparison with other LatinAmerican countries the problem in Brazil is mild and unworthy of exerted critical attention; that the Brazilian Government's pronouncement banning the use of torture, together with the renewal of friendly relations between the United States and Brazil, have provided a secure, normal climate for continued economic growth and corporate investment.

title: Korchnoi Seeks Chess Match With Fischer
description: Victor Korchnoi, a Soviet defector who is the world's No. 2 ranked chess player, showed up at the 100th birthday party of the Manhattan Chess Club yesterday and announced he would soon go to California to arrange a match with Bobby Fischer, who vanished from public view shortly after winning the world championship in 1972.

title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from all major retail outlets; singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: Tito First Foreigner To Visit Mao's Tomb
description: PEKING, Aug. 31 (Reuters)President Tito of Yugoslavia, once branded a traitor to Communism by China, today became the first foreigner to visit the Mao Tsetung Mausoleum.

title: Reverse English in Bridgeport
description: David Gonzalez, a native of Puerto Rico who has been welfare director of Bridgeport, Conn., for about a year, has issued a directive ordering all ablebodied nonEnglishspeaking welfare recipients to enroll in free English classes or lose their welfare checks. Mr. Gonzalez claims to have the power to withhold welfare payments from anyone who refuses to take the steps necessary to qualify for a job. Connecticut welfare authorities have questioned the legality of his order, and a number of civil rights organizations have threatened to take action against it.

title: Midwest Rains Bringing Relief To Grain Areas
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 31Good, soilsoaking rains throughout most of the Middle West have brought relief to droughtstricken farms in the nation's major graingrowing region and have stored enough moisture in the subsoil to promise a good beginning for next year's crops.

title: Disks: Maddox Brothers And Rose in Their Glory
description: The Maddox Brothers and Rose rated less than a paragraph in Bill Malone's compendious Country Music U.S.A., but their importance should be reflected more adequately in books that follow the release of these records. Drawing on both commercial recordings and radio broadcast transcriptions, Rose Maddox and Arhoolie's Chris Strachwitz have assembled two impressive albums that document the uniquely wideranging music of the Maddox Brothers and Rose during their glory years. 194651.

title: B'nai Torah Receives Order To Show Prosecutor Its Books
description: B'nai Torah Institute, which is under investigation by the Federal Departments of Labor, Agriculture, and Justice in connection with its operation of federally financed food and job programs, was ordered yesterday to turn over its records by a judge in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

title: Meadowlands Commission Charged With Delaying Passaic Sewage Plant
description: NEWARK, Aug. 31 (AP)A local contractor has charged the Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission with delaying construction of a plant to treat wastes being dumped in Newark Bay.

title: AUTONOMY PLANNED___FOR U. S. RADIO UNIT
