title: Yonkers Drivers
SOVIET TRADE WITH WEST IS FOUND STILL DECLINING
description: LONDON, Aug. 31 (UPI)The Soviet Union's trade with the West is still declining, official figures showed.

title: Hanging of Birdman in Bronx Pet Shop BreakIn Is Being Investigated
description: It's like Agatha Christie, said Pat Sasso, the detective working on the murder of the birdman, who was found hanged in a dilapidated pet shop in the Morrisania section of the Bronx, his hands and feet tied with twine.

title: 42d Street's Future Taking Shape As Building of Theater Row Starts
description: A group of urban visionaries sees at some future date a rivertoriver trolley service, a yearround farmers' market and a dance center among the amenities that they hope will restore some of the old elegance and excitement to West 42d Street.

title: BEAME THREATENING ACTION AGAINST S.E.C.
description: Mayor Beame demanded yesterday that the Securities and Exchange Commission release its findings on the 1975 default of New York State's Urban Development Corporation and threatened to go to court if the commission refused.

title: The Standings
description: Thursday. September 1. 1977

title: Lyrics for Soviet Anthem Revised, So People No Longer Have to Hum
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 31, (AP)Soviet citizens who have had to hum their national anthem for 20 years because the words contained heroic references to Stalin can sing It again. Mention of the disgraced dictator has been excised from the new lyrics.

title: Dollar Gains Slightly Against Swiss Franc and the Yen
description: The dollar weakened in most foreign exchange trading yesterday, but gained slightly against the Japanese yen and the sturdy Swiss franc, the Associated Press reported.

title: Key Voting District Seems to Be Talking About Koch
description: Just before 8 A.M., the cars prowl, their drivers searching the interstices in Manhattan's peculiar patchwork of noparking zones.

title: Holmes Rides 4 Winners At Southampton Show
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 31John Holmes of Lagrangeville, N.Y., who can handle both hunters and jumpers, was aboard the winners of four classes today at the Southampton Horse Show. He piloted Marked Card to three victories in events for fox chasers and Ace In The Hole to one triumph in a preliminary jumper class.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NOW'S THE TIME The fall music season is officially on, with the beginning of the New York City Opera's 11week program. Tickets are gone for performances of Die Fledermaus tomorrow and Sunday nights. But seats are still available this first wek for a cluster of perennial favorites in the Italian repertory, with some new leading singers and a conductor who is making his American debut.

title: RUMORS POPE MAY RETIRE LAID TO VATICAN RIFTS
description: ROME, Aug. 31  Italian newspapers suggested today that the source of a wave of rumors that Pope Paul VI might resign on his 80th birthday, on Sept. 26, or a few weeks or months thereafter, should be sought in the Vatican and in the Roman Catholic hierarchy.

title: TV Show for Elderly to Start Nov. 14
description: THE ELDERLY and the young are age groups that make up television's most devoted audience, but while there are numerous programs designed for children on both commercial and public television, there have not in recent times been any, on an ambitious scale, directed expressly at the concerns and interests of the older population.

title: Dandy Digs at College: A Space of One's Own
description: SEPTEMBER will once again find college students hammering, painting, wiring and generally recreating all the comforts of homenot to mention a bathtub in the bedroom or even a roller coaster.

title: New President of Cyprus
description: The Greek Cypriot who became acting leader of Cyprus upon the death of Archbishop Makarios Aug. 3 took office yesterday as President of the island republic and appealed for the support of the entire people. But Turkish Cypriots, who control onethird of the island with the aid of occupying Turkish troops, had said in advance that they would not recognize the new President as leader of the entire country.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 1, 1977

title: KabukiArrivesAndIt's Grand
description: Kabuki Arrives  And It's Grand

title: Home Repair Clinic
description: Q. I have an old brick house and the north wall leaks in a heavy rain. A water repellent paint has been applied, but apparently has not solved the problem. What is the best way to treat this wall? Can aluminum siding be applied?Dr, J.C.S., Bayonne, N.J.

title: Connecticut Toughens Its Stand on Jai Alai
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn.,Aug. 31 (AP) The State Gaming Commission toughened its position on jai alai today, saying that one arena made too much money and that the names of prospective buyers of another must be made public.

title: Astros Raise Mets Loss Streak to Seven
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 31The New York Mets completed a totally imperfect 07 road trip and the Houston Astros finished a perfect 70 home stand as Houston prevailed, 52, tonight in the Astrodome.

title: Surgery on Poor Is Found Higher
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31A Congressional study of people receiving Medicaid benefits has found that surgery is performed on the needy and the nearpoor at twice the rate of surgery on the general population. For some forms of elective surgery, for conditions that are not lifethreatening, the disparity was found to be even greater.

title: 3Way Race Confuses Pittsburgh Mayoral Campaign
description: PITTSBURGHThe trash baskets on___city streets are no longer littered with___the motto For Pete's Sake, referring___to Mayor Peter F. Flaherty, who left___here last spring to become Deputy Attorney General in Washington.

title: BENEFITS TO FILIPINOS BY V.A. TERMED HIGH
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 (AP)Congress was told today that thousands of Filipinos who served in or with United States armed forces lived a life of luxury in the Philippines on Veterans Administration benefits.

title: Gravelle Key to New Giants Line Shifts
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Aug. 31 Gordon Gravelle, who had to cut his first class in ccounting management at Duquesne University, was studying the Giants playbook instead tonight while Jay Fry was pondering what to do with his new offensive tackle.

title: MONEY ORDER COMPANY WILL REPAY INDIVIDUALS
description: NEWARK, Sept. 1 (AP)  universal Money Order Company, which went bankrupt owing more than $13 million to certificate holders in 46 states, will repay individuals in full, according to George Weisz, the attorney for the concern's receiver in New York.

title: The Hippocratic Oath Hasn't Been Amended,
description: Fifteen years ago, the distinguished anthropologist Margaret Mead addressed the Rudolph Virchow Medical Society on the importance of the Hippooratic Oath to society and to the practice of medicine. Before Hippocrates, Dr. Mead pointed out, the hapless patient could never be certain, when he hired a doctor for some white magic, that one of his enemies had not paid to dispatch him with black magic. Confidence in and reverence for the physician dates from the historic separation of the power to kill and the power to cure stated clearly and concisely in the Hippocratic Oath.

title: Italian Who Headed Earthquake Relief Resigns in Rising Scandal
description: ROME, Sept. 1The Government's former special commissioner for disaster relief in the region struck by an earthquake last year resigned today from the Cabinet in a widening corruption scandal.

title: Cuisine: Bernstein's FourCourse Suite
description: FOUR RECIPES for voice and piano? Now first you take 11 pounds of juicy Concord grapes . . .  sings the tenor, his tone preciso e senza espressione, or rather grim, according to Leonard Bernstein's score for a plum pudding recipe.

title: One Day In a City's Life
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 For the people who have to govern this country, and even for those who have to report and analyze the news, the events of the last day of August 1977 around here were almost enough to make you think that life is a little complicated. For example, on this one day:

title: Abundant Blues, Weakfish Sweet Rewards for Anglers
description: AREA AYou cant miss, it's like fishing in an aquarium, said Ralph Stork of Capt. Andy's Marina about the healthy run of blufish and weakfish in the Avalon Shoals at Margate, N.J. Between Buoy 2 and Sea Isle Lumps, the hot spot, one fisherman this week caught 42 weakfish and Tom Gallagher of Longport, N.J., pulled in a 23pound blue. From Brigantine to Cape May, inlets are abounding with summer fluke. Plug fishermen at Island Beach State Park are taking 7to18pound striped bass in the predawn hours. In Barnegat Bay, between Cedar Creek and forked River, weakfish and small blues have been plentiful. Blues in the 8to14pound range have been abundant on the Ridge to chumming fishermen.

title: Shift to Long Dry Era in World Climate Now Doubted
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 1The popular view that world climate is shifting to an unusually long dry era has now been largely disavowed by most climate experts.

title: Antiques
description: BRITAIN'S CELEBRATION of Queen Elizabeth II's silver jubilee, has spawned a number of art events, not the least of which is the Faberge exhibition on view (through Oct. 23) at London's Victoria and Albert Museum.

title: Medtronic Loses Bid to Prevent ExEmployee From Joining Rival
description: Medtronic Inc., the leading manufacturer of pacemakers, conceded defeat yesterday in its court fight in Minneapolis to keep one of its former employees from going to work for Cardiac Pacemakers, Inc., a smaller rival.

title: Newark Subway Cuts Fare to Dime on Part of Line
description: NEWARK, Sept. 1Grumbling and repeated glances at watches gave way to smiles and even a brief cheer this morning when more than 100 people at the Penn Station stop of the Newark subway system learned the cause of the car's failure to arrive on time.

title: Timed Misquoted Carey
description: An article and a headline in The Times yesterday incorrectly quoted Governor Carey as saying Mayor Beame lacked the integrity to run the city during the 197475 fiscal crisis. Mr. Carey's actual words were: I did my utmost to find in the incumbent the kind of leadership our city needed. For whatever reason, it wasn't there.

title: Berkowitz Termed Aware but Emotionally Dead
description: David R. Berkowitz, the man accused of being the 44caliber killer, was described yesterday in a small section of a confidential psychiatric report as being well aware of the six murders and seven attemptedmurder charges against him in Brooklyn, the Bronx and Queens.

title: Miss Wade Beats Dr. Richards By 61, 64;Chris Evert Gains
description: The jury is still out on Bjorn Borg and Jimmy Connors, but the verdict was clear on Dr. Renee Richards and Chris Evert yesterday at the United States Open tennis championships.

title: County Colleges Are Urged to Aid Unqualified, Yet Keep Standards
description: NEWARK, Sept. 1Dr. T. Edward Hollander, the state's new Chancellor of Higher Education, said today that while county colleges should admit all high school graduates they should not lower their standards by insuring that all graduate from the colleges.

title: NOW's President: I Definitely See the Movement Coming of Age
description: WASHINGTONLife is full of small awakenings, some more rude and vivid than others, and here are a few of Eleanor Cutri Smeals: keeping score for her father's boys' baseball team when she was a girl and realizing years later how much she had yearned to play instead; watching her Neopolitan mother hit a boiling point when people would ask why good money was being wasted on sending a girl child to college; making Phi Beta Kappa at Duke and being dissuaded from attending law school; spending a year bedridden after the birth of her second child and mulling over the reasons why so many women have chronic illnesses; going to a bridge party one night to discover that every young suburban matron in the room was on tranquilizers except her.

title: Money
description: Thursday, September 1, 1977

title: Bomb Found in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 1 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation found an unexploded bomb in the citys Nob Hill section early today after a search of the exclusive neighborhood touched off by a terrorist group's assertion that it had planted the device. It was the second time in four days that the New World Liberation Front took responsibility for leaving a bomb in the San Francisca Bay area.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Declines 4.2%
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week was an estimated 15.6 billion tonmiles, off 4.2 percent from the yearearlier level. Strikes in the coal and ironore industries were considered primary factors in the decline. The A.A.R. also reported that carloadings in the same period totaled 452,067 cars, down 6.9 percent from last year.

title: Wildcat Strikes Imperil U. M.W., Coal Chief Says
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., Sept. 1This year could mark the beginning of the end of a national coal labor agreement unless a way is found to eliminate wildcat strikes by miners, Joseph P. Brennan, the president of Bituminous Coal Operators Association, said today.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
description: For period ended July 31 unless otherwise indicated.

title: Federal Reserve Statement
LANCE'S BANK FUNDS UNDER NEW SCRUTINY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Federal bank examiners are investigating whether Budget Director Bert Lance has exceeded his bank balances in a series of checks moved recently between two Georgia banks in which he was formerly an officer. Government officials said tonight.

title: A Former Nixon Aide to Help Farber in His Drive for Mayor
description: Ken W. Clawson, who served as director of communications for former President Richard M. Nixon during his last year in office, has joined the mayoral campaign of Barry Farber, a spokesman for Mr. Farber said last night.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: SAN FRANCISCOIt appears that large families have something to teach small families. They teach them how to argue.

title: Letters
description: To WEEKEND:

title: Study Says Power Dam in Maine Would Damage the Environment
description: BOSTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)Flooding the St. John River in northern Maine to build a hydroelectric dam would cause great harm to the environment, a longawaited study said today.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: HISTORY IS its own reward in Flemington, N.J., though George Washington never slept there, and the major confrontation with history of this rural Hunterdon County crossroads was clothed in notorietyas the site of the crowded 1935 trial of Bruno Richard Hauptmann, the Germanborn carpenter from the Bronx, who was sentenced to death for the kidnapmurder of the Charles A. Lindbergh baby.

title: Howard A. Leipzig Marries Terry F. Silbert, a Student
description: The marriage of Terry F. Silbert, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Silbert, to Howard A. Leipzig, son of Fred Leipzig of Lauder Hills, Fla., and Shirley Raiken of Irvington, N.J., took place yesterday. Rabbi Judah Nadich performed the ceremony at the St. Moritz Hotel.

title: Piarcik Takes One Giant Step: Given Starting Role Against Jets
description: Another side to that intriguing hopeful quarterback of the Giants, Joe Pisarcik, was revealed yesterday by none other than the Jets quarterback, Richard Todd

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: Below 42d Street

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York State's jobless rate for July increased by 0.2 percent to 8.5 percent, according to the State Labor Department, but the rate represents a 2.1 percent drop from the July 1976 level of 10.6 percent.

title: Television
The SelfIsolation of the P.L.O.
description: The gingerly courtship dance between the United States and the Palestine Liberation Organization is over for the moment, and perhaps longer. the P.L.O.'s governing council has refused, despite Western and Saudi efforts, to accept United Nations Resolution 242 affirming the rights of all Middle East statesincluding Israelto live in peace. But that rejection does not mean Washington should now do what the present Israeli Government clearly wants it to do: pretend that there is no real Palestinian issue.

title: JUSTICE REFUSES TO BAR ORDER AGAINST TRADERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)Associate Justice Harry A. Blackmun of the Supreme Court refused today to block a court order said to be forcing out of business a company trading in commodities options on the London market.

title: Pop: Tropea Band At Bottom Line
description: Only in New York City could a group like the John Tropea band have been assembled for a brief run at a club like the Bottom Line. Mr. Tropea is a guitarist with extensive studio experience who also has been heard live with Deodato, the Brazilian jazzrocker, and Laura Nyro. Lately he has been recording jazztinged funk instrumentals of his own for the Marlin label, and his performance at the Bottom Line on Wednesday was intended to support these efforts.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (Reuters)Britain's air.traffic control assistants went on indefinite strike today after three of them were suspended for refusing to work at a normal pace.

title: Court Says Stuyvesant High School Can Bar Student Sex Questionnaire.
description: A sharply divided Federal appeals court ruled yesterday that school authorities could prohibit a student newspaper from conducting a survey of the sexual attitudes at Stuyvesant High School in. Manhattan.

title: Panel in House Pressing Korea To Help Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Investigators for the House ethics committee, led by its special counsel, Leon A. Jaworski, have started an effort to persuade the South Korean Government to cooperate with their inquiry into the Korean influendebuying scandal here, Congressional officials said today.

title: Major League Scores
description: DPBoston 2. LOBCleveland 5, Boston 8. 2BCarbo 2, Lynn, Burleson. Yastrzemski. SBYastrzemski. SDoyle. SFCarty.

title: Opera: Starting With Mefistofele
description: The New York City Opera and, in effect, the fall music season opened at the State Theater on Wednesday evening, when the company presented the Mefistofele of Amigo Boiti.

title: Pro Transactions
description: SEATTLE (AL)Activated Tom House, Rick Jones, lefthanded pitchers.

title: Brooklyn Beams Again as Youths Bring Home a Baseball Pennant
description: With unabashed pride and a touch of nostalgia, 300 fans, parents and dignitaries paid tribute yesterday to Brooklyn's first championship baseball team since the Dodgers copped the National League pennant in 1956 and two years later defected to the West.

title: Democratic Mayoral Foes Hold Acrimonious Debate
New Face: James Naughton
description: ONE NIGHT during his junior year at Brown University. James Naughton, class of 67, who had already flirted with the idea of a career in medicine or the law but opted for English while amassing expertise in pool, bridge and crossword puzzles, was on his way to the library to study for an exam.

title: Ethel Waters Is Dead at 80
description: Ethel Waters, the singer and actress whose talents took her from honkytonk night spots to Broadway, into motion pictures and on to radio and television, died yesterday, apparently of kidney and heart failure. She was 80 years old and lived an Chatsworth, Calif., with friends in whose home she died.

title: Film Festival Gains Bunuel and Pasolini
description: That Obscure Object of Destiny, the most recent film by the revered Spanish director Luis Bunuel, will be the closing attraction of the 15th New York Film Festival at Avery Fisher Hall on Oct. 9, it was announced by Martin E. Segal, president of the Film Society of Lincoln Center. Fernando Rey, a leading player in many Bunuel films, is the star, portraying a 50yearold man hopelessly in love with a young woman, whom he sees as a feminine Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde. In accordance with her split personality, Bunuel has the character played by two actresses, with her voice provided by yet a third.

title: Labor Dept. Yields On Foreign Labor For Apple Harvest
description: RICHMOND, Sept. 1(AP)The United States Labor Department said today that it had complied with the order of a Federal judge to certify the importation of 5,000 foreign workers to harvest the nation's apple crop.

title: Art People
description: DOWNTOWN Hartford will never be the same again, now that Carl Andre has got through installing an environmental sculpture called Stone Field on a patch of grassland adjoining the Center Church.

title: Braves Get Archibald,Knight in Trade
description: Some of the biggest names in pro basketball moved yesterday.

title: About Real Estate
description: Historically the posture of the Federal Government has been passive once it has insured the loans that have built thousands of privately owned apartments around the country. It stands back while management runs the project and pays off the loan to the private, insured lender.

title: Merrill Lynch Plans Distribution To Investors in Failed Company
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith agreed yesterday to distribute $1.4 million among a class of investors who bought stock in a nowbankrupt sales concern, the Scientific Control Corporation.

title: 4 BOND DEALERS SETTLE FRAUD CHARGES BY S.E.C.
description: Four bond dealers with a Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Government securities firm have settled charges brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission that they used highpressure, fraudulent methods to sell Governmentbacked mortgage securities, S.E.C. officials said yesterday.

title: Around the Nation
description: ATLANTA, Sept 1 (UPI)  Federal health officials today received help form the Army in their search for 3,153 persons associated with a 1957 nuclear test in the Nevada desert. They are trying to determine if any of them have contracted leukemia as a result of the radiation.

title: Advertising
description: The biggest advertising spender in the writing instrument field is Flair and the biggest part of its spending is taking place right now at backtoschool time.

title: REPORT ON U.S. ARMS RAISES CONTROVERSY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1A controversial study that paints a bleak portrait of United States defenses has emerged as the focus of an emotional debate involving Congress and the Pentagon.

title: Surge in Sales by Retailers Helps To Lift Dow 3.37 as Trading Lags
description: The stock market, encouraged by news of a surge in retail sales, advanced moderately yesterday, in slower trading.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: For Jean Rouch, the French film maker, ethnology is poetry. A pioneer in the use of the portable, 16millimeter camera, Mr. Rouch has walked through Africa catching a multitude of anonymous lives on film. In Jaguar, one of his earliest documentaries, he follows men leaving their homeland near the Sahara Desert to seek their fortunes on the Gold Coast. The New York Visual Anthropology Center, 99 Prince Street, is opening a monthlong Friday series of anthropological films tonight with Jaguar, which will be seen at 7 and 9 o'clock. Admission is by contribution. Information: 5642654. .

title: The Pop Life
description: PATTI LABELLE goes back a long way. First there was Patti LaBelle and the Bluebells. That turned into Labelle, the spaceage female soul trio with the exaggerated, futuristic costumes and a tough, hardrocking image. But for all its occasional singles success (e.g., Lady Marmalade) and its strong cult following, Labelle never really made it in significant commercial terms. Which, for all the talk of the need for individual artistic fulfillment, must be one of the main reasons the group broke up late last year.

title: Boulmetis Named a Steward
description: Sam Boulmetis, a former jockey, will represent the New Jersey State Racing Commission as steward when the Meadowlands opens a 100night thoroughbred meeting Tuesday night. The other stewards named for the East Rutherford track's first flat meeting are Richard Lawrenson and John Rotz, another former rider. Boulmetis, who retired in 1966 after riding 19 years, won 2.783 races and $15,425,953 in purses.

title: Cool Harbor Cruises For the Holiday
description: Growing numbers of New Yorkers have been escaping summer miseries and getting new perspectives by stepping off the tip of Manhattanonto decks, that is, and under sail.

title: Newark Subway  Cuts Fare on Part of Line
description: NEWARK, Sept. 1Grumbling and repeated glances at watches gave way to smiles and even a brief cheer this morning when more than 100 people at the Penn Station stop of the Newark subway system learned the cause of';the car's failure to arrive on time.

title: Oh Fails to Surpass Aaron
description: TOKYO,Sept. 1 (UPI)Sadaharu Oh failed to break Hank Aaron's record for most home runs in a career tonight but his Central Leagueleading Yomiuri Giants routed the Taiyo Whales, 42, beforee a crowd of 50,000 persons at Korakuen Stadium here. Most spectators were at the stadium hoping to see the 37yearold first baseman set a record by hitting his 756th homer of his 19th year in Japanese professional baseball. Oh belted his 39th homer of this season last night to match Aaron's record of 755 homers.

title: Management
description: A management consultant believes troubled times for big companies have produced heightened sensitivity to perils of business disaster. Page D5.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: If you want to see a tiger in its natural setting, think twice before rushing off to India. The trip is expensive and arduous, and in the end you are far from likely to find one. There are now fewer than 2,000 tigers left in all that vast subcontinent and they are extremely hard to spot in a bamboo thicket. Go to the new Wild Asia exhibit in the Bronx Zoo instead.

title: Restaurants
description: IN MANY WAYS, the two restaurants reviewed today have a great deal in common, although they are virtually at opposite ends of town. Both are run by young people and are fresh and casual in tone. Both feature bright, clean and airy decors and staffs that are friendly, efficient and accommodating, if informal. And both offer moderateprice food basically Continental and American, but with original and innovative touches that reflect the youthful trend toward natural foods. And while in both of them the food is pleasantly satisfying and respectably decent, the innovative touches are too frequently just a little offkey.

title: Jenkins Excels at Southampton Horse Show
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Sept. 1Rodney Jenkins dominated the openjumper competition by riding three of the first five finishers today at the Southampton horse show.

title: Ethel Waters Is Dead at 80
description: Ethel Waters, the singer and actress whose talents took her from honkytonk night spots to Broadway, into motion pictures and on to radio and television, died yesterday, apparently of kidney and heart failure. She was 80 years old and lived in Chatsworth, Calif., with friends in whose home she died.

title: LANGUAGE LAW FACES DEFIANCE IN QUEBEC
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 1A new provincial law aimed at promoting the primacy of the French language in Quebec has touched off unrest in northern Eskimo communities and defiance by some school boards elsewhere in the province.

title: Democratic Mayoral Rivals Hold Debate Filled With Recriminations
description: Pointing up the personality issue in the mayoral primary campaign, Demoratic candidates attacked one another's integrity, honesty and qualifications yesterday in a debate that often slipped into fingerjabbing shouting matches.

title: Notes on People
description: Indira Gandhi, India's former Prime Minister, has applied for a passport to lecture abroad, but her successor, Morarji Desai, said yesterday that she may not be given permission to leave the country. It is not easy to give a passport while investigations are going on, said Mr. Desai, referring to investigations of alleged illegal activities and political excesses in Mrs. Gandhi's 19month emergency rule. Several of her former aides were arrested last month on charges of official corruption. Mrs. Gandhi turned in her diplomatic passport when she left office but now wants to accept speaking dates in the United States and elsewhere

title: Preseason Football
description: San Diego at Los Angeles.

title: U.S. AND JAPAN AGREE ON TOKYO'S OPENING OF ATOM FUEL PLANT
description: TOKYO, Sept. 1The United States and Japan today announced basic agreement on plans to allow the Japanese to open a nuclear fuel reprocessing plant that the Carter Administration had originally opposed as part of its policy to curb the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: Waltrip Wins Pole DARLINGTON S.C., Sept. 1 (UPI)
description: Darrell Waltrip drove his Chevrolet today to the fastest qualifying speed to claim the pole for Monday's Southern 500 stock car race. Waltrip averaged 153.493 miles an hour round the nation's oldest superspeedway. He won the Rebel 500 at Darlington earlier this year.

title: 2 Californians in Final
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Sept. 1 (AP) Earl Burt of Paradise, Calif., defeated Jaime Vergara of Chile, 5 and 4, and Frank Hardison of Laguna Beach, Calif., beat John Andersson of Sweden, 1 up, today to advance to the final of the 18th World Senior golf tournament.

title: Belmont Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions.

title: Music: Black Composers Vocal Works
description: THE NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC, in planning its Celebration of Black Composers, a fiveday event that closes tonight at Avery Fisher Hall, seems to this observer to have gone wrong in a number of ways, most of them admittedly debatable and matters of personal taste. There can be little argument, however, on one point: the Auditorium of the Lincoln Center Library of the Performing Arts was a poor choice for twofifths of the concerts in the series.

title: A Movie Production in Bay Ridge Goes Like a House Afire
description: The flames raged almost until dawn yesterday at 558 50th Street, in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. Sirens screamed, firemen fought the blaze, police officers held back the spectators and ambulances stood by to carry away the injured. But there was no panic and hardly any anxiety, and when some fiery debris fell from the fourstory brick building there was even be a scattering of applause from the crowd. A movie was being made,

title: Time to Start Saving the Soil
description: We are accustomed to think of soil destruction as a problem confronting other lands and other times: the inexorable spread of the Sahara Desert, the parching of lands in India, the American Dust Bowl of the 1930's. But as a United Nations conference in Nairobi, Kenya, begins to assess the global problem of the loss of arable lands, it is sobering to note that even in this country, the reputed world leader in modern agricultural practices, the land is eroding away.

title: Beach Boys Turn Central Park Into California Dreamin
description: The Beach Boys turned Central Park's Great Lawn into a bit of California dreamin on a hot, muggy latesummer New York afternoon yesterday. The police variously estimatedthe crowd at between 75,000 and 150,000.

title: COST PER NASSAU PUPIL PUT AT $3,100 A GRADE
description: MINEOLA, LI.,Sept. 1 (APNassau County Executive, Ralph Casa, says the average cost of putting a youngster through one grade in a county grammar school matches the annual tuition of an Ivy League college. He says the cost per pupil is $3.100.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: World Psychiatrists Vote To Censure Soviet Abuse; Moscow Charges Slander
description: HONOLULU, Sept. 1 (AP)The General Assembly of the World Psychiatric Association voted today to censure the Soviet Union on charges of abuse of psychiatry for political purposes and to establish a committee to review such practices in any country.

title: U.S. Agency Gets an Arts Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Transportation Secretary Brock Adams today announced a new policy to encourage greater use of design and the arts to enhance the nation's transportation systems.

title: U.S. Sets Heating Rule for Precooked Roast Beef
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The Department of Agriculture ordered processors of precooked roast beef today to heat the meat to at least 145 degrees Fahrenheit to prevent the growth of salmonella bacteria, which have caused six outbreaks of food poisoning, including two in upstate New York.

title: Agnew Set Back in Suit Over Alleged Bribe Funds
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Sept. 1A yearold taxpayers lawsuit seeking restitution to the state treasury from former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew and two other persons for substantial sums allegedly paid them as bribes by Maryland contractors has won crucial procedural support in a state court here.

title: Ethel Waters, Singer and Actress On Stage and Screen, Dies at 80
description: Continued From Page A1

title: Jazz: Gillespie at the Gate
description: In the echoing cavern at the bottom of the Village Gate, where Dizzy Gillespie's Quartet Plus One is appearing. the group is largely buried in its own reverberations. Although Mr. Gillespie's open trumpet bursts out of the surrounding rumble and bumble from time to time, the typical colors and shading of his playing come through clearly only in the more subdued moments when he puts a mute in his upturned trumpet and gently picks his way through melodic lines or rhythmic riffs.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times reported incorrectly Wednesday that corporate defendants convicted in a Federal court in Baltimore of conspiring to fix retail gasoline prices were subject to penalties established by 1974 amendments to the Federal antitrust laws, and that the charges were felonies. The charges were misdemeanors, the activities having occurred before the amendments became law.

title: Scope of Coolidge's Research
description: Dr. Coolidge's research included computations of atomic and molecular structure, adsorption of vapors by charcoal and the electrostatic theory of colloids.

title: China Reversing Education Policy To Improve the Quality of Schools
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 1Peking's new leaders have begun to reverse many of the late Mao Tsetung's radical education reforms as part of a broad program to improve the quality of China's schools and provide a basis for the country's rapid economic modernization.

title: Of Beame, Blame and ShouldHaveDones
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Were I voting in New York next week, I would be for Abe Beame, but just after Barry Farber and all the other candidates, and just before the Buckleyeither brother, or bothwritein movement. But I have trouble blaming the Mayor for his frantic and dissimulative efforts to find money for the city payrolls in 197475, as the Securities and Exchange Commission has now told in such splendid detail.

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday

title: Big Board Assails S.E.C.'s Plan To Drop OffFloor Trading Rules
description: The New York Stock Exchange has charged the Securities and Exchange Commission with ignoring the intent of Congress in proposing the elimination of exchange rules dealing with offfloor trading.

title: EASING OF INFLATION SEEN IN SMALL RISE FOR AUGUST PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The Government today signaled a further abatement of inflation when the Labor Department reported that the Wholesale Price Index, which anticipates what shoppers will pay, rose in August by a slight onetenth of 1 percent.

title: Yanks Hit Road as Days Dwindle Down
description: Baseball turned into its final full month yesterday with everybody bracing for the homestretch of a season that began in Aprilthe sprinting Yankees en route to Minnesota and eight games on the road, the stumbling Mets back in New York for eight at home and Jerry Grote headed for LosAngeles and somebody else's pennant race.

title: Women Call for Combat Service
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (AP)Leaders of women's organizations appealed to Congress today for more jobs for women in the armed forces, saying that economies and increased military effectiveness could result.

title: Charles Merz: 18931977
description: The name of Charles Merz was not well known to readers of this newspaper but his words were. For more than 30 years, from before the New Deal until the New Frontier, he was one of the small band who wrote the anonymous editorials on this page. From 1938 to 1961, he was the Editorial Page Editor, responsible for every word and every opinion that appeared here.

title: For Children
description: Whaling Museum

title: Union Says Car Insurers Put AccidentFree Drivers Into AssignedRisk Pool
description: A union representing the 900 Allstate Insurance Company's agents in New York State charged at a State Senate hearing yesterday that large insurance companies are forcing mny drivers with clean records into New York's assignedrisk pool, where they may pay 50 percent more in premiums for less coverage than they could get in the voluntary insurance market.

title: ISRAELI SAID TO URGE MORE SETTLEMENTS
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 1An Israeli Government minister has reportedly prepared a security plan for the occupied West Bank that would involve surrounding what are considered to be Arab trouble areas with new Jewish urban and rural settlements.

title: Monmouth
description: Horses listed In order of Post positions

title: 2,716 Women at NBC To Share Bias Award
description: NBC has agreed to an affirmativeaction hiring program and will award $540,000 in back pay as part of the settlement of a discrimination suit by female employees. The back pay ranges from $1,336 to $35,174 for 16 women who originally brought suit, and either $1,000 or $500 each for 2,700 others as a result of the suit's having become a class action.

title: TV Rivals Using Ads To Promote New Season
description: THE CLASH of primetime specials next Tuesday night, signaling the opening of the new television season, may have consequences beyond the issue of which of the three rivals will have the fastest start in this year's ratings contest.

title: League Leaders
description: By The Associated Press (Based on 300 or more at bats.)

title: Bridge:
description: The traditional Labor Day tournament of the Greater New York Bridge Association will paradoxically stop short of Labor Day this year.

title: National Democratic Chief Backs Byrne, Minimizes Bateman's Lead in the Polls
description: TRENTON, Sept. 1  The national Democratic chairman, Kenneth M. Curtis, said today that Governor Byrnewho was 10 percentage points behind his Republican opponent for Governor, State Senator Raymond H. Bateman, in the latest poll by the Eagleton Institutewas In good shape politically and should be reelected

title: 2 Transfers to Hofstra And St. John's Ineligible
description: Henry Hollingsworth and Reggie Carter, who have left the University of Hawaii and returned to the New York area to play basketball for Hofstra and St. John's University, respectively, will be ineligible for the first half of the coming season.

title: Dance Kicks Up Its Heels In Park Again
description: FROM TAP TO TOE, the shape of this year's New York Dance Festival in Central Park promises more variety than ever. With tonight's opening 8 P.M. at the openair Delacorte Theater, the popular annual festival starts a 10day run that will present dancers as different from one another as the Rockettes and soloists from the Joffrev Ballet.

title: No Comment From Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 1The South Korean Government had no comment today on reports from Washington that Tongsun Park had .been indicted by a Federal grand jury.

title: Motorcyclists Indicted in Drug Case
description: TRENTON, Sept. 1Thirtyone persons associated with two motorcycle gangs, one from New Jersey and the other from Delaware, have been indicted on drug charges the state's Attorney General, William F. Hyland. said today.

title: Beame Agrees: Carey Had a Right to Say It
description: The question involved the political politeness of a Governor's involving himself in a New York City mayoral campaign.

title: Harnett Makes Point With Few Believers
description: I would like to point out one thing, Joel Harnett announced yesterday during the debate at The Times. I am not a politician.

title: Publishing: Going to Moscow Book Fair
description: AMERICAN PUBLISHERS who will attend the first Moscow International Book Fair, which begins next Tuesday, will be there as exhibitors and observers and are hopeful that their presence will lead to a growing exchange of books and ideas.

title: Bridgeport Kills Rule on English In Relief Cases
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.,Sept. 1This city's welfare director said today that he has resoinded his order denying welfare checks to ablebodied, nonEnglishspeaking welfare recipients who refused to take courses in English.

title: The Standings
description: Friday, September 2, 1977

title: Deaths
description: ADELSophie Miller, beloved mother of Dr. Harold N. Adel and Samuel Adel and beloved granumoiner of Vickie, Lori, Paul and Daniel. Services at I. J. Morris, 1895 Fla?bush Ave., Bdooklyn at 11 A.M. Sep,. 2, 191?.

title: Sagner to Discuss Agency's Commitments to State
description: TRENTON, Sept. 1The head of a State Assembly committee said today that Alan Sagner, chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, had agreed to meet with the panel to discus the authority's. commitments to public transportation in New Jersey.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Storms Again Rake Midwest
description: By United Press International

title: Corporation Affairs
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 1 (AP)Sunkist Growers contended today that a Federal Trade Commission complaint against the citrus producer was counter to Congressional policy encouraging cooperative marketing.

title: Albert S. Coolidge, at 83; Helped Establish Theory Of Quantum Mathematics
description: CONCORD, Mass., Sept. 1 (UPI)Dr. Albert Sprague Coolidge, the chemist and physicist who helped prove quantum mechanics theories and who was also a founder of Americans for Democratic Action, died yesterday. He was 83 years old.

title: Pastor a Charlatan to Some, a Philosopher to Wife
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Sept. 1No matter what others say, to his wife, Jim Jones is a Marxist social philosopher and pastor to whom service to my fellow man is the highest service to God.

title: On the Mark For Fire I. Marathon
description: Close to 500 runners are expected to compete tomorrow at 5 P.M. in the first minimarathon to be held on Fire Island Registration for the race, which will cover 5.3 miles along the beach, ends at 8 P.M. tonight. There is an entry fee of $4.

title: New Soviet Arms Deal Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon Sept 1 (Reuters)Diplomatic sources here said today that the Soviet Union had agreed to supply Ethiopia's military rulers with 48 advanced MIG jet fighters and large consignments of tanks and missiles under a $385million accord.

title: Jill Kornberg Is Married To Peter Simon Shaerf
description: Jill Carrie Kornberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Kornberg of New York, was married at the Regency Hotel last evening to Peter Simon Shaerf, son of Mrs. Leonard Selby of London and the late Dr. David Shaerf. Rabbi Emanuel Rackman performed the ceremony.

title: F.D.I.C. PLANNING STUDY OF BANKS TO LAST A YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation announced today it is to undertake a yearlong study of state and Federal regulation of the nation's 14,700 commercial banks.

title: TV Weekend: Tennis Marathon
description: THE UNITED STATES Open Tennis Championships are under way, at the West Side Tennis Club in Queens, and between now and Sept. 11 CBS will offer 27 hours of coverage, more than double last year's total.

title: Dutch Block Ad Saying Soft Drinks Offer Refreshment From Heaven
description: THE HAGUE, Sept. 1 (UPI)The Dutch Advertising Council today prohibited television spot promoting a soft drink as a refreshing cooling from heaven.

title: Crane Raises Offer for Chemetron To Block Merger With Allegheny
description: The pursuit of the Chemetron Corporation quickened yesterday when the company announced that it had reached a tentative agreement to merge with Allegheny Ludlum Industries Inc. by exchanging securities. The Crane Company responded by increasing its cash offer for Chemetron's common from $40 to $48 per share.

title: NAVY PICKS SIKORSKY, INSTEAD OF VERTOL, FOR ANTISUB COPTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The Navy today selected the Sikorsky Aircraft division of the United Technologies Corporation at Stratford, Conn., to build 200 new helicopters for antisubmarine combat.

title: Speculation Raises Soybean Prices
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 1 (AP)A late wave of speculative buying propelled most soybean futures nearly 5 cents higher after a rather listless session on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed In order of post positions. Letter designates call listing

title: Tennis
description: WOMEN'S JERSEY CLAY COURT Singles Semifinals

description: FIRST ROUND

title: In Memoriam
description: CLAYMANIda. By beloved grandmother. In everlasting memory. MARK. FIORILLOCarmela. Dear Mom, happy birthday In Heaven. Mass and prayers offered. Your loving children.

title: U.S. Envoy in Caribbean Post
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (Reuters)President Carter today appointed Frank Ortiz, who is Ambassador to Barbados and Grenada, to the additional post of special representative to Antigua, Dominica, St. ChristopherNevisAnguilla, St. Lucia and St. Vincent.

title: New Face: Annette O'Toole
description: When Annette O'Toole tried out for the part of a desperately competitive beauty contestant in the 1975 movie Smile, she was asked to fill out a Junior Miss pageant questionnaire, listing, among other things, her special talents. Miss O'Toole wrote that she did impressions, including one of a dead cockroach

title: U.S. Drops Arms Plan for Somalia
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (AP)The United States has decided, in a reversal, not to provide military assistance to Somalia.

title: Panel in House Pressing Korea To Help Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Investigators for the House ethics committee, led by its special counsel, Leon A. Jaworski, have started an effort to persuade the South Korean Government to cooperate with their inquiry into the Korean influencebuying scandal here, Congressional officials said today.

title: Morey, 58, Sander Gain At Amateur
description: NEWTON SQUARE, Pa., Sept. 1 (UPI) Dale Morey, the oldest player in the tournament, ousted 22yearold James Holmes on the 20th hole today to advance to the third round of the United States Amateur golf championship.

title: Arranger for Rhapsody in Black
description: In a way, it's anticlimactic. Leon Thompson will stand before the New York Philharmonic Orchestra in Avery Fisher Hall tonight to conduct the final program in the weeklong Celebration of Black Composers.

title: Report That Carter Used Unsecured Loans to Fund Campaign Denied by Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The White House said today that the only unsecured loan President Carter used in his 1976 campaign was a $100,000 loan obtained on Mr. Carter's signature against a net worth of $600,000 and at competitive interest rates.

title: California Divers Resume Harvest Of Abalone, a Vanishing Delicacy
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 1Before dawn today, a flotilla of small boats left their shelter along the California coast and by sunup, hundreds of divers were scouring the sea in search of abalone, a delicate white shellfish that, to the despair of many Californians, has become increasingly scarce.

title: Ford Chief Admits Mistake In Failure to Recall Autos
description: DEARBORN, Mich., Sept. 1Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, said today that because of a regrettable mistake, Ford failed for four years to recall 424,000 of its 1972model cars that posed what proved to be a serious safety hazard. One death and 11 injuries were linked to the defect between the time it was discovered in 1973 and the recall was finally made last June.

title: ISRAELI SAID TO URGE MORE SETTLEMENTS
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 1An Israeli Government minister has reportedly prepared a security plan for the occupied West Bank that would involve surrounding what are considered to be Arab trouble areas with new Jewish urban and rural settlements.

title: Stevenson Is Improving
description: HAVANA, Sept. 1 (Reuters)Teofilo Stevenson, the 25yearold Cuban Olympic boxing champion badly burned in a domestic accident last Saturday, was in an improved condition today in a Havana hospital, a hospital spokesman said.

title: Kabuki: Drama From Japan
description: Japanese legend has it that the world was once without sun when, as a result of a family quarrel. Amaterasu, the Sun Goddess, retreated into the Rock Cave of Heaven and refused to come out. Gifts were offered and songs were sung at the mouth of the cave, but the goddess remained within. At length, Amenouzumenomikoto, the heavenalarmingfemaleaugustness, lifted her skirts in a raucous, bawdy dance outside the cave. At the sound of the gods laughter, Amaterasu peered out and Ler light was once more restored to the world.

title: T. M. Bancroft Jr. Weds Barbara Wiedemann
description: The marriage of Barbara Symmers Wiedemann to Thomas Moore Bancroft Jr. took place at the River Club yesterday. The Rev. W. Raymond Webster, associate rector of St. James Episcopal Church performed the ceremony.

title: Upstate Village to Hold Outdoor Art Festival
description: Main Street in Roxbury, N.Y., an upstate village with a population of 600, will be lined with paintings, sculptures, photographs and handcrafted items this weekend, and artisans will demonstrate wood sculpture and pot throwing at an outdoon art festival

title: At the Movies
description: THIS IS the best script I've read since The Touch,  beamed Elliot Gould, whipping up joyful noise about Curtis Hanson's The Silent Partner, a romantic chiller now shooting in Toronto under the direction of Daryl Duke, the Canadian who delivered the laudable but unlucrative Payday. In The Silent Partner, which he likes to think of as Hitchcockian in tone, the politely rebellious, woollyhaired actor will portray a mousey bank teller who turns to crime, outslicks a psychopathic robberplayed by Christopher Plummerand lives illicitly ever after with his boss's adventurous mistress, Susannah York.

title: Excerpts From the Debate Among Democrats Seeking the Nomination for Mayor
description: Following are excerpts from yesterday's debate between the seven Democratic mayoral candidates Bella S. Abzug, Representative Herman Badillo, Mayor Beaune, Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo, Joel Harnett, Representative Edward I. Koch and Borough President Percy B. Sutton of Manhattan. The questions were asked by editors and reporters of The New York Times.

title: Injuries Fail to Hinder Borg and Connors
description: Bjorn Borg was so concerned about his injured right shoulder that he mentioned the possibility of default, but Jimmy Connors said his bad back won't prevent him from playing as the United States Open's top two male players yesterday breezed through their firstround matches. After each had posted straightset victories, they were scheduled to play secondround matches today.

title: The U.N.Today
Rhodesia Peace Plan: Maneuver Around Premier Smith
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 1The BritishAmerican plan for a settlement in Rhodesia, details of which were released today, attempts to work around Prime Minister Ian D. Smith. The proposals were put forward by the British Foreign Secretary,

title: Scholarly U.S. Diplomat
description: In describing Lyle Lane, who opened Washington's first permanent diplomatic mission in Havana in 16 years yesterday, colleagues and friends spoke foremost of his discretion.

title: In a Glass Cage With Renee
description: All around Renee Richards, people were staring her as they have for more than a year, as they always will. They had stared as she walked from the Tudor clubhouse of the West Side Tennis Club toward Forest Hills Stadium; they had stared as she lost to Virginia Wade, the Wimbledon victor, 61, 64, in the opening round the United States Open women's championships; they had stared as she left the court; they had stared as she disappeared into the women's locker room. And now they

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY. SEPTEMBER 1. 1977

title: NEW CONSTRUCTION IN JULY BILLION BELOW JUNE RATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)The annual rate of new construction during July totaled $170.7 billion, slightly below the June level, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Aid in Looting Is Near Completion
description: Workmen all but fell over one another yesterday in a rush to install a new storefront at Radio Clinic, a discount appliance store at Broadway and 98th Street, that was badly damaged by looters during the July blackout.

title: Dollar Is Slightly Higher Against Yen and Mixed In European Trading
description: The dollar was slightly higher against the Japanese yen and mixed against major West European currencies in slow foreign exchange trading yesterday, The Associated Press reported.

title: 17 British Tridents Grounded
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (Reuters)British Airways said today that 17 of its 25plane fleet of Trident jets had been grounded, 14 because of cracks in the wings. The others have been found to be more seriously affected than at first believed, the stateowned airline said. Repairs may now take up to three weeks, the airline said.

title: Market Place
description: Twentyfour days ago today the MillerWohl Company, a leading women's specialty store chain, disclosed that a private company, then unnamed, had offered to pay $50 a shareor $162 millionfor all MillerWohl stock.

title: Rungers. Penn State Get Head Start on College Football Season Tonight at Meadowlands
description: Neither Joe Paterno of Penn State nor Frank Burns of Rutgers is happy about starting the football season tonight, in the earliest seasonopening game since Rutgers and Princeton started the idea of college football in 1869.

title: CBS Gets Laurel Turf Classic
description: The $200,000 Washington D. C. International will be televised by CBS for the next three years, the network and Laurel Race Course announced yesterday. The 1 1/2mile thoroughbred horse race, which will be contested on the track's grass course by an outstanding, field, including Seattle Slew and Forego, will be run Saturday, Nov.5.

title: Gasoline Plentiful for Holiday
description: WASHINGTON,Sept. 1 (UPI)Motorists will find gasoline plentiful over the long Labor Day holiday weekend and cheaper than it was over the Fourth of July weekend, an American Automobile Association survey indicated today. The association said a survey of 3,910 service stations around the country indicated that gasoline prices had dropped onehalf to ninetenths of a cent a gallon in the last two months.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Bridgeport Police Now Describe Deaths Of Two Girls, 2 and 5, as Rape and Murder
description: BRIDGEPORT, Sept.1The police said today that they were following up several leads in the rape and murder of two little girls whose bodies were found in an unused refrigerator on Monday night.
