description: SOUTHAMPTON

title: Eritrean Says Victory Is Near
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Sept. 1A spokesman for the Eritrean People's Liberation Front said today that the secessionist rebels wore near victory in their struggle against Ethiopian occupation and for national independence.

title: Moves by a PreNasser Politician For a Tory Party Worries Cairo
description: CAIRO, Sept. 1  An Egyptian who was a leader of the nation's principal conservative party before King Farouk was deposed in 1952 announced plans last week for a new political organization, and concern has been growing in official circles ever since.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Imported Beef Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (Reuters)The Department of Agriculture gave imported Australian beef a satisfactory rating today, attributing the salmonella outbreaks to domestic processing procedures. Some reports had said the infection came from imports.

title: EASING OF INFLATION SEEN IN SMALL RISE FOR AUGUST PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The Government today signaled a further abatement of inflation when the Labor Department reported that the Wholesale Price Index, rose in August by a slight onetenth of percent.

title: Filipino Airport Tax Soars
description: MANILA, Sept. 1 (AP)Filipinos expecting to make use of President Ferdinand E. Marcos's decision to let them travel abroad found themselves unexpectedly facing a 400 percent increase in the airport tax today.

title: Books: No Gossamer Wings
description: I S ALL ON THE RECORD, both in print and on vinyl. As composer and lyricist of Night and Day, Begin the Beguine, Let's Do It, What Is This Thing Called Love?, Love for Sale, Just One of Those Things and the score of Kiss Me, Kate, not to mention I Get a Kick Out of You, Get Out of Town,

title: It's Yesteryear Time Again
description: Remember the last line of King Kong?

title: BASIC MONEY SUPPLY DROPS $100 MILLION
description: The nation's basic money supply declined $100 million in the week ended Aug. 24, causing a modest slowing down in its rate of growth for the second consecutive week.

title: Dance: Senta Driver
description: SENTA DRIVER'S dances are flagrantly nontheatrical in the traditional sense and quite unrepentantly brainy. They are formidable, but linger in the imagination for longer than most smiling and cuddly dances do. One thinks of them as conceptual statements, delivered in an emphaticmovement style that forges ahead with a nononsense stride. Her newest work, Running the Course, was given its first performance in the spacious rotunda of the U.S. Customs House Wednesday afternoon by her distinctively named company, Harry.

title: Tito and Top Leaders in Peking Confer on Improved Relationship
description: PEKING, Sept. 1 (Reuters)President Tito had another long round of talks with Chinese leaders here today that, it was said, concentrated on the establishment of closer relations.

title: Assessment Gloomy On German Economy
description: BONN, Sept. 1 (Reuters)The West German Economics Ministry today issued a gloomy assessment of the country's economic performance so far this year.

title: Times Misquoted Carey
description: An article and a headline on page 1 in The Times yesterday incorrectly quoted Governor Carey as saying Mayor Beame lacked the integrity to run the city during the 197475 fiscal crisis. Mr. Carey's actual words were: I did my utmost to find in the incumbent the kind of leadership our city needed. For whatever reason, it wasn't there.

title: North Mexico Braces for Anita As Hurricane Shifts Southward
description: BROWNSVILLE, Texas, Sept. 1Hurricane Anita, generating winds of more than 150 miles an hour, veered away from this southernmost Texas city late tonight and headed for an earlymorning landfall about a hundred miles to the south on Mexico's sparsely populated Gulf Coast.

title: Management
description: Sweet are the uses of adversity. Marvin Schiller, a management consultant, believes that troubled times for big companies have produced a heightened sensitivity to the danger of being overtaken by business disaster

title: Commodity Spot Price Index Off 0.3 to 200.9 in the Latest Week
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 200.9 from 201.2 last week.

title: Rights Group Cites Beame for Bias In Failing to Rehire Policewomen
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union charged yesterday that Mayor Beame's administration in rehiring laidoff police officers, was leaving vacant 11 positions rather than fill them with laidoff policewomen.

title: In Connecticut, a Fair for the Books
description: Tennis players will head for the courts this weekend, swimmers the beaches, fishermen the streams, dozers the shade of a tree. But book lovers can spend a bibliophile's holiday by journeying to Redding, Conn., where tomorrow, Sunday and Monday, the annual Labor Day Weekend Book Fair for the benefit of the Mark Twain Library will be held.

title: Garbage Collectors on Strike on L.I.
description: MELVILLE, L.I., Sept. 1Garbage collection at thousands of Long Island businesses, mostly in Nassau County, was disrupted today as 300 employees of 80 private carting concerns went on strike.

title: Comptroller May Ask Reports on Overdrafts
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)The office of the Comptroller of the Currency, in light of the Bert Lance case, soon may take the very unusual action of asking the 4,700 national banks it regulates to spell, out their policies on overdrafts, it was learned today.

title: New Bond Issues
Blind Man, 87, Regains His Vision After Getting Corneal Transplants
description: An 87yearold man who had been blind for 15 years has received corneal transplants in both eyes at Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn.

title: Energy Off The Rails
description: When the Senate gets back to work after its summer recess, it will take up an Administration energy program that the American people apparently do not believe is necessary. That's the sad conclusion to be drawn from a New York Times/CBS poll in which 57 percent of the respondents said they did not believe the energy situation was as bad as President Carter said it was, and 49 percent suggested that the crisis was only a plot to get higher prices for oil and gas companies.

title: A Wedding Suit
description: HAYS, Kan., Sept. 1 (UPI)Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Weilert oppose the wedding of their daughter so strongly that theyare filing a $10,000 suit to have their names removed from the wedding invitations. It is not likely, however, that the suit will come to court until after the wedding, scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Ashland Oil's Option to Buy Stock Of Commonwealth Is Extended
description: An agreement has been signed extending Ashland Oil Inc.'s option to purchase $50 million of the Commonwealth Oil Refining Company's preferred stock to Sept. 30.

title: Carter Family's Peanut Business Is Taken Over by Farm Cooperative
description: PLAINS, Ga., Sept. 1 (UPI)Gold Kist Inc., an Atlantabased farmers cooperative, officially took over management of President Carter's family peanut warehousine business today.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Pop Music: Buzzy Linhart In Pursuit of Ecstasy
description: It is possible for a performer to expend too much energy onstage. Nowadays laid back performing, a style which is offen associated with the environs of Los Angeles, and the carefully calculated frenzies of Mick Jagger and Bruce Springsteen are the two poles of the pop music norm but there was a time, ten years or so ago, when a more extreme performing style was in flower.

title: Woman Is Near Perfect On Guess of Brock Mark
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 1 (AP)A woman deputy city sheriff has won a St. Louis Cardinals contest by guessing the exact minute, as well as the exact inning and exact date, that Lou Brock stole his record 893d base.

title: Reserve Report
description: *Seasonally Adjusted.

title: AffirmativeAction Order by Carey Exceeded Authority, Court Says
description: Governor Carey exceeded his authority in requiring affirmative action by contractors to insure equal job opportunities on state projects, a State Supreme Court justice has ruled.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: If You're Not Going Away on Labor Day. . .
description: WHAT, you're not going out of town this weekend? You're going to let the Labor Day exodus fend for itself on this last gasp of summer? Well, you should have no ground for regrets. On this long weekend, New York slumbersin New York terms, of courseand Lower Manhattan can be a tourist haven for the New Yorker who wants to turn sightseer when nobody else is looking.

title: Golf
Art: The Glories That Were France
description: THE COLLECTION of Henry P. Mcllhenny is known the world over for its perspicuous foraging among the paintings, drawings and sculptures that France produced in such glorious abundance between 1750 and 1950. Last seen in public in its entirety just 15 years ago in San Francisco, the collection is now on view through Sept. 18 at the Allentown Art Museum in Allentown, Pa.; and for anyone who cares about French art it would be hard to imagine a better day's outing, from New York. Allentown is a two hours drive from Manhattan. The museum is open from 10 A.M. to 5 P.M., Tuesday through Saturday, and from 1 to 5 P.M. on Sundays. It is closed Mondays.

title: News Summary
description: Tokyo and Washington reached an agreement that would allow Japan to open a nuclear fuel reprocessing plant that the Carter Administration had opposed in keeping with its policy of curbing the spread of nuclear weapons. The United States provides the enriched uranium that is used in Japanese nuclear power plants and has had a virtual veto over the use of the spent fuel that would be used in the reprocessing plant. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: U.S. and Cuban Missions Opened In a Step to Resuming Relations
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The United States and Cuba restored today a modest portion of the official relations that were broken off in anger 16 years and eight months ago.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: New Finance Minister in Angola
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (Reuters)President Agostino Neto of Angola has appointed the National Bank Governor, Ismael Gaspar Martins, as Finance Minister, the Angolan news agency reported today. Thesince former Minister, Dr. Saydi Mingas, and several other leaders of the ruling Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola were killed in an unsuccessful coup May 27.

title: Forest Hills Merchants Fear Move Of Tennis Open May Ace Them Out
description: For 353 days a year, one needs a road map and a Sherpa guide to find the tennis books at the Marboro Books outlet on Continental Avenue in Forest Hills. But for the 12 days of the United States Open tennis championships, Solomon Rajendran, the store manager, gets them down from the far right wall and puts them into the front window for display. He has his reasons.

title: BANKERS DENOUNCE SOME LANCE MOVES
description: A number of Bert Lance's banking practices fell outside the limits of customary or even ethically acceptable behavior, according to bankers and financial executives who were asked in a spot check to assess the embattled budget director's performance as a Georgia banker.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: ONE OF THESE DAYS Frank Herbert's head is going to fall off, while he is sitting at his typewriter, and roll away looking for some shade. It is a hot and heavy head, containing multitudes, time warps, frog gods, sand worms, talking stars and extraterrestrial theories of justice. It is programmed for feverish invention, permanent dreaming. It seems to have seen everything and forgotten nothing, past and future, and to be equally at home among the abstractions of physics and the shrieks of the id. Mr. Herbert might have given his head a vacation after recently completing the quite wonderful Dune trilogy. But no. He is back, with his 19th book, to confound us again.

title: U.S RETAIL CHAINS POST BIG INCREASES FOR AUGUST SALES
description: Continued strong consumer buying directed toward backtoschool apparel and the fall fashions, helped most of the nation's major retail chain stores post doubledigit sales gains in August over the corresponding month a year ago.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 2, 1977

title: Eastern League
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: People and Business
description: George L. Shinn, 54 years old, chairman of the board of First Boston Inc. and its subsidiary, the First Boston Corporation, was elected yesterday to the board of directors of the New York Stock Exchange. He will be one of the 10 securities industry representatives on the 20member board.

title: U.S. AND JAPAN AGREE ON TOKYO'S OPENING OF ATOM FUEL PLANT
description: TOKYO. Sept. 1The United States and Japan today announced basic agreement on plans to allow the Japanese to open a nuclear fuel reprocessing plant that the Carter Administration had originally opposed as part of its policy to curb the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: Mexico's Leader Says Economy Improves but Problems Persist
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 1President Jose Lopez Portillo said today that Mexico was slowly emerging from its 12monthold economic crisis, although he warned that per capita income would fall this Year and that unemployment would continue to rise in the coming months.

title: BANKERS DENOUNCE SOME LANCE MOVES
description: A number of Bert Lance's banking practices fell outside the limits of customary or even ethically acceptable behavior, according to bankers and financial executives who were asked in a spot check to assess the embattled budget director's performance as a Georgia banker.

title: U.S. Jury Action on Congressmen In Park Inquiry Is Expected Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1The Justice Department is expected to follow up soon on its sealed indictment of Park Tong Sun with the indictment of at least one and possibly several former members of Congress, officials familiar with the investigation said today.

title: JULY MUTUAL FUND SALES DOWN FROM JUNE LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)Sales of conventional mutual funds in July totaled $573 million, down from June's level of $639 million but more than double sales of July, 1976, the Investment Company Institute said today.

title: 4 Lead by Shot on 68s In L.P.G.A. Tourney
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Sept. 1 (UPI)Jane Blalock, Betsy Cullen, Sally Little and Hollis Stacy each fired 4underpar 68's and shared the lead in the opening round of a $100,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament today. Two brief thunderstorms temporarily halted play in midafternoon.

title: Carter Gets Draft of U.S. Stance On Reverse Discrimination Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Amid reports that the Government may be weakening its support for affirmative action, Attorney General Griffin B. Bell delivered to the President today the first draft of a Government position on a landmark civil rights suit pending before the Supreme Court.

title: Nixon Backing ExAide, Frost Says
description: Former President. Richard M. Nixon says in his last televised interview with David Frost that he believes Rosemary Woods account of the 18minute gap in the Watergate tapes, Mr. Frost said in New York City last night.

title: McDonnell Given Award
description: Mayor Beame presented a Certificate of Appreciation yesterday to Vincent D. McDonnell, who has resigned as chairman of the New York State Mediation Board. The certificate said Mr. McDonnell had brought new dimensions of knowledge, skill and understanding to the mediation post and to the LaborManagement Advisory Panel, which he also headed. Mr. McDonnell is joining the law firm of Shea, Gould, Climenko, Kramer and Casey. He is also going to serve as director of the Graduate School of Industrial Relations at Pace University.

title: Vatican Silences Priest Who Urged Church Ease View on Homosexuals
description: The leading Roman Catholic advocate of a liberalized attitude toward homosexuality on the part of the church has been ordered by the Vatican to keep silent on the subject.

title: State Prison Supervisor Suspended in the Bronx In Alleged Abuse of Post
description: The supervisor of a state prison in the Bronx has been suspended on charges of permitting staff members to make longdistance telephone calls. allowing security to be lax and using inmates to print leaflets and perform other personal work.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Atlanta Braves, twilightnight doubleheader, at Shea Stadium. Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow. Queens, 5:35 P.M. (Television Channel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadioWNEW, 5:30 P.M.)

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times reported incorrectly Wednesday that corporate defendants convicted in a Federal court in Baltimore of conspiring to fix retail gasoline prices were subject to penalties established by 1974 amendments to the Federal antitrust laws, and that the charges were felonies. The charges were misdemeanors, the activities having occurred before the amendments became law.

title: SHIPPING/MAILS
description: Incoming

title: The Changing Character of Black Problems
description: The meeting of 15 black leaders at the National Urban League's headquarters on Monday has resurrected memories of the 1960's, when the Big Six of the civil rights movement would periodically get together to plan the 1963 March on Wash

title: Newcombe to Serve For Dorman Cheese
description: M. Dorman & Company Inc., the cheese company, has recently come up with a new logo that encompasses the three elements that its president, William Dorman, wanted encompassed. The logo points up the fact that Dorman is an old corporation (established 1896), is a familyowned concern (the company name is in the form of a signature) and is the producer of the cheese with the paper between the slices (a graphic representation of the paper and the slices is included).

title: Harold D. Vursell, 79, a Book Editor
description: Harold D. Vursell, a former vice president and managing editor at the publishing house of Farrar, Straus and Giroux, died Tuesday at Roosevelt Hospital in Manhattan. He was 79 years old and lived at 24 Gramercy Park South.

title: U.S. and Britain Present Rhodesia With Plan for Transfer of Power
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sept. 1Britain and the United States today presented Rhodesia's white minority Government with a plan for ending its 12yearold rebellion and transferring power to the black majority. They warned that rejection of the plan probably would plunge the region into an economic and military disaster.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5 No Title

title: Abercrombie and Its Creditors Discussing Modified Repayment
description: The Abercrombie & Fitch Company, operating under the Chapter XI provisions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act, said yesterday that it was discussing with its creditors a modification of its proposed arrangement for repayment.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The state unveiled a plan to end its placement of emotionally disturbed children in outofstate residential treatment programs that are more than 50 miles from New Jersey's borders.

title: Jet Engine Disintegrates, Debris Hits V alley Stream; No Injuries Are Reported
description: About 20 pounds of metal debris fell over Valley Stream, L.I., late Wednesday night when an engine on a Trans World Airlines 747 jetliner disintegrated in midair shortly after the craft took off for Rome.

title: It's Clambake Time At Old Bethpage Village
description: Costumed villagers will recreate an 1851 clambake this weekend at the Old Bethpage Village Restoration, a working 19thcentury farming community on Long Island. In a shallow pit lined with heated stones, clams, corn, potatoes and seaweed will be steamed, and a kettle of clam chowder will bubble over an open fire.

title: Broadway
description: ANNIVERSARIES in the theater have the poignancy of seesawing raves and pans, longlost profits and losses, changing fashions and times, a cycle of upanddown existence that is to be found in the life span of such playhouses as the Phoenix Theater, which was founded on the Lower East Side a quarter of century ago this season. The Phoenix, conceived as one of the early Off Broadway purveyors of serious drama, underwent a kind of rebirth in a new home last year after it had decided to devote itself to new works not yet mounted in full productions in New York, rather than concentrating on the classics or the muchdone contemporaries. This anniversary year the season follows that same theme.

title: Singapore Jaywalkers Fined
description: SINGAPORE, Sept. 1(AP)A total of 351 pedestrians wer efined $4 each for jaywalking today on the first day of enforcement of strict new traffic laws, the police said.

title: $250,000 Gems Reported Stolen
description: BOSTON, Sept. 1 (AP)Jewels valued at more than a quarter of a million dollars were reported stolen last night from a Copley Plaza Hotel room. The theft was reported by Anne Engelhorn of West Germany, according to Alan Tremain, managing director of the hotel. She has since checked out and has not left a forwarding address.

title: Notes on People
description: F. Lee Bailey, the Bostonbased criminal lawyer, made a $5,000 goodfaith payment yesterday to .Boston to keep the city from seizing his $90,000 helicopter for $18,000 in allegedly unpaid personal property taxes. On Thursday Mayor Kevin H. White had ordered the police to seize the helicopter and put it on display in the Boston Common to show delinquent taxpayers that the city means business. But Mr. Bailey, apparently alerted, locked up his helicopter in a private hangar at Plymouth, Mass. In Suffolk County Superior Court yesterday, Mr. Bailey's lawyer made the $5,000 payment, which may wind up as a settlement of the tax bill on Mr. Bailey's law offices. Outside, Mr. Bailey said: This will be settled in a courtroom, not in Boston Common with the chopper's rotors turning.

title: State Department Declines Comment
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The State De, partment declined today to comment on an Israeli newspaper report that the Israeli Government had prepared a securi ty plan involving the settlement of thou sands of Jews on the West Bank of the Jordan.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6

title: Events Today
description: NEW YORK CITY OPERA, New York State Theater, Verdi's La Travlata, 2; Mascagni's Cavllerta Rusticana and Leoncavallo's Pagllacci, 8.

title: Pneumonia Bacteria Building Resistance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Germs that are among the leading causes of pneumonia throughout the world have developed resistance to the main drugs usually used against them, Federal health authorities reported today.

title: Groups Press for State Takeover of Medical Center
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 2Community and business groups, trade unions, churches and professional societies rallied behind Mayor Thomas F. X. Smith today in his demand for a state takeover of the financially ailing Jersey City Medical Center.

title: Clinic Aide Killed by Patient Who Then Kills Himself
description: A patient at a methadone clinic in the Bronx stabbed the program's administrator to death yesterday, the police said, and thenafter holding a staff member hostageleaped to his death from a sixthfloor window.

title: SHIPPING/MAILS
description: Incoming

title: DOROTHY L. HOHENBERG, EXCOLUMNIST FOR POST
description: Dorothy Lannuier Hohenberg, a feature writer and columnist for The New York Post during World War II, died yesterday in the Todd Nursing Home in Southampton, L.1, after a long illness. She was 72 years old and lived in Aquebogue, L. I.

title: RESULTS
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% Municipal surtax)

title: UNIONS ROLLS IN NATION DOWN 767,000 IN 2 YEARS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP)American membership in labor unions declined by 767,000 over a twoyear period ending in 1976, with most of the losses among women, the Government said today on the eve of the Labor Day weekend.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Front Page 1

title: Hambletonian Trot to Remain at Du Quoin;16 in First HeatToday
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Sept. 2As a prelude to tomorrow's 52d edition of its trotting classic, the Hambletonian Society voted today to keep the famed mile event in this corngrowing, stripmining region of the Midwest for at least three more years.

title: OFFICIALS IN TRENTON PROTEST TRAIN CUTS
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2State officials said today that Amtrak's plan to cancel much of its rail service through New Jersey might put an unacceptable load on other commuter trains. About 150,000 New Jersevans use trains daily.

title: Juantorena, Williams Impressive in World Cup Track
description: DUESSELDORF, West Germany,Sept. 2Alberto Juantorena, Steve Williams and Irena Szewinska came to the first World Cup championships of track and field with something to prove. Tonight, before a crowd of 30,000 at the Rheinstadion, they each won dramatic victories that reaffirmed supremacy in their respective events.

title: Did Banks Dump City Notes?
description: A week after the Securities and Exchange Commission issued its staff report on New York City's financial crisis, a hotly disputed question remains: Did the banks dump the city's securities?

title: Dividends
description: FRIDAY. SEPTFMBER 2, 1977

title: Seaport Host To 2 Winners Of Band Prize
description: One of the prizes for the two winning bands at the fifth annual New York City Bluegrass and Old Time Country Music Band Contest, held three weeks ago at the South Street Seaport, was an engagement at the seaport where the winners were scheduled to play Thursday evening. However, the winning oldtime group, the Wretched Refuse String Band, had made a commitment for Thursday night before it won, so the runnerup, the Arm and Hammer String Band, replaced it, sharing the program with the bluegrass winner, Diamonds in the Rough.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
description: Week ended Sept. 2. 1977

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week.

title: The Latest Entertainment Trend: Charter a Yacht for Four Hours
description: The 100foot diesel vessel Cabaret was carrying what could have been a humdrum cargo as she plied the East River one recent evening: shrimp and meat. But the meat was all filet mignon, and the big shrimp were on parsleygarnished hors d'oeuvre trays offered by butlers to a deckful of realestate and banking executives.

title: PreTypewriter Americana on View
description: In the dark ages before the typewriter offered its keys to rapid composition, the pen was all. With it, authors composed works of great and small eloquence, elegies and laundry lists.

title: CITY FOOD PROGRAM IS LOSING NOTORIETY
description: This year's New York City Summer Food Services program served its last meal yesterday, ending a season that was relatively free of charges of impropriety, but was still marled, according to the program's clients, by inefficient service and inadequate food.

title: Taiwanese Fishing Vessel Seized In the Aleutians by Coast Guard
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Sept. 2 (UPI)The Coast Guard said today that it seized a Nationalist Chinese fishing vessel last night. It was the first seizure f a foreign fishing boat on the West Coast since the 200mile fishing zone went in effect last fall.

title: Deaths
description: NORTONDr. William J.. 79 years, of 114 Woodbridge Avenue, Metuchen, NJ, September 1, 1977. Husband of Dr. Frances Steinman Norton, uncle of Robert W. July. Private service at the convenience of the family. Interment Hillside Cemetery, Metuchen. A Memorial Service will be held at Rutgers University, New Brunswick, NJ, on a date to be announced. For turther information contact The Runyon Mortuary, 568. Middlesex Avenue, Metuchen, NJ.

title: Dance Umbrella Set For Its Busiest Season
description: Dance Umbrella, presented by TAG Foundation Ltd., is entering its thirdand what promises to be its busiestseason. During a fall program running from Oct. 18 through Nov. 20, and a spring one from Feb. 14 through March 19, it will offer performances by 20 companies.

title: Man's Despair, and Hope
description: My subject is the Official Optimism and the Unofficial Pessimism. The official optimism is that of the people who own and control our societymen of power, men of money.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Germs that are among the leading causes of pneumonia throughout the world have developed resistance to the main drugs usually used against them, Federal health authorities reported today.

title: C.I.A. SAYS IT FOUND MORE SECRET PAPERS ON BEHAVIOR CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Central Intelligence Agency said today that it had discovered 10,000 additional documents describing its secret research on control of human behavior, which was conducted from 1943 to the mid1950's. The discovery vastly increases the amount of infor. mation to be made public about the research projects, codenamed Bluebird and Artichoke.

title: 4 Firemen Hurt in Belleville, N.J. As Fire Destroys 90% of Factory
description: Fire raged through a plasticgoods factory in Belleville, N.J., last night, sending up billowing clouds of black smoke that could be seen from the New Jersey Turnpike. Three firemen and a deputy chief were sliehtiv iniured.

description: ADDIS ABABA, EthiopiaThis country is in the throes of a revolution that in terms of ambitions. and the often uncontrollable forces unleashed is coniparable to the Chinese, Russian and Cuban upheavals.

title: U.S. Mission Turns Cubans Away
description: HAVANA, Sept. 2 (UPI)  Officials turned away a group of 35 Cubans who came to the new United States mission in Havana on its first day of business today asking for entrance visas to the United States.

description: Replying to American warnings that the United States trade deficit with Japan had reached an intolerable level, a Japanese economist said yesterday that the deficit existed because the United States continued to squander growing amounts of expensive imported oil.

title: WIDER LANDING RIGHTS FOR CONCORDE HINTED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Carter Administration is weighing the possibility of giving the Concorde supersonic airliner landing rights at 10 cities in addition to New York and Washington despite the controversy surrounding the noise of the craft, Government sources said today.

title: F. E. A. to Allow Crude Oil Price To Climb Again
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP)  The Federal Energy Administration announced today it would let United States crude oil prices start rising again, ending a 14month price freeze.

title: Dollar Off Slightly Abroad In Light Trading Session, But Moves Up in New York
description: The dollar closed slightly lower against most major West European currencies overseas yesterday but it was a bit higher at home, the Associated Press reported. It was the third successive session of light trading on the foreign exchange market.

title: Horse Shows
description: AmateurOwner Hunter Championship, Division ACh. Kevin Maloney's Bodacius, 13 points; reserve, Mrs. R.J. Reynolds 3d, Snicklefritz, 10.

title: Prison Starts 30Hour Family Visits
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N.Y. Sept. 2Madeline Pineda, a 35yearold narcotics offender who has 19 years still to serve, says she is excited at the prospect of spending 30 hours in privacy with her mother and three children on the grounds of the Bedford Hills Correctional Facility.

title: SUMMIT IN LONDON IS TERMED A FAILURE
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, Sept. 2Prime Minister James Callaghan said today that last May's conference of seven industrialized nations in London has not succeeded and suggested that the United States and West Germany must bear much of the responsibility.

title: Belmont Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing FIRST$11,000, cl., 3Y0, 7f.

title: BLACKS BEAR BRUNT OF JOBLESS RATE RISE TO 7.1% FOR AUGUST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Labor Department reported today that the unemployment rate rose twotenths of a percentage point in August, to 7.1 percent of the work force, and said that the increase reflected almost exclusively higher unemployment among black workers.

title: 2d Straight Shutout
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept.2Ron Guidry, wallowing in poverty compared with most of the other members of the Yankees millionaire club pitching staff, sparkled once again tonight like the jewel he has become.

title: Previn Leaving London Symphony
description: LONDON, Sept. 2 (AP)Andr Previn will give up his post as principal conductor of the London Symphony Orchestra in 1979, an orchestra spokesman announced today. The Berlinborn American conductor has held the post since 1968, but in the last few years there has been dissension over him in the ranks of the selfgoverning orchestra.

title: Books of The Times
description: Books about Jesus usually bear the stamp of the evangelist or the cynic, hampering the reader who wants something more neutral and dispassionate. The dilemma has been further compounded in recent years by the appearance of a number of fictionalized accounts that project pseudoscriptural portraits.

title: Vsevolod Rozhdestvensky, 82; Russian Poet and Literary Official
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 2 (UPI)One of the Soviet Union's oldest and most prolific poets, Vsevolod A. Rozhdestvensky, died this week at the age of 82, the press agency Tass reported today.

title: Shipbuilders, in a Slump, Float Factories
description: TOKYO, Sept. 2 (AP)  Some of the world's top shipbuilders, suffering from a severe business slump, are competing in a quickly developing new industryfloating factories.

title: Guardsmen Sent to St.Croix Jail
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I.,Sept. 2Gov. Cyril E. King today ordered Virgin Islands National Guardsmen to the Golden Grove Prison on Saint Croix, where guards have refused to work for two days.

title: 2 MORE SUSPENDED AS PORT AUTHORITY EXAMINES EXPENSES
description: The treasurer and the director of aviation of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey were suspended without pay late yesterday after admitting irregularities in their expense accounts, the agency announced.

description: SECOND ROUND

title: 3 Lead by Shot On 67's in Golf's World Series
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 2That's the kind of game golf is. Ray Floyd loses his concentration and shoots 67. Hale Irwin sets out to shoot 18 pars and he also shoots 67. Tom Weiskopf figures on shooting 68, and he comes in with 67. Mark Hayes plays wild and sloppy, and he scores 68.

title: Around the Nation
description: BOSTON, Sept. 2 (AP)The Labor Department has informed New England apple growers that they can hire more than 1,600 Jamaicans to help pick the crop this fall. Massachusetts stands to get more than 400 of the workers.

title: Black Mayors in the South Are Learning How to Get Federal Grants
description: BOLTON, Miss.With a certain pride of accomplishment, Mayor Bennie Thompson talks about the halfmilliondollar municipal complex under construction here, recalling that he went over the head of a regional official in nearby Jackson straight to the Federal authorities in Washington to get it approved.

title: MARY I. BOVEE M'ADOO, AIDED SALVATION ARMY
description: Mary Isabel Bovee McAdoo, a prominent volunteer worker for the Salvation Army, died Thursday at her home in Vineyard Haven, Mass. She was in her late 80's.

title: All Nippon to Buy Planes
description: All Nippon Airways announced in Tokyo that it had signed a contract to purchase three Boeing 747 airliners from the Boeing Corporation. The first of the three large aircraft is scheduled for delivery in December 1978 for service between Tokyo and Sapporo, Japan. The 747's are priced at about $47.4 million each.

title: U.S. Relying on Soviet to Continue Weapons Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Carter Administration is relying on an unwritten understanding with the Soviet Union, rather than a formal agreement, to continue existing limits on the deployment of strategic weapons after the treaty that imposed those ceilings expires on Oct. 3, senior officials said today.

title: 2 MORE SUSPENDED AS PORT AUTHORITY EXAMINES EXPENSES
description: The treasurer and the director of aviation of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey were suspended without pay late yesterday after admitting irregularities in their expense accounts, the agency announced.

description: Some people try to get by on their smarts. Not Brother Taylor. He believed in working.

title: Memories of D. H. Lawrence Helped Her Shape the Beginnings of a New Life
description: UKIAH, Calif.At the age of 81, Enid Hopkin Hilton dresses like an English country gentlewoman, lives in an eclectic cottage in this orchard town 100 miles north of San Francisco, regularly drives mountainous miles to my Indian people and lectures at the local college on the man who shaped her life.

title: Appointment In Samaria
description: GILLETTE, WYO.

title: McBride Stars as Phils Top Reds, 30
description: Just before game time in Philadelphia last night. Garry Maddox reported soreness in his injured shoulder and was replaced in center field by Bake McBride. McBride proved to be invaluable in Philadelphia's 30 triumph over the Cincinnati Reds, marking the Phillies 15th straight victory at home.

title: DR. WAYNE L. M'MILLEN
description: Dr. Wayne L. McMillen, associate economist of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company here from 1956 until his retirement in 1972, died Tuesday in Boca Raton (Fla.) Community Hospital after a lingering illness. He was 70 years old and lived in Boca Raton.

title: Bridge:
description: Redoubled contracts are very rare in tournament play. Even if the doubler is in error, the doubled side may well be satisfied: Making a doubled contract will be a good result, so there is no need to redouble.

title: Roughing It in Comfort at the Franchisers Campgrounds
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 2Americans have been taking to the hills and shorelines in record numbers and a lot or them are finding accommodations in a new kind of campgroundthose operated under franchises from national chains.

title: Ethiopians Say Arabs Help Somalia
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 2 (UPI)Ethiopia charged today that Iraqi and Syrian troops had joined Somalis in the Ogaden war and said its air force had shot down two more Somali jets, for a total of five in two days.

title: 2 IN BROOKLYN RACE VOICING CONFIDENCE
description: Howard Golden says he is confident that his ninemonth record as Brooklyn Borough President can stand up to any scrutiny. But Assemblyman Frank J. Barbaro contends that Mr. Golden's record is so shabby that next Thursday voters will toss him out of contention to succeed himself and that he, Mr. Barbaro, will win the Democratic nomination.

title: Not Just New York City's Crisis
description: In its recent report, the Securities and Exchange Commission staff provides more than a critical review New York City's fiscal crisis. It surely is thata fascinating account of the halfyear that led up to financial collapse in March 1975 and of the shameful part played by all the major actors. But it is also an indictment of national policy. For all the vast Federal regulatory apparatus, there is virtually no regulation of municipal finance, except a rather primitive and ineffectual effort at selfregulation.

Malaysia, Spurred by U.S., Is Letting In Indochinese
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 31President Carter's decision last month to admit 15,000 more refugees from Indochina has already produced one important result, American diplomats report: Malaysia, where most of the Vietnamese fleeing in fishing boats run ashore, no longer pushes them back out to sea, as it frequently did.

title: Memorial Services
description: VAN TUYLLMargaret Kelsey. A memorial service will be held for the late Margaret Van Toll at noon on, Wednesday, Sept. 7 In the Cha??? of the Church of the Heavenly Rest 5th Ave & 90 St, NYC. In lieu of flowers, a contribution may be made., to the Church of the Heavenly Rest.

title: Rhodesia's Leader Derides Peace Proposals as Crazy
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sept. 2Prime Minister Ian D. Smith said today that key sections of the latest BritishAmerican proposals for a Rhodesian settlement were mad, crazy and insane but that his white minority Government would give them serious consideration before responding, possibly with counterproposals.

title: Personal Investing
description: A telephone call the other day to the Houston offices of Charles T. Bauer, president of American International Management Advisors Inc., brought a cheery response from his secretary. I'm sorry, sir, she said. Mr. Bauer will be on a road show for the next three weeks, selling a new fund we've got coming out.

description: BASEBALL

title: To Judge the Judges
description: Everyone knows that there must be a better way to select judges for New York State courts, but no one is sure what it is. On Sept. 8, Democratic voters will find themselves facing contested but littlepublicized primaries for Surrogate in Manhattan, and for Civil Court judges in Brooklyn, Queens and the Bronx. many Assembly districts, there will be even more obscure elections of delegates and alternates to the Democratic Judicial Convention, which will, in turn, select Democratic nominees to run for the Supreme Court.

title: In Mexico, Influence Is Coveted; Illusion of Influence Is Next Best
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 1A Mexican reporter recently joined two police motorcyclists on patrol and, over a 24hour period, they stopped 32 cars for traffic violations. Only two of the drivers had papers that were in order, while 29 flashed everything from press cards to Colt 45's as evidence of their importance. The 30th offender, the reporter recounted, only flashed her eyes.

title: Former Kennedy Aide Critically III
description: BOSTON, Saturday, Sept. 3 (AP)Kenneth P. O'Donnell, who served as a special assistant to President John F. Kennedy, was put on the critical list yesterday at Beth Israel Hospital here and was moved from a regular room at the hospital to its intensive care unit. The nature of Mr. O'Donnell's illness was not disclosed; a hospital spokesman said that the family requested that no further information be released. Mr. O'Donnell, 53 years old was admitted to the hospital on Aug. 11.

title: Princess Lalla of Morocco Killed When Automobile Hits Tree in Fog
description: RABAT, Morocco, Sept. 2 (AP)Princess Lalla Nouzha, 37yearold sister of King Hassan 11 and the wife of Prime Minister Ahmed Osman, was killed in an automobile accident in northern Morocco early today, the Government announced.

The discovery vastly increases the amount of information to be made public about the research projects, codenamed Bluebird and Artichoke.

title: Baker Waryon National Race But Talks Up National Issues
description: MARYVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 30Joining the gathering of Tennessee Republicans who were having punch and cookies outside the courthouse, the woman told the Senator she had driven here from California to meet him because she admired him on television and thought he should be President. He chuckled and thanked her.

description: For period ended July 31 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (0/ overthecounter.
