description: LINCROFT

title: Labor Looks to Opposite Sides for Allies
description: This Labor Day weekend finds the American labor movement proving anew the firmness of its adherence to George Meany's maxim that ideology is baloney. To muster support for its most ambitious and controversial legislative goals in a quartercentury, organized labor is building coalitions of such divergence that its allies in one are its enemies in the other.

title: DINING OUT
description: BROOKFIELD

title: Law Science
description: Competency to stand trial, along with innocence by reason of insanity, are two of the most controversial issues in contemporary law. They're also quite different and shouldn't be confused, says Abraham S. Goldstein, professor of law at Yale University and author of the book The Insanly Defense. As he explains it, Competency to stand trial relates to the defendant's mental condition at the time of the pretrial hearing. The insanity defense, in contrast, concerns the defendant's mental state when he allegedly committed the crime.

title: Susan Beth Cohen Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Arthur G. Cohen of Kings Point, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter. Susan Beth Cohen, to Neal S. Schweber, son of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour C. Schweber, also of Kings Point. Mr. Cohen is chairman of the Arlen Realty and Development Corporation. Mr. Schweber is a senior at New York University. His father is president of the Schweber Electronics Company.

title: Racing Drivers Need to Stay in Shape
description: Many race car driversespecially those who win on a regular basiswork hard on physical conditioning just as other professional athletes do.

title: Cardinal Linebacker Out
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 3 (AP)Rick Fenlaw, St. Louis Cardinal linebacker, underwent surgery on his left knee today. He was injured in last night's exhibition game against the Chicago Bears.

title: THE LITERARY VIEW
description: IN the 1840's nearly 100 years after the expression of Enlightenment opinion, the Westminster Review, one of England's most popular periodicals, summarized the prevailing feminine ideal: Woman . . . must possess no elevated description of knowledge; as she is gentle in her temper, so she must be inferior in her attainments. England's Poet Laureate, Robert Southey, added to the misogynist chorus of the time when he wrote in a letter to Charlotte Bront that literature cannot be the business of a woman's life because of the sacredness of her duties at home. How

title: What's Doing in HELSINKI
description: DAUGHTER OF THE BALTICHelsinki is one of the most underrated capitals in Western Europe because of both its relative remoteness and its modest size (only 500,000 inhabitants). Though founded in 1550, it lacks the physical heritage that other European cities enjoy, since the old town was destroyed by fire when the Russians seized Helsinki in the early 19th century. These apparent drawbacks only enhance the charm of a city that is almost surrounded by the Baltic. Its pastel neoclassical buildings and cobblestone streets are interspersed with flashes of bold architecture by internationally known Finns like Eliel Saarinen and Alvar Aalto. It is Scandinaviantidy, but the leisurely pace is more akin to Oslo than to bustling Copenhagen or Stockholm. Helsinki endures discouraging spells of cold and dampness, but this is more than compensated for by its residents, who have not yet become sated with American tourists. Officially, the weather is rated as mild, ranging from an average midday temperature of 25 degrees Fahrenheit in February to 72 degrees in July. The average midday temperature this month is 59 degrees, and the September water temperature in nearby lakes and the Baltic usually ranges between 55 and 60.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Today  Long Island Sports Car Association and Sports Car Club of America autocross at Gateway National Recreation Area, Floyd Bennett Field, Brooklyn. Registration: 9:30 A.M.: first car off 11:30. Information: Alan (212)6314297 or Ed (212)4649355.

title: DINING OUT
description: THIS is an establishment that seeks to overwhelm its customers with a combination of enormous quantities of food and a thematic decor that can only be described as just short of oppressive.

title: Juliana Daily Wed to Richard Masterson
description: Juliana Margaret Elizabeth Daily, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. L. Eugene Daily of Norwich, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Richard A. Masterson, who is on the administrative staff of the Immigration and Naturalization Service of New York.

title: Guided Tour
description: AT the suggestion of his travel agent, Lawrence Durrell joins a twoweek group tour through Sicily, appropriately called the Carousel. He chooses Sicily at the suggestion of an editor and because a close friend, Martine, now dead, who lived on Sicily, wrote Durrell long amusing and tender letters about it and asked him to write a pocket history of it for her children.

title: PERSPECTIVES OF PENN
description: Irving Penn is possibly a great photographer, though he, resisting superlatives, surely would not designate himself as such, and the term is still a tricky one in such a young medium (if Stieglitz is great, then how does one decide about Arbus, and so forth?). Unquestionably, Penn is an important photographer, properly renowned for the tact and lan of his commercial work and for his elegant portraits and fashion photographs in Vogue. Many of these will go on display at the Marlbor ough Gallery on Sept. 9 as part of a resplendent assortment of platinum prints which Penn himself produced with loving and laborious care. Such prints have earned Penn the esteem of his peers and could make his work a bluechip investment in the photocollector's market.

title: I Want to Dance All the Princes
description: A diamondintherough is what Violette Verdy, director of the Paris Opera Ballet, calls 18yearold Patrick Dupond, the Parisborn member of the company's corps de ballet, who last year became the first French dancer ever to win the Gold Medal at the Varna (Bulgaria) International Ballet Competition. And yet, it is possible that this young diamondintherough may emerge as the ballet world's latest prodigy.

title: VIEWS OF WORKERS
description: The leaders of labor speak up loud and often, but what do the laborers them. selves have to say? To find out. photographer Bill Owens canvassed the country. photographing and interviewing hundreds of workers in a vast variety of jobs. The results of his investigation have just been published in his book Working. Some of his interviewees are shown here and on Page I I.

title: Notes: Tour Routes For Foliage Watchers
description: Shorter days, cooler breezes and lower evening temperatures in the Northeast are harbingers of the region's fall foliage spectacular. Soon the sugar maple trees will be turning red (then orange), the beeches and birches, golden, and the sumacs, scarletand foliage watchers will set out along scenic routes and seek good vantage points for colorful vistas. They'll also be able to catch a glimpse of country life at the many festivals and other events that proliferate in the area in autumn. The height of the color season is expected to be the last week in September in the northern reach?? of the Northeast, with the southern part of the region reaching its peak around the Columbus Day holiday weekend (the holiday will be Monday. Oct. 10).

title: Japanese Industrialists and Farmers Look to Earthworms for Help
description: TOKYO, Sept 3Japanese industrialists and farmers are looking to the earthworm for help in solving many of the country's problems, including the disposal of wastes, restoring the fertility of farm land, fish breeding and, possibly in the future, even feeding the nation.

title: Memorial Services
description: BECKERDr. Leonard R. Becker, died July 17, 1977. Memorial service Wednesday September 7, 1977 at 2 PM In the main Sanctuary Central Synagogue 55th St.on Lexington Ave.

title: Barbara Ann Franks Is Wed
description: Barbara Ann Franks and Hallett Johnson 3d were married yesterday afternoon in the Princeton University Chapel by the Rev. Daphne W. T. Hawkes, an Episcopal priest. The bride graduated last year from Princeton, where her husband received a bachelor's degree in 1974.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: This book is described as a child's story for adults. What that means is unclear, because the book's illustrations, typesize and design are typical of books for young readers. When I think of books that might fit the category of children's stories for adults, what comes to mind are works like Henry Roth's Call It Sleep, Harper Lee's To Kill a Mockingbird, and James Baldwin's own first novel, Go Tell It on the Mountain. These books changed our perceptions of adult reality because the presentation of children's reality was so intense, vivid and true, which is not so with Little Man, Little Man.

title: A New Horse Show
description: THE nationally famous North Shore Horse Show, a fixture in Old Field for 43 years, will give way next week to a relative newcomerthe Smith Haven Ministries Horse Show, a mere eight years old.

title: Once More, Surrogate Talk
description: Compared with the noise and chaos that almost identifiesthe Manhattan Criminal Courts building, Surrogate's Court a few blocks south, is a sanctuary of silence. Its quiet dignity befits the affairs of the dead that preoccupy the two surrogates. When the courthouse was built at the turn of the century, many judges considered it the finest in the country; the two surrogates then received the same salary as the Chief Justice of the United States and more than the Governor of New York State.

title: Long Island/ This Week
description: ART

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: ACTORS CAFETHEATER, 263 Central Avenue, East OrangeHedda Gabler. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. Opens Friday (through Oct. 15). $3.50$4.50; students and the elderly, $2.50$3.90; group rates. (201) 6751881.

title: Jane Gallagher Betrothed to Bruce A. Huber
description: Jane Chispa Gallagher and Bruce Alan Huber, graduate students at the University of Rhode Island, will be married in October. Their engagement has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. J. Wes Gallagher of Santa Barbara, Calif., formerly of Rye, N.Y. Mr. Gallagher is former president and general manager of The Associated Press.

title: Convent Caper
description: WHO can resist a beautiful, brilliant, blonde biographer on a book jacket, reclining on needlepoint pillows, all softeyed and slightly sultry? Who can resist a mystery novel about nuns, small children, fearless female television reporters and married members of Parliament? Who, after all, can resist the unexpected combination of Antonia Fraser and a tale of murder entitled Quiet as a Nun.

title: FISHING
description: PORT WASHINGTON

title: UNIONS ARE BETTER TODAY
description: The following questions and answers are excerpted from an interview by Nick Kotz with the A.F.L.C.I.O.'s president, George Meany.

title: The Flimflam Men
description: New York City has many problems. As the old saying goes, its problems have got problems. The city's still flirting with bankruptcy, its serviees have had to be cut back, its potholed streets are obstacle courses, its municipal unions have too much power to para lyze it, everybody knows about its blackouts. and the S.E.C. says the big banks played games with its nctes. Welfare is a horrendous burden. A lot of other cities have more crime, but New York's still a pretty good place to get hit over the head on your way home at night

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: Chauncey Hare's horror show (as I am tempted to call the exhibition of photographs at the Museum of Modern Art through October 23) is a group of photographs documenting in lavish and ghastly detail the kind of places certain people make for themselves to live in. Most of the pictures are of domestic interiors, though a few also depict flophouse lobbies, neighborhood storefront social clubs and other places of public resort. In some of the pictures only the places are shown, but many others also show the people who inhabit the places.

title: Mary Honerkamp to Be Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frederick William Honerkamp of Douglas Manor, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mary Elizabeth Honerkamp, to Joseph John Snee, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Thomas Snee of Emerson, N. J.

title: Travel Insurance: Figuring the Odds
description: Last year Jim Adams, vice president of a tourpackaging company on Long Island, had a brainstorm. He was going to increase sales of his tours by including accident insurance as part of the packagea little something extra that travel agents could use to sell the public on his programs. Within a few months, after receiving what he calls negative feedback from some agents, he decided to forget the whole thing. The agents, he says, felt it was unwise to suggest that something could happen that would spoil a customer's vacation.

title: Burma Said to Hold Five In Plot to Murder Cabinet And Break Up the Nation
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 3 (UPI)Five Burmese secessionists have been arrested in a plot to assassinate President Ne Win and his Cabinet and set up separate states in their homelands, the Burmese Government announced today.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: African Generalizations
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Japan Announces Plans To Stimulate Economy And Cut Trade Surplus
description: TOKYO, Sept. 3 (Reuters)The Japanese Government announced plans today to stimulate the nation's economy and reduce its record foreign trade surplus.

title: Night Crawling for Night Crawlers
description: RYE

title: Results at the United States Open
description: MEN'S SINGLES

title: B. A. Friedman, Lawyer, Will Marry Suzan Balk
description: Mr. and Mrs. Albert Balk of New Milford, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Suzan Sandra Balk, to Barry A. Friedman, son of Nettie Friedman of New York and Hyman Friedman of Altamonte Springs, Fla.

title: Dog Calendar
description: Today  Sussex Hills K.C. 16th show and obedience trial, Automatic Switch. Inc., Hanover Road, Florham Park. NJ.; 1.286 dogs;8 A.M. to 7 P.M.

title: Soccer Action From Venezuela to N.J.
description: The Cosmos play in Venezuela today, the Soccer Festival of the Americas gets under way in Downing Stadium under the Triborough Bridge and the championship game of the American Soccer League will be held

title: Roslyn Synagogue Raising Spirits Instead of Funds
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L.I.A small Modern Orthodox synagogue here is preparing to do something highly unorthodox. The Roslyn Synagogue, which recently celebrated its first birthday, has decided not to charge worshipers for reserved seats for the High Holy Days.

title: Phils Rout Reds, 93, for 5th in Row
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 3 (AP)Bake McBride's tworun homer and Bob Boone's badhop single with the bases loaded sparked a sixrun third inning that carried the Philadelphia Phillies to a 93 victory over the Cincinnati Reds tonight.

title: Basque Ends Hunger Strike
description: MARSEILLES, France, Sept. 3 (Reuters) Miguel Angel Apalategui, a militant Basque nationalist, today ended a monthlong hunger strike here after learning that the French Government no longer opposed his request for the status of a political refugee, one of his lawyers announced. Mr.Apalategui, 22 years old, is wanted in Spain on charges of armed robbery, murder and kidnapping.

title: Miss Bennett, Cooper Stuart Have Nuptials
description: Trudy S. Bennett. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Edgar Bennett of St. Martin, French West Indies; Estepona, Spain, and Greenwich, Conn., became the bride yesterday of Cooper B. Stuart, son of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer R. Stuart of Darien. Conn. The Rev. Jack G. Schutte performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church in Greenwich.

title: Major League TeamAgainstTeam Records
description: Includes games of September 2

title: Jessie H. Duane Is Engaged
description: Announcement has been made by Dr. and Mrs. Richard B. Duane Jr. of the engagement of their daughter, Jessie Holladay Duane, to Roger Loft, son of Mrs. Louis Tetunic of New Rochelle. N. Y., and the late Louis Loft. Miss Duane, a graduate of the Chapin School, attended the University of Perugia in Italy. Her fiance is an alumnus of the Tyler School of Art of Temple University.

title: Chinese Saga
description: AGAINST a lavishly textured backdrop of Hong Kong and China, Robert S. Elegant has given us an actionpacked novel about a proper English girl who boldly marries into the family of a Eurasian merchantprince and sometime opium smuggler. Mr. Elegant, a journalist and author of six nonfiction hooks on Asia and two novels about ancient China, lived in Hong Kong for 25 years. He writes with a knowledge and understanding of the culture of Hong Kong, which he links with sharp insights into the wheelswithindeals, the intrigue and manipulations that make the stratified colonial society of Hong Kong tick. The exotic panorama and

title: Brooklyn Man Is Suicide After Shooting Wife and Son
description: A 33yearold man critically wounded his estranged wife and 9yearold son and then shot himself to death yesterday in an isolated part of Prospect Park in Brooklyn.

title: Lawyer Weds Valli F. Fuiks
description: Valli Flavin Fuiks, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lewis John Fuiks of Rye, N.Y., and Wardsboro, Vt., was married yesterday to Paul Lukeman, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Paul Lukeman of Columbus, Ohio. The Rev. James Blynt performed the Roman Catholic ceremony in the Wardsboro Methodist Church.

title: The Nation
description: DENVERFor an organization at an all time low in national popularity, holding fewer important offices than it has in many years and with its internal divisions as deep as ever, the Republican Party is a strangely cheerful institution. The 38 Senators and 146 Representatives who will return to Capitol Hill this week have already won more fights than they expected, especially on election law and labor issues. They look forward to more.

title: NONFICTION.IN BRIEF
description: LIONS are often ignoble. Hyenas do not scavenge. Gorillas are not vicious Icing Kongs, but lead a gentle, unhurried, even monotonous and humdrum existence and are strictly vegetarian, munching on wild celery or bamboo. These are some of the surprising discoveries Boyce Rensberger made during a year in  Africa on leave from his post as a science reporter for this newspaper. Supported by a fellowship from the Alicia Patterson Foundation, he visited the great African parks and game preserves, talked to the conservationists, watched the exotic mammals and read the recent literature on his subject. A no

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10 A.M. (channel 4) Here and Now: Representative Herman Badillo, Democratic candidate for Mayor.

title: Kenya Opens Center on Early Man
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 3With beating drums, ceremonial dancers and speeches, Kenya officials today formally opened a major new center for research on early man in Africa.

title: Coal Company Asks Suppression of Report
description: CATLETTSBURG, Ky., Sept. 3  A Federal judge is expected to make a decision Tuesday on the Blue Diamond Coal Company's request for suppression of a Federal report on two explosions that killed 26 men at a Kentucky mine in March 1976.

title: Judy K. Guerin Is the Fiancee Of Criminal Court Judge Neco
description: Mrs. Michael Flynn of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Judy K. Guerin, to Judge Luis M. Neco of the New York Criminal Court, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Jose Neco of New York.

title: Zambia, in Security Move, imposes Curfew and Blackout in Lusaka
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 3 (Reuters)The Zambian capital was plunged into darkness tonight after the government imposed a curfew and blackout, apparent ly reflecting heightened tension with neighboring Rhodesia.

title: John Brademas, The Congressman They Call Mr. Arts
description: When Joe Papp talks with John Brademas, no one says Brademas who? anymore, a theater man said recently. Everyone in the arts knows now that Brademas is the Congressman to see.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: MARTIN CRUZ SMITH'S writing career had a distinct turn for the better recently when his novel Nightwing was sold to a paperback house for a lot of money, but it took him eight years grinding out paperback originals to get where he is.

title: Carol L. Ratliff Married to Rainer E. Steinhoff
description: Carol Loveland Ratliff, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Rob Roy Ratliff of Rockville, Md., was married yesterday to Raider Steinhoff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Steinhoff of Upper Saddle River, N.J.

title: INTERVIEW
description: MAX NOVICH is a man with a passion. He is the newly appointed director of sports medicine in the orthopedic surgery section at the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey, and he is determined to cut down on the number of injuries resulting from sports, especially those on the undergraduate level.

title: 400 Meters to Be Rerun On Juantorena Protest
description: DUESSELDORF, West Germany. Sept. 3Alberto Juantorena, in the 400 meters, and John Walker in the 1,500 meters, met unexpected defeat under unusual circumstances tonight at the World Cup track and field meet. But three hours after his race, Juantorena learned that his protest had been upheld, and he will get another chance tomorrow.

title: NAZI ESCAPE IN ROME SHAKES CARABINIERI
description: ROME,Sept. 3A storm of criticism has been swirling about Italy's military police force as result of the recent escape of a 70yearold Nazi war criminal it had been assigned to guard.

title: New Appointees To Control Unit Pose a Problem
description: In its two tempestuous years of existence, the Emergency Financial Control Board has almost never acted with less than full unanimity on major controversial issues. Governor Carey, who heads the sevenmember panel that has the final say on all of New York City's financial affairs, has been especially afraid that dissent, particularly coining from any of the three privatesector board members, would only encourage outsiders to secondguess the already difficult political decisions the board has had to make.

title: Susan Chase Bride Of Gilbert H. Deitch
description: Susan Paula Chase of Atlanta, specialevents director for Rich's, the department store chain in the Southeast, was married yesterday evening to Gilbert H. Deitch, a partner in the Shulman, Bauer, Deitch, Raines & Hester law firm in Atlanta.

title: U.S. Jewish Committee Will Scrutinize Revision Of Oberammergau Play
description: The American Jewish Committee will take a linebyline look at a proposed revision of West Germany's famed Oberammergau Passion Play in a search for antiSemitic passages.

title: College Careers: Extra Family for the Poor
description: THE day Dorothy Allensworth decided to accept collect phone calls from the students she had placed in colleges, most of them many miles away in the South, was the day we knew we'd hammered out philosophy for College Careers, the organization she heads.

title: Carey Steps In As the Days Dwindle Down
description: When he decided months ago to gamble on his ability to help retire Mayor Beame, Governor Carey automatically became an inescapable presence in New York City's Democratic mayoral campaign, Now, with the primary this Thursday, he has increased his stake.

title: HONE CLINIC
description: WASHING machines are usually hooked up to hot and cold water lines in a basement or utility room by means of flexible hoses that screw onto spigots something like those used around the outside of the house.

title: Air Ambulance Flies to Livingston
description: MORRISTOWN AFLORHAM Park physician who holds a commercial pilot's license has meshed his vocation with his avocation and created an airambulance service. The physician, Dr. Daniel C. Keesee, is chief of family practice at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston. His air ambulance provides speedy access to the special facilities offered at St. Barnabas: two hyperbaric chambers and the recently reopened burn unit.

title: Suzanne E. Reiss Wed To William Dunnington
description: Suzanne E. Reiss, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kurt W. Reiss of Gulph Mills, Pa., was married yesterday afternoon to William Southall Dunnington, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Dunnington of Burlington. Vt.

title: STATE AIDE ASSAILED ON PRISONER ACTION
description: John Fox was sleeping the happy sleep of hope, even in jail. By day the 27yearold prisoner was on work release, and his employer was training him to be a foremaneven to take charge of the Brooklyn cabinetmaking shop during the coming Jewish holidays.

title: Cynthia A. Haertel Bride Of Michael Chamberland
description: Cynthia Ann Haertel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerard D. Haertel of Packanack Lake, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon to Michael Chamberland, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Chamberland of West Hartford, Conn. The Rev. Michael Quinn performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the Immaculate Heart of Mary Roman Catholic Church in Wayne, N.J.

title: KICKOFF IS FORMALITY IN VIRGINIA CAMPAIGN
description: NORFOLK, Va., Sept. 3A gubernatorial campaign that Virginians are likely to find hard to ignore had its nominal beginning here today as Henry E. Howell Jr., an unrestrained political barnstormer of the revivalist school, officially opened his latest crusade to drive the Republicans from the Statehouse in Richmond.

title: Pritchard Strong Garrett Fiance of Tracy T. Davis
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Spencer Davis of Washington have announced the engagement of their daughter, Tracy Tucker Davis, to Pritchard Strong Garrett, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Garrett of Rochester.

title: Pioneer Woman Runs Seoul Legal Aid Unit
description: SEOUL, South KoreaWhen Lee Tai Young was 7 she decided to become a lawyer. I did not know what it was, the 63yearold feminist leader recalled, but I knew I wanted to be one.

title: Respite in Assessments
description: ALL sides claimed victory in the battle over propertytax assessments in Nassau and Suffolk County after Governor Carey signed the state's new assessment reform bill into law last month.

title: Sarah S. Rockefeller Is Engaged
description: Sarah Stillman Rockefeller, who is in forest management with the International Paper Company, and Philip Michael Bogdanovitch, a forest manager with the St. Regis Paper Company in Paul Smith's, N.Y., plan to be married Oct. 8 in Paul Smith's.

title: Desire Is Fine, but What an Amateur Athlete Needs Is Someone to Help Pay Bills
description: I was lucky. Not in the competition, but in having a wife who made decent money and who was just as committed to seeing me win the gold medal as was.

title: Photography Beckoned, and Now It's the Light of Her Life
description: Jill Freedman says her magnificent rolltop oak desk is the one piece of furniture she prizes in her barefloored, sparsely furnished Greenwich Village apartment What means everything to her is her photographic darkroom.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Manuel Santana, the 39yearold Spaniard who won the United States Nationals in 1965, and the Wimbledon title the next year, on why he returned to Forest Hills for the first time since 1968: I came back to Forest Hills because I heard it would be the last time here and I thought it would be nice to play here again. He lost in the first round to Guillermo Vilas of Argentina, 61, 60.

title: In Morris County, Pull of the City Grows Stronger
description: Morris County is a growing suburban area where people sometimes seem to find as much interest in what lies behind them as in what lies ahead.

title: Gold Cup Title Defense Miss Smith's Next Test
description: Melanie Smith, a 26yearold blonde from Germantown, Tenn., will find herself in an unaccustomed role next weekend at the American Gold Cup in Philadelphia. As the defending champion, Miss Smith will be the rider all

title: GOODMAN TROUBLED BY FARBER'S EFFORT
description: In the final week of the Republican mayoral primary, State Senator Roy M. Goodman, one of the city's leading Republican officeholders and the party organization's designee for Mayor, is running scared, according to his aides, against a challenge by a conservative political amateur, Barry Farber.

title: Italian Municipalities, With Debts of $36 Billion, Scramble for Funds
description: SIENA, Italy. Aug. 29On payday each month Maria Grazia Conti, accountantadministrator for this Tuscan city's public transport company, faces a crisis.

title: Boy Dies After Falling Into Crocodile Pit
description: MIAMI, Sept. 3 (UPI)A 6yearold boy tumbled into a crocodile pit at the Miami Serpentarium today and a 14 foot, 1,800pound African crocodile snapped its jaws around the child's middle and dragged him to his death in a small lagoon.

title: Poison in the Air
description: DOROTHY Noyes Kane's article on air pollution [Opinion Page, Aug. 21] particularly as it refers to lead, calls attention to a serious problem affecting vast numbers of American children.

title: Births
description: Klasfeld

title: Linda Ann Meyn, Teacher, Engaged to Brian McElroy
description: Mr. and Mrs. John H. Meyn of Albertson, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Linda Ann Meyn, to Brian Richard McElroy. The wedding will take place on Oct. 7.

title: Sunnier Days for Britain, Where Labor Now Seeks Its Place in the Sun
description: The sun, at long last, seems to be shining on the chronically cloudy British economy. Britons reveled in slowing inflation, falling interest rates, and improving foreign trade position, expanding foreign currency reserves and wonder of wondersa rising pound, which traded last week at the highest levels in nearly a year. And, in the best summer the financial pages had reported in years, the London stock market climbed last week to a peak not seen since January 1973. The Financial Times index broke through the 500 mark, up 100 points from Easter and far, far above the 146 low hit in 1975.

title: Days at Eton And Oxford
description: ON several occasions in early childhood, Anthony Powell tells ps, he was conscious of approaching the brink of some discovery. One afternoon in about 1911, when he was 5 or 6, standing outside the door of his London home, the truth came flooding in with the dust infested sunlight, he writes. The revelation of selfidentity was inescapable. There was no doubt about it. I was me.

title: College Football Preview:Top Teams Are Familiar,the Passing Rule Is New
description: College football jumped off to its earliest start in the 109year history of the fall sport when Penn State routed Rutgers in Giants Stadium at the Jersey Meadowlands on Friday and 18 other major college games were played yesterday. Never before have so many teams begun action before Labor Day.

title: Shortchanging Aid for the Aged
description: A FEW weeks ago Commissioner William Ratchford of the Connecticut Department on Aging described in these pages what the state was doing to provide services for the elderly. He emphasized the importance of helping people remain in their own homes, mentioning that this was his department's highest priority. While I agree on the importance of this priority, I see a far less encouraging picture than the one he paints.

title: VOIX DE LA FRANCE ALSO COMES IN ARABIC
description: MONTE CARLO, MonacoIt began as an effort by Charles de Gaulle to increase Fren?h influence ane prestige in the Middle East. But now, thanks to the oilprice explosion, the French may soon have a moneymaker as well.

title: ART
description: YONKERS

title: Alice B. Doscher, Leader In Horticultural Society, 97
description: Alice B. Doscher, an active member of the Horticultural Society of New York, died Friday at her home, 575 Park Avenue. She was 97 years old.

title: Weiskopf, Wadkins Share Lead at 135
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 3It has become a habit. Torn Weiskopf birdied the 18th hole today to tie Lanny Wadkins for the lead In the second round of the World Series of Golf. Yesterday, playing in the final pairing of the day, he came to the 18th green late in the afternoon and did the same thing to share the lead with Ray Floyd and Hale Irwin.

title: Jenifer Neils Bride Of J. H. McInerney
description: Jenifer Neils, a Ph.D. candidate at Princeton University, and James Harvey McInerney, an investment manager with the American International Group in Wilmington, Del., were married yesterday in St. MartinsbytheLake Episcopal Church in Minnetonka Beach, Minn. The rector, the Rev. Edward J. Eilertsen, performed the ceremony.

title: High Levels of a Protein in Blood
description: From studies involving thousands of individuals, new support has been found for the hypothesis that blood constituents known as HDL (for high density lipoproteins), which are plentiful in some people and scarce in others, act as powerful preventers of heart attacks.

title: TV VIEW
description: It's instant recognition time again on the home screen. See the dome of the Capitol in the distance beyond that attractive couple earnestly conversing? It tells us we're in Washington, D. C. See and hear the antiVietnam picketers? They're announcing it's the late 1960's. See those fellows in shades, with buttons in their ears? That says Secret Service, so the man they're surrounding must be a somebody. See that woman holding a whisky glass in one hand and a cigarette in the other? That, pardon the metaphor, means a marriage on the rocks, going up in smoke.

title: Giants, Jets Clash Today With Problems to Solve
description: It is a young series, being played for only the ninth time. But it has transcended the quality of the teams in it, and that is why this morning, when Randy Rasmussen wakes up, he knows he is going to tingle all over.

title: ART MAILBAG
description: To the Editor:

title: Andrew Osborn Fiance of Nancy A. Gross
description: Nancy Ann Gross and Andrew Eli Norton Osborn, who graduated with the class of 75 from Cornell University, plan to be married Oct. 16 at the Roslyn (L. I.) Country Club.

title: The Cloud Of Danger
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 LPresident Carter went off to Camp David for the Labor Day weekend with some distressing homework: the latest Labor Department figures6,900,000 Americans out of work7.1 percent over all; 14.5 for blacks, as high as any month since the last world war; and 40.4 for teenage blacks as compared to 14.7 percent for teenage whites.

title: Arabs Seek Unity on Plan to Block Israeli Settlements
description: CAIRO,Sept. 3Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister called today for joint Arab action to face what he called Israel's flagrant challenge on the West Bank of the Jordan River.

title: Good Buddies: Walter Mitty Rides the Merritt
description: THE slightly built man wearing wirerimmed glasses and a pinstriped suit looks like a corporation executive commuting in his car on the Merritt Parkway from his home in Fairfield to Interna tional Business Machines headquarters in Westchester Country

title: Are Sycamores A Dying Breed?
description: FOR 50 years, as the Island changed from farm to suburb, uncounted thousands of sycamore trees were planted on miles of curbs to provide shade and beauty as they matured. Now, however, the treessingly, in pairs, in threes and moreare dying, and town officials say it was a mistake to have chosen the sycamore for the Island. Most people are familiar with sycamores, even if they don't know them by name. Their leaves resemble those of maples, and they are distinctive because of the appearance of the bark: As the tree grows, chunks of bark fall off and are replaced by fresh growth, giving the tree a mottled appearance.

title: 27 Hurt in Crash of Church Bus
description: DRUMS, Pa., Sept. 3 (AP)A bus carrying 27 church members from Toledo, Ohio, to New York struck a median barrier and rolled over five times on an exit ramp of Interstate 80 near here yesterday. One passenger was hospitalized, in fair condition, and the others were treated for minor injuries and were released. The police said that the bus was owned by the Bible Understanding Church of New York City.

title: To Our Readers
description: Starting today, most advertising in the Sunday Sports section under the headings Automobile Exchange, Boats & Accessories, Dogs, Cats & Other Pets and Horses & Equipment will appear only in copies of The New York Times distributed in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Mario Cuomo and the Miracle Workers
description: The snarling Democratic campaign for the mayoral nomination nears its end in an outburst of ill will. For the past three years most of the seven candidates have been involved with each other in Congress, in Albany, in New York, cooperating to save the city from collapse. Now they have turned on each other with violent denunciations.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Four young musicians will be taking over Fisher Hall this week, all winners of the Avery Fisher Award Program (the details are described in Music Notes elsewhere on this page). Note the two key words in the Fisher project: Award Program. Program, not competition. These artists did not compete against each other. They were selected on their merit by a board of wellknown musicians and educators.

title: INVESTING
description: Individual investors may be disenchanted with inandout trading in the stock market, but they are accumulating shares by reinvesting their dividends at a record clip. Its no way to get rich quick, but it's steady and conveuientboth for shareholders and for corporations.

title: Broadway Gets in Gear
description: In theaters bare of scenery, in cheerless lofts and unglamorous rehearsal halls, the new Broadway season is beginning to take shape. Actors, directors, playwrights, designersall the talents that must blend if theater is to come aliveare putting their minds and bodies to work on new shows. There are scripts to be rehearsed and modified and rehearsed again, songs and dances to be learned, cues to be memorized. Tempers will flare, vocal cords and feet will ache, eager gofers will fetch oceans of cardboardflavored coffee and mountains of pastramionrye. Somehow, it will all come together by Opening Night, and somehow, some of it will not have been in vain.

title: Schedules of the Leading College Football Teams for the 1977 Season
description: AIR FORCE

title: Miss Dayton Fiancee Of P. B. Lanius 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Wilson Dayton Jr. of Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, L. I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Deborah Leeds Dayton, to P. Baxter Lanius 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lanius Jr. of Denver. The wedding is planned for next June.

title: U.S. Swimmers Leading Soviet Squad by 10262

description: Vitas Gerulaitis feels fine. No aches. No pains. No mental hangups. He thinks he can win the men's singles title at the United States Open if people will let him sleep enough to prepare for Harold Solomon, Bjorn Borg, Guillermo Vilas and Jimmy Connors.

title: Taxis to Use Express Bus Lanes In Test Plan on L.I. Expressway
description: Beginning this month, taxis carrying fares will be allowed on a trial to use express bus lanes on the Long Island Expressway during morning rush hours, it was announced yesterday.

title: DINING OUT
description: CAMINARI's is an ivycovered dining landmark in the heart of Locust Valley. It reflects traditional North Shore taste and breeding with its parquet floors, leaded, diamondpaned windows, framed hunt scenes, the gracious curve of its mahogany bar, candlelight and flowers. Opened in 1935, it has aged well.

title: College Football: Pitt, Penn State and Kentucky Among the Best
description: Pitt should again be on top, this time under the direction of Jackie Sherrill, an assistant to Johnny Majors at Iowa State and Pittsburgh before he served as head coach at Washington State in 1976. The players are familiar with Sherrill, who worked was actually the whipcracker during practice under Majors.

title: Economic Stimuli Abroad
description: With the Carter Administration still taking a wait and see attitude on whether the American economy needs additional stimulus, the Government of France went ahead last week with steps aimed at speeding up that nation's growth rate. And several other European countries seemed to be considering measures to lift their own sagging economies.

title: College Point Synagogue, Closed For 7 Years, to Reopen on Friday
description: Congregation Agu?as Achim of College Point, Queens, closed its doors seven years ago because of a declining Jewish population.

title: Bhutto Is Arrested in a Murder Plot
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Sept: 3Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, who ruled Pakistan sternly for five and a half years, was arrested today on a charge of having conspired to murder a poiitical opponent in 1974.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: ExYale Coach Finds Herself New Field
description: When Judith Dixon resigned as Yale's women's tennis coach in March, filing a suit charging sex discrimination by the university, she said she was tired of fighting the establishment and the administration. In her four years at Yale, Miss Dixon charged, she had hardly seen any changes in women's athletics and in her area the changes were negative. The main contention of the suit, which has reached only the deposition stage, is that Miss Dixon was paid the same salary ($14,500) as the men's tennis coach, though she had two years seniority more than he and performed additional duties as assistant to the director of women's sports information.

title: Dorothy A. Ludwig Married
description: Dorothy A. Ludwig, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Ludwig, was married yesterday afternoon to Michael Lorenzo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor Lorenzo. Both families live in Brooklyn. The Rev. Patrick McGarrity, cousin of Mrs. Ludwig, performed the ceremony in Our Lady of Perpetual Help Basilica in Brooklyn and concelebrated the nuptial mass with the Rev. James Geiger.

title: Literary Letter From Moscow
description: HE controversy in American publishing circles over whether to attend Moscow's upcoming first International Book Fair has not escaped its Soviet sponsors. Yuri V. Torsuyev, the fair's director, sat at his small conference table recently while a busy staff outside his office worked to meet the dwindling deadline of the Sept. 6 opening.

title: Paperbacks:
description: GENIUS AND LUST, edited by Norman Mailer. (Bantam, $3.50.) A bountiful anthology of the writing of Henry Miller assembled by one of his most enthusiastic admirers. As William Gass observed in reviewing it here, Norman Mailer's selections don't represent all of Miller's moods, and he comes through sounding sometimes a sage, more often a crank. Of the judgments Mailer offers in his commentary, Gass said they were generally legitimate if not beyond dispute.

title: French Yacht Leads
description: PORTSMOUTH, England, Sept. 3 (AP)The French yacht 33 Export, the oldest boat in the fleet, gained the lead in the roundtheworld race today, as the fleet moved down the Portugese coast, spread out between Lisbon and Coruna.

title: Welfare Activist
description: SURELY it is a coincidence, but this biography of the late George Wiley is being published just as the Federal Government is making another stab at welfare reform. The Carter Administration may not know it, but it is paying homage to the man who, more than any other individual, first made Washington aware that welfare recipients are entitled to equal rights.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THIS week, it's the yachting cap and brassbuttoned jacket and anchors aweigh! That is to say, the subject is boating, a topic on which I am inexpert but enthusiastic. One thing I do know, however, is this: If there's one thing better than having your own boat, it's having a friend who has his own boat.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR

title: Home Style
description: OCEAN GROVE, N.J.Frozen custard and Tshirt stands along the boardwalk here are finding some unusual competition these days: model apartments of what will be a new, 272unit lifecare facility for retired persons, a new housing concept slowly entering the New York area.

title: When Is a Movie So Bad It's Good?
description: When you find yourself stuck at a bad moviea March or Die or The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training, for instancethere is usually little you can do but surrender to the misery: you study your watch or try to nap or contemplate suicide. But it doesn't always have to be that way. There are times when the experience of watching a clinker can produce elation rather than agonyfor some bad movies are so energetically idiotic that they become unwittingly hilarious entertainment. Such fiascoes are no substitute for firstrate films, of course, but they can and do occupy a special place in a movielover's heart. A compulsive moviegoer treasures not only the enchanted evenings he spent with Rules of the Game or Citizen Kane, but also the lazy afternoons he spent hooting at such monstrosities as The Oscar or The Greatest Story Ever Told.

title: Rebecca Davis, Teacher Is a Bride
description: The marriage of Rebecca Davis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Otis Benson Davis of Kent, Conn., to Bancroft Gherardi Davis 3d took place yesterday in the chapel at the Kent School, where the bride's father is chairman of the English department. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. Davis of Greenwich, Conn., and Marguerite Atkinson Davis of New Canaan, Cann., and Bal Harbour, Fla.

title: Bergen Seeks Site For Park and Pool
description: HACKENSACK THE Bergen County Park Commission has begun a search for 12 acres in the southern part of the county that can be developed into a recreational complex that would include a swimming pool.

title: By the Beautiful Sea. If You Can Get Near It.
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich,  Going to the beacha summer ceremony. Daydreaming. Dozing, Basting in the sun. Wallowing in the water like whales; plunging like porpoises. We came from the sea, and that, psychologists suggest, is perhaps why we enjoy going hack so much, a primal compulsion to visit the place we came from. Or maybe psychologists are putting on airs; maybe it is only that beaches can be pleasant places.

title: After the B1, a New Scramble for Arms Deals
description: LOS ANGELESIn the wake of President Carter's cancellation of B1 bomber production, the most expensive aircraft project in the nation's history, arms makers are scrambling for a share of the $25 billion that industry optimists believe will be liberated for other projects over the next five years.

title: Britain and Rhodesia May Never Find the Solution to Bitterness
description: SALISBURY, RhodesiaWhen the British Foreign Secretary, Dr. David Owen, and the Rhodesian Prime Minister, Ian D. Smith, met in Salisbury last week to discuss the latest BritishAmerican plan for black rule, they quickly fell to arguing about which of the two sides had broken trust in past attempts to end the territory's rebellion. Andrew Young, chief United States delegate to the United Nations, listened patiently until welt into the threehour meeting, interrupting when Mr. Smith was running through a litany of Britain's broken promises. Where I come from, he said, in his lilting southern accent, We have a saying that there isn't any point in crying over spilt milk.

title: O.R.C.A. Has Computers To Provide Crew Berths

In between, the best bets are albacore, bonito and scattered blues, which can be found 25 to 30 miles offshore.

title: Some City Employees Make a Lot More in Retirement
description: All over the United States, and especially in the three states of the metropolitan region, government officials are grappling with problems of fiscal insecurity aggravated by ambitious efforts to guarantee oldage security for public employees. No level of government is immune from worry over remaining solvent under the weight of escalating pension obligations, as President Carter swiftly discovered. He has appointed a committee to study military pensions, which have doubled in cost in the last five years and now have an unfunded liability of more than $200 billion in obligations to present and future retirees.

title: Argentine Writer Is Freed
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 3The Ministry of Interior announced yesterday the release from detention of Antonio di Benedetto, an Argentine novelist and newspaper editor who had been held as a political prisoner for more than a year. Mr. di Benedetto, 55 years old, had been under detention without charges at prison in La Plata, the capital of Buenos Aires Province. Literary groups in Western Europe and the United. States had petitioned tbe Argentine military Government to free him.

title: BRIDGE
description: On the world championship scene the year 1977 may well prove to be the end of one era and the beginning of another. The past 20 years have belonged to the Italians, but the invincibility of their Blue Team seems to be at an end: They have finished second in three major international competitions in the past 18 months, behind the United States in the Bermuda Bowl, behind Brazil in the World Team Olympiad, and behind Sweden last month in the European Chamoionships.

title: CarTrain Crash Releases Fumes
description: WATSEKA, Ill., Sept, 3 (UPI)A car crashed through the gates at a railroad crossing and struck two trains last night, derailing 13 cars and sending toxic, highly explosive fumes wafting over the area. Part of the city was evacuated. The driver of the car, Gary Horner, 22 years old, of Watseka, was killed. The police said four tankers among the derailed cars were leaking toxic and potentially explosive fumes.

title: Y.M.H.A. in West Orange

The Newark Daily Advertiser called the first Young Men's Hebrew Association in New Jersey a place where Jewish youths could go after the toilsome labor of the day . . . to seek recreation in literary pursuits, in reading and listening from time to time to eminent lecturers whose discourses are to enrich their minds with all that history can teach.

description: OCEAN BEACH, Fire Island, Sept. 3This village's law against eating cookies and most other foods in public was challenged today on constitutional grounds.

description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Sept. 3 (UPI) The Navy today chalked up its seventh consecutive successful flight test of a Trident missile from a launching pad at Cape Canaveral. There are expected to be 15 or 20 more land pad tests before the missile is flighttested from submerged submarines.

title: $2,000 Phone Calls Paid For
description: PROVIDENCE, Sept. 3 (AP)Robert O. Tiernan, a member of the Federal Election Commission, has reimbursed the Government for more than $2,000 in telephone calls billed to a commission credit card. The former Rhode Island Congressman said yesterday that the calls had been made over a 25month period and were either personal or could be interpreted as personal. Last month, The Wall Street Journal reported that he charged 1,688 longdistance calls to his government credit card from July 1975 to May 1977 at a cost of $2,750 plus tax.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Elvis mania. It was late in the afternoon of an August dog day when the word reached Manhattan: The King of RockandRoll was dead. Naturally, the news stirred up a great storm in Recordland, where 500 million Elvis Presley albums and singles had been sold during the preceding 20 years. Along Publishers Row things were calmer. No book about the Memphis Myth had ever reached the national best seller lists. Only four books about himall paperbackswere in print, and their sales were far from phenomenal. But by the next morning the whirlwind had reached the four publishers offices.

title: Lincoln Tunnel Under Repair
description: New Jerseybound motorists are advised to avoid the Lincoln Tunnel today and tomorrow because three of four lanes will be closed for repairs until Tuesday. Police of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey have requested that the George Washington Bridge or the Holland Tunnel be used instead.

title: Last Week's Election Meant Nothing to Them;They Couldn't Participat
description: SALISBURY, RhodesiaIf the victory last week in Rhodesia of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith restored a semblance of unity to white Rhodesia (only onetenth of one percent of the country's 6.3 million blacks were eligible to vote and most did not), black politicians, including moderates whom the Prime Minister would like to bring into a multiracial government, were more divided than ever.

title: In Recess, Legislators Hear About Issues That Hit Home
description: DENVER, Sept. 3Congress returns to Washington next week with one clear message from home: The public cares a lot more about whether the Federal Government makes it harder or easier to earn a living than it cares about such headline issues as abortion or Korean payoffs or even Bert Lance.

title: Robbery in Nice
description: More than a year ego, embarrassed bank officials of the Societe Generale bank disclosed that their branch in Nice, had been invaded by thieves who had dug a tunnel under the bank, had left behind scraps of food and empty wine bottles from their apparently leisurely weekend and had taken with them $10 million in cash and jewels. The ringleader of the group that staged the theftdubbed the heist of the century (le fricfrac du sicle) by the French pressis still at large.

title: Deaths

Friends may call at Ave,Fairchild Chapel, 22005 Hillside Ae Queens Village, Monday and Tuesday, 2 to 5 and 7 to P.M. Service at the First Presbyterian Church of Jamaica, Wednesday, 1:30 P.M. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Greater New York Y.M.C.A and the American Cancer Fund would be appreciated.

J., Sept. 3Harry, the winning wire for terrier, did it again today at the Newton Kennel Club's 34th show when he was selected over 1,269 dogs on the grounds of St. Paul's Abbey. The star of last spring's Tar Heel circuit and the huge Bucks County and Trenton events posted his 34th best in show after taking his 89th terrier group victory.

The Dempseys decided to expect a miracle, and began to pray for a healing. Today their child is a thriving 2yearold, with all her liver function tests normal. added Mrs. Dempsey.

title: GARDENING
