title: Old Smithy Gets Rhodesia's Nod
description: For a dozen years, outsiders have watched Rhodesia's Prime Minister, Ian D. Smith, and wondered just how long he and the system of minority privilege he represents would survive economic sanctions and the growing strength of black nationalists committed to majority rulenot to mention the scorn of much of the rest of the world. White Rhodesians answered the outsiders in an election last week, reaffirming their allegiance to good old Smithy. But somehow the answer isn't convincing anymore.

title: Robert Stopher, A Lawyer, Weds Nancy Stanger
description: In the Noroton Presbyterian. Church in Darien, Conn., yesterday evening, Nancy Judson Stanger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rhys L. Stanger of Darien, became the bride of Robert Estes Stopher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph E. Stopher of Louisville, Ky.

title: Elizabeth Grove Fiancee Of David Wood Stookey
description: Announcement has been made of the engagement of Elizabeth Hilary Grove, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond J. Grove of Bromsgrove, England, to David Wood Stookey, son of Mrs. Don B. Stookey of Cotuit, Mass., formerly of HastingsonHudson, N.Y., and the late Mr. Stookey. A December wedding in Bromsgrove is planned.

title: Outlook of a Labor Chief
description: JOHN J. Driscoll, president of the Connecticut State Labor Council, is worried about the job drain and the continued high rate of unemployment in the state. We're suffering from the same problems as the rest of New Englandthe loss of important industry, he said. And in view of developments of the last couple of years, I think we have to look forward to a real struggle against economic deterioration.

title: Sycamores Fall Prey to Disease On Long Island
description: For 50 years, as Long Island changed from farm to suburb, uncounted thousands of sycamore trees were planted on miles of curbs to provide shade and beauty as they matured. Now, however, the treessingly, in pairs, in threes and more are dying, and town officials say it was a mistake to have chosen the sycamore for the Island.

title: ART VIEW
description: Among the French painters of his generation Paul Signac (18631935) stands out as a very lucky man. He had a robust, outgoing nature, he enjoyed excellent health, he never lacked for money, he had wonderful friends, he wrote without evident effort a book (From Eugene Delacroix to NeoImpressionism) which is a classic in its field, his selfconfidence never failed him and he painted some very good pictures. We have to pick and choose among his output to persuade ourselves that he was anywhere near the top class; but in human terms he led an enviable and unchequered existence, and he was on good terms at one time or another with some of the greatest French painters.

title: 40 Bombers Heading Yours
description: WALTER LORD is a writer who can take chunk of momentous contemporary history in his teeth and shake it into a lively, wellresearched narrative. In A Night to Remember he took on the sinking of the Titanic, in Day of Infamy, the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and in Incredible Victory, the Battle of Midway. Now, in Lonely Vigil, he turns to a more obscure but no less surefire episode of World War IIthe Allied Coastwatchers, who spotted enemy ships and planes during the Solomon Islands campaign.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Article 9  No Title

title: NuclearSafety Study Generates Dispute
description: HARTFORD

title: Should the U.S. Regulate Municipals?
description: WASHINGTONFederal regulation of municipal securities is an idea that has been patiently awaiting its time.

title: 2 PHONE EXECUTIVES CALLED PROMISCUOUS
description: SAN ANTONIO, Sept. 3The trial of a $29.2 million lawsuit filed nearly three years ago against the Southwestern Bell Telephone Company neared an end this week as the company sought to prove that two former executives had engaged in promiscuous sexual conduct in their own offices.

title: 7 IN DEMOCRATIC RACE MOUNT FINAL DRIVE WITH HEAVY SPENDING
description: With four days to go in a Democratic mayoral primary considered too close to call, the seven candidates stumped the city for votes yesterday and put finishing touches on a campaign that has set record for spending and will blitz Nevi Yorkers with half a million dollars television commercials in its final stage

title: Chicago to Attempt to Integrate Schools After Success in Other Cities
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 3On Wednesday, the third largest school system in the United States will take its first step toward desegregation when nearly 1,000 black children attend classes with white children in allwhite enclaves on the southwest and northwest sides.

title: Meadowlands Starts Flat Racing Tuesday Night
description: Don't look now, but the Pied Piper of Hackensack is about to lead another parade of New York sports fans across the Hudson River to East Rutherford, N.J.

title: Westchester Sets Mark For Entries With 3,666
description: Westchester will present the biggest ?lbreed production in the East for 1977 next Sunday with 3,348 dogs representing an overall recordbreaking total of 3,666 entries. The many rings and colorful tents will be spread over

title: Realty News
description: Two banks have moved into the Westvaco Building at 299 Park Avenue.

title: Weddings
description: RosenbaumWeinstein;

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: And Now a Word For DropperOffers

title: Young Michael Fishbach's SemiSecret Weapon
description: The racquet looks like a bad joke, If a madman had strung it, using pipe cleaners, noodles and macrame, it wouldn't surprise anybody. Sheathed in a cover, it looks like any other racquet, a Head Professional metal frame, the grip covered with green gauze.

title: 350 More Police Officers to Work On HighCrime Shift in New York
description: Starting Sept. 15, the New York City Police Department will put 27 percent more officers on the street during the highcrime hours of midnight to 2 A.M.

title: Check Your Present Policies
description: Before going abroad on a trip, oheck the conditions in your group or individual health plan to see if you are covered for hospitalization in a foreign country. In Paris, for example, patients at the American Hospital can use their Blue Cross coverage. Elsewhere in France, tourists taken to a local hospital are charged for the services they receive and are expected to pay for them upon discharge. In Denmark and Britain, emergency medical care is free to nonresidents and residents alike, but in Norway and Sweden, United States residents are required to pay for any medical attention, whether emergency or not. Other countries have differing practices.

title: Events Today
description: FAMILY WEEKEND AND CRAFTS FAIR: Plant sale, crafts exhibition, entertainment; 10 A.M. to 4 P.M., New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Southern Boulevard, Bronx Park.

title: SCM's Surgeon General
description: Since Paul H. Elicker became president of the SCM Corporation in 1972, the conglomerate's earnings have risen. The noble path of profitability has been followed by all divisions except onebusiness equipment, which wantonly wallows in the red. But SCM refuses to accept the whole blame for this.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: New Address For a Dissident

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Miami of Ohio Defeats Dayton, 2623
description: OXFORD, Ohio, Sept. 3 (AP)Fred Johnson kicked a 26yard field goal with eight seconds remaining to give Miami (O.) a 2623 victory over Dayton today in college football. Miami had trailed at one point. 173.

title: Deadline Extended on Saccharin
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (UPI)  The Food and Drug Administration has extended until Oct. 3 the time period in which it is accepting comments on its proposed ban on saccharin. The original comment period was to have expired Aug. 31 but the Calorie Control Council, representing the makers of diet soft drinks, went to court on Aug. 18 to obtain certain documents from the F.D.A; In a notice published today in the Federal Register, the agency said it granted the council an extension of time because the court case was still pending.

title: CANADIAN LAWYERS TAKE A MILD POSITION ON UNITY
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 3The Canadian Bar Association, in an action reflecting the deep sensitivities aroused here by the threat of Quebec separatism, backed away from a strong resolution on national unity at the group's annual convention in Ottawa this week.

title: MUSIC
description: I'VE lived in Westchester for nearly 18 years, and I confess that I still tend to get mixed up among the three major county orchestras. Maybe it is the similarity of their names that breeds this identity crisis. It's easy enough to confuse the Westchester Symphony Orchestra with the Philharmonic Symphony of Westchester, or either of them with the Music for Westchester Symphony Orchestra. But whatever the reason, it is unfair to all of the ensembles, each of which has labored long and hard to establish a distinctive profile.

title: The Ired Wife in a Retired Life
description: RETIREMENT is a problem that an increasing number of Westchester women are facing today. Not theirs; their husbands. Westchester is an ideal place to look at the problem. A large and diverse county with its traditional bedroom communities, its growing number of apartment complexes and retirement villages, Westchester is an area where newly enforced retirementfor the womencan be a daily trauma.

title: Mara Is Grateful to Fans For Response to Team
description: Wellington Mara couldn't help but smile at all the irony. Here are his establishment Giants playing the upstart Jets at 1 P.M. today in the city championship game on a former New Jersey swamp in the stadium built by his former bitter rival and present landlord, David A. (Sonny) Werblin.

title: Mexico Denies Leader Is Shunning Treaty Ceremony
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3  Both Mexico and the United States strove today to discredit reports that President Jose Lopez Portillo was shunning the ceremonial signing of the Panama Canal treaties Wednesday because of dissatisfaction with the treaties and with the scheduled attendance of Latin American military dictators.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: The Eclectic Internationalism Of Don Cherry
description: Only one musician has performed or recorded with all of the major jazz saxophonists of our timewith John Coltrane, Sonny Rollins, Ornette Coleman and Albert Aylerand with the contemporary composers Krzysztof Penderecki and Terry Riley, and with Lou Reed and Steve Hillage, both leading progressive rockers. His name is Don Cherry, and he has also played his trumpet with Moroccan hill tribesmen, Indian classical musicians, Africans and Laplanders. More importantly, he has been involved in synthesizing these ethnic strains with jazz, rock and contemporary concert music for more than a decade now

title: HOW BACKERS LINE UP IN THE MAYORAL RACE
description: Almost every pamphlet handed out by Edward I. Koch pictures him with his photogenic cocampaign chairman, Bess Myerson, who was Miss America before she was Mayor Lindsay's Consumer Affairs Commissioner.

title: Narragansett Signs Pact
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Sept. 3 (UPI)Narragansett Park officials cleared a major hurdle toward reopening the track by signing a fouryear pact with the Rhode IslandVermont Horsemen's Benevolent and Protective Association last night. The track closed in May 1976 because of financial difficulties.

title: Florence Ann Davis Fiancee of Kevin James O'Brien
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard S. McGhee Jr. of Brookline, Mass., have announced the engagement of Mrs. McGhee's daughter, Florence Ann Davis, to Kevin James O'Brien, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur B. O'Brien of Pittsford, N. Y.

title: The Standings
description: Sunday, September 4, 1977

title: Thaddea Barsh Engaged to A. H. Handal
description: Mrs. Thaddeus A. Barsh of Passaic, N. J., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Thaddea Anne Barsh, to Anthony H. Handal, board chairman of the Aramtek Corporation, a public relations and consulting concern that specializes in United States and Middle East communications.

title: The Treaty Will Be Signed This Week
description: WASHINGTONOn his first campaign trip of 1976, on the snowy slopes of New Hampshire, Ronald Reagan brought up an issue that was new to most of his listeners: The prospective giveaway of the Panama Canal. The voters were puzzled by the mention of the remote and unlikely issue, and reporters tended to regard it largely as a joke.

title: All Sides Claiming Victory in Property TaxAssessment Battle on L.I. After Signing of New Law by Carey
description: All sides are claiming victory in the battle over propertytax assessments in Nassau and Suffolk Counties after Governor Carey signed into law the state's new assessment revision bill last month.

title: The Woman Who Wants to Succeed Ought to Appear to Be in Charge
description: Difficult as it is for anyone to succeed, women carry the additional burden of a cultural and social tradition in which they were not supposed to compete against men, let alone win. An increasing number of women today are motivated to succeed, and more and more of them are in fact succeeding. Yet the pattern of success for women remains spotty, despite a few highly publicized cases.

title: Manhattan Surrogate Race Tops 7 Judicial Contests
description: Nominations for judicial office on the Democratic ticketprime political prizes in a city where possession of the dominant party's line on the November ballot is usually tantamount to electionare being contested in seven of the 12 constituencies where judgeships are at stake in next Thursday's primary voting.

title: Pick of the Crop: Fall Cookbooks
description: Undaunted by an apparent lack of new or good ideas, publishers continue to bring forth cookbooks by the baker's dozen. With 50 or so in from the fall crop, only a few bear special mention. With luck, the later fall entries will be more enticing.

title: Some Tips For Buyers
description: *Name a beneficiary. The beneficiary is the person who will receive the proceeds if the person applying for the insurance dies. If the space marked for the beneficiary's name is left blank, the insured person's estate receives the funds. Most experts say it is wiser to name a beneficiary in order to effect a tax saving. Insurance proceeds are not taxable to the beneficiary. But if the funds become part of a deceased person's estate, and the estate is large enough, they become subject to inheritance taxes.

title: Michigan Officials Are Challenging Blue Cross on Ouster of Dissident Board Member
description: DETROIT, Sept. 3The state is battling Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Michigan, its largest prepaid health insuror, over the organizationET ETA9 ETETETEEES elect a board member who publicly criticized its activities.

title: Smith Haven Ministries Horse Show Next Week to Draw 500 Riders in Place of the North Shore Event
description: The nationally famous North Shore Horse Show, a fixture in Old Field for 43 years, will give way next week to a relative new?omerthe Smith Haven Ministries Horse Show, a mere eight years old.

title: Church Is Permitted To Vote on Seceding
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 3 (AP)A scheduled vote by the congregation of. St. Paul's Episcopal Church here to decide whether to secede from the national church will be allowed to take place after all.

title: Grace Ellen Morth, Thomas Mott Fraser, Anthropologist, Wed
description: Grace Ellen Morth and Thomas Mott Fraser, both of Dorchester, N. H., were married there yesterday at the Town House Church by the Rev. John Fischer of the Congregational Church in Hebron, N. K,

title: HOME CLINIC
description: WASHING machines are usually hooked up to hot and cold water lines in a basement or utility room by means of flexible hoses that screw onto spigots something like those used around the outside of the house.

title: Steamboat on the Sound
description: ABOARD THE MARTHA'S VINEYARD

title: HOW TO FEAST AND FAST IN FLIGHT
description: Brownbag it above the Atlantic? Well, why not? You wouldn't be the first. Charles A. Lindbergh took five sandwiches along on his lonely flight. Craig Claiborne prefers something like roast quail wrapped in bacon. Julia Child makes do with tasty leftovers. More and more, preflight packing by gourmets and gourmands who have given up on airline food includes filling insulated bags and thermoses with such goodies as caviar, cold lobster, Virginia ham, and even chicken soup  not without psychological significance for those whose fear of flying requires a culinary comfort blanket.

title: Gregory Meredith And Sarah K. Ellis Set Bridal for Oct. 1
description: Sarah Kane Ellis, a subsidiary rights assistant with Alfred A. Knopf Inc. in New York, and Gregory Scott Meredith, an associate with the New York law firm of Kelley, Drye & Warren, will be married on Oct. 1 in Germantown in Philadelphia. Their engagement has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles H. Ellis Jr. of Jenkintown, Pa. Mr. Meredith's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lester F. Meredith, live in Shawnee Mission, Kan.

title: Kimberly Johnson and James Hedges Are Married
description: Kimberly Johnson and James Hedges, 1976 graduates of DePauw University, were married yesterday afternoon in West Terre Haute, Ind., at the home of Robert Bright, a friend of the bridegroom's family. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Noel Sokoloff, rector of St. Thomas Episcopal Church in Hanover, N.H.

title: Eric Britter, Former British Correspondent, Dies
description: Eric V. B. Britter, who served for 14 years as a New York correspondent for The Times of London before his retirement in 1968, died Friday in St. Georges, Grenada, after suffering a heart attack. He was 71 years old.

title: Family Runs Monmouth Egg Farm
description: THE farm operated by Emanuel and Mary Puglisi and their three husky sons in Howell Township, Monmouth County, is both a testimonial to American tradition and an object lesson in the rearing of chicks to mature pullets, egg production and egg processing.

title: World News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 3 (UPI)  A sharp earth tremor that caused caveins at two gold mines and left 14 miners dead today and 23 others missing more than a mile beneath the earth.

title: Child Care
description: AQUICK survey of the multitude of books available on child raising shows how many are written by people with no professional qualifications or professional experience whatsoever. Many are journalists who became selfstyled experts by interviewing researchers, clinicians and other real professionals in the field of child behavior. Unfortunately, parents consume large quantities of this material because their need for help in understanding their children is so great. The real need is for scientifically based information written by experienced clinicians who can translate the information into a language that is easily understood by parents.

title: The Nation
description: The human dimensions to statistics were starkly drawn in list week's report by the Labor Department. The national jobless rate for August rose to 7.1 percent from 6.9 percent in July and that increase reflected almost exclusively the worsening economic plight of blacks. Their rate of unemployment moved from 13.2 percent in July to 14.5 percent, the highest since World War II. At the same time, the jobless rate among whites stayed stable at 6.1 percent. Translated Into people, 6.9 million were without jobs last month, 180,000 more than the month before.

title: Players to Watch
description: QuarterbacksMatt Cavanaugh, Pitt; Gifford Nielson, Brigham Young; Douglas Williams, Grambling; Leamon Hall, Army; Rodney Allison, Texas Tech; Mike Dunn, Duke.

title: Jane Hartwig Bride Of Robert C. Mandel
description: Jane Carol Hartwig, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph E. Hartwig of Denver and Truro, Mass., was married yesterday in New York to Robert Charles Mandel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin E. Mandel of Hollis Hills, Queens and Lake Worth, Fla. Civil Court judge Harry W. Davis performed the ceremoney in the garden of the Horn of Plenty restaurant.

title: Bills Conquer Bucs,176; Ferguson and O.J. Click
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 3 (AP)Joe Ferguson ran 1 yard for a touchdown and connected with O.J.Simpson on a 62yard pass play for another score tonight as the Buffalo Bills beat the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, 176, in a preseason game.

title: CAN LABOR'S TIRED LEADERS DEAL WITH A TROUBLED MOVEMENT?;
description: George Meany took the cigar out of his mouth. surveyed the grayheads on the Executive Council of the A.F.L.C.I.O. and growled: Some of you older fellows are going to have to step down. George Meany himself is now 83. But few council members, even when they meet privately, will ever talk about his retirement. Word might get back. The boss would not be pleased. George Meany, the councilors seem to believe, will go on forever. And, indeed, he may. His current plan, he has told me, is to seek reelection to another twoyear term at the A.F.L.C.I.O.'s convention in December, a reelection that will be a mere formality. But even if Meany

title: Pro Football
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Commissioner Evaluates T&E
description: THE picture of thorough and efficient education given by Dr. David E. Weischadle (Aug. 22) contained some major distortions of this new approach to education. While Dr. Weischadle's expertise in education cannot be faulted, certain statements made in his article questioning the workability of t and e are based on inadequate information which, therefore, led to inaccurate conclusions.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: WASHING machines are usually hooked up to hot and cold water lines in a basement or utility room by means of flexible hoses that screw onto spigots something like those used around the out of the house.

title: Quake Reported in Indian Ocean
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Sept. 3 (AP)A strong earthquake about 1,000 miles east of Jakarta was registered here today, a spokesman for the Indonesian meteorological department said. He said the epicenter of the quake, which measured 6.0 on the Richter scale, was believed to have been in the Indian Ocean.

title: Black Managers Voice Optimism That They Will Reach the Top
description: Recent reports have discussed how few black managers have reached top executive positions in large organizations. These findings are accurate, but they fail to note trends toward greater employment of black middle managers.

title: Fear of Crime Driving Doctors Away From Brooklyn
description: It's terrible for a medical student to since we're supposed to be so idealistic, but I probably won't practice in Brooklyn.

title: 14th New York Dance Festival Gets Under Way at the Delacorte
description: The 14th Annual New York Dance Festival at the openair Delacorte Theater in Central Park got under way on Friday night under threatening skies and, initially, an impressive display of lightning. This was almost the most exciting part of the evening. However, while rain was stav?d off, tedium was not. For an opening program it could have been better chosen.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: September 4, 1977/The New York Times Book Review

title: HAWAIIANS STUDY RECYCLING ON L.I.
description: WESTBURY, L.I.Although 6,000 miles separate the Town of Hempstead and the city of Honolulu, they have at least one interest in common: how to keep from being inundated by solid wastes.

title: Treasury's Urban Program
description: Reacting to criticism that it has neglected the nation's poor and the decaying cities where they live, the Carter Administration has leaked a document showing that its officials have indeed been working on the problems of urban economic development.

title: Andrea Colton Wed To Peter S. Britell
description: Andrea Colton and Peter S. Britell, both of New. York, were married last evening in Rochester, Minn. Rabbi Joseph Davidson performed the ceremony at the home of Dr. Jonathan and Dr. Catherine Britell, brother and sisterinlaw of the bridegroom.

title: TRENTON NOTEBOOK
description: LAST year, it was the $6 million in public funds spent to open a restaurant that the taxpayers couldn't use without special permission. Now, it's $1 million a year worth of travel, aroundtheworld junkets and expenseaccount padding.

title: Baby Girl for Lonbergs
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 3(UPI)The wife of Jim Lonborg, the Philadelphia Phillies pitcher, gave birth to a 9pound7ounce girl today at Garden State Hospital in Marlton, N.J.

title: Group Headed by Mrs. King Focuses on U.S. Judgeships for Blacks
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 3A group of influential black Southerners says it has firm commitments from President Carter and Attorney General Griffin B. Bell to name blacks to Federal judgeships in the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit, which covers six states of the South from Texas to Florida.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI)Justice Potter Stewart of the Supreme Court refused today to hold up construction of a gymnasium on the site where Kent State student antiwar protesters were killed by National Guardsmen in 1970.

title: GARDENING
description: EVERYONE must have planted cucurbits this year, or so it would seem from the number of problems encountered. If the name is unfamiliar, this is the family of the cucumber, cantaloupe, watermelon, pumpkin, squash and gourd.

title: BEAME SEEKS EXTENSION OF REHABILITATION PLAN
description: Mayor Beame yesterday sent to the City Council legislation that would extend for six years the city's J51 housing rehabilitation program.

title: Stimulating Celebration of Music
description: The breadth and variety of styles on display in the fifth and last Celebration of Black Composers program in Avery Fisher Hall Friday night made for a stimulating if variable evening of music making. The most memorable piece was no doubt David Baker's Cello Concerto, a work completed in 1975.

title: Today's Feature Matches
description: STADIUM

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Caroline B. Bissell Wedin Connecticut
description: The Second Baptist Church in Suffield, Conn., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Caroline Bouvet Bissell, daughter of Mrs. David L. Coffin of West Hartford, Conn., and Charles S. Bissell Jr. of Suffield and New York, to Etienne d'Otreppe de Bouvette, son of Baron and Baroness Pierre d'Otreppe de Bouvette of Barse, Belgium. The Rev. Odyss Kneece performed the ceremony.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: The theater of words is a bastard formalthough none the less agreeable for that. It is in part literatureit exists on the page and in the story. It may need an actor to give Marlowe's mighty line its full resonance, yet, even unheard, it can echo in the brainbox of the reader.

title: He Asserts Kissinger Urged Korea Bombing
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3According to former President Richard M. Nixon, Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger urged in April of 1969 that the United States bomb several North Korean military airfields in retaliation for the downing of an unarmed American reconnaissance plane in the Sea of Japan.

title: Syria and Jordan Fight Cholera
description: DAMASCUS, Syria. Sept. 3 (Reuters)The Syrian and Jordanian health ministries agreed today on taking joint measures to control cholera and prevent it from spreading, the Syrian Health Minister, Madani alKhyami, announced after a long meeting here with his Joranian counterpart, AbdelRaouf alRawabidah. Syrian Health Ministry sources said today there had been 1.586 cholera cases in Syria, with 58 deaths.

title: THE MARKETS
description: The stock market last week finally took its cue from the old adage better late than never and posted its first advance in six weeks.

title: Weekend Archeologists Dig Ancient Artifacts in Jersey
description: FREEHOLD, Sept. 4Under a hot summer sun, John A. Cavallo dug near here yesterday for more evidence of Indians who he says lived in the area at least 10,000 years ago. An amateur archeologist, he has been uncovering dozens of small stones every weekend for the last three years.

title: Chinatown Attack Kills 5, Wounds 10 In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 4  Three masked men sprayed a Chinatown restaurant with rifle and shotgun fire about 2:40 A.M. today, killing five persons.

title: Some Residents of Hartford Are Throwing Stones At Sculptor's Extended Serenity of the Graveyard
description: HARTFORDAtter months of planning, Carl Andre finally arrived at a design for a new outdoor sculpture to grace downtown Hartford. The site selected for his sculpture is a small grassy spot at the corner of Main and Gold Streets adjacent to a historic graveyard and church. The sculpture was designed, said the artist, to extend the serenity of the graveyard into the bustling city.

title: Rhodesia Frees Leaders Of Catholic Rights Group On Bail in Security Case
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sept. 4 (AP)Three officials of a Roman Catholic humanrights group here were free on bail today after being accused of violating Rhodesian security laws.

title: Negotiator for a New Nation
description: CAIRO, Sept. 4The Foreign Minis, ter of Djibouti, Abdallah Mohammed KameI, achieved an important goal today when his small country on the Horn of Africa was admitted as the 22d member of the Arab League.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY. SEPTEMBER 5, 1977

title: Computer Experts Question Value Of F .B.I . Crime InformationCenter
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4A group of computer scientists has concluded in report prepared for a Congressional committee that the Government's National Crime Information Center has not yet proved its worth as a crimefighting tool and that its benefits still remain in the area of surmise, rather than actual results.

title: Death Penalty in Egypt Is Opposed By Leaders of the Coptic Churches
description: Leaders of the Coptic Orthodox Christian churches in North America have sent telegrams to Pope Paul VI and President Carter expressing dismay and distress at what they described as a miscarriage of justice and betrayal of human rights in Egypt.

title: Javits's Rise Slow but on His Terms
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4In 20 years in the Senate, Jacob K. Javits has worked so hard and run so fast that he has outdistanced alMost all of his critics, winning influence and respect in a body that barely tolerated him as a newcomer.

title: Schools Beginning a Crucial Year As Dispute on Federal Role Grows
description: The nation's schools are opening a crucial academic year that is expected to bring some resolution to the brimming controversy over the Federal Government's multibilliondollar role in education.

title: Standards for Inflation Accounting Sought in Britain
description: LONDONA British accounting group is rushing to devise the first uniform guidelines for British companies to follow if they choose to disclose how inflation has affected their financial results.

title: City Opera Sings a Smooth Butterfly
description: A cast of City Opera regulars gave the company's first presentation this season of Madama Butterfly yesterday afternoon at the State Theater. It was a smooth, efficient performance on the whole, satisfying on all, important particulars even if it Offered no fresh insights into Puccini's familiar tearjerker.

title: Deaths
description: LANNINGHerbert, On September 30977. Beloved brother at Arline Hanlin Drummond. Dear uncle of Robert D. Lederer, Marie Perkins Lederer; and Kate Lederer of Monroe, Ct. Dear nephew of Frances Judelson. Esteemed friend of Lucien Therrien. Friends may call at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave at 81 St Monday and Tuesday 24 and 7:309:30 P.M. Service Wednesday 1 P.M.

title: GOUING OUT Guide
description: SAME HORIZON Twenty years ago today, Viking Press issued a turbulent novel by an unknown author, Jack Kerouac's On the Road, and the book's impact on the socialcultural scene is still very much alive.

title: Crocodile That Killed Boy Is Shot to Death
description: MIAMI, Sept. 4 (UPI)A 12foot African crocodile that killed a 6yearold boy was killed today by the owner of the Miami Serpentarium, who pumped nine shots into it with a Luger pistol. It took the 1,800pound reptile an hour to die.

title: Guests at the Meadowlands See Thoroughbred Preview
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 4Any driver changes? Sam Anzalone asked out of habit tonight as he checked the program for the betless racing preview at the Meadowlands.

title: Impossible Dream Comes True For One Young Virtuoso Pianist
description: If a young musician were to ask friendly genie to grant one impossible dream, the request might very well run something like this: Give me Avery Fisher Hall for a night, add the New York Philharmonic as a backup orchestra and let me play an entire program of my own choosing.

title: EnglishSpeakers in Quebec Defying New Law
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 4Defiance of new law establishing the primacy of French in Quebec is spreading in the Englishspeaking community despite government warnings of financial sanctions.

title: Files Show Tests For Truth Drug Began in O.S.S.
description: LOS ALTOS HILLS, Calif., Sept. 4 Documents on file in a small college museum here indicate that the American intelligence community's research on the control of human behavior focused as long ago as 1943 on ways to induce people to tell the truth against their will.

title: Wadkins Leads Series By Stroke on 67 for 202
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 4Lanny Wadkins has one of the quickest swings on the progolf tour and he hates laying up safely. And if anyone suggested changing his playing style, he said, I wouldn't listen, because it works for me.

title: Scots Challenge Callaghan on Lack of Jobs
description: GLASGOW, Sept. 3The Labor Party's Scottish election manifesto in October 1974 said the party would make the creabon of more and better jobs its overriding concern. There were then 80,000 unemployed Scots.

title: Gail Heilbron, Teacher, Bride of Edgar Steinitz
description: Gail Heilbron of Cincinnati, a. teacher and modern dancer, was married yes terday to Edgar S. Steinitz, who Win his fourth year at the University of Cincinnati Medical School. Rabbi Daniel S. Wolk performed the ceremony at Temple Emanuel of Westchester in Harrison, N.Y.

title: Jet Emergency in Teheran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 4 (AP)Fire brokeout in an engine of a British Airways Boeing 747 as it took off from Teheran's Mehrabad Airport today, forcing the jetliner to make an emergency landing, officials said. No injuries were reported.

title: Americans Top Russians In Swimming
description: LENINGRAD, Sept. 4 (AP)The United States national swimming team scored victories in three relays and defeated the Soviet Union, 212132, today in a twoday dual meet.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: More than 100,000 people jammed the state's lake and beach resorts yesterday as vacationers took advantage of nearperfect weather on the last holiday weekend of the summer.

title: DAIRY FARMERS TO SUE ON ICE CREAM PROPOSAL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI)Dairy farmers are preparing to go to Federal court in their ice cream war with the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Another Dickens, Another Life Spilled Out in Best Sellers
description: BOSTONIt has been said of Charles Dickens that his life reads like a novel. One may get the same feeling when meeting his greatgranddaughter, the writer Monica Dickens, at the Samaritans, a suicide prevention center here where she is a volunteer.

title: Gullett Allows 3 Singles In Beating Twins by 40
description: BLOOMINGTON, Mimi., Sept. 4So what was his hurry?

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Deaths
description: APPLEBYDr. Aaron, on September 3, 1977, beloved husband of Doris, devoted father of Jean and Joseph, loving son of Lillian, brother of Joseph and Frederick. Service private. Three day shiva beginning Tuesday will be observed al the home of Frederick Appleby, 52 Dorchester Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Chinatown Attack Kills 5, Wounds 10 In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 4  Three masked men sprayed a Chinatown restaurant with rifle and shotgun fire about 2:40 A.M. today, killing five persons.

title: ExZaire Aide to Be Tried
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Sept. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)Former Foreign Minister Nguza Karl I Bond of Zaire will be given a public trial, broadcast by radio and television, on charges of high treason, President Mobutu Sese Seko said here today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: After a fourmonth blackout as a protest against crime and pornography, the electric news sign at 1 Times Square will be turned on again tomorrow.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: JAMES VAUGHAN, LAWYER FOR SHUBERT INTERESTS
description: James N. Vaughan, a New York City lawyer closely identified with the Shubert theatrical interests, died Friday at St. Luke's Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 1133 Park Avenue.

title: Market Holiday
description: All banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut will be closed today in observance of the Labor Day holiday. Domestic securities and commodities exchanges, as well as those in Canada, will also be closed.

title: 14YearOld Star Keeps Her Cool at Forest Hills
description: Maybe some day it will sink in. Playing on the center court. National television. Sue Barker. And the magic of Forest Hills.

title: Lesley Levine Wed To Edwin Weinberg
description: Lesley Faith Levine, an assistant district attorney in Bronx County, and Edwin Wayne Weinberg, a lawyer, were married yesterday at Temple Beth Sholom in Roslyn, L.I. Rabbi Samuel Burstein, assisted by Cantor Ralph Schlossberg, performed the ceremony.

title: Files Show Tests For Truth Drug Began in O.S.S.
description: LOS ALTOS HILLS, Calif., Sept. 4 Documents on file in a small college museum here indicate that the American intelligence community's research on the control of human behavior focused as long ago as 1943 on ways to induce people to tell the truth against their will.

title: Cracking Down on Scofflaw Diplomats
description: The Senate will soon have a chance to act on the abuse of American law by foreign diplomats and embassy staffs. Our Government requires all members of its missions abroad to obey the laws and regulations of the countries to which they are accredited, recalling them if they abuse their privileges. At the same time, secure from prosecution or suit, members of diplomatic missions sent here are allowed to treat United States laws in a cavalier manner.

title: Foster Clouts 45th, but Big (Dead?) Machine Still 10 Back
description: It is becoming more and more unlikely that the Cincinnati Reds. winners of the World Series the last two years, will reign over the baseball world again this season. With four weeks left on the regular schedule, the Reds trail the Los Angeles Dodgers in the Western Division of the National League by 10 games.

title: Tina Simpson Bride Of Dr. Alan Richman
description: Tina Carol Simpson, a resident in radiology at Flower and Fifth Avenue Hospital, was married last evening to Dr. Alan Herbert Ricnman, an attending radiologist at Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. Rabbis Irving Koslowe and Norton Shargel performed the ceremony at the Westchester Jewish Center in Mamaroneck, N. Y.

title: Washington Post Editor Is Killed By Whirring Propeller Blades
description: EAST TAWAS, Mich., Sept. 4 (AP)Marion L. Clark, a Washington Post editor who last year was a member of team at the paper that reported that Wayne Hays, then a Democratic Congressman from Ohio,had on his office payroll a woman who was employed mostly for sexual favors, was killed tonight when she walked into a moving airplane propeller. She was 34 years old.

title: Rain and Shortages Spur Malaria Revival in India
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 4 (AP)Shortages of drugs and insecticides and early monsoon rains have aggravated an already serious resurgence of malaria on the Indian subcontinent.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Train of Events Stalls Token of Appreciation To the City of NewYork
description: Once upon a time, there were two smallbusinessmen  clothing manufacturers from Cambridge, Mass.who were so grateful to the City of New York for what it had meant to the success of their business that they decided they should do something in return.

title: Books of The Times
description: When Mr. Head takes his 10yearold grandson Nelson on a trip into Atlanta, he conceives of it not as a pleasure excursion, but a moral one. He wants Nelson to find out that the city is not a great place. Mr. Head meant him to

title: Congressmen Find Voters Don't Link Carter to Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4For all his personal popularity, President Carter the man who isn't there when constituents question or lecture members of Congress about the Government's policies.

title: Mets Bow To Niekro Again, 75
description: Phil Niekro of the Atlanta Braves approximated Sandy Koufax yesterday and Lenny Randle of the Mets behaved like Ty Cobb, which is not bad for a pair of players whose teams are buried in the division cellars.

title: Dividend Meetings
Mexico's Passionate Affair With the Comics
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 4Slumped in parked police cars, riding crowded buses, having their shoes cleaned, hidden behind fruit stalls in a market or just standing expressionless on the street, millions of Mexicans live double lives.

title: U.S. Asking Latins To Sign Statement On Canal Treaties
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Carter Administration has circulated the draft of a Declaration of Washington that it hopes Latin American leaders will sign here this week as a general expression of support for the two new Panama Canal treaties.

title: Susan B. Goldman Wed To Dr. Gene D. Resnick
description: Susan Beth Goldman, a staff officer in the national banking group of Citibank in New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Gene David Resnick, a fellow in the hematologyoncology division of the New York HospitalCornell Medical Center.

title: 10 Killed in Vancouver Accident
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Sept. 4(Reuters)Ten persons were killed in a road accident on Vancouver Island yesterday involving a bus and two trucks. The police said 17 other persons had been injured; and seven of them were in hospital intensive care units.

title: To Candidates, Support From. Unions Means Money and Manpowerbut Not Always Votes
description: Late each afternoon, Marla Colon, a sewing machine operator, goes to the telephone bank at the offices of Local 99 of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union and begins making calls seeking support for Mayor Beame in the primary election.

title: Jets Defeat Giants, 100, in MistakeFilled Game
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept 4The Jets beat the Giants, 100, today in the Bragging Rights Bowl, but they didn't win much to boast about.

title: Nigerian Visits Mozambique
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Mozambique and Nigeria agree that the Rhodesian Army must be dismantled before any settlement can be reached in the rebel British colony, Planning Minister Marcelino Dos Santos of Mozambique said today. Mr. Dos Santos was briefing reporters on a short visit here by the Nigerian head of state, Gen. Olusegun Obasanjo, who left today for home.

title: Commodities
description: Shortly after the news agencies reported late last week that the Government would allow trading in commodity futures options on American exchanges, many wouldbe investors flocked to their brokers with orders.

title: Tracy Austin Routs Miss Barker, 61, 64; Dibbs Upset by McEnroe
description: Tracy Austin and John McEnroe, who delighted the tennis world as new faces at Wimbledon, produced their greatest achievements yesterday in the United States Open championships with upset victories over Sue Barker and Eddie Dibbs.

title: Sweden's Progressive Jails Failing to Curb Repeaters
description: NORRKOPING, SwedenThe Swedes have one of the most progressive and humane prison systems. The Government has striven to keep prison populations low, to mete out short sentences, to provide a vast array of services and support facilities for inmates, and to experiment with minimumsecurity detention centers.

title: Around the Nation
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio,Sept. 4. (AP)Four cases of legionnaires disease, one of them fatal, have appeared in the Columbus area. Officials say that it is the first time since the mysterious disease was discovered that so many cases have broken out in one place.

title: Transvaal Miner's Body Found, Bringing Toll in CaveIn to 16
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 4 (AP)Search teams found another miner's body buried in a Transvaal gold mine today, bringing to 16 the death toll there and in a neighboring mine from earth tremors Friday.

title: U.S. Bows in Track Meet
description: The United States men's team was denied the championship at the World Cup track and field meet in Duesseldorf, West Germany, yesterday when Maxie Parks was injured during the final event. East Germany won the men's competition, with the United States second. Details page 15.

title: Pittsburgh Paper Names Editor
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 4John G. Craig Jr., who has been assistant to the publisher of The Pittsburgh PostGazette since Sept. 1, 1976, has been named editor. William Block, publisher, announced today that Mr. Craig would succeed Frank N. Hawkins, who retired last week as editor, a position he held since 1965, to join the faculty of the Henry Grady School of Journalism of the University of Georgia. Mr. Craig, who is 44 years old, was executive editor and vice president of the NewsJournal Company newspapers in Wilmington, Del., from November 1970 to February 1975.

title: COLSON DISCUSSES FAILURE TO DESTROY NIXON TAPES
description: RINDGE, N.H., Sept. 4 (AP)Charles Colson, the former adviser to President Nixon, said today that he thought another former aide, H. R. Haldeman, had disobeyed orders to remove a White House taping system because he did not, think the tapes would be heard by anyone but the White House inner circle.

title: World News Briefs
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 4 (UPI)Somali and Ethiopian forces both claimed victory today ia a fierce battle for a key town in the Ogaden region, with the Somalis reporting 3,000 Ethiopian troops killed in the fighting.

title: Judging Mr. Lance
description: To see things in perspective, one ought to keep in mind what Bert Lance has not done.

title: REV. THOMAS M'GLYNN, 71, CREATED SCULPTURES
description: The Rev. Thomas M. McGlynn, a. Roman Catholic priest of the Dominican order who became known as a sculptor of religious subjects, died Saturday at the home of a sister, Grace Crowe, in Glen Cove, L.I.

title: NewYorkCity'sPopulationLoss, 442,000 Since 1970, Is Slackening
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4New York City's population loss since 1970 has reached 442,000nearly half of it in Brooklynbut the annual rate of decline which averaged 85,000 between 1970 and 1975 has slackened to 19,000, according to new Census Bureau projections.

title: Hispanic Enclave on Long Island Fights To Retain Bilingual Education Program
description: BRENTWOOD, LI., Sept. 4Benny Nieves dropped out of the eighth grade in Brooklyn 32 years ago because, fresh from Puerto Rico, he couldn't speak a word of English and nobody paid any attention to me.

title: Radio
description: 7 A.M.2 A.M., WKCR. Der Ring Des Nibelungen, Wagner (Complete).

title: 7 DEMOCRATS ARGUE. ABOUT CITY FINANCES AND BEAME'S BUDGET
description: In their final chance at free television time until election eve on Wednesday, the seven candidates for the Democratic nomination for Mayor of New York City argued for an hour yesterday over city finances, the blackout, jobs for youth and layoffs of municipal employees.

title: TV: The New Season Is Upon Us
description: This evening does not exactly represent the official opening of the new season. It seems one network, ABC. decided to get an early start with a 12hour miniseries, Washington: Behind Closed Doors, which begins a sixnight run tomorrow. Then the two others. CBS and NBC, rushed into the normally enervated end of a holiday weekend to begin a day earlier with several specials, all connected with the new season. In the trade, this kind of activity provides the required semblance of intense competition and creativity. The rest of us, at this point, are permitted a discreet yawn.

title: India Stands Firm Against CocaCola
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 4CocaCola appears to have lost its battle for survival in India.

title: Poorer Nations Bid Puts Common Market on the. Spot
description: PARIS, Sept. 4The poor southern countries of Europe are banging on their richer northern neighbors front doors, but they are finding them hard doors to open.

title: ARABS WILL URGE U.N. TO CONDEMN ISRAELIS
description: CAIRO, Sept. 4The Arab League foreign ministers agreed today to urge the United Nations General Assembly to condemn Israel's policy of settlement in the occupied Arab territories.

title: Bridge:
description: An experienced New York expert who is virutally retired from tournament play made a successful reappearance Friday afternoon at the start of the Knickerbocker championships of the Greater New York Bridge Association at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: O'Donnell Still Critically III
description: BOSTON, Sept. 4 (AP)Kenneth P.' O'Donnell, an aide to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, remained critically ill with an undisclosed ailment at Beth Israel Hospital today, The hospital said that Mr. O'Donnell's family had requested that information on the illness not be released. Mr. O'Donnell, who is 53 years old, has recently been a management consultant and public relations representative in Boston.

title: Life Is Clean and. Healthy but Isolated at U.S. Navy Base in Cuba
description: GUANTANAMO BAY, Cuba, Sept. 2 Navy Skyhawk attack jets of Squadron VC 10 bank sharply to dive for a bombing run over a salt flat, while at the mouth of the broad harbor, the United States Navy frigate Aylwin is picking its way gingerly through simulated minefield.

title: U.N. SOLDIERS IN LEBANON ARE REPORTED VICTIMIZED
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept 4 (Reuters)Gunmen in Lebanon's wartorn south are using United Nations vehicles for target practice and are regularly ambushing and robbing the United Nations truce observers, an authoritative source said today.

title: Victoria de los Angeles Will Begin a U. S. Tour in October
description: After an absence of five years, the Spanish soprano Victoria de be Angeles will give a concert tour in the United States.

title: Neighborhood: In Laurelton, Middle Class Likes Sutton
description: To walk the streets of Laurelton, a quiet, wellmanicured community tucked away in the southeast corner of Queens, one could easily come to believe from campaign posters that Percy E. Sutton was the only candidate for the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: Poorer Nations Bid Puts Common Market on the Spot
description: PARIS, Sept. 4The poor southern countries of Europe are banging on their richer northern neighbors front doors, but they are finding them hard doors to open.

title: HUGE ANTITRUST SUIT INCHES TOWARD TRIAL
description: A mammoth private lawsuit plodding toward trial in Federal court in Chicago may result in a payment of a record sum to settle antitrust allegations.

title: Deaths
description: STACKPOLEPhilip W. formerly of Montclair, N.J., on Sunday September 4, 1977, husband of Sarah M. Stackpole, and father of Robert H. Stackpole, M.D., of Elizabeth, N.J. He Is also survived by tour granddaughters. Funeral private.

title: INDIRA GANDHI SAYS SHE EXPECTS TO BE ARRESTED
description: Indira Gandhi, in an interview published in the current issue of Newsweek, says she is convinced that the new Indian Government of Morarji R. Desai will arrest her because they are afraid of me.

title: Kennedy Son Said to Rule Out Race For Massachusetts Post This Fall
description: BOSTON, Sept. 4 (AP)Joseph P. Kennedy 3d, eldest son of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy, Democrat of New York, will not run for the state Treasurer's office this year, according to a newspaper report today.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times Friday erroneously identified Jim Jones, a controversial clrgyman in California, as a minister of the United Church of Christ. Mr. Jones is a minister of the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ).

title: Schools Beginning a Crucial Year As Dispute on Federal Role Grows
description: The nation's schools are opening a crucial academic year that is expected to bring some resolution to the brimming controversy over the Federal Government's multibilliondollar role in education.

title: Unwitting Part in Behavior Tests Fo'r C.I.A. Disclosed by Denver U.
description: DENVER, Sept. 4 (UPI)The chancellor of the University of Denver said today that the school participated in mind control experiments sponsored by the Central Intelligence Agency 20 years ago, but did not know at that time of the agency's involvement.

title: OIL LINE WORKERS SAY MATERIAL IS DUMPED
description: ANCHORAGE. Sept. 4Workers on the Alaska oil pipeline project say they have seen everything from reels of copper wire to new generators hauled off to dumps along the 800mile line.

title: Prices of Crude Oil Slipping as Result Of Worldwide Glut
description: The current worldwide glut of crude oil, especially of heavy grades of crude, is leading to some price slippage.

title: September Song
description: Labor Day is one of the year's mileposts. Regardless of almanac or weather, it marks the end of summer, the beginning of autumn. Here we are in September after a freakish August. And September actually is a season in itself, a time of transition, of beginnings and endings and changes so swift and subtle the eye and ear can scarcely take them in.

title: Debra Dorfman Married
description: The marriage of Debra Dorfman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Willard S. Dorfman of Fair Lawn, N.J., to Herb Kleinberger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Kleinberger of Glen Oaks, Queens, took place yesterday at the Fair Lawn Jewish Center. Rabbi Simon Glustrom officiated. The bride is a compensation analyst with Saks Fifth Avenue. Mr. Kleinberger is an associate consultant with Touche Ross & Company in Newark.

title: CARTER SAID TO SEEK A DEDUCTIBILITY LID FOR BUSINESS LUNCH;
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 2Though no final decisions have been made, it looks more and more as if President Carter will seek to impose a dollar ceiling on the deductibility of the expense account lunch.

title: Rodino Offers Remedy for Lack of Doctors in Newark
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Noting sharp decline in the number of physicians in private practice in Newark, Representative Peter M. Rodin, Democrat of New Jersey, is becoming a cosponsor of a bill to encourage students from the country's innercity areas to seek careers in medicine and the biomedical science's.

title: Csonka, Marinaro Watch Others Carry the Football
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 4Between them, the two most wellknown running backs with the Giants and Jets had a total of one run today.

title: Suicide Mentality Said to Grow Among White Women in Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sept 4 (Reuters) The strain of Rhodesia's guerrilla war is causing more and more white women to contemplate suicide, social workers rportd today.

title: Cynthia Treat, J. B. Hollister 3d Marry in Ohio
description: Cynthia Liane Treat, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sanford M. Treat Jr. of Shaker Heights, Ohio, was married there yesterday afternoon to John Baker Hollister 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hollister Jr. of Gates Mills. Ohio. The Rev. Dr. David W. Rees performed the ceremony in the Plymouth Church (United Church of Christ.)

title: How Old Is Old? The Readers Reply.
description: On Aug. 8, the OpEd page carried an article titled How Old Is Old? that was written anonymously by a mandatorily retired assistant professor of English in the City University system. The writer spoke sadly about becoming a relic and of a new life of isolation: To be considered unfit for the very job for which I was trained, in which I have many years of experience, is the cruelest kind of rejection. The article evoked a sizable number of replies, some of which appear below.

title: LAURIS G. TREADWAY
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Sept. 4 (AP) Lauris G. Treadway, the founder and the president of Treadway Inns, died at his home here early today. He was 94 years old.

title: TWO BUY PRODUCER OF BILLIARD BALLS
description: The Albany Billiard Ball Company, the last billiard ball producer in the country, and possibly the oldest plastics manufacturer, was sold late Friday.

title: Population Figures Of State's Counties
Death Penalty a Curious Issue for a Mayoral Race
description: In a tight Democratic mayoral primary campaign in which real issues separating the seven candidates are hard to find, the death penalty has arisen in the last week as an emotional and a potent one. The irony is that the death penalty is completely outside the power or purview of a mayor; only the Legislature and the Governor have the power to enact capital punishment in New York. Indeed, it would be strange if such a nonmunicipal issue as capital punishment played a substantial role in the mayoral primary results on Thursday instead of such issues as the Beame administration's record, the city's severe fiscal problems, substandard and scarce housing, unemployment, crime and devastated and arsonplagued neighborhoods of the city.

title: LNG Tanker Demand Running Out of Steam
description: During the last two and a half years of gloom in the international oil tanker market; a few shipbuilders have been able to keep their yards filled on the thriving demand for tankers that carry liquefied natural gas.

title: Deborah Rudansky, a Nurse, Married to Dr. Perry Wyner
description: Deborah Rudansky, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Sheldon Rudansky of Garden City, L.I., was married yesterday at her parents home to Dr. Perry Wyner, son of Mrs. Leo Wyner of Boca Raton, Fla., and the late Mr. Wyner. Rabbi David Kahane, an uncle of the bride, of the Sutton Place Synagogue for the United Nations, performed the ceremony.

title: Tough Times for Steel
description: As the steel industry's friends see it, American steel producers are under siege. Government agencies force them to spend hundreds of millions of dollars on antipollution equipment, but warn them against raising prices to recover their investment. Foreign firms undercut them in oncelucrative markets. And Wall Street is reluctant to extend credit. As a result, steel profits are running at half last year's nonetoogenerous rate, and several thousand workers have been laid off. Industry representatives predict that if environmental standards are enforced and foreigners permitted to sell all the steel they wish, 100,000 jobs will be lost by 1980.

title: Commodities
description: The Government has recently given its approval for the eventual trading of commodity futures options, but the Commodity Futures Trading Commission intends to surround the potential market with strict regulations to protect the investor from abuses. Page 24.

title: An Ecuadorian Airliner Crashes Into Mountain; All 33 Aboard Are Killed
description: GUAYAQUIL, Ecuador, Sept. 4 (AP)An airliner flying from this port city to Cuenca in southern Ecuador crashed into a mountain peak today and all 33 persons aboard were killed, aviation authorities reported.

title: No Weather Problems Expected For Launch of Voyager 1 Today
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Sept. 4 (AP) The Voyager mission to the outer planets was scheduled to become a duet tomorrow with the launching of Voyager 1.

title: Goodman for Mayor
description: Do you take a perverse delight in staring at political television commercials? Then conclude your summer vacation in this primarybesodden, beleaguered fortress of a city, New York.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: It is an educated guess that most of the dish names in classic cookery have sprung from the heads of the chefs who created them, without grave consideration and on the spur of the moment. Some dishes, of course, are named for key ingredients. anything maltaise meaning from the island of Malta contains an orange flavor; something provencal generally speaking has garlic and tomatoes as do antiboise (in the style of Antibes) and nicoise (in the style of Nice). Crecy (some say named after the battle of Crecy, others that Crecy is simply a nice place in France where carrots are cultivated) means carrots and Dubarry (heaven knows why) indicates the presence of cauliflower and is named after the countess, the favorite of Louis XV.

title: Portuguese Women Granted Equal Rights
description: LISBON, Sept 4 (Reuters)Portuguese wives are to be given equal rights with their husbands and women will be able to become judges for the first time under an amendment to the Constitution published this weekend.

title: Our Mims First In Handicap At Delaware
description: STANTON, Del., Sept. 4 (AP)Calumet Farm's Our Mims, ridden by Jorge Valesquez, rallied from last place to catch Mississippi Mud in the final stride and score a nose victory today in the $108,900 Delaware Handicap at Delaware Park.

title: Chess:
description: Playing for a victory with Black against a strong opponent who favors conservative openings is a difficult task. That's why such luminaries as Boris Spassky or Tigran Petrosian, both former world champions, rarely try it.

title: Will the Giants QB Please Stand Up?;
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Sept. 4  As only they could, the Jets and the Giants proved today that two negatives do not make a positive. In their annual exhibition game, the Jets orevailed,, 100, but the level of excellence was far below that which the Cosmos, the soccer tenants of Giants Stadium, had established in recent weeks. Another, bad season for the Giants and it might be known as Cosmos Stadium; and another bad season for the Giants appears inevitable. With only next Sunday's exhibition against the Miami Dolphins remaining before they open their National Football League season against the Washington Redskins, the Giants still have three quarterbacks, which means they have none. Joe Pisarcik, the free agent who was cut by the Calgery Stampeders of the Canadian League last season, and Jerry Goisteyn, the rookie who was cut by knee surgery before last season began, guided. the Giants to only 202 yards total offense against a Jets defense that has not been the Super Bowl lately. In the confusion, Steve Ramsey, obtained from the Denver Broncos in the trade for Craig Morton, might now be the quarterback by default. Or perhaps there is time to bring back Lee Grosscup or Bobby Clatterbuck.

title: 'Pagliacci Undaunted as Tenor Loses His Voice
description: As Julius Rudel confessed to the audience after the City Opera's performance of Pagliacci Saturday night, it was one of those nightmares opera directors dread and occasionally have to face. Halfway through the performance, Herman Malamood, who was singing the leading role of Canio, fell prey to a vocal indisposition and completely lost his voice.

title: E. Germany Beats U.S. In Track
description: DUSSELDORF, West Germany, Sept. 4The first World Cup track and field meet was conceived as a festive international team championship, but this afternoon, at the concluding session, all the festivity was generated by individuals like Alberto Juantorena, Irena Szewinska and Miruts Yifter.

title: Carter Plays Tennis And Attends Services
description: THURMONT, Md., Sept. 4 (UPI)President Carter took advantage today of perfect weather to relax at his Maryland mountain retreat. Mr. Carter, his wife, Rosalynn; their daughter, Amy, 9 years old, and a friend, Courtney Moore, 10, attended worship services inside the Presidential compound conducted by Col. Cecil Reed, an Army chaplain.

title: Financial Problems Besieging Black Medical College
description: NASHVILLE, Sept, 3Serious financial problems are endangering Meharry Medical College, a 100yearold private institution that has trained 43 percent of the blacks now practicing medicine and dentistry in the United States.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY. SEPTEMBER 5, 1977

title: TROPICAL STORM IN GULF UPGRADED TO HURRICANE
description: NEW ORLEANS, Sept. 4 (AP)Tropical storm Babe became Hurricane Babe and began moving toward the Louisiana Coast tonight, sending residents back to emergency shelters and prompting an alert from Alabama to Texas.

title: White House Concedes No Move On Appointment for StripMining
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4A month after President Carter signed into law the Federal stripmining control bill, a measure that took 10 years to win approval in Congress, the White House has still not cleared the way for the appointment of an administrator to enforce the controversial act.

title: U.S. National Soccer Team Subdues Ecuadoreans, 30
description: The United States national team showed plenty of promise for the future in the Soccer Festival of the Americas yesterday afternoon.

title: Hartford Ballet Stylish and Adroit
description: LEE, Mass., Sept. 4In 1972, when Michael Uthoff, after years of experience with such companies as the Joffrey and the Limbo, took over the Hartford Ballet, it was one of many across the country of modest standing but professional aspirations. In seven years he has transformed it into a small (15 dancers) chamber group with wide repertory and impressively stylish standards.

title: California Strike Leaders Jailed
description: OAKLAND. Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)Eugene Jennings and Jack Strand, officers of Service Employees International Union Local 1008 who defied a court order and led a strike by Bay Area transit police officers, were sent to jail yesterday for brief terms on charges of contempt of court. About 1,300 of the employees in the Bay Area Rapid Transit District have refused to cross picket lines set up after a third of the district's 79 police officers struck 10 days ago.

title: East Coast Shippers Seek to Heal Split That Blocks Longshore Talks
description: Members of the Council of North Atlantic Shipping Associations are to meet in New York tomorrow in an effort to heal the split in their ranks that has hindered critical negotiations with the International Longshoremen's Associaton.

title: New York City's Population Loss 442,000 Since 1970, Is Slackening
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4New York City's population loss since 1970 has reached 442,000nearly half of it in Brooklynbut the annual rate of decline which averaged 85,000 between 1970 and 1975 has slackened to 19,000, according to new Census Bureau projections.

title: Unser Wins, But Sneva Takes Title
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 4 (.4.P)Al Unser, inheriting a huge lead when Gordon Johncock hit the wall 26 laps from the finish, won the $345,000 California 500 auto race today, and Tom Sneva clinched the national championship with a thirdplace finish.

title: Letter: On Gun Control
description: To the Editor:

title: A List of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: KISSINGER AND HAIG KNEW OF KOREA LOBBY IN 1972, INQUIRY SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Congressional investigators say they have documentary evidence that Henry A. Kissinger was aware as early as .1972, while he was national security adviser to President Nixon, of allegedly improper Korean lobbying.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN PUBLISHER LOSES HIS FOREIGN STAFF
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 4(Agence FrancePresse)The publisher of a South African magazine, To The Point, says that a dispute over the use of its articles in its Belgianbased international edition led to the mass resignation of most of the international edition's staff.

title: Miss Niculescu in Superb U.S. Debut
description: The first Traviata of the New York City Opera's fall season at the State Theater Saturday afternoon was distinguished by Mariana Niculescu's American debut as Violettaone of the most exciting unheralded debuts in recent memory.

title: Farber Says He Paid His Back Tax Bills
description: Barry Farber, a radio talkshow host who is vying with State Senator Roy M. Goodman for the Republican mayoral nomination, admitted yesterday that he had been in arrears on his Federal, state and city income taxes when he announced his candidacy last May.

title: Events Today
description: LINCOLN CENTER OUTOFDOORS, Damrosch Park, A Kurt Weill Cabaret, with Martha Schlamme and Alvin Epstein, singers, 8.

title: KISSINGER AND HAIG KNEW OF KOREA LOBBY IN 1972, INQUIRY SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4Congressional investigators say they have documentary evidence that Henry A. Kissinger was aware as early as 1972, while he was national security adviser to President Nixon, of allegedly improper Korean lobbying.

title: REPUBLICAN PANEL CALLS FOR PERMANENT TAX CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4(Reuters)The Republican National Committee called today for a general Federal tax cut to stimulate the economy and provide new jobs.

title: Mexico's Passionate Affair With the Comics
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 4Slumped in parked police cars, riding crowded buses, having their shoes cleaned, hidden behind fruit stalls in a market or just standing expressionless on the street, millions of Mexicans live double lives.

title: BeerCan Boat Begins. A 2,000Mile Voyage
description: DARWIN, Australia, Sept. 4 (AP)The CanTiki, an oceangoing boat made of beer cans, headed toward Singapore today from this northern Australian port.

title: DAY AN REPORTED TO MEET HUSSEIN ON U.S. POLICY
description: CBS News said last night that Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel and King Hussein of Jordan met in London two weeks ago and discussed mutual anxieties about the Middle East policy of the United States.

title: Desert Parley, With Clashes Muted, Makes Strides
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 4The United Nations Conference on Desertification, now halfway through its deliberations here, is struggling mightily not to go down in history, like so many other U.N. conferences on global problems, as a debating session that resolves much and solved little. There are signs that it may be succeeding.

title: Case Involving a German Radical Deepens Divisions in Italian Left
description: ROME, Sept. 4  A controversy over a Germanborn radical is dividing Italian Marxists. The dispute is typical of the strains between the established Communist parties in Western Europe and the ultraleftist groups proliferating here.

title: Bomb Explodes in Azores
description: LISBON, Sept. 4 (Reuters)A powerful bomb exploded under a military vehicle outside the residence of the Portuguese military commander in the Azores last night, the police said. The explosion severely damaged the vehicle but caused no casualties.

title: FIRE BRIGADE FORMED FOR SPORTS COMPLEX
description: EAST RUIHERFORD, Sept. 4When horse racing starts Tuesday evening at the sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands, a volunteer force to fight fires will be on hand for the first time since the facility opened a year ago.

title: 50% of Americans Favor Japan
description: TOKYO, Sept. 4 (Reuters)One out of two Americans regards Japan as a reliable ally, according to a Gallup Poll commissioned by the Japanese Foreign Ministry.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Nancy Abrams Wed To Dr. Joel Primack
description: Nancy Ellen Abrams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur L. Abrams of Maplewood, N.J., was married there yesterday at the home of her parents to Dr. Joel Primack, son of Loretta Primack of Los Angeles and the late Roy Primack. Rabbi David Levy performed the ceremony.

title: BHUTTO'S FOLLOWERS MAP DRIVE FOR VOTES
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Sept. 4The leaders of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto's political party, after an emergency meeting here, declared today that his arrest yesterday would not prevent them from taking part in next month's parliamentary elections.

title: Fought, Fischesser Gain Amateur Final
description: NEWTOWN SQUARE, Pa., Sept. 4John Fought, a young golfer who intends to turn to the pro tour for a living within a few weeks, and Doug Fischesser, an assistant greenskeeper from Indiana, will meet tomorrow for the United States Amateur golf championship.

title: DayCare Centers for the Elderly: Bridging the Gap of Lonely Hours
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 1For years, daycare centers have provided recreation for millions of children and respite for their parents, and now more and more centers ere being established across the country to meet the daycare needs of the elderly and their families.

title: Film Processing Mix  Ups Spoil Holiday Memories
description: GLEN COVE, L.I.When the Linneman family of Roslyn Harbor returned from a long vacation in Europe a few weeks ago, everyone was in high spirits. We took lots of pictures, and it was a sort of Roots thing for my husband, Sandra Linneman said.

title: Spectator Is Shot At Forest Hills
description: A 33yearold Manhattan resident, James Reilly, was shot in the left thigh last night while watching a match in the United States Open tennis championships.

title: Hospital Moves Walter Pidgeon
description: SANTA IvIONICA, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)Walter Pidgeon, the actor, who is recovering from the removal of a blood clot on the lung, was moved today from the intensive care unit 't St. John's Hospital here. A hospital spokesman described the 78yearold actor as alert, but his condition was still being listed as serious. He was admitted to the hospital Aug. 4 after a fall and underwent surgezy to remove a blood clot on the brain. Doctors then discovered the blood clot on the lung and began treatment to dissolve the clot.

title: Javits's Rise Slow but on His Terms
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4In 20 years in the Senate, Jacob K. Javits has worked so hard and run so fast that he has outdistanced almost all of his critics, winning influence and respect in a body that barely tolerated him as a newcomer.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 4Tomorrow will mark the end of the summer doldrums in New Jersey politics and government, and both Governor Bryne and State Senator Raymond H. Batemanthe two major gubernatorial candidateswill step up their campaigning.

title: Rehabilitation Lagging Worldwide
description: STOCKHOLMIn most of the developed Western world rehabilitation efforts for criminals have been abandoned, in practice if not in theory, as governments attempt to balance the conflicting demands of a public aroused by rising crime and bloated prison systems.

title: Berta A. Codoner Is Married to Allen R. Low
description: Berta Alejandrina Codoner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Salvador Codoner of Cordoba, Spain, was married, at noon yesterday to Allen Robert Low, son of Commissioner Robert Low of the New York City Department of Environmental Protection and Mrs. Low of New York.

title: Danzig Is Honored By Tennis Writers
description: Allison Danzig, former tennis writer for The New York Times, was honored by the United States Tennis Writers Association yesterday.

title: Purcell Shuns a TV Appearance With His Rivals in Nassau County
description: Francis T. Purcell, the Republican organization's candidate for Nassau County Executive, skipped a joint appearance for a telecast yesterday with his two rivals in next Thursday's primary, prompting both to assail him as a boss candidate who is ducking issues.

title: Malaysian Economic Program Is Lagging
description: KUALA LUMPUR, MalaysiaMalaysia's current fiveyear program, designed to redistribute the nation's wealth, is failing to live up to some of the Government's expectations.

title: MANILA OPENING AIRPORT TO MORE FOREIGN FLIGHTS
description: MANILA, Sept. 4The Philippines has ended a decadeold protectionist policy toward its national airline and approved additional flights by foreign carriers to and from Manila International Airport.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times Friday erroneously identified Jim Jones, a controversial clergyman in California, as a minister of the United Church of Christ. Mr. Jones is a minister of the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ).

title: Hazel Scott Is Excellent but Has Lapses at the Cafe Carlyle
description: Hazel Scott, who has moved into the Cafe Carlyle until Bobby Short returns later this month, is running much the same gamut between polished discernment and overindulgence that is often characteristic of Mr. Short's performances there. Maybe there is Something about the room that brings out such fluctuations.

title: Easing Fears on Offshore Drilling
description: To say that the Court of Appeals overturned Federal Judge Weinstein's decision canceling offshore oil drilling in the Atlantic, is to put it mildly. The court accepted almost nothing of the judge's contention that the drilling should be banned because all the Ford Administration's environmental procedures concerning the outer continental shelf were no more than a charade. Yet even among those who regret the new opinion, there seems to be no feeline that it will prove disastroun.

title: Politics and Literature Pondered by 2 Authors
description: WASHINGTONA fragile, waiflike figure, lugging a canvas satchel and with a small blond girl in tow, hopped out of the cab and headed for the doors of the Kennedy Center's Hall of Nations but they were locked. So Joan Didion, the author, who was to be one of the morning's panelists at the National Town Meeting in the center's Opera House, and her 11yearold daughter, Quintana, patiently joined two strangers on an adjacent stone bench to wait for rescue.

title: Falcons Top Chiefs, 2416
description: Clicking on his first four passes. Bartkowski hit Jim Mitchell with.a 31 yard scoring strike at 10:16 of the third Period after Rick Byes intercepted a Mike Livingston pass at the Chiefs 27 Rolland Lawrence picked off another Livingston aerial on the next series and Bartkowski drove the Falcons 63 yards, capped by Haskell. Stanback's 3yard, touchdown plunge.
