description: EYcengbIoe, Cash. DPMontreal 1, Mats 1. LOBMontrest 8. Mets 8. 2BParrish, Hendersort. HRPerez (16), Va:ehrire (21), Mazzilli (?). SBHencersoh, Cash.

title: Deaths
description: BLANKARNGladys pell on september, 5 1977 after a long illness at her home, 730 park ave. Wife of Marshall P. Blankars. mother of Howland P. Rogers. Daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Howland pell. Also survived by three grandchildred. Private service, st. ????????? Church park Ave. at 51 st. ?nterm??t, private at Princ??on Cemetry.

title: Notes on People
description: Preaching his first mission in a Sovietbloc country, the Rev. Billy Graham is in Hungary for a week. He is conveying a goodwill message from President Carter. He called me just before I left and said he would be praying for us, the 58yearold evangelist said after a Sundaynight service at Budapest's Central Baptist Church. Earlier in the day, conducting openair prayer meeting at a Baptist youth camp, he spoke to 10,000 Protestants in an audience that included delegations from Poland, Czechoslovakia, East Germany and Yugoslavia.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Article 9  No Title

title: Edinburgh Festival Fights Gallantly Against a Crippling Lack of Funds
description: EDINBURGH Recently, the Edinburgh Festival was forced to cancel one of two scheduled performances of Heinrich von Kleist's comedy, Das Katchen von Heilbronn, by the Stuttgart State Theater. After a remodeling job that cost more than $1.1 million, the emergency lighting system in the Lyceum Theater failed to operate, so the city's building department refused to issue a license. Several hundred people were turned away at the last moment.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: Market Place
description: An eightyearold battle between the Securities and Exchange Commission and Allen & Company, the Wall Street investment house, has finally ended, with Allen the winner.

title: Nun's Parents Are Informed
description: PITTSBURGH,Sept. 5 The parents of a Roman Catholic nun being held in a Rhodesian prison said today that they had been informed she was in a private room at the prison and in good spirits.

title: Angry Mrs. King Wins Match but Loses Fans
description: Another first for Billie Jean King. In 10 years of professional tennis she had always shaken the hand of her opponent after a match. But yesterday, following a seesaw 61, 36, 76 victory over a longtime ally in the women's tennis movement, Kerry Melville Reid, Mrs. King averted her eyes, scooped up her extra racquets and walked away without performing the courtesy.

title: Colleges Are Fighting Federal Government's Expanding Influence as Academic Year Opens
description: The conflict arising from the Federal Government's expanding influence over higher education occupies center stage as the academic year opens with Washington locked in battle with many of the nation's colleges and universities.

title: Driver Says He Tried To Disrupt Klan Rally
description: CHICAGO, (UPI)The man accused of ramming his sports car into a crowd at a Ku Klux Klan rally in Plains. Ga., said that he was only trying to disrupt the rally, not hurt anyone. Buddy Cochran, 30 years old. gave this explanation yesterday at a rally of the National United Workers Organization.

title: Torrijos, Here for Treaty Signing, Praises U.S. for Ending Injustice
description: WASHINGTON, (AP)Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, the Panamanian Chief of Government, arrived here tonight for the signing of the Panama States for its wiilingness to relinquish Canal treaties and praised the United eventual control over the waterway.

title: F.B.I. Mismanagement, Not Abuse Likely to Concern New Director
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Many officials familiar with the operation of the Federal Bureau of Investigation believe that the biggest challenge facing its new director will be imposing effective management techniques rather than curbing abuses.

title: Top New York Banks Report Mixed Trend in 2dQuarter Loan Demand
description: Demand for loans at domestic offices of New York City's biggest banks showed a slight decline in the second quarter. Overseas, however, their branches reported a sizable increase.

title: Carlton Posts 20th; Candelaria Takes Step in That Direction
description: The Pittsburch Pirates pursuit of the Philadelphia Phiilies in the National League East Division took a step forward and then one backward yesterday. The Pirates won the first game, 31, but the Phils regained their sevengame divisional advantage in the second fume with an 111 romp.

title: Bishop's Home Is Looted
description: PHILADELPHIA, (UPI) The apartment of Bishop S. McDowell Shelton of the Philadelphiabased Church of the Lord Jesus of the Apostolic Faith was robbed of $40,000 in cash, 22 bars of gold and an undetermined amount of men's jewelry over the weekend. The police said the front door of the apartment in his highrise building had been forced and two safes looted in his bed?oom between 9 P.M. Friday and 1:15 A.M. Saturday.

title: TEXAS LAWYER HINTED FOR KEY ENERGY POST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5A member of the law firm of Vinson & Elkinswhich, which has strong links to the oil industry, is the leading contender for the post of general counsel in the newly created Department of Energy, according to reliable sources.

title: DOROTHY NIEMEYER ACKEN
description: Dorothy Niemeyer Acken, a former president of Colony House, a childcare center in Brooklyn, died yesterday in hospital in Utica, N.Y. She was 71 years old and the widow of Henry S. Acken Jr., a physician in Brooklyn, and lived in New Hartford, N.Y.

title: 18 Young Thais Plead Not Guilty To Treason in Universiy Clashes
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Sept. 5 (Reuters) Eighteen young Thais accused of treason and Communist activities after clashes between the police and students in October pleaded not guilty before military court today.

title: Illinois Fume Danger Past
description: WATSEKA, III., (UPI)Service resumed today on the L&N Railroad line where four derailed tank cars containing noxious chemicals brought on evacuation of 1,500 people this weekend. The last of the cars was put back on the tracks and pulled out of town last night, about 24 hours after the derailment, caused by collision with an automobile.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Memorial Services
description: VAN TUYLLMargaret Kelsey. A memorial service will be held for the late Marpant Van Tuyll at noon on Wednesday, Sept 7 in the chapel of the Church of the Heavenly Rest, 5th Ave & St, NYC. In lieu of flowers, a contribution may be made to the Church of the Heavenly Rest.

title: The Standings
description: Tuesday, September 6, 1977

title: SwastikaWearing Youth Kills Black Man and Self
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Sept. 5 (AP)A white 17yearold sniper wearing swastika armband opened fire on a mostly black crowd at a church picnic today, killing a man and injuring at least three other persons before killing himself, the police said.

title: U.S. Junior Chess Championship Ends in Tie Between Jersey Youths
description: DENVER,Sept. 5 (UPI)The United States Junior Chess Championship has ended in a tie between two New Jersey youths.

title: United Nations Handicap
description: C1972 by Daily Racing Form, Inc.

title: OUTLOOK IMPROVING AT CAMP FOR ASIANS
description: SONGKLA, Thailand,Sept. 5  As women in the Vietnamese refugee camp on a narrow strip of beach here in southern Thailand knitted sweaters yesterday in preparation for moving to colder climes, an American delegation arrived to start processing applicants under President Carter's program to admit 7,000 boat people to the United States.

title: Coast Woman Is Slain, Body Found on Stage Of College in Jersey
description: The bludgeoned body of a young woman was found late Sunday on the stage of a Trenton State College theater. The woman was identified yesterday by the Ewing Township, N.J., police as Sigred Stevenson, 25 years old, of Livermore, Calif.

title: Abducted Woman Tells Of Fear of Her Captor
description: DES MOINES, (AP)A Michigan woman says that she was so frightened during an eightday journey with an escaped convict that when he fell asleep drunk at the movie Star Wars, she sat beside him and watched the rest of the film.

title: SUAREZ AND SOCIALISTS REJECT COALITION PACT
description: MADRID, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Felipe Gonzalez, leader of the Spanish Socialists, said tonight after a twohour meeting with Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez that neither he nor Mr. Suarez favored forming a coalition government.

title: South Africa Mine Toll Now 21
description: JOHANNESBURG, (UPI)Rescue workers today found the bodies of three more gold miners trapped over a mile underground in two caveins, raising the death toll to 21 with 16 men still missing.

title: Barnard Patient Gets 2d Heart
description: CAPE TOWN, Sept. 5 (UPI)A man was in satisfactory condition in a hospital here today, with a second heart that was grafted to his heart by Dr. Christiaan Barnard, the pioneer in heart transplant surgery. A spokesman at Groote Schuur Hospital said the patient, identified only as a fairly young man, underwent six hours of surgery. The spokesman said it was the 16th such operation by Dr. Barnard.

title: Maurice Peltz, 76, Built Family Food Business Into a Major Marketer
description: Maurice Peltz, who developed the family food business founded by his father into what is now the Flagstaff Corporation, a major foodservice marketing and distribution company, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 710 Park Avenue.

title: Yonkers Raceway Drivers
New Corporate Bonds
description: (For week ended S??t. 2, 1977)

title: 2 Structures, One Full of Tires, Are Destroyed by Fire in Toledo
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 5 (UPI)  Two buildings next to the American Motor Company's main Jeep Division, one of which was packed with new tires, were destroyed today in a $1 million fire that filled the air with billowing, acrid smoke.

title: Race for City Council Presidency Upstaged by the Mayoral Contest
description: Carter Burden, one of five candidates seeking the Democratic nomination for New York City Council President, showed up at the Brighton Beach Baths in Brooklyn yesterdayand found himself vying with three mayoral candidates for the attention of the poolside loungers, bingo players and other habitues of the oceanside playground.

title: Carter May Press His Plan for Selling Radar Jets to Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The Carter Administration is planning to resubmit to Congress its proposal to sell seven highly sophisticated airborne warning systems to Iran, but without the plane's most sensitive gear.

title: Events/Sports
description: 2 P.M., WNEWAM, WNYC AM: Baseball. Mets vs. Montreal.

title: Gromyko Calls an Arms Accord With U. S. Attainable
description: MOSCOW, Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union declared today that a new agreement on strategic armaments with the United States was quite attainable, but he added that this could be realized only if the principles of equality and undiminished security were observed by both sides.

title: Nomads Are the Missing Experts at Desert Talks
description: NAIROBI, Kenya,Sept. 5Of all the experts on deserts who are participating in the United Nations Conference on Desertification here, only one group is not representedthose who live in the desert.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Article 11  No Title

title: McVay, Csonka Unsure of Who Is Giants Starting Fullback
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 5Is Larry Csonka, who carried the ball only once yesterday against the Jets, still the Giants starting fullback?

title: Events Today
description: STOUT, Sea chanteys, South Street Seaport, Fulton Street and East River, 7:30.

title: Is Juvenile JusticeTougher on GirlsThan on Boys?
description: Girls and boys are apparently unequal in the eyes of the law.

title: Cloud of Natural Gas Is Ignited By Moving Van; 2 Men Are Burned
description: NEW CUYAMA, Calif., Sept. 5 (AP)An invisible cloud of natural gas turned into a 500foothigh fireball here When a moving van drove through it today. Two men in the van were critically burned.

title: Negotiations Break Off in Strike By Sanitation Workers in Suffolk
description: SMITHTOWN, LI., (AP)Negotiations in the fiveday strike by union employes against private garbage collection companies in Suffolk County broke off tonight and a state official said no agreement was in sight.

title: Police in New York Form Roving Squad Of 60 to Fight Crime
description: Encouraged by the success of an unpublicized federally financed experiment that resulted in a 59 percent increase in robbery arrests, the New York City Police Department has assembled a squad of 60 handpicked officers who will be sent into selected highcrime areas to strengthen precinct anticrime efforts.

title: Amnesty Lists Lawmakers in Peril
description: LONDON, (AP)Amnesty International, a Londonbased organization that attempts to monitor human rights worldwide, today published a list of 62 legislators who, it says, have been imprisoned or have disappeared in 17 countries. It appealed to legislative bodies to campaign for their release.

title: Rare Seabirds Return to Maine for First Time Since Early 1900's
description: EASTERN EGG ROCK, Me.The puffin. that comical little seabird with its outsize red, yellow and blue beak, is coming back to Maine for the first time since the turn of the century.

title: $1.5 Million Gem Theft in Germany
description: HAMBURG, West Germtny, Sept. 5 (UPI)Three bandits. one a woman. attacked a jeweler and his wife tonight and escaped with gems worth $1.5 million, the police said today. The bandits also robbed the couple and two of their employees of $28,260 in cash.

title: With 1978 Models on Way, Optimism Is High in Detroit
description: DETROITThe pessimism pervading the stock market and some other quarters over the slowing pace of the economy has not spread to the capital of the nation's giant automotive industry as it prepares to turn the calendar into another newModel year. Without exception, the top executives of the three major auto companies are anticipating their third consecutive boom year.

title: Philippine Battle Kills 10
description: ZAMBOANGA, the Philippines, Sept. 5(UPI)Moslem rebels opened fire on Government militiamen in the southern Philippine island of Basilan, touching off a battle in which 10 people were killed and two others wounded, authorities reported today.

title: Swedish Glass Maker Still Shuns Machinery
description: KOSTA, SwedenIf Erik Rosen had any business sense, he would realize that in a country like Sweden, where labor gets the highest wages in the world, an enterprise can survive only by mechanizing its operations to the limit and telling its designers to concentrate on products with proven commercial appeal.

title: Injunction Served on Town Official
description: DES MOINES, Sept. 5 (UPI)  A temporary injunction was served today on Attorney General Richard C. Turner of Iowa aimed at .blocking him from further participation in a lawsuit to stop the signing of the Panama Canal treaties.

title: Carey Plays A Risky Role
description: By common agreement among his aides, Governor Carey's heightened role in the New York City mayoral election marks a significant new phase of his tenure in office.

title: Dancing in Streets Marks Brooklyn's West Indian Fete
description: Thousands of singing, dancing West Indiansand a good number of honorary West Indiansthronged Eastern Parkway in Brooklyn yesterday for Carnevale parade to celebrate West IndianAmerican Day.

title: New Fiscal Chief of Schools
description: The last memory Ronald Alan Walter has of Martin Van Buren High School in Queens is the principal telling him on graduation day not to get the school in trouble. Now, some 18 years later, he's still trying to heed the principal's warning. Mr. Walter, th new deputy chancellor fo administration for the New York City school system is the Board of Education's chief fiscal officer. As such, he has overall responsibility for all business and management aspects of Martin Van Buren and nearly 1,000 other city schools.

title: METRIC ROAD SIGNS DUE IN CANADA TODAY
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 5Motorists in most of Canada will find new figures posted for all speed limits and distances tomorrow as the highways here switch from the familiar English measurements to the metric system, using kilometers instead of miles.

title: Dangerous Mutant At Large
description: Here is a letter from an unauthorized person. He is angry and confused. While driving a rural road in New England recently, he was stopped by a sign which said, No Unauthorized Persons Permitted Beyond This PointViolators Will Be Prosecuted. The rest of his letter follows:

title: TEXAS FARM WORKERS END MARCH WITH RALLY
description: WASHINGTON,Sept. 5 (UPI)Farm workers ended a 1,500mile March for Human Rights today on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial.

title: Six Killed in Boat Collision
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)A pleasure boat running without lights on the San Jacinto River cut across the path of two southbound boats last night, causing a collision that killed six persons and injured two others, a Harris County Sheriff's Department spokesman said. The victims were not immediately identified.

title: The Short, Unhappy Life of Rubin Almeyda
description: They had first been creatures of the night and of the street. They had lived in Inwood Park, they had slept damp alleyways and in littered stairwells and in doorways. Even the neighbors who never knew them remember seeing them after they got their baby and an apartment: he, pushing her about in her wheelchair, forever going some place or no place at almost any hour; she clutching a baby who seemed to cry a lot.

description: BROOKSShelton. Though he is no longer here, SOME OF THESE DAYS Will live forever. Jerry Vogel.

title: Cuomo Gets Biaggi Endorsement for Mayor; Badillo, Mrs. Abzug, Sutton Press Campaign
description: Because Mario M. Cuomo has a strong, personal, constant commitment to providing safety in the city, Mario Biaggi said yesterday, he was endorsing Mr. Cuomo in Thursday's Democratic primary for Mayor of New York City.

title: Bechtel Gets Mobil Saudi Work
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Sept, 5 (AP)The Bechtel Corporation of San Francisco has been appointed the prime contractor to carry out preliminary engineering studies and develop cost estimates for an $800 million petrochemical plant in Saudi Arabia's Yanbu industrial center, the Middle East Economic Survey reported today. The newsletter said the plant was to be built by the Mobil Company and the Saudi Basic Industries Corporation.

Even the neighbors who never knew them remember seeing them after they got their baby and an apartment: he, pushing her about in her wheelchair, forever going some place or no place at almost any hour; she clutching a baby who seemed to cry a lot.

title: Meany Says Labor Still Faces Formidable Opposition to Goals
description: WASHINGTON,Sept. 5 (UPI)  The American labor movement still faces formidable opposition to the achievement of its goals, Gearge Meany said in a Labor Day address today.

title: A Night of Determinedly Funny Dance
description: Funny dancedance that was funny haha, dance that was funny peculiar and dance that was just funny, perioddominated the second program of the New York Dance Festival Sunday night at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park. Perhaps it was in honor of the Labor Day weekend, or perhaps it was simply by chance, but the program was determinedly lighthearted

title: Carey Plays A Risky Role
description: By common agreement among his aides, Governor Carey's heightened role in the New York City mayoral election marks a significant new phase of his tenure in office.

title: 16 Killed in Philippine Crash
description: MANILA, (UP)Two trucks speeding along a southern Philippine highway crashed into an oncoming bus and killed 16 people and injured 24, the official Philippine News Agency reported today.

title: Advertising
description: As good as an advertising campaign may be, it does not do the complete job unless the advertiser's sales force, distributors and dealers are ready to promote and merchandise it. And they cannot be ready unless they not only know about the campaign, but also are enthusiastic about its promulgation.

title: Sponsor of Backgammon Contest Is Warned by State to Play Fair
description: The high rollers of backgammon will either get a fair shake for a $1 million first prize in a Las Vegas tournament or get their money back, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed In order of post positions. Letter desionates OTB listing

title: Thousands Beautifying Hanoi
description: SINGAPORE, (Reuters)Thousands of people in Hanoi are busy beautifying the city, the Hanoi radio reported today. It said in a broadcast monitored here that every day 5,000 to 8,000 people were engaged in dredging the Red River, widening streets and building a new botanical garden and zoo in the Vietnamese capital.

title: U.S. Intensifying Bid to Get World Trade Action in 78
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Alonzo L. McDonald Jr., fresh from being sworn in, takes up his post this weekend in Geneva as deputy special trade negotiator signifying a steppedup American effort to get the longstalled international trade negotiations into a decisive phase.

title: Angry Man in the Iron Mask
description: New York lost another one of its sports fixtures the other day when the Mets traded Jerry Grote to the Los Angeles Dodgers. And while some people may shed no tears for him as they did for Joe Namath, Julius Erving, Brad Park and Tom Seaver, the fact remains: Jerry Grote was a varsity catcher in this town for 12 years, so he must have been doing something right.

title: World News Briefs
description: Special to The New York Times

title: 400 Busing Protesters Dispersed By Police on Kentucky Highway
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., (AP)Police officers clad in riot gear broke up a crowd of 300 to 400 busing protesters tonight after the demonstrators blocked traffic on a major highway.

title: COLLEGES RESISTING FEDERAL PRESSURES
description: The conflict arising from the Federal Government's expanding influence over higher education occupies center stage as the academic year opens with Washington locked in battle with many of the nation's colleges and universities.

title: Around the Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS, (AP)Hurricane Babe sputtered out in Louisiana's interior today but spawned at least one tornado and left the Gulf Coast awash in rain.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: A subject close to the hearts, and pocketbooks, of most Americans is the sanctity of their tax returns. Hardly anyone enjoys paying taxes, and the least taxpayers expect in return is assurance from the Government that their personal financial data will be safely tucked away in the Internal Revenue Service's computers.

title: Banks Closed for Holiday
description: All banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut were closed yesterday in observance of Labor Day. Securities and commodities exchanges in the United States and Canada were also closed, but most foreign markets were open.

title: E. F. Schumacher, 66, Economist Who Believed That Small Is Beautiful
description: GENEVA, Sept. 5 (AP)E. F. Schumacher, economist and author of the book Small Is Beautiful, has died in Switzerland at the age of 66.

title: Vanilla, Chocolate, Red Herring
description: The quality of the nation's ice cream will soon be in jeopardy, if the warnings issued by the dairy farmers are to be swallowed. The threat supposedly comes from the Federal Food and Drug Administration, which has proposed a new ice cream standard that would allow a change in the recipe. The resulting concoction, dairy forces claim, will taste bad and be less nutritious than current ice creams. Editorial writers, Congressmen and some consumer groups have rallied round to defend America's favorite fun food from technological tampering;However, the dairymen's campaign looks to us like a red herring.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Tate to Hold Lottery to Help Buy Two 18thCentury Oils by Stubbs
description: LONDON, (AP)For the first time, the Tate Gallery will hold a public lottery in an effort to save two 18thcentury British paintings from being sold to someone else and perhaps leaving the country.

title: Yonkers Teachers Union Urges Strike Unless Raises Are Given
description: The president of the 1,600member Yonkers Federation of Teachers said yesterday that the union's executive board would recommend at a membership meeting this afternoon that teachers refuse to work until the terms of their present contract are met.

title: OHIO BEGINS SEARCH FOR LEGION DISEASE
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 5State and Federal health officials have begun an intensive investigation to determine why at least four cases of the socalled legionnaires disease appeared here and whether other cases went undiagnosed.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: British Flight Delays Worst With Charters
description: LONDON,Sept. 5 (AP)Some trans. Atlantic flights were delayed as long as 20 hours today by a nationwide strike of Britain's 850 assistant air traffic controllers.

title: Wadkins Repels Weiskopf to Win Golf World Series
description: AKRON,Ohio, Sept. 5In one of the most spectacular shootouts of the season, Lanny Wadkins outdueled Tom Weiskopf today and won the World Series of Golf by five strokes

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SMALL WORLD The puppetmask music titled Masaniello, which the Bread and Puppet Theater Company is presenting tonight through Saturday in Greenwich Village, has some colorful ingredients both on and off stage. Using masks and a variety of puppets ranging from 6inch dolls to 16foot giants representing historical characters, the troupe's 10 puppeteers will be depicting a true story. They will tell of Masaniello, a poor Italian fisherman who led a successful uprising against the heavy taxation imposed by the Spanish rulers of Naples.

title: Jehovah's Witnesses Thrive in Brooklyn in Contrast to Losses by Establishment Sects
description: A gentle army has taken over a corner of Brooklyn, preparing for the end of the world as we know it.

title: COLLEGES IN CONFLICT OVER FEDERAL ROLE
description: The conflict arising from the Federal Government's expanding influence over higher education occupies center stage as the academic year opens with Washington locked in battle with many of the nation's colleges and universities.

title: Turner's Honesty Costs Him Yacht Race Victory
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Sept. 5Ted Turner, who will sail the 12Meter sloop Courageous in defense of the America's Cup starting next week, was both a winner and a loser in the Stamford Yacht Club's 43d Vineyard Race. Robert Hutton, skipper of Tatoosh, received the Vineyard trophy today.

title: Gunfight Kills Pregnant Woman And 2 Kansas City Men Are Held
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Sept. 5 (AP )Two men were charged with murder today after a gunfight in a crowded dance hall that killed a pregnant woman and her unborn child and wounded at least five other persons.

title: Koosman Loses 8th In Row, 43
description: For the second day in a row, the Mem spotted their foe a fourrun lead and then came back to tie or have the tying run on third base before losing. That's like slipping off a cliff, escaping by catching a branch on the way down and then. on the way home, falling in a manhole.

title: PEKING POLITBURO MEMBER SAYS MAO OPPOSED DOGMA
description: TOKYO, Sept. 5 (AP)A member of China's ruling Politburo, in one of the strongest signals of a new pragmatic course for the nation, has called on the Chinese people not to follow political theories dogmatically.

title: Arab Foreign Ministers Said to Plan Gradual U.N. Pressure on Israel
description: CAIRO, Foreign ministers of the Arab League countries, seeking to deal with what they describe as Israeli expansionist policies, have reportedly agreed here on a stepbystep plan designed to bring pressure on Israel through the United Nations.

title: Police in New York Form Roving Squad Of 60 to Fight Crime
description: Encouraged by the success of an unpublicized federally financed experiment that resulted in a 59 percent increase in robbery arrests, the New York City Police Department has assembled a squad of 60 handpicked officers who will be sent into selected highcrime areas to strengthen precinct anticrime efforts.

title: Home of Kent State's President Is Target of Gymnasium Protest
description: KENT, Ohio, Sept. 5(UPI)About 250 opponents of a proposed Kent State gym marched today to the campus home of the'university's new president, Brage Golding, and plastered it with signs and bumper stickers.

title: Rockefeller of West Virginia and 5 Named to Health Advisory Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)Gov. John D. Rockefeller 4th of West Virginia and five other persons were named Monday to a Government advisory council on costs of health care.

title: Meadowlands Turns Tonight To Flat Racing
description: Angel Cordero Jr. will go to the post at the Meadowlands tonight, and this time he will not be competing in one of those exotic promotions in which jockeys drive harness horses.

title: CORRECTION
description: The Times reported incorrectly last Tuesday that the Standard & Poor's Corporation had rated New York City's notes. Standard &Poor's has rated only the city's bonds, never its notes or shortterm debt.

title: Copter Ambulances Help Region's Hospitals Share LifeSaving Equipment
description: The big red and white Sikorsky helicopter whirled away from the Warwick, N.Y., airport and roared off toward New York City at 115 miles an hour. About 40 minutes later, it swung nimbly to a touchdown at the 34th Street Heliport on the East River.

title: BREAK CAUSES FLOOD IN BROOKLYN CENTER
description: A break in a 30inch water main in Downtown Brooklyn yesterday forced thousands of holiday shoppers to seek alternatives to flooded subways. and sent water cascading over the stages and  half the orchestra seats of the Brooklyn Academy of Music's two major auditoriums.

title: Stage Memories on Sale at Bazaar
description: Old shows never close at the Actors Fund Bazaar. Theater memories and theater magic are the stock in trade of this new charity boutique at 210 West 44th Street, which shares the block with two other Broadway longruns: Sardi's and A Chorus Line.

title: Trustees and Doctors of Hospital In Westchester in Fight for Control
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y., Sept. 5A lengthy dispute between members of the medical staff of United Hospital here and the hospital's administration and board of trustees has turned into what both sides are characterizing as a struggle for power at the 332bed institution.

title: Youths in Europe Are the Hardest Hit by Unemployment
description: NANTERRRE, France, The morning trains roared in and out of the station, disgorging students back for the fall semester at the university and filling up again with commuters.

title: Kentucky Plans Mine Training
description: FRANKFORT. Ky.,Sept. 5 (AP)The State of Kentucky plans to build five simulated underground coal mines to help train vocational and technical school students in mine safety and procedures. All the interest is in this direction these days in view of the emphasis placed on coal production, Billy Howard, the state's assistant superintendent for vocational education, said.

title: John Bull's New Island
description: WASHINGTONThere have been those who have said, Look at Britain and beware. Parity of reasoning suggests that, as we pioneer new political and economic ideas for overcoming our problems, the moral will become, Look at Britain and learn. This, at least, is mystrong personal conviction.

title: Radio
description: 78, A.M., WNCN Overture to Si j'etais Roi, Man; Canton in Echo Duodecimi Tonmi, Gabrieli; Ports of Call, Ibert; Sonata in A for Harpsichord, Paradisi.

title: 12 Hanafis to Be Sentenced Today
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP)Twelve Hanafi Moslems convicted in takeover of three buildings here last March, in which 149 people were held hostage, one man was killed and several were wounded, are to be sentenced tomorrow. The prosecutors have asked Judge Nicholas S. Nunzio Jr. of the District of Columbia Superior Court to impose stiff prison sentences, ranging up to 123 years for Hamaas Abdul Khaalis, the leader of the group. But a defense lawyer said that he would ask for compassion for the Hanafis.

title: A Notebook: OffYear Pace For Politicians
description: GUNNISON. Colo., Sept. 1The campaigning in a nonelection summer allows time to notice the first aspen turning gold, and to look longingly at trout streams, but not quite enough time to stop and fish.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Television.
Forli Wins on 2 Disqualifications
description: A double disqualificaton in the 108th running of the $110.600 Jerome Handicap lifted the favored Broadway Forli from third place to first yesterday at Belmont Park.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: Article 10  No Title

title: PHONES AND LEGWORK ARE SEEN AS CRUCIAL IN PRIMARY CAMPAIGN
description: Despite millions of dollars spent on advertising, computerized mailing lists and polls, the Democratic mayoral primary on Thursday may hinge on oldfashioned political foot soldiers and telephone canvassers getting out the vote in a score of key Assembly Districts, top aides of the mayoral candidates said yesterday.

title: Parochial Schools In New York Draw Larger Enrollments
description: Parochial schools in New York City are reopening today and through this week for 245.000 students, a figure that officials say is slightly higher than last year and represents a hopeful departure from a decade of declining enrollments.

title: Bridge:
description: The number of players who have won three titles during a weekend New York tournament can be counted on the fingers of one hand. Gail Moss, a member of the United States women's team, joined this select company at the Knickerbocker championships that ended at the New York Hilton Hotel on Sunday. Mrs. Moss won the women's pairs with Lila Perlstein of Roslyn, L.I., and then scored twice with Ahmed Hussein of New Yorkin the mixed pairs and the life master pairs.

title: Rhodesia Won't Allow Bail for Nun
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia,Sept. 5 (AP)A Rhodesian Government spokesman says that an American nun arrested last week with three other members of a Roman Catholic human rights commission cannot obtain bail until she is brought into court for a preliminary hearing.

title: Fought Amateur Golf Victor
description: NEWTON SQUARE, Pa., Sept. 5John Fought's attitude toward matchplay golf is: Any opponent I have in match play is the enemy. I like them off the course, but on the course I hate them.

title: PHONES AND LEGWORK ARE SEEN AS CRUCIAL IN PRIMARY CAMPAIGN
description: Despite millions of dollars spent on advertising, computerized mailing lists and polls, the Democratic mayoral primary on Thursday may hinge on oldfashioned political foot soldiers and telephone canvassers getting out the vote in a score of key Assembly Districts, top aides of the mayoral candidates said yesterday.

title: Today's Feature Matches
description: STADIUM

title: Bemo Takes Atlantic City's U.N. Handicap
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 5 (AP) Bemo, whose racing career has been hindered by injuries and mishaps. sped to victory today in the $100,000 United Nations Handicap on the grass at Atlantic City Race Course.

title: TV: Opening  Washington Doors
description: Indulging in one of its favoriteand frequently disturbingmodes, television is once again scraping simplistic fiction from the bones of complex fact in the lucrative cause of popular entertainment. The new specimen at hand is Washington: Behind Closed Doors, a 12 hour production that, this evening at 8:30 on ABC, begins a run of six consecutive nights.

title: Ocean Disposal Site for Nuclear Waste Suggested
description: WASHINGTON,Sept. 5 (UPI)Two scientists said today that they believe that huge cracks in the eastern basin of the Atlantic Ocean floor might be perfect as a disposal place for nuclear wastes. Lethal material could lie there undisturbed for 250,000 years. they said.

title: The Jerome Handicap
description: 1977 by Dally Racing Form, Inc.

title: Edwin W. Jones, Ohio County Judge Who Presided at Kent State Inquiry
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, (AP)Edwin W. Jones, the Portage County, Ohio, Common Pleas Court Judge who presided over a state grand jury that investigated the disorders at Kent State University in 1970, died yesterday in Robinson Memorial Hospital, where he had been in a coma since a fall at his home on Aug. 27. He was 66 years old.

title: About New york
description: Claire's occasional urge to kill herself had returned the night before, and when she got on the elevator her friend, Esther Montanez, did not hesitate to confront her across the glances of curious passengers.

title: Yankees Box Scores
description: FIRST GAME

title: LAKER IS SEEKING TO FLY TO FIELD NEARER LONDON
description: LONDON, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Laker Airways today asked Britain's Civil Aviation Authority to alter some of the rules governing operation of its LondonNew York Skytrain service in order to make it more competitive.

title: Bhutto Is Accused Of Having Ordered 2d Political Death
description: ISLAMABAD. Pakistan, Sept. 5 (AP)The deposed Prime Minister, Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, already jailed in one political murder, has been accused of having ordered a second, federal investigators sa?d today.

title: 32 Private Schools Learn Lesson On Buying More and Paying Less
description: Two years ago, the heads of 32 private schools in New York City were looking for a way to save money on everyday purchases such as mimeograph paper and food for student lunches. So, they formed an organization.

title: Miss Stacy Cards a 72Hole Record of 271
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Sept. 5 CAP) Hollis Stacy won the $100,000 Muscular Dystrophy golf tournament today with a 17underpar 271, a Ladies Professional Golf Association record for 72 holes.

title: New Jerseyan to Start Trial On Threat to Kill Rockefeller
description: CAMDEN, N.J., Sept. 5 (AP)Robert A. Dufala, a day care school owner, was to go on trial for the second time tomorrow on charges that he threatened to assassinate Vice President Rockefeller last year with a cyanide bullet.

title: Adirondacks Purchase Completes Public Holding of High Peaks Area
description: ALBANY, Sept. 5New York State has agreed to buy 9,311 acres in the eastern Adirondack Mountains, including 11 of their highest peaks, to add to the Adirondack Forest Preserve.

title: Democratic Registration Among Minorities Gaining
description: Efforts to increase Democratic voter registration among minoritygroup members have apparently succeeded, with percentage gains in some heavily minority districts triple the citywide average, an analysis of new registrations since the last election indicates.

title: DRUGLINKED ARRESTS REPORTED INCREASING
description: Topdog dealers in drugs are being arrested more frequently in New York State and are increasingly likely to be convicted and sentenced to stiff prison terms, according to Frank J. Rogers, the state's Commissioner of Criminal Justice Services.

title: Tracy Austin Triumphs Again; Crowd Stages an Unruly SitIn
description: Yesterday was another day to remember at Forest Hills, and not simply because of Tracy Austin's latest triumph or the heroics of Harold Solomon and Billie Jean King.

title: Tax Reform: End the Disgrace
description: On the stump, Candidate Carter was a fiery tax reformer. He pledged that if elected he would eliminate the complexities and inequities of the nation's income tax system, which he called a disgrace to the human race. Now the time has come. President Carter must end the disgrace. The postWatergate reformist spirit in Congress and the country offer him a rare opportunity to turn the decadeold dreams of tax reformers into a reality. When the President finally announces his longawaited plan, perhaps later this month, we shall learn if Jimmy Carter will be remembered as the first serious tax reformer in the modern White House or as just another of the postwar Presidents who only talked tough.

title: Trial in $60 Million Suit By Widows of 15 Miners Is Opening in Kentucky
description: PIKEVILLE, Ky., Sept. 5 (AP)Fifteen women whose husbands died in a coal mine explosion 18 months ago are asking $60 million in a Federal suit that goes to court here tomorrow.

title: George Barnes, 56; Jazz Guitarist Won Acclaim for Style
description: George Barnes, the jazz guitarist who teamed with Bucky Pizzarelli and with Carl Kress in guitar duos and who shared the leadership of a widely acclaimed quartet with Ruby Braff, the cornetist, died of a heart attack Sunday night at his home in Concord, Calif. Mr. Barnes, 56 years old, had been teaching and freelancing in Concord since he moved there from New York in 1975.

title: When Not to Use Lie Detectors
description: No one knows just how many polygraph, or lie detector, tests are currently being given routinely to job applicants and employees in this country, but the number is certainly in the scores of thousands, and rising. For employers, the main attraction of these testswhich measure changes in a person's physical responses as questions are askedis their speed and their price. A polygraph test usually requires only one or two sittings and costs substantially less than a fullscale check of an employee's background. But whatever the seeming benefit to employers, the social cost is too high.

title: Rock Fans Leave Tons of Trash
description: ENGLISHTOWN, N. J., (UPI) The last few thousand of the 150,000 rock fans who attended a weekend concert by the Grateful Dead headed home today, leaving tons of litter.

title: U. S. and Philippines to Hold Talks A 3d Time in Bid for Economic Pact
description: MANILA, Sept. 5Trade and investment in a surging Philippine economy will he discussed on Wednesday when a panel of economic officials from the United States meets with a counterpart group here.

title: WEATHER AND INEXPERIENCE CLAIM MANY LIVES IN ALPS
description: PARIS, (AP)Bad weather and a rush of novice climbers have turned this summer into one of the deadliest mountaineering seasons on record in the Alps.

title: F.B.I. Inefficiency, Not Abuses, Likely to Concern New Director
description: WASHINGTON, Many officials familiar with the operation of the Federal Bureau of Investigation believe that the biggest challenge facing its new director will be imposing effective management techniques rather than curbing abuses.

title: New Jersey Schools Starting New Term Hopeful on Finances
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5Despite declining enrollment and rising costs, New Jersey's 607 public school districts will resume classes in the next three days more optimistic about their financial health than they have been in many years.

title: Farmworkers Group Will Sue State On Bar to Overtime for Migrant Labor
description: GLASSBORO, Sept. 5The Farmworkers Rights Project of the American Civil Liberties Union will sue New Jersey tomorrow, challenging the constitutionality of the 1966 state law that excludes farmworkers from provisions for overtime pay.

title: Explosion in Soviet Recorded
description: STOCKHOLM, (AP)An underground explosion measuring 6.7 on the Richter scale was registered today from the Soviet Union's nuclear testing area in western Siberia, the Uppsala Seismological Institution reported. It was the fifth and most powerful underground explosion recorded this year from the Semipalatinsk area.

title: Wilton B. Persons Is Dead at 81; Chief Assistant to Eisenhower
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.. (AP) Maj. Gen. Wilton B. Persons, retired, who Ivas chief assistant to President Eisenhower, died here today. He was 81 years.

title: Yanks Swept by Indians And Lead Is Cut to 2
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 5  Ordinary tools such as bats and ball hadn't worked too well against the Yankees in the last month so the Cleveland Indians resorted to a novel weapon tonightI Hate the Yankee Hankeesand it worked.

title: PRISON UNIT ISSUES A SET OF STANDARDS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5(AP)A nationwide group of prison officials has established its own accreditation commission in an effort to improve institutional activities and conditions and plans to invite the Federal and state prison authorities to apply for accreditation in much the same way that hospitals and colleges are approved by their professional grouns.

title: British Unionists Press Fight on Laborite Pay Policy
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Rankandfile trade unionists stepped up their attacks on the Government's restrictive pay policy as the annual Trades Union Congress got off to a tumultuous start here today.

title: San Francisco Police Fear Reprisal In Slayings Laid to Chinese Gangs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5The police have increased patrols in Chinatown here on the possibility that there will be gang reprisals for shootings yesterday in a Chinatown restaurant.

title: Ford Backs Goodman for Mayor, Praising aToughMinded Leader
description: Roy M. Goodman, the organization Republican candidate for Mayor of New York City, was endorsed by former President Gerald R. Ford yesterday as a toughminded leader with an outstanding record of accomnlishment.

title: 24.11(b)(1) Sec. 66(iv) Flatly Says No (Maybe)
description: Our free society is gravely imperiled and individual freedom itself is in danger of being smothered.

title: Yields Are Down In TaxExempts To a 3Year Low
description: Yields on taxexempt bonds dropped last week to their lowest levels in nearly three and a half years as investment bankers completed offering a record $31 billion of new state and local government securities through the first eight months of 1977.

title: Calhoun Bank Sources Say Lance Cannot Be Linked to Embezzlement
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Sources close to the Calhoun First National Bank said today that it was impossible that Bert Lance could be implicated in any way in the embezzlement of about $1 million by a bank officer while Mr. Lance was president and board chairman of the bank.

title: Elizabeth Hunter Wed To William Solomon
description: Elizabeth Irene Hunter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Hewat Hunter of Williamstown, Mass., and Sea Island, Ga., was married yesterday at her parents home in Williamstown to William I. Solomon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Max S. Solomon of Takoma Park, Md. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. John C. Lase, senior minister of the Overbrook Presbyterian Church in Columbus. Ohio.

title: Books of The Times
description: Sometimes you get lucky. Of the 20 years or so I've spent pretending to be an adult, only five have been devoted to book reviewing. And yet I was permitted to review Vladimir Nabokov's Lolita for my college newspaper; to review Joseph Heller's Catch22, Doris Lessing's The Golden Notebook and Gunter Grass's The Tin Drum for a radio station in California; and to review John Cheever's Bullet Park, Gabriel Garcia Marquez's One Hundred Years of Solitude and Maxine Hong Kingston's The Woman Warrior for The Times. That's luck. These are special books. About them, a reviewer tends to feel touchy and possessiveas if, together, they constitute much of what I know and think, and to give away their magic to strangers is somehow to give away my advantage in moral and esthetic realms.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 6, 1977

title: BEGIN'S VICTORY LAID TO SEPHARDIC VOTES
description: The key to Prime Minister Menahem Begin's victory in the May elections in Israel was a marked switch to his Likud alignment by Sephardic Jews of African and Asian origin.

title: $6.5 Million Drive Set for Palisades Jewish Center
description: ENGLEWOOD, Sept. 5A $6.5 million buildingfund drive for the Jewish Community Center on the Palisades will formally open Thursday with a cocktail party for leaders in government and business at the home of Sylvia Heidenberg on Highview Road here.

title: ExComptroller Says He Talked To Carter Aides About Bank Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Robert Bloom, who as acting Comptroller of the Currency praised Bert Lance to the Senate committee that later recommended his confirmation to be budget director, says he did not tell the Senate panel about Mr. Lance's banking difficulties because he assumed that the Senators had already been given the information by Presidentelect Carter's aides.

title: Leak in Nuclear Unit in Jersey Fixed With No Radioactive Loss
description: LOWER ALLOWAYS CREEK, N.J., Sept. 5(AP)  A pinhole leak in a nuclear unit at Public Service Electric & Gas Company's generating station here was. repaired today, utility officials said.

description: Horses listed In order of post positions.

description: FIRST$9,000, mdns., 3YO and up, 6f.

title: Black TeenAge Unemployment Is Climbing Steadily
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5The unemployment rate among black teenagers in New Jersey has been climbing steadily in the last few years and currently fewer than 20 percent of the blacks between 16 and 20 years of age have jobs. Between 45 and 50 percent of whites in the same age bracket have jobs.

title: Mrs. Thatcher Widens Horizons to Take In U.S.
description: LONDON, Still full of confi dence that she will one day be prime minister, Margaret Thatcher flies to the United States tomorrow on the latest in a series of trips designed to give her the look of a seasoned international politician.

title: RIBICOFF AND PERCY PRESS CARTER FOR LANCE'S RESIGNATION, CITING NEW ALLEGATION OF ILLEGALITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5  Senators Abraham A, Ribicoff and Charles H. Percy told President Carter today that they had received allegations of illegality about Budget Director Bert Lance and had urged the President to ask Mr. Lance to resign.

description: The Times reported incorrectly last Tuesday that the Standard & Poor's Corporation had rated New York City's notes. Standard & Poor's has rated only the city's bonds, never its notes or shortterm debt.

title: Harry, Terrier, Sweeps Third Weekend Show
description: CHESTER, N.J.. Three shows in three days ended today in a winning finale to the New Jersey holiday circuit for Ch. Harwire Hetman of Whinlatter.

title: JOSEPH H. TOBIN
description: GLOVERSVILLE, N.Y., (AP)Joseph H. Tobin, who spent much of his career in the broadcasting industry and once was a personal announcer for the singer Kate Smith, died Sunday at the ace of 64.

title: Taiwan Greets Its Heroes
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Sept. 5(Reuters)A huge crowd gave a tumultuous welcome to three Taiwanese Little League baseball teams that returned today after capturing all three titles at the league world series in the United States last month. Premier Chiang Chingkuo greeted each player at the airport.

title: Inquiry Opening in New Rochelle On Handling of Gunman's Threat
description: A formal inquiry is to begin today in New Rochelle, N.Y., into the way the police handled a murder threat by Frederick W. Cowan 18 months before the Nazi follower gunned down six persons and took his own life last February.

title: JOHN GOLLAN, 66, LEADER OF BRITAIN'S COMMUNISTS
description: LONDON, (AP)John Gollan, general secretary of the British Communist Party from 1956 to 1975, died at his London home today, the party announced. He was 66 years old.

title: C.D. Batchelor, 89; Cartoonist for News Won Pulitzer Prize
description: C. D. Batchelor, a Pulitzer Prizewinning cartoonist whose work appeared in The Daily News from 1931 until his retirement in 1969, died yesterday at his home in Deep River, Conn. He was 89 years old.

title: 2d Voyager Spacecraft Lifts Off Smoothly, Speeds Toward Jupiter
description: CAPE CANAVERAL Fla., (AP) The Voyager I spacecraft was launched precisely on time today on top of a Titan Centaur rocket and headed for a course that is to take it by Jupiter and Saturn ahead of its earlierlaunched twin, Voyager 2. A proiect official termed the flight absolutely flawless.

title: Nazi Defense by A.C.L.U. Has Cost 2,000 Members
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 3The American Civil Liberties Union has lost more than 2,000 members because of its involvement on behalf of a Nazi group here that contends its First Amendment rights have been breached.

title: EARLY CRIME DETECTION EXPLORED IN RAND STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)  Researchers have found that more dangerous, highly active criminals were involved in serious crime before they reached the age of 13 than less dangerous, amateur criminals, the Rand Corporation reported today.

title: A Missed Opportunity
description: If President Carter had stayed with his original preinaugural plan for stimulating the economy, the effect of the stimulus would have been felt by Labor Day. But he didn't, opting instead for business confidence that's one good reason why the economy now appears to be pausing, perhaps ready to head downward.

title: New York Parochial Schools Getting More Pupils
Dollar Makes Small Gains In Dull European Trading; Price of Gold Up Sharply
description: LONDON, Sept. 5 (AP)The dollar rose slightly against major West European currencies today in what dealers said was a featureless day on the foreign exchange market.

title: Sparked by Bartkowski,
description: KANSAS CITY, Sept. 5 (AP)Steve Bartkowski, his injured right knee in brace, converted three Kansas City turnovers into third:quarter scoring drives and sparked the Atlanta Falcons to a 2416 exhibition victory over the Chiefs tonight. .

title: Restaurateur to Share Profits With Diners
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Sept. 5 (UPI)Because he says he appreciates his customers business, Nguyen Huy Han plans to serve up a helping of profits to regular diners at his restaurant in this Detroit suburb.

title: Doctors Talk About Grief and the Complexity of Dealing With the Terminally III
description: POINTE CLAIRE, QuebecAt a recent oneday conference here on cancer and death, Dr. Eric Cassell, of New York Hospital, welcomed what he called the new religion of truth.

title: $25,000 Reward Offered In 5 Slayings on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6 (AP)A $25,000 reward was offered today for information leading to conviction of those involved in the shooting up of Chinatown restaurant by three masked gunmen that left five dead and 11 wounded.

title: Advertising
description: Plunging with its massive $15 billion plus sales into the heart of the television  newspaper advertising issue, Sears, Roebuck & Company, the country's largest retailer and biggest retail advertiser, is making a significant media change this year.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Dolls of Cloth

title: In the Style of the Gauchos,
description: There are many kinds of feasts based to one degree or another on rituals of either a formal or a highly casual nature. They exist in almost every culture and numerous ones come to mind. In China there are the elaborate fire pots or Mongolian hot pots wherein foods, fish, meat and vegetables are cooked at the table by guests who stand around a communal and decorative steaming device.

title: O'Donnell Condition Still Critical
description: BOSTON, Sept. 6 (AP)Kenneth P. O'Donnell, an aide to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, remained in critical condition today at Beth Israel Hospital. Mr. O'Donnell, 53 years old, was admitted to the hospital Aug. 11 with an undisclosed illness, and his condition apparently worsened last week. The hospital said that Mr. O'Donnell's family had requested that information on his ailment not be released.

title: Legislative Analyst for California Retires After 28 Years of Service
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6A. Alan Post, an unusual figure in California politics and public administration, left the office of legislative analyst last week to go into retirement at age 63.

title: Misanthrope to Begin At Public Theater Oct. 4
description: A musical version of Moliere's The Misanthrope, adapted by Richard Wilbur and set to music by Margaret Pine; has entered rehearsals and will begin performances Oct. 4 at the New York Shakespeare Festival's Public Theater, Joseph Papp, the festival's producer, has announced.

title: Boston Teachers Back Contract Peaceful School Opening Foreseen
description: BOSTON Sept. 6 (AP)Boston teachers voted today to accept a $6 million contract negotiated last week, clearing the way for what officials hope will be an uneventful school opening tomorrow.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designatea OTB listings

title: Carter Asked to Curb Japanese Oven Imports
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 6(Reuters)A trade association representing manufacturers of home appliances asked President Carter today to restrict imports of Japanesemade microwave ovens.

title: About Education
description: The National Education Association has intensified its assault on the use of standardized tests in American classrooms.

title: Complaint About Pollution Against Cyclops Dismissal
description: The Cyclops Corporation, a leadin? producer of stainless steel, announced tilt settlement and dismissal of a complaint filed two weeks ago by the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency.

title: TERRORISTS BID BONN RELEASE PRISONERS
description: BONN, Sept. 6Officials said tonight that the terrorists who kidnapped HannsMartin Schleyer, the president of the West German Employers Association, in a submachine gun attack in Cologne yesterday had established contact with the authorities today.

title: 15 Are Injured When Firebomb Is Tossed Into Washington Nightspot
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI) A firebomb was tossed into a crowded northwest Washington nightspot last night injuring at last 15 persons. the police reported. Three of the victims were listed in critical condition in hospitals, officials said, and several others were seriously burned.

title: The Standings
description: Wednesday, September 7, 1977

title: DiGregorio of Braves Is Acquired by Lakers
description: Ernie DiGregorio, an unhappy Buffalo Brave for several seasons, is now a happy Los Angeles Laker. The Lakers have called a news conference for today to announce the purchase of the 6foot backcourt man from the wheeling and dealing Braves.

title: Notes on People
description: IN Montgomery, Cornelia Wallace, wife of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, moved out of the Governor's mansion yesterday, saying She could no longer endure the vulgarity, threats and abuse. She also said she had retained legal counsel. to protect me, but she refused to say whether she would formally file for divorce from Mr. Wallace, who sceveral weeks ago had divorce papers drawn up. One of Mrs. Wallace's lawyers, Ira DeMent, said: She's deeply hurt and distraught. She states that she has attempted in every way to save her marriage. The Governor, who was in the mansion when the movers came for Mrs. Wallace's belongings, was said by friends to have appeared emotionally upset all last week. Among the lawyers hired by Mrs. Wallace yesterday was John P. Kohn, a former State Supreme Court justice who was appointed to the bench by the late Gov. Lurleen Wallace, Mr. Wallence's first wife.

title: Perry Street Reviving Emperor Jones
description: The Emperor Jones, O'Neill's 1920 Expressionistic drama, will be revived as the opening production of the sec-ond subscription season of the Perry Street Theater at 31 Perry Street. The play, which will have Rodney Hudson as Brutus Jones, the railway potter who becomes the ruler of an African tribe, will play Thursday through Sunday evenings at 8 o'clock from Sept. 15 through Oct. 2. All tickets are priced at $2.50.

title: Portrait Comes to Light Of Elizabeth Browning
description: How did he draw her?

description: Horses listed in ored of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Reserve Bolstered Dollar in $247 Million Transactions
description: The Federal Reserve bought and sold the equivalent of $246.7 million, mostly in West German marks, during the three months ended July in an effort to counter disorderly market conditions for the dollar.

title: Technology
description: If repair bills are any indication, the oftencriticized automobiles made by American Manufacturers are slowly becoming more reliable, according to the Hertz Corporation, the carrental company that is the nation's largest nongovernmental purchaser of cars.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT SHOULD BE pretty obvious even from the title what Robert Coover is up to in his fifth book his first work of fiction since his collection of stories, Pricksongs slid Descants, was published in 1969 and his first novel since his memorable The Universal Baseball Association, Ja Henry Waugh, Prop. came out the year before. And lest it isn't clear what a novel about Julius and Ethel Rosenberg called The Public Burning is about, any remaining doubts should be dispelled by; .its Prologue, called Groun'Hog Hunt, in which it is established that the Phantom of International Communism is gaining in his contest with America's Mighty Superhero. Uncle Sam.

title: DANIEL P. McGIBBENY
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 6 (AP)Daniel Patrick McGibbeny, former general manager and coach of the Pittsburgh Triangles of World Team Tennis, died in a hospital today at the age of 26. He was the son of Daniel J. McGibbeny, executive sports editor of The Pittsburgh PostGazette.

title: President Congratulates Oh
description: TOKYO, Sept. 6 (AP)Sadaharu Oh, the Japanese homerun king who surpassed Hank Aaron's career total of 755 homers on Saturday, received congratulatory letter from President Carter today. Baseball is a passion shared by our two peoples, and is one of the many ways Japanese and Americans are brought together, the President wrote. We applaud your achievement. I hope you will continue your remarkable career for many years.

title: Glossy Books From West Delight Russians as Moscow Fair Opens
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 6Moscow's first international book fair opened today to expressions of delight from Russian booklovers and complaints of censorship from some American and British exhibitors.

title: TENG SAYS VANCE TRIP SET BACK NORMAL TIES
description: PEKING, Sept. 6Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping said today that efforts to establish normal diplomatic relations between the United States and China had suffered a setback during the visit last month of Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Old Bridge Township will go to court to freeze $1.3 million in revenues from a weekend rock concert to protect the community from possible lawsuits.

title: Chess:
description: When you are up against a defender loaded with the latest opening theory and you find yourself playing 20 moves without getting .any imitative as. White, there are two things you can do offer a disgruntled draw and vow to. come, up, with something to destroy his defense the next time you meet, or risk playing for complications that could easily backfire.

title: PANEL VOTES INQUIRY ON LANCE'S ACTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The Senate Governmental Affairs Committee voted today to open a fullscale investigation, complete with subpoena power, into the activities of Bert Lance, director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Woman at School for Retarded Dies of Food Poisoning; 11 III
description: CHESTER HEIGHTS, Pa., Sept. 6 (UPI) One student at a Delaware County school for mentally retarded adults has died and 11 other persons have been hospitalized as a result of food poisoning, it was disclosed today.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Tempers Rise and Tempo Quickens As Mayoral Hopefuls Seek Votes
description: Testiness and tempo rose yesterday in the nexttothelast campaign day of the New York City Democratic mayoral primary.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: ONE morning not long ago, Bernard Englander was walking east on 22d Street, having just emerged from the IRT subway, when he noticed a snakeabout 2 feet long, an inch and a half in diameter, with gaily colored diamond shaped markings on its backmaking its way along the sidewalk toward Lexington Avenue.

title: PLAN FOR GREEN BELT NEAR SAHARA REVIVED
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 6The establishment of a green belt tightened against the southern border of the Sahara a swath of planted trees and shrubs stretching from the Atlantic to the Red Seahas repeatedly been proposed for more than 20 years as the best way to hem in the apparent southward march of the desert.

title: 6 Metropolitan Areas Are Dropped From Jobless List; One Is Added
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP)  Six metropolitan areas were removed last month from the Labor Department's list of areas with substantial unemployment rates of 6 percent or more, and one was added, the department announced today.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHARLESTON. W.Va., Sept. 6 (AP)The summerlong wildcat strike that idled up to 85,000 Appalachian coal miners and cost the nation millions of tons of coal ended today in West Virginia as the last holdouts returned to work. A few miners remained out in eastern Kentucky.

title: Bombs Destroy 5 Belfast Stores
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 6 (UPI)Six firebombs exploded early today in the center of Belfast, destroying five shops in what the police said was the work of the Provisional Irish Republican Army.

title: Ronco Named Prosecutor
description: TRENTON,Sept. 6(AP)  Leonard Ronco, a longtime associate of Governor Byrne, was named today Acting Prosecutor of Essex County, the biggest county in the state. He succeeds Joseph P. Lordi.

title: Events Today
Night Racing Breaks Into a Gallop at Meadowlands
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 6Itshing Man won the $109,900 Paterson Handicap tonight at the Meadowlands, galloping as fast as he could every step of the way.

title: Deaths
description: BATAJan Tomas, son of the late Dr. Jan Antonin Bata of Moravia, Czechoslovakia and Brazil, in Sao Paulo, Brazil, in an automobile accident on September 3, 1977; deceased was President of Bata Shoe Company of Batatuba, Brazil, and is cur. dyed by his widow, two daughters, his mother Maria Gerbec Bata, four sisters, Mary Bata Nash of Lexington, Massa. chusetts, Edith Batova Oliveira of Sao Paulo, Brazil, Janet Batova Mitrovitch of Indiana, Brazil, Lud mite Batova Arambasic of Sao Paulo, Brant, a cousin To. mos J. Bata of Toronto, Canada and fourteen nephews and nieces.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. WEIGHS PROSECUTION OF LANCE FOR USING BANK'S PLANE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The Comptroller of the Currency has referred Bert Lance's use of his bank's airplanes to the Department of Justice for possible criminal prosecution.

title: Former Warehouse Employee Held In Theft of $5. Million From Trunk
description: A man who used to work in an East Side warehouse has been accused of taking part in the theft of as much as $5 million in cash from a trunk left in the warehouse 20 years ago.

title: Iris Brussells, Pianist, Teacher; Wrote Scores for Two Shows
description: Iris Brussels of Paterson, N.J., a pianist, composer and teacher, died there of pneumonia Monday in Barnert Memorial Hospital. She was 77 years old.

title: Coast Opera Going on Air in Fall
description: All the operas sung by the San Francisco Opera during the 1977 season will be broadcast nationally this fall by the member stations of National Public Radio. It will be the first time that the entire season of a major American opera company has been given such coverage noncommercially.

title: RockThrowing Vandals Harass Residents of a Bergen Community
description: A gang of youths has been harassing residents of Washington Township in Bergen County for several months, vandalizing homes and threatening people with violence should they report them to the police.

title: 12 Hanafis Get Long Prison Terms
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 6The 12 member's of the Hanafi Moslem sect who seized three buildings in downtown Washington last March and took 134 persons hostage at gunpoint for three days were given severe sentences in Superior Court today that may send at least two of them to prison for life.

title: CARTER SAID TO BACK PIPELINE VIA CANADA TO MOVE ALASKA GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6  President Carter plans to announce his support for a transCanada natural gas pipeline following a meeting here Thursday with Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada, White House and industry sources said today.

title: Gang of RockThrowing Vandals Bombards Homes In Bergen Community and Threatens Its Residents
description: A gang of youths has been harassing residents of Washington Township in Bergen County for several months, vandalizing homes and threatening people with violence should they report them to the police.

title: Henderson Stars, Mets Defeat Expos
description: Steve Henderson batted in three more runs yesterday as the New York Mets defeated the Montreal Expos, 53, but The deed was done in solitary splendor before only 4,702 cash customersthe smallest crowd of the baseball season in Shea Stadium.

title: Breitel Summons a Special Court On Fuchsberg's Holdings of Notes
description: A special state court on judicial discipline will investigate Judge Jacob D. Fuchsberg's transaction in New York City securities while crucial cases on the city's finances were before the bench on which he sat, the New York State Court of Appeals.

title: Unions Expected to Endorse Britain's Wage Policy
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Sept. 6The Government's payrestraint policy appeared to be headed for formal union endorsement following an uncompromising lastminute plea to labor leaders by Prime Minister James Callaghan here today.

title: New York Liberalism, and Fiscal Conservatism
description: New York liberalism is dead.

title: New York's Schools In Accord With U. S. On Minority Hiring
description: A dispute between New York City and the Federal Government over alleged discrimination against women and minoritygroup members, which had jeopardized milions of dollars in aid to the city's school system, was tentatively settled yesterday, just a day before the opening of the new school year.

title: Dr. Kolb Informs Governor He Wants to Leave His Mental Health Post
description: Dr. Lawrence C. Kolb, who has had a controversial career as New York State's Commissioner of Mental Health, has informed Governor Carey that he does not want to head the department when it is reorganized next April 1.

description: EMPTY

title: U. S.Philippine Talks Expected
description: MANILA, Sept. 6 (Reuters)Stalled talks over the future of American bases in the Philippines are expected to reopen in Manila in November, Foreign Secretary Carlos P. Romulo said today. The talks, which began early last year, were suspended a year ago pending the outcome of the American presidential elections. At stake is whether an agreement allowing the United States to maintain bases here until 1991 should be continued and under what terms.

title: EXC. I. A. AIDE ASKS IMMUNITY TO TESTIFY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6Lawyers for Sidney Gottlieb, the biochemist who directed much of the Central Intelligence Agency's secret research on methods of controlling human behavior, have told Senate subcommittee that Mr. Gottlieb will refuse to testify before the panel unless he is granted immunity from criminal prosecution.

title: U.S. STEEL CHIEF CUTS SHIPMENTS ESTIMATE
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 6Edgar B. Speer, chairman of the United States Steel Corporation, today lowered his estimate of how much steel the industry would ship this year.

title: About Real Estate
description: A report from Washington a few days ago had it that a Cabinetlevel study group was trying to define the Carter Administration's urban policy, in time perhaps for a Presidential sendoff in the State of the Union message in January.

title: Private Lives
description: DMITRI doesn't play games. That is, you won't find him on the floor, fiddling with little pieces of paper or plastic buttons or chunks of wood. He neither Scrabbles, nor will he Monopolize, not when there are books to read and music to listen to and grapes to stuff. Boredom is not one of his categories. Boredom, he feels, was invented by capitalists who needed a new market to exploit, just like adolescence. They invented boredom and adolescence so they could sell us games and potato chips. Boredom, adolescence, games and potato chips are unnecessary, and bad for the character

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a transmission error, an article in The Times Saturday stated erroneously that prosecutors in the Don Bolles murder trial in Arizona have evidence to substantiate allegations in the case made against Kemper Marley, a prominent rancher. The article should have said that the prosecution does not have such evidence.

Unopposed candidates are automatically nominated, and their names will not appear on the ballot. Asterisks denote incumbents.

title: Injured Borg Is Forced To Quit Against Stockton; Connors, Orantes Score
description: More bluechip players clashed yesterday at the United States Open tennis championships, but Blue Cross matters still dominated the seventh day of action at Forest Hills.

title: 2  IN BOROUGH RACE FEELING NEGLECTED
description: The four candidates for the Democratic nomination for Borough President of Manhattan found themselves sitting together before television cameras for the first time yesterday, and they agreed that even the limited exposure afforded by a daytime talk show and a cable TV forum was long overdue.

title: GOING OUT Guide
Books: Artful Maleficence
description: THE PUBLICATION of William Peter Blatty's The Exorcist seemed to have revived a slumbering interest in the diabolical (even though such dark classics as Bram Stoker's Dracula and Mary Shelley's Frankenstein, like indefatigable specters, continued to haunt), and since then a raft of preternatural novels have appeared. Still, few of these entries approximate the Stoker or Shelley classics in style or shock effect. Anne Hebert's latest work, Children of the Black Sabbath, however, does provide a welcome element of refinement to this generally predictable genre.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: PITTSBURGH,Sept. 6 (AP)The boards of Allegheny Ludlum Industries and the Chemetron Corporation today approved a proposed merger of the two companies.

title: FLOOD DAMAGE HIGH IN BROOKLYN ACADEMY
description: We're going to need a lot of help, Harvey Lichtenstein, president of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, said yesterday as he looked over a sea of mud, five feet deep, in the academy's basement. Under the mud lay costumes, scenery, electrical equipment, props, tools and other paraphernalia.

title: 97 Who Fled to U.S. Base in Cuba Are Flown Back Home to Haiti
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP)Ninetyseven of 101 Haitian peasants who arrived at the United States Naval base at Guantanamo, Cuba, in a sinking boat on Aug. 10 have been flown back to their country, the State Department said today.

title: Ribicoff Regrets His Mistake in Backing Lance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6I knew it was a mistake the moment I said it, Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff reflected today.

title: PANAMANIAN LEADER MEETS WITH CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6  President Carter welcomed Panama s Chief of Government, Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, the White House today to open a crowded threeday program of diplomatic activities designed to bolster support for two new Panama Canal treaties.

title: MRS. HALLAM BOYD
description: Mrs. Hallam Boyd, wife of a retired New York broker, died yesterday in Memphis, where the couple made their home in recent years. She was 76 years old.

title: MATHILDE OUEEN
description: BOSTON, Sept. 6Mathilde Kimball Queen of Dover, Mass., and Lauderhill, Fla., a former executiv' of Filene's department store here and a leader in the fashion industry and community affairs, died today at the Massachusetts General Hospital after a long illness. She was 70 years old.

title: CARTER URGED TO OPPOSE RACE QUOTAS AT COLLEGES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI)The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith asked President Carter today to take all necessary steps to make sure the Government does not endorse the idea of racial quotas in university admissions programs.

title: A Jubilant Ethiopian Capital Hears Its Army Has Routed Somali Force
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 6Ethiopian Government sources said in Addis Adaba today that the defenders of three key southeastern cities had routed attacking Somali units, inflicting heavy losses on them.

title: Arabs Meet on Occupied Lands
description: CAIRO, Sept. 6Foreign ministers of the Arab League countries ended a fourday meeting here today determined to try to win a commitment from the UnitedStates and other countries to oppose any Israeli moves to annex any part of the occupied territories.
