title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 6The Seabrook family, which last year closed down one of the world's largest frozen food companies, announced today plans to reopen in South Jersey.

title: 2 Women Victors Attribute Success at Open to W.T.T.
description: Threatening to quit World Team Tennis if she h2D to play one more match for Joe Zingale, owner of the Cleveland Nets, Martina Navratilova agreed last spring to go to the Boston Lobsters in exchange for Wendy Turnbull. Both players 2Dvanced yesterday to the quarterfinals at Forest Hills, where tr2Ditionalists once warned of the detrimental effects sure to come from W.T.T.'s innovative, oneset format.

title: Commission Is Sworn In
description: TRENTON, Sept. 6The chairman and two other members of the Casino Control Commission, which will regulate gambling in Atlantic City, were sworn into office today before cheering Atlantic City residents.

title: Lumber Concerns Oppose Larger Park at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6Representatives of the three large lumber companies that would lose the most in a proposed expansion of Redwood National Park indicated today they did not expect to succeed in their efforts to block the addition of 48,000 acres of their timber land to the northern California park.

title: CHRISTIANONLY ADS CHARGED WITH BIAS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6A legal conflict involving alleged religious discrimination versus what is defended as freedom of religion and the press emerged here last week when the local chapters of the AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith filed suit against two thriving Californiabased enterprises that publish business directories exclusively for born again Christians.

title: MARTHA FOLEY DIES; EDITOR AND TEACHER
description: Martha Foley, editor of The Best American Short Stories and a powerful force in the development of that American literary metier, died Monday of heart disease at Cooley Dickenson Hospital in Northampton, Mass. She was 80 years old and lived in Northampton.

title: A Widower's Life With Daddy's Girl
description: BRISTOL, R.I.

title: Werblin Drops a Plan to Invest in Atlantic City Casino
description: NEWARK, Sept. 6 (AP)David A. (Sonny) Werblin, chairman of the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority, which runs a race track and the Giants Stadium in the Hackensack Meadowlands, and Adrian B. Foley, treasurer of the authority, abandoned plans today to invest in a proposed Atlantic City hotel and casino.

title: News Summary
description: Teng HsiaoPing, China's Deputy Prime Minister, said that efforts to establish normal diplomatic relations between Washington and Peking were setback during the visit of Secretary of State Vance last month. Ha told Associated Press executives and directors visiting Peking that the discussions with Mr. Vance represented .a retreat from what he said was a promise by President Ford in 1975 to break relations with the. Taiwan government if he was reelected. [Pge Al, Column 3.]

title: Trenton State Students Cautioned. After Murder
description: EWING TOWNSHIP, N.J., Sept. 6As a result of the murder of a 25yearold graduate student, members of the entering class at Trenton State College were urged today to move around the 210acre campus in the evenings in pairs.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept. 6 (Reuters)President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia said today that Idi Amin's rule in Uganda was as stinking as South Africa. Mr. Kaunda, in a conversation with former Swedish Prime Minister Olof Palma, who is visiting here, said: Those that condemn racism in South Africa must also condemn it in Uganda. It is immoral to attack Vorster and Smith and yet embrace Amin.

title: Indians Bell Out for Season
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 6(UPI)  The___Cleveland Indians third baseman,___uridy Bell, will be lost for the rest of___the. season because of stretched ligaments in his left knee. The injury to___Bell's knee was diagnosed today at the___Lutheran Medical Center by the team___physician, Dr. Earl Brightman. Bell___injured the knee on Sunday while making, a diving stop of a ground ball___against the California Angels.

title: BOND PRICES CLOSE STEADY OR OFF A BIT
description: After surprisingly active trading last week in the normally quiet period before Labor Day, the credit markets briefly attempted to continue their advance yesterday and then settled back. At the close, most prices were unchanged for the day or down slightly.

title: Italian Heiress Found Dead
description: BOLZANO, Italy, Sept. 6 (AP)An Italian heiress, Luisa Spagnoli, was found dead in a ravine today, four days after she disappeared during a mountain walk, rescue squads reported. Miss Spagnoli, 42 years old, whose family has interests in a food group and a chain of fashion shops, apparently fell after wandering off from friends. rescue workers said.

title: Air Force Urges Revival of FB111 As a LongRange Nuclear Bomber
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The Air Force, seeking to salvage technology designed for the B1 bomber, has urged Defense Secretary Harold Brown to revive production of the controversial FB111 fighter and convert it into a longrange nuclear manned bomber.

title: Stocks Inch Up in Late TurnaroundFor Fourth Increase Dow at 873.27
description: A late rally sent stock prices slightly higher yesterday as the stock market recorded its fourth gain in a row.

title: Tidbits Can Pave The Road To Bliss
description: Recently, I served a sitdown dinner for 12, featuring cold cream of spinach soup, butterflied lamb and zucchini parmagiana. I haven't had a square meal since.

title: Arthur Smadbeck, 90, Ran Coliseum
description: Arthur Smadbeck, a pioneer in the development of rural and suburban real estate and president of the New York Coliseum, died yesterday at New York Hospital. He was 90 years old and had homes at 52 Vanderbilt Avenue here and in Carmel, N.Y.

title: MISTRIAL DECLARED IN GOLDMAN'S CASE
description: A mistrial was declared yesterday because of a prosecutors statement in the trial of Irving Goldman, former New York City Commissioner of Cultural Affairs, who was charged with conspiracy add fraud in the sale of candy supplies for subway vending machines.

title: Fire Officers Elect
description: Edwin F. Jennings, a battalion chief, has been reelected president of the Uniformed Fire Officers Association by a unanimous vote of the eightmember executive board for another oneyear term. Chief Jennings has been president since Sept. 1, 1975. The union represents more than 2,200 officers.

title: Primary Choices
description: We are only at the end of the beginning. The first phase of the election process in New York City and Nassau County comes to its embittered end tomorrow. It has produced more confusion than clarification, more of the heat of personal acrimony than light about the essential public problems that the metropolitan region faces.

title: The U.N. Today
Tony Kornheiser
description: Time was, and it was not that long ago, that almost no one who came to see the tennis at Forest Hills had ever been to a Tupperware Party. Tennis was the private preserve of the moneyed class, the country club set, and even after players started taking prize money, as well as glory for their efforts, the people who watched still applauded after every point, and the sound of their applause was muffled, as if their hands were sheathed in opera gloves.

title: Angels Claim Kingman
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.,Sept. 6 (AP)Dave Kingman was claimed today irrevocable waivers by the California Angels from the San Diego Padres for $20,000.

title: Suspect in Threat to Rockefeller Enters a Surprise Plea of Guilty
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Sept. 6 (UPI)Robert Dufala, a nursery school teacher who once ran for Congress, entered a surprise plea of guilty today to charges of threatening to kill former Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6 (UPI)Tiin Foli, shortstop for the San Francisco Giants was suspended for five___days and fined $500 today for fighting___with an Atlanta pitcher, Dick Ruthven,___on Monday night. The penalty was___levied by the National League president, Charles S. Feeney. Foli and___Ruthven got into an argument and___scuffled after Foli grounded out in the___seventh inning. All four umpires blamed___Foli, who was ejected from the game___for the incident.

title: TEACHERS GROUP REPORTS A BIG DROP IN WALKOUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (UPI)Labor unrest among teachers is at its lowest ebb in years as most schools opened this week, the National Education Association said today, with only scattered teacher strikes or threats of walkouts.

title: George S. Schuyler, Black Author
description: George S. Schuyler, a major black author and the first black journalist to attain national prominence with the acidic bite of his ideas, died Aug. 31 at New York Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 270 Convent Avenue.

title: Market Place
description: The rise in margin debt to record levels reflects in part successful efforts on the part of some brokerage firms to encourage customers to borrow money for purposes other than buying securities.

title: WOMAN TELLS INQUIRY OF THREAT BY COWAN
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Sept. 6A 26yearold woman testified at a formal inquiry tonight that a year and a half before Frederick W. Cowan went on a rampage and killed six persons he had threatened her with a rifle.

title: City Retail Unit Due At Morgan Stanley
description: Morgan Stanley & Company, in its second move in less than two months to attract wealthy individual clients, disclosed here yesterday that the investment banking house would shortly begin recruiting brokers for a new big ticket retail office to be set up in New York.

title: Who's Minding the Budget?
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6On the big issues Bert Lance, as friend of the President, has swung a lot of weight. He was influential in President Carter's decision to scrap the B1 bomber project. He led the forces that finally prevailed on the

title: Hotels Trying to Stem Rise in Thefts
description: There is a Gideon Bible in every room, but down in the subbasement, where the security chief has his office, they read a different kind of bible. It is called Major Hotel Violators and is published by the hotel unit of the Police Department's Manhattan Burglary Squad. It contains photographs, descriptions, aliases and methods of operation of 46 metropolitanarea burglars who make a specialty of hotel crime.

title: Robbery Victim Has Last Laugh.
description: OMAHA (AP)  A 78yearold North Omaha woman was the victim of a purse snatcher recently, but the second time around she had the last laugh. The second time, she said, the purse contained only a note that read, Ha, ha, thief.

title: Books: Prevailing Over Sexism
description: THE FIRST WOMAN in the United States to graduate as a physician, Elizabeth Blackwell, emerges from these autobiographical writings as a person of extraordinary determination to break the sex barrier in medicine. It was to my mind a moral crusade on which I had entered, she writes, a course of justice and common sense, and must be pursued in the light of day, and with public sanction, in order to accomplish its end.

title: $2.9 MILLION ESTATE LEFT IN BENJAMIN BRITTEN WILL
description: LONDON, Sept. 6The estate of Benjamin Britten, the composer. who died in December, was valued at the equivalent of $2.9 million in his will made public yesterday.

title: WIFE OF U.S. EXECUTIVE IS SEIZED IN EL SALVADOR
description: SAN SALVADOR, Sept. 6 (AP)Kidnappers armed with machine guns seized the wife of an American industrialist today after a shootout with her bodyguards in front of her husband's company offices the police said.

title: Moscow Denounces Reports Of Minor Looting by Firemen
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 6 (UPI)The Soviet press today denounced Western reports implying that Soviet firemen had been involved in minor looting during the fire at the United States Embassy.

title: Canal Pacts: Fight Stalls Other Foreign Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The ceremonies surrounding tomorrow's signing of the new Panama Canal package mark the Carter Administration's first significant achievement in foreign affairs. But the Administration's pleasure has been more than offset by its concern over obtaining enough Congressional and public support to insure early passage of the treaties and the accompanying annexes and protocols. This concern has been conveyed in two ways.

title: Carter and Powell Noncommittal As They Parry Questions on Lance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6  President Carter said: We'll see about that later, when a reporter called out a question about Bert Lance today.

title: Dissolution of Chile's Police Agency:
description: LOS ANGELESThe Chilean military dictatorship has declared the dissolution of DINA (Direction National de Inteligencia), the Gestapo of President Augusto Pinochet, and its replacement by another organization C.N.I., Centro National de Informaciones. It took advantage of the visit of Terence A. Todman, Assistant Secretary of State for InterAmerican Affairs, to make the announcement.

title: Uganda to Execute 12 Friday
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 6Twelve Ugandans who were found guilty yesterday of plotting to overthrow President Idi Amin will be shot in public Friday, the Uganda radio announced today. The 12 include several former government officials and businessmen.

title: Secretarial Pay Varies With Responsibilities
description: The pay of secretaries ranges widely, depending largely on their ???????????? ties and the executives for whom they work. The Administrative Management Society, a nonprofit organization for management improvement, has just completed a study of secretarial salaries that shows increases over yearago levels in three categories of secretaries.

title: KENT STATE PROJECT DELAYED BY BRENNAN
description: KENT, Ohio, Sept. 6 (UPI)Associate Justice William J. Brennan Jr. of the United States Supreme Court today temporarily halted construction of a proposed gymnasium at Kent State University near the site where four students were shot to death in 1970.

title: Lucy Reruns Bow Out for Soap
description: AFTER A RUN OF 26 YEARS, with  some brief interruptions, the situation comedies. of Lucille Ball are terminating on CBSTV. The daytime reruns of Here's Lucy, the last series the comedian made for the network, will leave the network Nov. 4 to allow the venerable soap opera The Guiding Light to expand to a onehour format. Miss Ball has been a mainstay of CBS since 1951, when her first series, I Love Lucy, became the toprated show and she was television's biggest star. The reruns of her comedies often played by day, while her newest series Was seen Monday nights.

title: Jets Marinaro Put on Waivers; A Slap in Face
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I.,Sept. 6Ed Marinaro knew it was coming, but it still felt like a slap in the face today when the Jets placed him on recallable waivers.

title: Rights Panel Sets Role In Homosexual Cases
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP)The Civil Rights Commission has agreed that it has authority to look into specific cases involving alleged unequal administration of justice against homosexuals, a spokesman said today.

title: 430 Teachers Strike Lakeland Schools; Opening Due Today
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 6About 8,000 students in northern Westchester County faced an uncertain start to their school year after the 430member Lakeland Federation of Teachers walked out on strike this morning.

title: West German Terrorism Is Heroic Step to Genet, Who Finds All Life Violent
description: PARIS, Sept. 6Most of the European intellectual left has, in recent years, condemned urban terrorism of the sort that has erupted in West Germany.

title: In Bensonhurst, Italians Talk of Cuomo, but Not the Jewish Voters
description: The voices one hears from the shoppers on 18th Avenue in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn are about as likely to be, speaking Italian as English. But the voices that are heard at the polls in this nearly allwhite, comfortable, workingclass district are more often those of the Jewish residents.

title: Sale of 3 Grace Units to Be Allowed
description: The Justice Department said in Washington yesterday that it would not oppose the sale of three W. R. Grace & Company units to Tenneco Chemicals Inc, a. subsidiary of Tenneco Inc, The three companies make up Grace's Hatco group.

title: Cosmos Heading for Orient With 3 Players They'd Like
description: After having played in Trinidad and Venezuela last week, the Cosmos depart today on a trip to Japan, China and India with three players they may acquire for the next North American Soccer League season.

title: Queens Actors Cue Up
description: The Stage Company, the nonprofit group that is attempting to maintain professional theater in Queens, will be gin its second season at Flushing Town Hall with the popular Joseph Kesselring comedy, Arsenic and Old Lace, was announced yesterday by Howard da Silva, associate director. Ron Roston has been signed to stage the, play.

title: Liddy Clears Way for His Release By Swearing He Can't Pay Fine
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Sept. 6G. Gordon Liddy, who has spent more time in jail than anyone else for the Watergate burglary and has said the least about it, took a pauper's oath today that he was unable to pay his $40,000 fine, thus paving the way for his release from prison tomorrow.

title: Careers
description: Edwin Quigley, who lives on the edge of the Columbia River in Washington Stein loves to ski, fish and hunt in his off hours. By profession, he is one of the growing number of registered nurses who might be described as occupational nurses.

title: MAYORAL CANDIDATES WINDING UP CAMPAIGN
description: The Democratic mayoral primary, marked by a record number of candidates and few substantive issues, moved toward a climax in tomorrow's primary as testy and tired candidates exchanged personal charges and tried to shake as many hands and make as many speeches as possible in the final hours.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: The term qualified labor pool is expected to be debated and worked out after the agreement is signed. It could mean all college graduates or college graduates with education courses. The definition will be essential to the setting of goals under the agreement.

description: The dollar closed mixed yesterday against major West European currencies and the Japanese yen during another quiet day on foreign exchange markets, The Associated Press reported.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6There have been more heads of government in Washington this weekall of them from the Western Hemispherethan at any time since the funeral of President Kennedy in 1963. They are here at the invitation of President Carter, who has a clear purpose in mind.

description: WALLINGFORD, Conn., Sept. 6 (UPI)Gravediggers in the Hartford area returned to work today, ending a sixweek strike, but funeral directors are now faced with another probleman increase of $30 in ????? fees

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6Affidavits of two top officials from the office of the Comptroller of the Currency and the text of a banking agreement released today give new dimensions to the processing of Bert Lance's nomination last fall.

title: James L. Buckley Backs Farber in the Primary Race
description: Barry Farber, the conservative contender in tomorrow's Republican primary, announced yesterday morning that he had won the primary endorsement of James L. Buckley, former ConservativeRepublican United States Senator.

title: Bank of Italy Pays First Part Of $2 Billion West German Loan
description: ROME. Sept. 6 (UPI)The Bank of Italy today repaid the fast $500 million installment of a $2 billion loan it received three years ago from the Federal Bank of Wekt Germany.

title: Financial Crisis Facing Cup Challenger Australia
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Sept. 6 (AP)Backers of the l2meter yacht Australia have found their America's Cup bankroll depleted and are making a pitch back home for another $220,000, spokesman said today.

title: DeSoto Sells Line
description: The Collins & Aikman Corporation, maker of textile products, said a tentative agreement had been reached with DeSoto Inc. to acquire certain of its wallcovering lines. DeSoto recently announced it would discontinue pro. duction of wallcovering lines Dec. 31. The purchase price was not disclosed. DeSoto makes paints, detergents and furniture.

title: Texts of Canal Treaties That Were Initialed by Panama and U.S. in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6Following are the texts of the Panama Canal Treaty, the treaty on the neutrality of the Panama Canal and a protocol to the neutrality treaty that were initialed today in Washington by the United States and Panama. Also initialed today, but not reproduced here, were an agreed minute to the treaty and an annex on Procedures for the Cessation of Transfer of Activities Carried Out by the Panama Cana Company.

title: As Homes Go, It's the Cat's Meow
description: Bustopher Jones, the cat about town of T. S. Eliot's Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats, who doesn't haunt pubs  he has eight or nine clubs, would be right at home in New York. In fact, the late Mr. Eliot himself, a notorious cat lover, would have been delighted to find himself in the Harvard Club, the Algonquin Hotel, the Alamo Chili House, Fanelli's or even the Italo Pizza shop on Columbus Avenue.

title: Speculative Buying Cancels Early Loss In Soybean Prices
description: A late wave of speculative buying of soybean futures wiped out earlier losses on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, causing prices to advance about 5 cents a bushel, except in the spot delivery.

title: Bargaining on Teacher Contracts Under Way in 6 School Districts
description: As schools across New Jersey prepared to reopen today for 1.4 million students, officials disclosed that tense, 11thhour contract bargaining was under way in at least six districts, including two large ones in Monmouth County and two others in Morris County.

title: CITY IN TEXAS AVERTS MOVE TO CUT OFF GAS
description: SAN ANTONIO, Sept. 6For the fourth time in the last two weeks, the maverick community of Crystal City has won a lastminute court order to avert a cutoff of the natural gas supply to its 8,000 citizens.

description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 6 (AP)Eight Westchester County Republicans today endorsed the reelection bid of Alfred B. DelBello, the Democratic County Executive

title: Virginia Rejects H.E.W. Quotas On Admitting Blacks to Colleges
description: RICHMOND, Va., Sept. 6 (UPI)Virginia officials said today that the state would not comply with racial quotas ordered by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to desegregate its colleges and universities.

title: Fancy Street Sweeper for Plains
description: PLAINS, Ga. (AP)President Carter's hometown has a new $15,500 street sweeper, received in ceremonies marked by about as much pomp as the circumstance would allow. The ceremonies took place in front of Mr. Carter's former national campaign headquarters, itself a former railroad depot. Mayor Pro Tem Boze Godwin wore a necktie for the occasion. The City Engineer, Ishmal Morris, who will operate the machine, said: I expect to clean the downtown street in one hour. It previously took a crew of four men four hours.

description: TORONTO, Sept. 6Donald S. Macdonald resigned as Canada's Minister of Finance today, paving the way for a majcr reshuffling of the Federal Cabinet and the renewing of speculation on the direction of the faltering, Canadian economy.

description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Sept. 2 (Reuters)The Canadian Wheat Board said today it was selling 120,000 tons of red winter wheat to Vietnam.

description: EAST BERLIN, Sept. 6 (Reuters)East Germany welcomed President Urho Kekkonen of Finland today as he began the first visit to this country by a nonCommunist European head of state.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a transmission error, an article In The Times Saturday stated erroneously that prosecutors in the Don Bolles murder trial in Arizona have evidence to substantiate allegations in the case made against Kemper Marley, a prominent rancher. The artide should have said that the prosecution does not have such evidence.

title: 76,000 Tractors Are Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP)The International Harvester Corporation is recalling 76,000 heavyduty truck tractors to correct a defect in the steering system, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration reported today. Involved are 1968 through 1974 models of the company's heavyduty caboverengine truck tractors. Officials said that no accidents or injuries have been reported as a result of the defect.

title: REID A. RAILTON
description: Reid A. Railton, a British designer of racing cars, sport cars and racing boats, died last Thursday in a hospital in Berkeley, Calif. He was 82 years old and had lived in Berkeley.

title: ExCongressman Is Depicted in Park Indictment as Agent of Korea
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The secret indictment against Tongsun Park that was unsealed by Attorney General Griffin B. Bell today depicts former Representative Richard T. Hanna of California as an agent, in effect, for the South Korean Government while he was serving In Congress.

title: TENG SAYS VANCE TRIP SET BACK NORMAL TIES
description: PEKING, Sept. 6Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping said today that efforts to establish normal diplomatic relations between the United States and China had suffered a setback during the visit last month of Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance.

title: Two Cookbooks To Help Dieters
description: With more and more people interested in maintaining a diet low in cholesterolproducing polysaturated fats, whether by their own design or by a doctor's orders, there should be a ready market for The American Heart Association Cookbook, with lowfat recipes collected from friends, nutritionists and volunteers of association affiliates around the country. There is also a good deal of general diet information with hints on adapting your own recipes, and what to choose when dining in restaurants, as well as charts with fat breakdowns of many foods.

title: New Musical Among Six Shows Set for McCarter
description: Three premieres, as well as revivals of plays by Shakespeare, George. Kelly and Lillian Hellman, will mark the 197778 season of the McCarter Theater Company in Princeton, N.J., it was announced yesterday by Michael Kahn, producing director.

title: Girl Dies of Mushroom Poisoning
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 6 (UP1)An 11yearold girl who ate poisonous wild mushrooms while on a camping trip in Ashtabula County, then lapsed into a coma, has died of mushroom poisoning at Cleveland Metropolitan General Hospital, where sh was admitted Aug. 28. The mushrooms eaten by the victim, Michelle Tommasini of Brook Park, had been picked by her father, Mario B., 43, who also had mushroom poisoning and was rleased last Friday from Southwest general Hospital, Middleburg Heights, after recovering.

title: Students at Trenton State College Cautioned After Campus Murder
description: EWING TOWNSHIP, Sept. 6As a result of the murder of a 25yearold graduate student, members of the entering class at Trenton State College were urged today to keep their dormitory rooms locked and to move around the 210acre campus in the evenings in pairs.

title: Result of Nassau County Executive Race Held Vital
Goodyear Payment Cut
description: The United States Circuit Court of Appeals in Denver has reduced to $4.7 million from $19.6 million the amount of compensatory and punitive damages the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company must pay to Big 0 Tire Dealers for infringement of Big O's Big Foot trademark.

title: The record
description: I am running for Mayor on the Republican line, asking the support of a broadbased coalition of all who place loyalty to our city above loyalty to any political party. In this time of continuing danger to our city, I believe that those who put New York first will demand a Mayor who has got what it takes to do the job.

title: Hughes Estate Said_ TO Owe $71 Million To Air West Group
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6A Federal judge ruled litre today that the Howard Hughes estate owes $71 million to the former stockholders of Air West.

title: Asian Nations Ready Bid to U.S. For Aid in Economic Development
description: MANILA, Sept. 6How the United States can cooperate more actively in the economic development of nonCommunist Southeast Asia will be explored at discussions here Thursday through Saturday between an American panel and a delegation designated by the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.

title: Thomas R. Reid, 63, Dies; Retired Ford Executive Also Held Federal Posts
description: Thomas R. Reid, who retired as executive director of civic and governmental affairs for the Ford Motor Company in 1975, died yesterday in Bon Secours Hospital, Grosse Pointe, Mich. He was 63 years old.

description: BASEBALL

title: TENNESSEE BUYERS FACE A CREDIT SNAG
description: Getting a consumer loan has become virtually impossible in Tennessee because of a new state court ruling, resulting in plummeting sales of cars, furniture and appliancse, and in wouldbe borrowers crossing state lines in search of credit.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: ONE of the obvious advantages of living in coastal areas is the relative abundance of fresh fish. Perhaps the most abundant fish is that sold over the counter as sole. The truth of the. matter is that the sole found in American markets may well be fluke or flounder, gray sole and lemon sole, among others. Just why the word sole became a sort of catchall is not known, but the ultimate consideration in buying sole, as any other fish, is its fresh quality.

title: Missile TestFired by Submarine
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Sept. 6 (UPI) The nuclearpowered submarine U.S.S. Henry Clay successfully testfired a Poseidon missile this afternoon while cruising submerged about 30 miles off the east coast of Florida. It was the 66th flight of a Poseidon since the first was launched in August 1968, but the first testfiring of a Poseidon by the Henry Clay.

title: Drugs That Heal Sometimes Harm.
description: AMERICANS SWALLOW nearly 40 billion doses of tablets, capsules, elixirs and other medicinal potions each year. The average doctor writes nearly 8,000 prescriptions a year, choosing from among 1,200 prescription drugs (2,500 different brand names). Seven prescriptions a year are filled for every man, woman and child.

title: Lee E. Graham, 64, an Author, And Commentator on RadioTV
description: Lee E. Graham, author and radio and television commentator on social prob.. lems, died yesterday of cancer at her New York City home She was 64 years old.

title: Sloop Explodes in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6 (AP)A 39foot sloop exploded and sank last night at the San Francisco Yacht Club. The police said no one was aboard at the time and no injuries were reported. Richard Shippy, a police lieutenant, said the authorities had been alerted through sources last week that the terorist New World Liberation Front might bomb yachts in the harbor, but he added that the cause of the explosion on the sloop Major O was undetermined.

title: Best Buys
description: With the Labor Day weekend over, summer's last excuse for a hot dog, hamburger and cornonthecob binge now in the past, thoughts are likely to turn to less casual fare. For one thing, the Jewish holidays are coming up, and markets, getting into the mood, are featuring brisket of beef and fresh fowls, the former at 99 cents a pound for the thick cut, $1.49 to $1.59 for the first or thin cut. Fresh fowls can be found from 39 to 55 cents a pound.

title: Ford to Lecture at University
description: ANN ARBOR Mica., Sept. 6 (UPI)Former President Gerald R. Ford will return to his alma mater, the University of Michigan, for a second stint of teaching and lecturing this fall. University officials said Mr. Ford plans to be on campus Nov. 2, 3 and 4, but added that details of the visit had not been worked out. The former President met with political science classes at the university last April.

title: Diamonds, Gold and a Premier
description: Ellen Rajdl never particularly thought that diamonds were a girl's best friend but, like most women, she believed that a nodding acquaintance with them couldn't hurt.

title: 194% Price Rise Cuts Water Use In Ohio Suburb
description: TRURO TOWNSHIP, Ohio, Sept. 3This speck on the map in central Ohio obviously is not California. But from the way people here are acting about their water, one might think it was.

title: G.T.E. Tokyo Delisting
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Corporation has applied for delisting of its stock from the Tokyo Stock Exchange's 17company, foreign section. It was the second such request by a foreign company. Last November, Borden asked to be delisted. Borden was listed in December 1974 and General Telephone in December 1973. The two American companies cited sharply decreased trading volume in their stocks by Japanese investors and the high cost of listing shares.

title: Indictment of Park Charges 36 Crimes; Bell Seeking Return
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The Justice Department unsealed an indictment today that charges Tongsun Park with 36 felony violations, all of thein stemming from an alleged influencebuying operation here that was intended to benefit the South Korean Government.

title: 'Dream  Mile Canceled As Walker Withdraws
description: A dream mile race between the world onemile recordholder, John Walker of New Zealand, and Filbert Bayi of Tanzania has been canceled by the withdrawal today of Walker because of health problems.

description: GARTERHy The beloved husband is deed; the most adored fattier Is gone. He plays us his music no more: his song will forever live on.

description: Dr. George L. Wolcott. a research specialist in preventive medicine, died Sunday at Riverview Hospital, Red Bank, N.J. He was 64 years old and lived in Franklin Lakes. N.J.

title: Power Study on in New York
description: ALBANY (AP)The state is studying the possible expansion of hydroelectric power in New York. The $168,000 study will select up to 20 sites with the best potential for small hydropower, plants at old and new locations. The study is being conducted by the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority. The State Power Authority will help finance it and provide technical expertise.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept 6Senator Edward M. Kennedy today attacked a number of tax credit proposals advanced by president Carter as part of the national energy plan.

title: How to Make Taxes Simple and Fair
description: In the periodic pushing and shoving over Federal tax reform, a great deal of attention is always paid to specific provisions of the tax code and very little to the tax system as a whole. That is understandable. It is the rules of the tax codethe deductions for threemartini business lunches or writeoffs for oil wellsthat excite attention, not the philosophy of the system. But genuine reform to achieve fairness and simplicity requires a return to basics. If first principles are ignored in planning yet another reform, we run the risk of adding only one more AliceinWonderland layer to the tax law.

title: Panama's Man: Of the Moment Omar Torrijos Herrera
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6  Asked some years ago how he would like to be remembered in history, Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera, Panama's flamboyant leader, replied: I don't want to go down in history, I just want to go into the canal zone. If the Panama Canal treaties he and President Carter will sign tomorrow in Washington are ratified by both countries, General Torrijos will soon realzie his wish.

title: Ribicoff Regrets His Mistake in Backing Lance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6I knew it was a mistake the moment I said it, Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff reflected today.

title: LEILA PETTENGILL
description: Leila Pettengill, widow of Rear Adm. George T. Pettengill of the United States Navy, died Sunday in a nursing home in Providence, R.I. She was 91 years old.

title: False Burglar Alarms Plague the Police
description: The New York City Police Department Said that its 911 emergency telephone number system, already overloaded with thousands of unnecessary calls, was being strained even further by calls set off by malfunctioning or misused burglar alarms.

title: Britons Mourning Beloved Kippers
description: ABERDEEN, SCOTLAND

title: Seaver, Foster, Brock Cited
description: Two Cincinnati teammates, Tom___Seaver and George Foster, have been___named the National League pitcher and___player of the month for August. Seaver___had a 60 wonlost record for the___month, as he struck out 52 batters in___60 innings and allowed only 16 walks___and 40 hits. He had one shutout and___posted an earned run average of 2.20.___Foster, the majorleagues leader in___home runs and runs batted in, hit 12___homers and drove in 28 runs during the___month: Lou Brock of St. Louis was___named player of the week after he___broke Ty Cobb's career record by stealing his 892d and 893d bases.

title: Antonia Brico to Conduct The Philharmonia
description: A threeconcert Family Series by the Brooklyn Philharmonia will be led this season by Antonia Brico. The 75yeas-old conductor, who came to promi-nence a few years ago through the film Antonia: The Portrait of a Wom-an, made a successful first appearance with the Philharmonia last season. For the series, she will speak about the music as well as conduct.

title: Article 8  No Title
JUSTICE DEPT. WEIGHS PROSECUTION OF LANCE FORUSINGBANK'SPLANE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The Comptroller of the Currency has referred Bert Lance's use of his bank's airplanes to the Department of Justice for possible criminal prosecution.

title: Canadiens Sign Lambert
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 6 (AP)Yvon Lambert, a 27yearold left wing with the Montreal Canadiens. has signed multiyear contract, the National Hockey League club announced today, Terms of the contract were not announced. Lambert has a career total of 108 coals and 94 assists.

title: Edward K. Brass Dies at 79;  44 Years at Morgan Guaranty
description: Edward K, Brass, who retired in 1962 as vice president of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, died last Wednesday in a nursing home in Cedar Grove, N.J. He was 79 years old and lived at 3 Windsor Place. Upper Montclair, N.J.

title: Man Accused of Assault on Officer
description: MIDDLE TOWNSHIP, N.J., Sept. 6 (AP)A Philadelphia man has been charged with assaulting a police officer who tried to intervene in a dispute over an $8 gasoline bill, the police say. The police officer, Frank Pallishuski had his nose broken and a finger fractured in the altercation, according to the police. They said Mr. Pallishuski intervened when Raymond Hoy, 21 years old, allegedly refused to pay for the gasoline.

title: Television
Somalia Jails Woman Bigamist
description: NAIROBI, Kenya (Reuters)A woman has been sentenced to 18 years in jail and fined the equivalent of $1,300 dollats at Hargeisa in northwestern Somalia for marrying two husbands in violation of our religious customs and the antisocial practices law, the Somali state radio has reported.

title: Strike in Yonkers Threatened
description: YONKERS, Sept. 6This city's teachers voted today not to return to classes tomorrow, the first day of school for the city's 26,000 students if there was no resolution of their contract dispute with the city's Board of Education.

title: Fisk and Red Sox Crush Blue Jays, 112
description: Carlton Fisk and the Boston Red___Sox jumped all over the expansion Blue___Jays in Toronto last night in order to___keep pace in the American League___East Division with the New York Yan-kees.

title: Kaunda Calls Amin a Racist
description: Kaunda Calls Amin a Racist

title: Spain Prohibits a Rightist Protest In Support of Accused Policemen
description: MADRID, Sept. 6 (Reuters)The Spanish Government today banned extreme right wingers from staging a demonstration in support of policemen accused of beating a Socialist member of Parliament.

title: ELSIE CARLISLE
description: LONDON, Sept. 6 (AP)Elsie Carlisle, who was a major British radio singer in the 1930's, has died, friends reported today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: After four months of darkness, Times Square's moving news sign was returned to life. Alex Parker, who owns the former Times Tower, now known as I Times Square, had turned off the building's famous sign as a protest against pornography in the area.

title: Indictment of Park Charges 36 Crimes; Bell Seeking Return
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6The Justice Department unsealed an indictment today that charges Tongsun Park with 36 felony violations, all of them stemming from an alleged influencebuying operation here that was intended to benefit the South Korean Government.

title: RUSSIANS DELIGHTED BY BOOKS FROM WEST
Carnegie Hall Cinema Books 24 Soviet Films
Beame Signs Bills to Aid Business
description: Four bills designed to encourage busi nesses to relocate to New York City and thus offer job opportunities were signed into law yesterday by Mayor Beame.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Move to Block Treaties Fails
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 6 (AP)A request that the Supreme Court block tomorrow's scheduled signing of Panama Canal treaties was denied today by Justice William J. Brennan Jr., who indicated that the request did not conform with procedural steps that must be taken when a suit is filed with the court. The request was filed in behalf of four state attorneys general who contend that their grainexporting states would suffer economically from Panamanian control of the canal.

title: Union Rejects a Plan To Organize Military
description: WASHINGTON,Sept 7 (Reuters)The major union representing Government employees has rejected by a vote of 4 to 1 a proposal to organize the United States military. The union's president said today that he was sure that Congressional pressure had influenced the vote.

title: Who Will Liberate Grandma?
description: SOME TIME AGO, our first, and therefore incomparable, toddler grandchild pirated a tiny pocket dictionary from my desk. Unaerstandable. The thing was irresistibly small, so she could palm it. It was red, so she loved it. It was RussianEnglish, so she needed it. The child is not a crook; how could I even bring it up?

title: CORRECTION
description: A chart Tuesday on the metric,system misstated the, milekilometer conversion formula. It should have read 1 mile=1.609 kilometers"1 and 1 kilometer=0.621 mile.

title: Army Weighs Moving 14,000 G.I.'s From Korea to Fort Drum, N. Y.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The United States Army, in a surprise move, has informed Congress that Fort Drum in upstate New York is under active consideration as the new home of the 14,000member Second Infantry Division, now stationed in South Korea.

title: Bronx Gives Life to an Italian Baby
description: When Giuseppe Abriano of Catania, Sicily, was four months old, Italian heart specialists said he had only a few days to live.

title: Stage: Characters You Care For
description: THE PLEASURES in watching the revival of Elmer Rice's play of the 1930's CounselloratLaw may be archaic, but they are authentic.  And they are worth pointing out, not only to praise the modest but highly successful production at the Quaigh Theater in the Hotel Diplomat, but also because they remind us of one or two useful but not always noticed facts about theater.

title: Yonkers Teachers Strike on Opening Day of School
description: YONKERS, Sept. 7  Public school teachers struck on opening day here today after allnight bargaining failed to resolve major contract differences between their union and the city's Board of Education.

title: Around the Nation
description: DETROIT, Sept. 7 (UPI)Urban problems were the focus of the annual fall meeting of the National Governors Conference, which opened here today. The governors planned to visit an automobile assembly line and the city's busiest police station in their threeday meeting.

title: Australia Devalues Dollar 0.11%
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Thursday, Sept. 8 (Reuters)The reserve bank said the exchange rate fixing authorities marginally devalued the Australian dollar 0.11 percent by adjusting the tradeweighted currency aggregate index to 91.3 from 91.4.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. BRIEF OPPOSES RACE QUOTA AT COAST UNIVERSITY
description: WASHINGTON,Sept. 7The Justice Department has advised President Carter that factors such as race can be taken into account in university admissions but that setting a quota of places in each class for minority students is unconstitutional, Administration officials said today.

title: Portuguese Water Dogs Make a Comeback
description: Portuguese water dogs are still considered part of the fishing fleets in the Algarve section of Portugal in the southwestern part of the Iberian Peninsula, and legend has it that centuries ago they served as couriers on board the Spanish Armada. The breed, however, almost became extinct about 1960, when it was found there were only about 50 of these dogs existing in the world. Now they are making a comeback and the United States has about 160 of the fewer than 200 that exist in the world.

title: Students in Panama Assail Canal Pact, Battle With Police
description: PANAMA, Sept 7 (AP)Panamanian demonstrators opposed to the new Panama Canal treaties dashed with riot policemen today outside the Foreign Ministry. Dozens of demonstrators were injured and at least 30 were arrested.

title: TODAY'S FEATURE MATCHES
description: STADIUM

description: Film

title: MAYORAL CANDIDATES DEBATE INTO NIGHT, WITH VOTING TODAY
description: While the Republican and Democratic mayoral candidates in New York City debated into the early hours of Primary Day, their supporters began intensive getoutthevote operations last night.

title: U.S. Prevails in Volleyball
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. 7 (AP)The United States women's team beat Peru today, 2022, 1510, 166, 1015, 159, in the world champion youth volleyball tournament being held in four Brazilian cities this week. In Belo Horizonte, the United States Men's squad beat Argentina, 815, 152, 1614.

title: Warning Signs Point Way to Foreclosure
description: NEARLY one out of every 100 homemortgage holders is behind on his mmrthly payments by 60 days or more. The trend is a lot better than in the depression of the 30's, but even now many delinquencies turn into foreclosures.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 1977

title: Namath Is Slated to Start For Rams Against Raiders
description: LOS ANGELES,Sept. 7 (AP)Joe Namath will open at quarterback Friday night when the Los Angeles Rams finish their exhibition season against the Super Bowl champion Oakland Raiders at the Coliseum.

title: Louisiana Republican Is Sworn
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)Robert L. Livingston was sworn in today as a new representative from Louisiana. Mr. Livingston's victory in a special election marked the first time in more than a century that a Republican was chosen to represent the district, which includes part of New Orleans. His election gave Republicans their third victory in four special elections to fill seats vacated by Democrats.

title: Attempted Bus Hijacking Charged To an Unarmed Rider in Jersey
description: BORDENTOWN, N. J., Sept. 7A passenger tried to hijacka Continental Trailways bus yesterday by using a finger in his pocket to pretend he had a revolver, the state police said.

title: Woman Is Charged In F.A.L.N.Blast
description: A 22yearold woman identified through a fingerprint found at the site of the Aug. 3 bombing that killed one person and injured several others at the Mobil Oil Building in Manhattan was charged with the bombing yesterday. The bombing was one of a series of terrorist acts attributed to a Puerto Rican nationalist group known as the F.A.L.N.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Connecticut Booters Win
description: STORRS, Conn., Sept. 7 (AP)Tom Nevers scored two goals today to lead the University of Connecticut to a 40 soccer victory over Southern Illinois University at Edwardsville. All goals were tallied in the second half. The game was the first of the season for each team.

title: Convicted Bank Officer Said to Want Immunity to Testily on Lance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7Bill L. Campbell, who is serving a prison sentence for embezzling about $1 million from a Georgia bank that Bert Lance once headed, has asked for immunity from prosecution for what he tells a Senate committee about Mr. Lance, a wellplaced Congressional source said today.

title: Posh Penthouse: Sleekness in Triplicate
description: PAT AND JOHN SCHUMACHER are having a party this weekend for Valentino, the Italian designer, but their apartment, one year in the making, may steal the show. At least it'll get the apartment finished, said Mrs. Schumacher, who has spent so much time supervising the renovation that the workmen gave her a set of tools to attach to her jeans.

title: Arts Complex Viewed as Boon In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 7The San Francisco Opera will begin its 55th season Friday in anticipation that this will be one of the last years the company will have to share the crowded 40yearold Opera House with the San Francisco Symphony and the San Francisco Ballet.

title: Contract Talks Open at Book Fair in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7Soviet publishers were negotiating today for book translation contracts with some Western exhibitors at Moscow's first international book fair despite a flurry of controversy over the confiscation of a small number of books and catalogues brought for display.

title: NEW CONTRACT OFFER FOR I.L.A. IS REPORTED
description: The Council of North Atlantic Shipping Associations was reported yesterday to be preparing a new contract proposal to present to the negotiating committee of the International Longshoremen's Association.

title: Vote Early, and Often
description: In short, vote. Vote earlythe polls in New York City and Nassau County, with the most important contests, are open from 6 A.M. until 9 P.M. And plan to vote often. Eleven days hence, the Democrats of New York will almost surely be asked to vote again to choose between the two leading votegetters in today's election as their candidate for Mayor, and perhaps for President of City Council as well. And only 50 days later a final vote will be needed to choose among major, minor and assorted independent party nominees. Tedious to some, no doubt, and, given the complexity of the primary ballot, confusing to many. But surely preferable to the alternative.

title: Mayoral Hopefuls in Light Mood As They Enter the Home Stretch
description: Two young boys wearing Abzug for Mayor Tshirts were shooting rubber bands at each other in the candidate's allbutdeserted headquarters. A few blocks away, Edward I. Koch and Mayor Beame sat in the Channel 13 television studio waiting for the five other candidates to arrive for a debate scheduled to begin at 10 A.M.

title: BRITISH POUND GAINS AFTER UNIONS VOTE
description: The British pound reached its highest level in nearly a year in London, while the dollar closed mostly lower against major world currencies in light foreign exchange trading yesterday, according to the Associated Press.

title: U.S. Planning to Sell Egypt 14 Lockheed Cargo Aircraft
description: WASHINGTON, (Reuters) Sept. 7The Defense Department said it intended to sell Egypt 14 C130 Lockheed Aircraft Corporation cargo jets with an estimated total value of $184.4 million.

title: Tenafly Residents Begin Drive Against Board of Education Office Plan
description: TENAFLY, Sept. 7  Dissatisfaction over official plans to construct a new Board of Education administrative office in this Bergen County borough has prompted a group of residents to begin a campaign to revise the community's charter.

title: Hnueilings
description: KAMPTON, T??llie (nee Grossman) unveilin? of memorial stone will be held on Sunday, Sept. 11 at 10:30 A.M. rain er shine, at Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, Long Island, N.Y.

title: U. S. China Talks: Peking, While Rejecting Proposals, Still Appears Flexible on Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Sept. 7  China appears to have rejected a proposal by Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance during his recent rtip to Peking that the impasse over Taiwan be resolved by downgrading the American Embassy here to a liaison

title: Four at Ted Bates Receive Promotions
description: Four senior vice presidents of Ted Bates & Company have been tapped as executive vice presidents and out of the four will probably come the new president of Ted Batcs/New York, the concern's principal ad agency.

title: 7Foot, 650Pound Security Guard Is Bulletproof
description: ORLANDO. Fla., Sept. 7 (UPI)At 7 feet and 650 pounds, he means business.

title: FIRST ISRAELI COLONISTS MOVE TO WEST BANK SITE
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 7A vanguard of Israeli colonists today quietly moved into Yattir, south of Hebron, in the first step toward carrying out the Government's controversial decision to establish three Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank.

title: Climber Is Killed, 4 Others Injured In 1,000Foot Fall on Mount Rainier
description: LONGMIRE, Wash.,Sept. 7 (UPI)Mary Gnehm, 47 years old, of Mercer Island was killed i na 1,000foot fall from Ingraham Glacier on Mount Rainier today and four others in the climbing party were injured.

title: 2,000 Demonstrate at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)Some 2,000 demonstrators representing a coalition of about 30 humanrights organizations gathered across the street from the White House after the Panama Canal treaty was signed tonight.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BRIDGES Tonight's 8:30 screening of Waterloo Bridge (1931), with Mae Clark and Douglass Montgomery, in the Universal series at the Museum'of Modem Art will be introduced by William K. Everson, film historian. Tomorrow's feature at 2:30 P.M. is Once in a Lifetime (1932), with Mine MacMahon, Jack Oakie and Sydney Fox. This is the rarely shown adaptation of the Broadway satire on early talkies by George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart.

title: Bonn Says It Is Ready to Negotiate For Release of Industrial Leader
description: BONN, Thursday, Sept. 8West German authorities indicated early today that they now were willing to negotiate for the release of an industrial leader who was kidnapped by terrorists in Cologne on Monday.

title: Letters
description: Keeping Up With Stanley

title: Specialty Plants for Sale at Fall Flower Mart
description: Frustrated city plant hunters who can never find that tiny spiny cactus or opulent orchid they have been seeking can now relax. There is a good chance the plants will turn up on sale at the giant Fall Flower Mart of the New York Horticultural Society this weekend.

title: Carter, Torrijos Sign Canal Pacts In the Presence of Latin Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  President Carter and Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrera tonight signed the two treaties that would transfer control of the Panama Canal to Panama by the year 2000 ratified by both countries.

title: High Schools Begin Amid Hope, But Others Face Boycott Today
description: New York City's public high schools opened their doors to 300,000 students yesterday in a mood of hope that, after two years of enforced economies, a stronger academic program was emerging with the smaller classes and new elective courses in many of the 111 schools.

title: Pollution Wrecking Inshore Fishing.
description: Pollution has turned the onceabundant Atlantic fishing grounds off Long Island, New York City and New Jersey into a foul and nearly barren sea, according to commercial and sport fishermen, whose $340 million ,industry is closing out its worst summer of inshore fishing in memory.

title: ALICE CRIMMINS WINS PAROLE ON SECOND BID
description: Alice Crimmins, who was convicted in 1971 of the strangulation death of her 4yearold daughter after three years of highly publicized trials, was granted a parole yesterday after serving five years of a 5to20year sentence.

title: Indians Drop Jersey City As Class AA Farm Club
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 7 (AP)Chattanooga's Southern League baseball team signed a threeyear player development contract with the Cleveland Indians today, replacing Jersey City as the Indians Class AA farm team.

title: Japan Cites Soviet Air Intrusion
description: TOKYO, Sept. 7 (AP)Two Soviet bombers violated Japan's airspace today over the Goto islands west of Kyushu, defense officials said. A protest was lodged with the Soviet Union, they added. The Soviet aircraft, both described as Tupolev TU95 bombers, flew over the islands about two minutes until Japanese jet fighters scrambled, the officials said.

title: Unusual Sheriff Improves a Jail In San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 7 (AP)At a desk, he checks the .38caliber revolver he wears in a holster at the waist of his dapper, pinstriped suit and enters the county prison.

title: BRITISH UNIONS AGREE TO ONE RAISE A YEAR
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Sept. 7Britain's labor unions voted by a substantial margin today to restrain wage demands and return the country to free collective bargaining after two years of formal controls.

title: MAYORAL CANDIDATES DEBATE INTO NIGHT, WITH VOTING TODAY
description: While the Republican and Democratic mayoral candidates in New York City debated into the early hours of Primary Day, their supporters began intensive getoutthevote operations last night.

description: EBahnsen. DPChicago 1. LOBMontreal 4, Chicago 10. 2BBilttner, Perez. Murcer, Gross. 3BDeJesus. STrillo.

title: TV:WHY We Need Our Liberty
description: AS THE NETWORKS prepare to bombard the nation with light entertainments over the next several weeks, public television, as is its right and perhaps obligation, is offering thoughtful ruminations on the subject of liberty by a professor of philosophy. Produced by WNEW/13 with a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities, the fourpart In Pursuit of Liberty will begin onChannel 13 tonight at 9 o'clock.

title: Yeganeh Is Named Iran Oil Negotiator
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 7 (Reuters)Mohammed Yeganeh, Minister of State in charge of budget and planning organization, was today named Iran's new chief oil negotiator to succeed Jamshid Amouzegar, who became Prime Minister last month.

title: Personal Beauty
description: THE fashion for deepercolored lipsticks and generally darker makeup this fall also means darker nail polish. And that means impeccable manicuring. As long as polish was on the light side, one could get away with being a bit slapdash, but the upcoming brown reds and wine reds draw attention to the hands, and nothing short of perfection will do.

title: For SingleParent Families
description: All organizations of single parents that are listed here offer weekly discussions or rap sessions with provisions for child care. Some also offer such services as telephone hot lines, counseling, group outings and talks by experts in fields of special interest to parents raising children alone.

title: Trilateral Post Goes To David Rockefeller
description: David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, has been named North American chairman of the Trilateral Commission, an unofficial policyoriented group linking Japan, North America and Europe.

title: U.S. Lead Reduced In Amorita Cup Sail
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Sept. 7The United States, which decisively defeated Bermuda in the first two races yesterday, held only a onerace lead in the Amorita Cup International Class team match today after a protest had been upheld.

title: Little Advantage Seen in Removal Of Gas Controls
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI)Removing Federal controls from natural gas prices would bring only a trickle of production more than, President Carter's somewhat eased controls would bring, Senator Henry Jackson, Democrat of Washington, contended today.

title: SOVIET RELIGIOUS GROUP REPORTS BEATING OF 150
description: MOSCOW, Sept 7 (Reuters)A force of 300 policemen and K.G.B. security men fought for six hours last week to break up a demonstration by Soviet Baptists protesting the closing of their prayer house, a dissident religious rights group said today.

title: Divorce Settlement Includes Horse
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 7 (UPI)A retired vice president of the Standard Oil Company of Indiana was ordered to pay $250 a month for the upkeep on his 14yearold daughter's show horse as part of a divorce settlement. F. Cushing Smith, 50 years old, of Wilmette, Ill., was ordered by Judge Reuben Liffshin in Cook County Divorce Court to pay for the upkeep of the pet, Monkey Business, and to turn over title of his $350,000 home to his former wife, Joan, 40, and to pay her $150,000 over a fouryear period. He must also pay $800 a month in child support, including the payments for the horse.

title: Classes and Workshops on Home Decorating and Design
description: WANT to learn how to design a loft? Build a solar hotwater heater? Repair antique porcelain? Does the development of interior design in Italy interest you? Or contemporary attitudes on decorative fabrics and wall hangings? Bronx Art Deco architecture?

title: TAXEXEMPT ISSUES UP SLIGHTLY IN PRICE
description: Taxexempt securities continued to advance toward slightly higher prices and lower interest rates yesterday, while the rest of the credit markets slipped back on very light trading.

title: Pessimism in White House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The newest series of allegations against Bert Lance, Director of the Office of Management and Budget, have increased the pessimism in the White House and at the top levels of the Administration about Mr. Lance's

title: Yanks WinIn 10th, 43; Go 3 Up
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 7Shut out for eight innings by the second wealthiest player in baseball's first class of free agents, the Yankees suddenly and belatedly burst alive tonight and added the 18th loss to Wayne Garland's scrutinized record on an unearned run.

title: Phils Keep Rolling at Mets Expense
description: All things considered, the Philadelphia Phillips would rather be in Los Angelesin the National League playoffwhen the season ends, and they drew closer to that goal last night when Larry Christenson stifled the New York Mets on two hits, 62.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: New York City's 111 high schools opened smoothly yesterday, though elementary, intermediate and Junior high schools faced boycott. Article appears on page D1S?

title: French Premier Will Seek Date for Visit by Carter
description: PARIS, Sept. 7Prime Minister Raymond Barre, during his trip to Washington next week, will seek to fix a date for President Carter to visit France late this year, French officials said today.

title: CARTER PUTS PRIORITY ON FULL EMPLOYMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  President Carter, meeting with black members of Congress, pledged today to make swift passage of full employment legislation a high priority of his Administration.

title: About New York
description: There is a level of politics where issues seem to be boiled down to 30second bloodlust puddings for consumption on television and the hustings.

title: Coat Hangers Used In Abortion Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)Advocates of Federal funding of abortions delivered about 200 metal coat hangers to a key Congressman today as a reminder of the way some abortions used to be performed.

title: 14 Defendants Are Listed

J., a securities trader on the floor of the National Stock Exchange; Michael Rekoon, 31, of Cranford, N. J., securities trader in New York; Yiddy Bloom, 66, Miami Beach. a real estate investor; Jerrold Bloom, 40, Coral Gables, Fla., a Miami Beach securities salesman; Jack Silbiger. 46. Shawnee Mission, Kan. Abraham Soloman, 42, Philadelphia; Ira Ingerman, 39, Narbeth, Pa., president of Beach, secretarytreasurer of Casa Bella Magic Marker; Burton Dubbin, 36, Miami Imports Inc., Miami Beach.

title: NEVA FLOODS LENINGRAD; WINDS CUT POWER LINES
description: LENINGRAD, Sept. 7 (UPI)A storm with winds of up to 66 miles an hour struck here today, tearing down power lines and causing serious flooding by the Neva River.

title: FIRST WOMEN APPLY TO BE FIREFIGHTERS
description: Several women stood in the small sea of men waiting outside the City Department of Personnel yesterday morning on. the first day that the city opened its firefighter entrance examinations to women. But most explained that they were waiting to put in applications for men.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A lottery to select vendors to sell hot dogs legally at 60 sites in Central Park was held yesterday at the Parks Department headquarters there and proved somewhat less than a smashing success.

title: Books of The Times
description: JESSICA MITFORD'S account of her life and times as a member of the Communist Party of the United States is perhaps a shade too delightful. She doesn't moan, whine, denounce, apologize, or make excuses. She makes jokes instead. (She tells us, for instance, that she never much cared for Howard Fast's turgid historical potboilers even when he was a party member in good standing: In those days, the witchhunting com

title: Judge Allows Peltz to Withdraw As Legal Counsel for Berkowitz
description: Philip Peltz, the Brooklyn lawyer under investigation for allegedly attempting to sell the taped memoirs of David R. Berkowitz, his client was allowed yesterday to withdraw as counsel to Mr. Berkowitz, the man accused of being the .44caliber killer.

title: Price War Leaves Cash in Buyers Jeans
description: Backtoschool shoppers got a rare surprise this year when they priced denim jeans, the favorite staple of young people's wardrobes. They found that Levi's, the leading seller, were priced sharply lower and that other jeans were also slightly less expensive.

title: Numbers Are Listed For Voter Problems
description: Telephone numbers have been announced for receiving complaints about any violations of the election laws regarding today's primary.

title: Stewart Keeps Floogie Floying
description: THE FLAT FOOT FLOOGIE, verging on her 40th birthday, is still flaunting her floyfloy with plenty of flojoy, flojoy, flojoy. Slam Stewart, who, with his partner, Slim Gaillard, created the song extolling the Floogie in 1938 and made it into such a hit that the Slim and Slam record of it was buried in a time capsule at the 193940 World's Fair, is at Hopper's this week and next, appearing in a New York club for the first time since he played the Three Deuces on 52nd Street in 445 and still singing the rhythmic and nonsensical joys of the Flat Foot Floogie.

title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: U.S. Help for the Steel Industry Urged by Pennsylvania Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (Reuters)Pennsylvania's two Senators today called for Federal help for the steel industry in the United States.

title: Comptroller Says Lance Borrowed $3.5 Million Froman Allied Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The Comptroller of the Currency disclosed today that Bert Lance, the director of the Office of Management and Budget, and his wife received some $3.5 million in loans or refinancing over 13 years from a Georgia bank where his bank maintained a substantial account under a correspondent relationship.

title: Egypt's Copts Fear Moves to Introduce Strict Islamic Laws
description: CAIRO, Sept. 7The leadership of Egypt's Coptic Christian minority held an emergency meeting today to study moves by Egyptian authorities to introduce strict Islamic law in this mainly Moslem but generally tolerant country.

title: Pollution Wrecking Inshore Fishing
description: Pollution has turned the onceabundant Atlantic fishing grounds off Long Island, New York City and New Jersey into a foul and nearly barren sea, according to commercial and sport fishermen, whose $340 million industry is closing out its worst summer of inshore fishing in memory.

title: Confusion Over Buses Mars Opening Day in Boston
description: BOSTON. Sept. 7This city began today its fourth year of courtordered busing for school desegregation but there were not enough buses to go around.

title: Baboons Cause 15 Deaths in India
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 7 (Reuters)Fifteen Indian schoolgirls were killed today when baboons jumped onto the roof of their village classroom and caused it to collapse, the Samachar news agency reported. More than 50 children were in the school near Jaipur, capital of the northwestern state of Rajasthan.

title: Caso Almost Loses Right to Vote in Nassau Primary
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 7The Nassau County Executive, Ralph G. Caso, who faces two opponents .in tomorrow's primary, got a new enrollment card todayand thus will be able to vote tomorrowafter his staff told him that he Fad been expunged from the Board of Elections books and had been listed as a blank.

title: State Senate to Return on Oct. 6 To Act on 3 Carey Appointments
description: ALBANY, Sept. 7The Senate will return to the State House on Oct. 6 to consider confirming some of Governor Carey's appointees, Senator Warren M. Anderson, Republican of Binghamton and the majority leader announced today.

title: T.V.A. Seeks to Block Mergers
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 7 (AP)The Tennessee Valley Authority said today that it wanted the power to bring antitrust suits to prevent further mergers of national oil, coal and uranium suppliers.

title: Adams Hints French Voting Is a Factor for Concorde
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7Transportation Secretary Brock Adams said today that Administration options on Concorde flights in this country were classified as secret by him last week to shield diplomatic exchanges between the Government and Britain and France.

title: 5County Panel Proposes Cutting Hospital Stays to Save $3 Million
description: NEWARK, Sept. 7 The Regional Health Planning Council, representing five counties in New Jersey, proposed today a plan for saving $3 million a year in healthcare costs by treating people at home instead of in hospitals.

title: July Consumer Loans Up
description: The Federal Reserve Board reported that outstanding consumer loans rose $2.32 billion in July. Page D5

title: Dollar Slips Against Yen
description: The dollar continued to slip against the Japanese yen, closing in Tokyo at 267.475 yen, down from Tuesday's 267.675.It dipped to 266.80 yen by the New York close. It finished tt 267.52 yen in New York on Tuesday.

title: Tentative Pact Reached in Strike Of San Francisco Transit Police
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Sept. 7 (UPI}A tentative agreement to end the twoweekold strike of Bay Area Rapid Transit District police officers was reached early today and leaders of unions involved called membership meetings to vote on the pact.

title: 4 British ShotPutters Walk Out of Meet
description: LONDON, Sept. 7 (AP)Geoff Capes, Britain's champion shotputter, led a walkout today from Friday's track and field meet at the Crystal Palace in protest against a plan to institute drug testing.

title: Bruns and Parrish in Deal
description: Bruns, Nordeman, Rea & Company has reached an agreement in principle to acquire Parrish Securities Inc., the two Wall Street brokers said yesterday. Benjamin L. Lubin, managing partner of Bruns, and Russell S, Bickel, chief executive of Parrish, said Parrish would continue to operate under its own name.

title: Liddy Freed, Still Refusing to Discuss Watergate
description: DANBURY, Conn., Sept. 7G. Gordon Liddy walked out of prison today the same way he entered in 1973silent about Watergate and almost everythingelse.

title: Businesses Plan 77 Rise Of 13% in Capital Outlays
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)The nation's businesses plan a modest 13.3 percent increase in investments in new plant and equipment this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: MEDICAL ETHICS RULE FACES CHALLENGE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The Federal Trade Commission got a quick response today as it opened its longpending case against the American Medical Association and two affiliated Connecticut medical socieities, charging them with illegally restraining competition among physicians.
