description: The Rev. Louis R. Gigante, a Democratic City Councilman, said yesterday that he had refused to waive immunity in testifying before a grand jury that has been seeking information on his ties to a Mafia leader because he believes that the grand jury system is unfair and an abuse of power in the hands of prosecutors.

title: 4 Tons of Marijuana Destroyed
description: MEREDITH, N.H., Sept. 7 (AP)More than four tons of marijuana, the largest amount ever seized in New Hampshire, was destroyed yesterday in the town's incinerator as eight sheriff's deputies watched. The 8,100 pounds of marijuana had been stored in the basement of the Belknap County jail, since it was seized in a raid last February.

title: WIRTZ AND DUNLOP BACK CHANGES IN LABOR LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI)  Two former Labor Secretaries. Willard With and John T. Dunlop, endorsed proposed changes in Federal labor laws today to require quicker union representation elections and penalize companies that refuse to bargain.

title: PRIMARY DAY
description: Primary day is not a legal holiday. Government offices, schools, banks, libraries, stores and bars will operate as usual. There is also no change in Sanitation Department schedules or parking regulations.

title: Excerpts From Statements by Carter and Torrijos
description: We are here to participate in the signing of treaties which will assure a peaceful and prosperous and secure future for an international waterway of great importance to us all.

title: CLERICAL STAFF STRIKES AT HOFSTRA UNIVERSITY
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Sept, 7More than 300 secretaries and clerical workers at Hofstra University walked off the job this morning after contract negotiations failed to resolve a salary dispute.

title: Speakers at Herald Square Rally Hold Carter to Promise on Jobs
description: Speakers at a rally of the New York Full Employment Action Council in Herald Square yesterday noon said that it was time for President Carter to deliver on his campaign promises to put the nation's unemployed back to work.

title: PAUL NAWIASKY, CHEMIST; SPECIALIST IN DYE STUFFS
description: Paul Nawiasky, an organic chemist specializing in dye stuffs, died Tuesday at his Reading, Pa., home. He was 94 years old.

title: People in Sports
description: Marvin (Bad News) Barnes, the Detroit Pistons basketball star, got a bit of good news yesterday. The state parole board granted the 6foot9inch Barnes parole from the Rhode Island Correctional Institution in Cranston, where he has served four months of a oneyear sentence. The effective date of the parole is Oct. 14, with Michigan authorities being asked to supervise his continued parole.

title: Annette Leiderrnan Wed To Hugh G. Raisky, Artist
description: Annette Louise Leiderman, director of communications for CBS Television retail sales, was married yesterday to Hugh Gray Raisky, an artist who is president of his own design concern in New York.

title: The Lance Hotfoot
description: It was clear that Richard Nixon would have to resign, someone observed tartly in 1974, when Johnny Carson started making Watergate jokes on the Tonight show. The jokes are now about Bert Lance. (Did you hear about the bank robbery at Lance's Calhoun National Bank? They got away with a million dollarsin pawn tickets.)

title: House Panel Backs Adding to Protection of Brokers Clients
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)Legislation approved by a House Commerce subcommittee today would give more financial protection to customers of failed brokers or dealers.

title: Scott's Back but Red Sox Lose by 32
description: George Scott was back in the Boston lineup at Toronto last night after missing two games, but the firstyear Blue Jays hurt the Red Sox pennant hopes anyway by snapping an 11game losing streak with a 32 triumph that ended Boston's fivegame winning string.

title: Dividends
Backgammon:
description: ACAPULCO. MexicoLast week, the World Amateur Backgammon Club, a new Californiabased organization, heild its first tournament here. The event drew a large number of native aficionados and American enthusiasts, including several experts from Texas and California. Over the last few years, backgammon has become a Mexican pastime. Indeed, the obsession with the game shown in this country is hardly exceeded elsewhere. Mexico's topranked players are beginIntl& to acquire international prestige.

title: Look what's cooking at A&S
description: Apples of love. that's what the Spaniards called eggplants back in the 16th Century. In those days they were reputed to be great aphrodisiacs.

title: Army Weighs Moving 14,000 G.I.'s From Korea to Fort Drum, N. Y.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The United States Army, in a surprise move, has informed Congress that Fort Drum in upstate New York is under active consideration as the new home of the 14,000member Second Infantry Division, now stationed in South Korea.

title: Ford Asserts He Called Severing Of Taiwan Ties Only a Possibility
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7Former President Gerald R. Ford today said he told the Chinese leaders in 1975 that breaking relations with Taiwan and keeping an unofficial American presence there was only a possibility for normalizing relations with Peking.

title: South Korean Car Exports Up
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 7 (AP)South Korea's fledgling auto industry exported 4,099 cars during the first eight months of this year, three times the entire 1976 figure of 1,300 units, the Government said today.

title: British Yield to the Lure of Angling Contests And Bite Eagerly at Any Good Bets on the Side
description: NORTH MUSKHAM, England, Sept. 5Three thousand people gathered here on the bank of the River Trent last week and stood for hours peering toward the water as it crept through Nottinghamshire's flat grassland toward the North Sea.

title: HARASSED RESIDENTS ASK FOR GUN PERMITS
description: WASHINGTON TOWNSHIP, Sept. 7Three homeowners in a neighborhood here that has been harassed by teenage vandals in recent weeks have filed applications for gun permits since the first of the month, police officials said today.

title: Screen: Polish Drama Better Than Its Tinsel
description: KRZYSZTOF ZANUSSI, the Polish director who has been represented here by "Family Life" (1971) and "Illumination" (1973), is a serious filmmaker whose method keeps getting in the way of his concerns. His newest film, "A Woman's Decision," which opened yesterday at Cinema 3, is a sensitively acted, sometimes-moving story about the emotional indecisions of the woman who has everything.It may not be an accident that the English translation of the film's Polish title dimly evokes some old Joan Crawford chestnut about a beautiful shopgirl torn between Herbert Marshall (money, glamour) and Franchot Tone (love, marriage).The alternatives faced by Mr. Zanussi's heroine, Marta (Maya Komorowska), a supposedly happily married woman and mother who is successful in her career (as an accountant) are a good deal more honest and complex than any that ever faced Joan Crawford, but the method is so prettily romantic it denies much of the emotional urgency.The photography, whenever possible, is dappled with Claude Lelouch-like reflections and the soundtrack is full of the kind of music to read a Mantovani record album's liner notes by.This is too bad since behind this fanciness there are characters of recognizable feelings and rare decency. Mostly there is Marta who, as played by Miss Komorowska, is a woman of intelligence who can cope with everyone else's problems but isas she sees itthwarted by a husband (Piotr Franczewski) absorbed by his own career and unable (or unwilling) to talk about their own difficulties.Their difficulties aren't unique. He's somewhat skeptical of her enthusiasms, proud of his position as head of the house, inclined to deal with problems by behaving as if they didn't exist. Marta, though, is a doer and a talker. When she finds herself having an affair with a man as footloose as it's possible to be in a socialist state, Maria must make her decision whether to make her break for freedom with the bohe-mian lover or stay with her husband.It isn't her decision that gives the film its poignancy but the subsidiary moments by which Marta's character is defined. These include her confrontation, as the office's union representative, with the office's boss, her washroom dialogues with her tough-minded best-friend who calls Marta's do-gooding "self-indulgent," and an extremely moving sequence in which Marta calls on her terminally ill mother-in-law who, though not all that fond of Marta, warns her not to act with her husband as she thinks she should but, honestly, as she feels.Such sequences are so strong and good, as are the performances by Miss Komorowska, Mr. Franczewski and Marek Piwowski, who plays her lover, that the movie doesn't need the lush production techniques, which, like make-up on a naturally beautiful woman, obscure the film's natural resources.

title: U.S. Checking Uruguyan Footwear:_ To See if Products Are Substidized
Met Warns Musicians of Closing
description: THE MANAGEMENT of the Metropolitan Opera Company, contending that little significant progress had been made in labor contract negotiations with its musicians, yesterday served all its employees with a preliminary notice about the possible closing of the house within the next 48 hours.

title: Television
Ursula Oppens Scores a Triumph In Avery Fisher Winner Concert
description: It is not often that a pianist gets a chance to mix solos with concertos during the course of an evening. But Ursula Oppens did last night in Fisher Hall, and so will the other three recipients of the Avery Fisher Winners Week who will succeed her. Several generations ago, mixed programs were common. Today they are so rare as to be all but outr.

title: For Tracy, It Was a Very Good Year
description: When she was 2 years old, Tracy Austin grabbed a tennis racquet with both hands and started hitting balls. When she was 3, she was playing with her older sister and three older brothers. When she was 4, she had her picture on the cover of World Tennis as the most appealing moppet in dozens photographs. When she was 7, she was swinging a fullsize racquet in tournaments. When she was 8, she won her first title, her first two titles actually, both the 10andunder and the 12andunder Los Angeles city championships. When she was 12, she was drafted by the Los Angeles Strings of World Team Tennis. When she was 13, she had her picture on the cover of Sports Illustrated as a tennis prodigy. And this year, when she was 14, she has been the darling of Wimbledon and Forest Hills in her pinafores and pigtails.

title: LetterFromHome
description: New Haven

title: ADM. HERBERT CHANDLER; SERVED IN SOUTH PACIFIC
description: Rear Adm. Herbert Gray Chandler died Monday at Keesler Air Force Base in Biloxi, Miss. He was 79 years old and lived in Gulfport, Miss.

title: GARDENING
description: There is a certain mulberry tree out back that I've been meaning to move for several years now. A landscape volunter no doubt planted by some passing bird, the tree grows within inches of a stone wallan intolerable situation. It's the unexpected trees that always seem to grow best, their roots swelling and thriving til walls come tumbling down.

title: Comptroller Says Lance Received $3.5 Million Loans at Allied Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The Comptroller of the Currency disclosed today that Bert Lance, the director of the Office of Management and Budget, and his wife received some $3.5 million in loans or refinancing over 13 years from a Georgia bank where his bank maintained a substantial account under a correspondent relationship.

title: A Right to Disaster Relief
description: Natural disasters in the decade aheadfloods, famines, epidmies, earthquakesare likely to result in even more misery than such events have brought in recent years. Runaway population growth and the kind of urbanization typified by the shanty towns of developing countries will make millions increasingly vulnerable and relief more difficult. This is the grim conclusion of two recent reports, one just released by the United Nations Association of the United States, the other published last spring by the 1980's Project of the Council on Foreign Relations. They contain commendable, strikingly similar recom mendations which, if implemented, would substantially reduce distress.

title: U.S.SOVIET EXCHANGE OF SCHOLARS DEBATED
description: A task force of the Twentieth Century Fund reported yesterday that the 19yearold SovietAmerican cultural exchange program was seriously flawed, even though it had benefited both sides.

title: Prosecutor Is Focusing on Juveniles
description: A special effort designed to reduce the disproportionate number of dismissals of felony charges against 14 and 15yearold juveniles was announced yesterday by District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brcoklyn.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. BRIEF OPPOSES RACE QUOTA AT COAST UNIVERSITY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The Justice Department has advised President Carter that factors such as race can be taken into account in university admissions but that setting a qupta of places in each class for minority students is unconstitutional, Administration officials said today.

title: Forest Hills: Some Are Glad, Some Not
description: Forest Hills High School in Queens opened yesterday with plenty of teachers and pupils. But there was neither teaching nor learning and it is not likely there will be, either there or at any othr secondary school in the city, until next week.

title: Bar to Busing Backed
description: BOSTON, Sept. 7 (AP)The Massachusetts legislature gave final approval today to a constitutional amendment that would prohibit courtordered d busing for school integration. The vote was 173 to 90, and the measure will go to the electorate for ratification in the 1978 state election.

title: 2 Voyager Spacecraft on Course
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 7 (UPI)The twin Voyager space probes were reported speeding quietly today toward the outer planets of the solar system with no major problems aboard either craft. Voyager I launched Monday, was 1.2 million miles from Earth and traveling at 22,938 miles an hour. A sister ship Voyager 2, sent aloft last month, was 9.7 millin miles from Earth and traveling at 21,679 miles an hour.

title: The U.N. Today
Schools Open on a Peaceful Note As Chicago Starts Racial Shift
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 7  Chicago took another tentative step today toward desegregation of the nation's thirdlargest school district without evoking any of the violence predicted by some groups, both black and white.

title: The Bakke Brief
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7Within the next week the Carter Administration is due to give the Supreme Court its views on the case of Allan Bakke, the white student who says that a California program for minority applicants unconstitutionally cost him admission to medical school. A draft of the brief, now being reviewed in the White House, concludes that the California system does violate the Constitution. That unexpected view is still not final.

title: BOMB BLASTS SHATTER 100 CAPITAL WINDOWS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 7 (UPI)Two powerful bomb blasts today shattered about 100 windows near the Soviet Embassy and blew up a cement flower pot near the White House. AntiCastro commandos claimed responsibility for the blast.

title: Dow Up 3.12 for 5th Straight Gain; Business Spending Plans a Factor
description: The stock market, drawing some encouragement from a modest increase in capital spending plans by corporations, managed yesterday to produce its fifth consecutive Rain.

title: Behind the Voting Machines
description: Betty Dolen is a wagering woman. In 1975 she bet a friend a combination corned beefpastrami sandwich that the turnout in the school board elections would top 10 percent. She lost. This year, she bet one election watcher another sandwich that the school election returns wouldn't top 6 percent. She won. Nothing much has changed for today's primaries, except the size of the meal. I'll treat you to the best lunch you ever ate, she said the other day, if there's no runoff. And she added to herself, Everyone's going to think I never think of anything but food.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMOWITZMollie. Beloved wife of the late Harry, devoted mother of Abe and Daniel, adored sister of Isidor Brenner. Services Thursday, 10 AM, Schwartz Brothers, Forest Park Chapels, Queens Boulevard and 76th Road, Forest Hills.

title: Sanitation Workers in Suffolk End Walkout Against Carters
description: SMITHTOWN, L.I., Sept. 7Private sanitation workers in Suffolk County ended their strike today and are scheduled to return to work tomorrow morning, a week after the walkout began.

title: Reserve Reports Consumer Loans Showed $2.32 Billion Rise in July
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)Outstanding consumer loans rose $2.32 billion in July, a slight increase from the June gain, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: CURRICULUMS ISSUE IN SUBURBAN SCHOOLS
description: As more than a million students in New York Citiy's suburbs returned to school today, the dominant issues involved curriculums, grading and performance  a marked contrast to the battles over teacher salaries or budget problems of previous years.

description: Belmont Jockeys

title: Sound
description: JUST WHAT IS IT that makes music played on a good sound system so pleasurable? For one thing, there's the extended range at both the high and low ends. It lends weight and conviction to the bass and brings out the upper part of the spectrum that gives each voice and instrument its distinctive tonal flavor. But there is one thing even more grateful to the musically sensitive ear than wide frequency response, and that is the absence of distortion. This is what truly separates quality equipment from its lesser counterparts. It is the preeminent touchstone of quality sound renroduction.

title: GOLDBERG TO BE SENT TO EASTWEST TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  President Carter will nominate Arthur J. Goldberg, a former chief delegate to the United Nations, as an ambassadoratlarge and Chairman of the American delegation to next month's EastWest conference in Belgrade, the White House announced today.

title: People and Business
description: Philip L. Vermeer, the lead attorney in the Government's suit to split  off the Western Electric Company from the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, has resigned from the Justice Department in a disagreement over how best to prepare the threeyearold case for trial.

title: Safety Panel Issues a Warning On Amusement Ride, the Zipper
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)The Consumer Product Safety Commission issued an warning today urging people to avoid the amusement rdie known as the Zipper.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Writing on the Wall Calligraphy, by definition, means beautiful hand writing. Classic Roman letters are still our standard of legibility. Through the manipulations of a broad pen or brush, these alphabetical forms can convey a range of feeling from quiet discipline to total freedom of expression. They range from traditional to totally modern graphics. Philip Bouwsma was inspired to make a career of calligraphy during a stay in Italy. His work today is mainly in calligraphy suitable for framing. And during the last year, this young artist has perfected his craft to include stonecutting. The black stone calligraphic plaque at right is an example of this new refinement. The calligraphic forms are chiseled out and filled in with gold leaf. The piece, cut from a 12inchsquare, costs $350, with a twotothree weeks delivery.

title: French Official to Visit Quebec
description: PARIS, Sept. 7 (Reuters)The French Minister of Justice, Alain Peyrefitte, is to leave tomorrow on a fourday visit to Quebec to mark the 10th anniversary of the signing of a FrenchQuebec cooperation agreement. The accord calls for increased educational, cultural, scientific and technical exchanges between France and the mainly Frenchspeaking Canadian province.

title: A New Daily Double: B(Belmont) and M (Meadowlands)
description: Cadillac Murray made the price. $25 for the chauffeured ride from Belmont to the Meadowlands on Tuesday. It's opening night over in Jersey, and these are rich people we're talking about, he said, as he waited by the clubhouse gate for the ninth race to let out. I'm thinking maybe I'll get a full car; I got some people telling me they might be interested in burying some money in the Meadow Land.

title: MAGIC MARKER FRAUD CHARGED BY U.S JURY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 7 (Reuters)A Federal grand jury today charged 14 men with manipulating the common stock of the Magic Marker Corporation, the maker of a wellknown brand of softtipped pen.

title: Cincinnati Breeds Rare Leopard
description: CINCINNATI (UPI)Cincinnati Zoo is the only one in the Western Hemisphere to breed the Persian leopard, an endangered subspecies, of which there are only about 50 in captivity and 20 reported remaining in the wild. A cub born at the Cincinnati Zoo was the seventh birth for the parents, themselves born at the zoo in 1970. Pairs were born in 1973, 1974 and 1976.

Goodman of Manhattan, who is seeking the Republican mayoral nomination.

description: LONDON, Sept. 7 (AP)Britain's Tony Jacklin shot a threeunderpar 70 today and took the firstround lead in the $70,000 Tournament Players championship over the 6,890yard Foxhills course in Surrey.

title: COCACOLA AND EGYPT PLAN JOINT VENTURE
description: CAIRO, Sept. 7CocaCola signed an agreement today for an agricultural venture that is considered here to be a step toward the eventual return of the soft drink to the Egyptian market, from which it has been excluded since 1966.

title: Jets Improving but Are Searching for a Bigger Kick
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I.,Sept. 7The Jets have come a long way. After all, when was the last time anyone thought the Washington Redskins would bother to take a peek at the New Yorkers workouts?

description: PASKOWEdward C. former president William V. Schmidt Company Inc., September 8, 1970. In loving memory of adear friend and colleague. Sam Weintraub.

title: Woman Defeats Judge in Madison
description: MADISON, Wis, Sept. 7Moria Krueger, strongly supported by local feminists, defeated Judge Archie Simonson of Dane County today in Wisconsin's first judicial recall election.

title: Market Place
description: The possibility that Congress may deregulate the air freight carriers before the election recess this year has kindled interest in Tiger International, the holding company that owns the Flying Tiger Line.

title: Hers
description: REALITY has recently come to my attention. It has always been there in a rather offhanded sort of way, but it resembled a quilt that oftentimes slipped from my lap while my mind raced ahead thinking about what the whole thing would look like once it was finished. That is the way it is with idealists, whose beady eyes tend to focus upon the distant cloud as opposed to the oncoming bus, and probably we would all be better off living in the country, where clouds predominate.

title: Explorations Off West Greenland Fail to Find Petroleum Deposits
description: GODTHAAB, Greenland, Sept. 7 (Reuters)Oil exploration off West Greenland has ended for the summer without finding any signs of petroleum deposits, a Greenland government spokesman said today.

title: Four Alcoholics in California File Lawsuit to Decriminalize Public Drunkeness
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 7Four indigent alcoholics have filed a class action suit in Los Angeles Superior Court seeking the decriminalization of public drunkenness.

title: Federal Judge Restores 3 to the Ballot for City Council
description: The insurgents successful appeal to trying to unseat incumbent City Council members were restored to the ballot yesterday after bringing suit in Federal Court under the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

description: Tracy Austin's summer saga ended yesterday in the United States Open tennis championships, but the streaks rolled on for Chris Evert and Guillermo Vilas.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio, Sept. 7 (AP)Layoffs can be expected at the Armco Steel Corporation's Middletown and Hamilton, Ohio, plants within two weeks, company officials said today.

title: PAN AM MAY DUPLICATE LAKER SKYTRAIN SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (Reuters)An official of Pan American World Airways said today his airline would duplicate the Skytrain service of Britain's Laker Airways if aviation officials in the United States refused to approve fare reductions proposed by Pan Am.

title: The Canal in Panama
description: There is no Panama Canal! There is an American canal at Panama, runs the new slogan of opponents to the two canal treaties signed in Washington last night. The antiseptic preposition at tells the story: Treaty opponents would have the American people overlook the fact that the canal is in Panama and is there because of a onesided treaty imposed upon a daysold Republic of Panama 74 years ago.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (Reuters)President Carter today asked Congress again to agree to his controversial offer to sell a modern airborne radar warning system to Iran.

title: Wichita State Cleared Of Recruiting Violations
description: TULSA, Okla., Sept. 7 (AP)Wichita State University was cleared of any recruiting violations involving a basketball player today but the player, Marcus Penny, was barred from play in the Missouri Valley Conference.

title: Boyle Attends Pretrial Hearing On Charges in Yablonski Deaths
description: MEDIA, Pa.. Sept. 7 (AP)W. A. Boyle, the former United Mine Workers president who was granted a second trial on charges of arranging the slaying of a union rival, came to Delaware County Court today for pretrial arguments in a judge's office.

title: Touring Aussie Juniors In Tie With E.T.A. Team
description: WANTAGH, L.I., Sept. 7A touring Australian junior tennis team played an 88 tie with an Eastern Tennis Association team at the Seaford Tennis Club tonight.

description: The Penultimate Penthouse

title: FRENCH GOVERNMENT ASKS DEFICIT BUDGET TO EXPAND ECONOMY
description: PARIS, Sept. 7 The trend toward more expansionist economic policies in West Europe's major industrial countries was strengthened today when the French Government proposed a $2 billion budget deficit for next year.

title: Jury Is Still Out on Impact of Jersey Night Flat Racing
description: In the executive offices at Meadowlands yesterday, stacks of harnessracing magazines like Hoofbeats and Trot! were being replaced by fresh copies of The BloodHorse and Thoroughbred Record. The track across the Hudson River in East Rutheiford, N.J., had made a smooth switch from trotters and pacers to thoroughbreds. drawing 25,158 fans on Tuesday as it introduced night flat racing to the metropolitan area. A few minutes before midnight, after the ninthrace result was posted, the video Matrix board in the infield boasted: This is only the beginning.

title: Mistrial in Coast Murder Case
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Sept. 7 (AP)A mistrial was declared yesterday in the triat to determine the sanity of Edward Charles Allaway, who is accused of killing seven persons in a college library on July 12 of last year. The jury of five men and seven women, which convicted the 37yearold janitor two weeks ago on charges of murder and assault, informe dJudge Robert Kneeland of Superior Court that it was hopelessly dead locked over the issue of Mr. Allaway's legal sanity at the time of the killings. A hearing on whether a new sanity trial should be held was set for a week from tomorrow.

title: Disks: Richter Sets a Classical Standard
description: Instead of the passionate subjectivity many pianists bring to these early Beethoven sonatas, Sviatoslav Richter offers lucid, sparingly pedaled readings that emphasize the Classical side of the music: Tempos are steady, dynamics adhere to the test, and the notes are about as cleanly played as they will ever be. In fact, the control. over voicing, articulation and dyanmics is quite phenomenal  one could practically take dictation from these performances.

title: KochanCollins Duo Tied For Golf Lead With a 65
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Sept. 7Tom Kochan of the Round Hill Club, Greenwich, Conn., and Bill Collins of Brae Burn CountryClub, Purchase, N.Y., tied for a onestroke lead with Mal Galletta Jr. of Glen Cove (L.I.) Golf Club and Austin Straub, assistant at Ridgeway C.C., White Plains, in the first round of the Metropolitan Professional Golfers Association $14,000 proandpro championship today at Kutsher's C.C.

title: Ratings Close in New TV Race
description: The three commercial networks broke away fast from the starting gate in what appears to be very much of a horse race for the abnormally early seasonal running of blockbusters Tuesday night.

title: SUSPECT IN MURDER OF 9 INDICTED IN WATERBURY
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Sept. 7 (UPI)A grand jury returned indictments today on nine counts of murder against Lorne Acquin, a 27yearold roofer, in the July 22 slayings of a Prospect mother and eight children. The jury took less than 15 minutes to hand up indictments after hearing the evidence against the defendant, who is charged with bludgeoning the victims before setting fire to their home.

title: Start of a ProF.A.L.N. Group Is Announced in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Sept. 7 (AP)A statement received by the Associated Press today said that a guerrilla group called Armed Commandos Against the Bandits has been organized in Puerto Rico.

title: I.M.F. Gets $56.2 Million to Lend To Poor Nations in Gold Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (Reuters)The International Monetary Fund raised $56.2 million to lend the world's poorest nations by auctioning off nearly 525,000 ounces of its gold stock today.

title: Mormon Leader Is Stricken
description: SALT LAKE MY, Sept. 7 (Reuters)Spencer W. Kimball. the 82yearold president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints, suffered a minor heart attack this morning, church offi,cials said. He was under care at a Salt Lake City hospitat. Mr. Kimball, who underwent openheart surgery in 1971, was striken as he was walking up the stairs of the Mormon Church's worldwide headquarters here.

title: Notes on People
description: A RETURN, of sorts, to the American stage is planned by Princess Grace of Monaco, once Grace Kelly, movie actress. She will give two performances of Shakespearean readings at the Loeb Drama Center at Harvard in midMarch of next year, a Loeb official said yesterday. The Princess, costarring with Richard Pasco of Britain's Royal Shakespeare Company, will also appear at CarnegieMellon Institute in Pittsburgh and the McCarter at Princeton, Princess Grace has not starred in movies since 1956, when she married Prince Ranier, but she has been a hostnarrator for television specials. She also gave some Bicentennial readings of American prose and poetry in 1976 at the Edinburgh Festival.

title: CENSUS BUREAU TO SEEK DATA ON U.S. BUSINESSES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)The Census Bureau announced today it would seek information from 2.5 million American businesses for its 1977 economic census.

title: Kennedy Center Sets Up Awards for Composers
description: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington has announced a new annual series of awards for American musical compositions. There will be three awards each year, beginning in September l078, and alternating between orchestral and chamber works. The prizes will be known as the Kennedy Center Friedheim Awards, in honor of Arthur Friedheim, who was a pianist and a pupil of Anton Rubinstein and Liszt.

title: Psychologist Chosen As Peace Corps Head
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)President Carter today nominated Dr. Carolyn R. Payton, a psychologist, to head the Peace Corps.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: or periods ended July 30 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) indicates stock Is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Bertelsmann Group Buys Control Of Bantam Books From Italians
description: REINHARD MOHN, a former Afrika Korps lieutenant who was a prisoner, of war in a camp near Concordia, Kan., during World War II, now holds the controlling interest in Bantam Books, the New York publishing house that puts out 350 to 400 titles a year and has about a 22 percent share of the paperback market in the United States.

title: Interiors Seen Through Horst's Eyes
description: TAKE A PHOTOGRAPH of someone's face and, if the picture turns out to be flattering, the sitter will praise you for accurately recording reality. In case of disaster, the camera will be called a liar, or, at worst (say 50 out of 50 pictures tell the same uncomely tale), the subject can blame DNA, the roulette of time, a stressful day or that moussaka at lunch. But photograph someone's living room and you are fooling with the stuff of pure ego, where the camera's unbiased eye may arouse more pure personal animosity than anything a portrait photographer ever encounters.

title: Nathan Resnick, 67, Head Of L.I.U. Art Department And Walt Whitman Expert
description: Nathan Resnick, a specialist on Walt Whitman and a longtime faculty member at Long Island University, died yesterday at Kingston (N.Y.) Hospital. He was 67 years old and a resident of Woodstock, N.Y.

title: Suspect in 37 L.I. Motel Burglaries Is Found Dead in His Apartment
description: A 47yearold former publishing executive who was arrested three weeks ago by the police in East Hampton, L.I., as a suspect in 37 motel burglaries, was found dead yesterday, apparently of a drug overdose, in his East Side Manhattan apartment, the police reported.

title: The Skunk at the Garden Party
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7Nobody wants to be a skunk at a garden party, said jobhungry Robert Bloom, explaining why his Comptroller's office concealed Bert Lance's shady past from Senator Ribicoff, who didn't want to know anything about it.

title: Giants Favor Youth, Pass Up Ramsey as No. 1 Quarterback
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.,Sept. 7Steve Ramsey was virtually ruled out today as the Giants starting quarterback as Coach John McVay indicated between lines at a news conference he would stick with youth.

title: Publicity About TaxClaim Talks Flusters Venezuela and Oilmen
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept. 7The Venezuelan Government and foreign oil representatives here have been embarrassed by a surge of publicity as they quietly attempted to work out settlements for hundreds of tax claims valued at $349 million.

title: PRIMARY DAY
description: Primary day is not a legal holiday. Government offices, schools, banks, libraries, stores and bars will operate as usual. There is also no change in Sanitation Department schedules or parking regulations.

title: Constitutionality of Death Penalty Is Tested in Top New York Court
description: ALBANY, Sept. 7The constitutionality of New York State's deathpenalty law was tested for the first time in an appellate court today, with two district attorneys and the State Atorney General defending it and attorneys for two men on death row challenging it..

title: Calvin W. Verity, 87, Dies; Former Armco Executive Was Also Bank Chairman
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio, Sept. 7Calvin W. Verity, 87, former general manager and a former director of the Armco Steel Corporation, died early today at his home in Middletown.

title: CHARLES E. HEINZERLING
description: Charles E. Heinzerling, a retired commercial artist, died Monday at a St. Petersburg, Fla., nursing home. He was 82 years old and a resident of St. Petersburg.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 1977

title: U.S. to Seek 92 Million Alaska Acres
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)Cecil D. Andrus, the Secretary of the Interior plans to ask Congress to preserve 92.8 million acres of land in Alaska for national parks, wildlife refuges, wild rivers and national forests, a move expected to set off a major environmental battle this fall.

title: Charlotte Mother Dies of Wounds From Labor Day Sniper Attack
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Sept. 7 (AP)A second person died today of gunshot wounds suffered in a Labor Day sniper attack by a white youth who took his own life after firing into a crowd of black picnickers.

title: Nancy Kissinger in Manila
description: MANILA, Sept. 7 (Reuters)Nancy Kissinger, wife of the former Secretary of State, flew here tonight on a threeday visit as a guest of Imelda Marcos, wife Ministry said that during her stay she would visit historical sites and other places of interest in Manila and that she of the Philippines President. The Foreign might also visit the nearby International Rice Research Institute.

title: Perry Street Reviving Emperor Jones
description: The Emperor Jones, O'Neill's 1920 Expressionistic drama, will be revived as the opening production of the second subscription season of the Perry Street Theater at 31 Perry Street. The play, which will have Rodney Hudson as Brutus Jones, the railway porter who becomes the ruler of an African tribe, will play Thursday through Sunday evenings at 8 o'clock from Sept. 15 through Oct. 2. All tickets are priced, at $2.50.

title: CORRECTION
description: A chart Tuesday on the metric system misstated the milekilometer conversion formula. It should have read 1 mile=1.609 kilometers and 1 kilometor=0.621 mile.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Better Crops and Reduced Exports Send Soybean Futures Prices Down
description: Futures prices of soybeans dropped about 10 cents a bushel yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade because of a sharp decline in the amount of beans inspected for export as well as improved crop conditions in the Middle West.

title: Photograph Center Sets Weegee Retrospective
description: Weegee the Famous, the first major retrospective of the work of the flamboyant press photographer whose real name was Arthur Fellig (18991968), will be held at the International Center of Photography (1130 Fifth Avenue) from Sept. 16 through Nov. 6. The show, organized by the center, was made possible by a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts. John Coplans was guest curator.

title: Lifelines for the Single Mother
description: AS a bartender, Carol Smith has heard her share of sad stories. As a divorced mother living in the city, she can tell a few of her own.

title: Ethiopians Break Ties With Somalia; Report AllOut War
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept 7 (UPI)Ethionia broke diplomatic relations with Somalia today and said its troops have launched allout war against the invading enemy in the Ogaden region.

title: Tiffany Net in Quarter Shows a Rise of 14.7%
description: Tiffany & Company reported yesterday that earnings in the second fiscal quarter ended July 31 gained 14.7 percent.

title: A New Daily Double: B (Belmont) and M (Meadowlands)
description: Cadillac Murray made the price $25 for the chauffeured ride from Belmont to the Meadowlands on Tuesday. 'It's opening night over in Jersey, and these are rich people we're talking about, he said, as he waited by the clubhouse gate for the ninth race to let out. I'm thinking maybe I'll get a full car; I got some people telling me they might be interested in burying some money in the Meadow Land.

title: West German Inflation Slows
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, Sept. 7 (UPI)West Germany's slackening inflationary spiral slowed down further in August, the Federal Statistics Office reported today.

title: Duryea Accuses Carey of Inaction On a Plan for the Stock Exchange
description: Assemblyman Perry B. Duryea yesterday accused Governor Carey of failing to move vigorously to retain the operations of the Stock Exchange in New York.

title: Goodman and Farber Pursue Separate Styles in Final Hours of Campaign for Republican Nomination
description: In the last hours of their campaign for the Republican mayoral nomination, State Senator Roy M. Goodman and Barry Farber. continued yesterday to pursue their separate styles, Mr. Goodman doggedly polling facts and figures from a manila folder, Mr. Farber invoking historical figures as examples of the kind of leadership needed to save New York.

title: A List of the Leaders At Treaty Ceremony
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7In addition to President Carter and Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos Herrea of Panama, the following reptesenatatives of Western Hemisphere countries attended the ceremonial signing of the Panama Canal treaties:

title: American Express Bids for Insurer
description: The American Express Company, in a merger move designed to bolster its earnings from insurance operations, offered yesterday to pay $230 million in preferred stock for all of the shares of the Philadelphia Life Insurance Cornpany$60 million higher than an earlier bid by Tenneco Inc., a widely diversified oil and gas company.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Officer Contradicts Woman's Testimony In Hearing on Cowan
description: NEW ROCHELLE. N.Y., Sept. 7A police officer tonight disputed the testimony of a woman who said that she had been threatened with a gun by a man who 18 months later shot and killed six people in a rampage at a local moving company here and then killed himself.

title: Argentina Lists Arrest of 5 Jews
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 7 (AP)The Argentine Army says that five members of a Jewish family who were reported kidnapped by 12 armed men 11 days ago in northern Argentina are under arrest on suspicion of having links with leftwing guerrillas.

title: Title Judo. Event Canceled Over Taiwan Visa Issue
description: LONDON, Sept. 7 (Reuters)The International Judo Federation canceled today the world championships scheduled for Barcelona, Spain, on Sept. 21 after hearing that the Taiwanese team had been unable to get visas, the federation president, Charles Palmer, said.

title: Waldheim Flies to Siberia
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 7 (UPI)Secretary General Kurt Waldheim of the United Nations flew to Irkutsk in Siberia today. Mr. Waldheim, who is making his first official visit to the Soviet Union in five years, was scheduled to return to Moscow Sunday and confer with the Soviet leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev on Monday.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 7Governor Byrne signed four children's rights bil is today, including one detailing new procedures for handling childabuse cases.

title: Solomon Is a Player With Time on His Side
description: The clock indicated that 40 minutes had elapsed since Harold Solomon and Dick Stockton began their quarterfinal match, and now Solomon had won the first set, 64. But seated at courtside, wearing a shirt with green stripes on the shoulders to match his son's, Leonard Solomon was unhappy.

title: Rev. Dr. Julius Mark Dies at 78; Former Temple EmanuEl Rabbi
description: The Rev. Dr. Julius Mark, a longtime national leader of Reform Judaism and retired senior rabbi of Temple EmanuEl, the largest Jewish congregation in the world, died early yesterday at his Park Avenue home after a long illness. He was 78 years old.

title: J. GILBERT HALL, 79; TENNIS STAR IN 30'S
description: J. Gilbert Hall, whose competitive tennis career spanned four decades and included seven consecutive national veterans singles championships, died yesterday in Columbia Presbyterian Hospital of a pulmonary infection. He was 79 years old.

title: Pilot With Marijuana Load Killed
description: GORMAN, Calif., Sept. 7 (UPI)A small twin  engine plane stuffed with 1,500 pounds of marijuana crashed 10 miles south of here yesterday as it approached a landing strip, killing the pilot, Michael Robert Clark, 28 years old, of Corvallis, Ore.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A program designed to detect the diversion of drugs from manufacturers to illegal uses was announced by state and Federal law enforcement officials.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Pavane, Faure; Thousand and One Nights,J. Strauss; 2 Songs Without Words, Hoist; Rondo Brillante in E flat, Mendelssohn; Preghiena from Mozartiana, Tchaikvosky.

title: BRITISH UNIONS AGREE TO ONE RAISE A YEAR
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Sept. 7Britain's labor unions voted by a substantial margin today to restrain wage demands and return the country to free collective bargaining after twoyears of formal controls.

title: Bridge:
description: A reputation for shrewd judgment can pay off at the bridge table as well as in wider spheres. It paid off for Gene Prosnitz of Brooklyn on the diagramed deal, and it may pay off for him in his bid today for the Democratic nomination for a Civil Court judgeship in Brooklyn.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: A Guide to Trees for the City
description: Trees for New York City is a pub lication about greening the city.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Sept. 7 (AP)The Ohio Racing Commission and the United States Trotting Association are conducting a joint investigation into racing irregularities at Northfield Park's harness track. Officials of both organizations confirmed today that they were involved in the inquiry centering primarily on a trifecta race July 27 at Northfield.

title: HOPES OF DEMOCRATS TED TO CARTER VISIT
description: ?RENTON, Sept. 7State Democratic leaders are hoping that President Carter's visit Saturday will bolster Governor Byrne's campaign for a second term, a campaign that some leaders say privately has been floundering.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Skies will be cloudy or partly cloudy today over the Eastern Seaboard. Showers and thunderstorms will be scattered from the Middle and South Atlantic States through the southern Appalachians and the Gulf States into eastern Texas. Other showers and thundershowers will develop from the central lake region into Iowa and the upper Mississippi Valley; showers are also forecast for Montana.

title: Books: Worth 200,000 Words
description: BALANCE, much sought after and difficult to achieve in annuals of any kind, is admirably attained in this handsome volume. The art, science and technique of photography are brought together with much the same finesse exercised by a fine chef in creating a great meal. Indeed, there is much food for thought in the outr directions and tremendous technological advances made in photography in the last few years.

title: Primary Candidates Get a Chance To Put Questions to Each Other
description: Locked into a boxlike television setting in a studio at WNET, Channel 13, the seven Democratic candidates for Mayor of New Yorkafter spending a long summer answering questionsgot the opportunity on election eve to question one another.

title: Excerpts From Comptroller's Report
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  Following is the text of a letter sent by John G. Heimann, the Comptroller of the Currency. to Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, chairman of the Senate Governmental Affairs Committee, and excerpts from supplemental report by the Comptroller on the affairs of Bert Lance, director of the office of Management and Budget.

title: Advertising
description: Although consumer prices rose only slightly in July and at a slower rate than in the preceding two months, all of Madison Avenues inflationfighting devices were already revved up and could not be stopped.

title: Situation in Other Cities
description: In Kansas City, Mo., the Superintendent of Schools and other public officials rode school buses on the first day of school yesterday to show support for peaceful implementation of a federally ordered desegregation plan. No disturbances were reported.

title: Woman Is Charged In F. A. L.N.B last
description: A 22yearold woman identified through a fingerprint found at the sits of the Aug. 3 bombing that killed one person and injured several others at the Mobil Oil Building in Manhattan was charged with the bombing yesterday. The bombing was one of a series of terrorist acts attributed to; a Puerto Rican nationalist group known as the F.A.L.M,

title: Dassault Is Reported Preparing To Take Over Major Paris Daily
description: PARIS, Sept. 7Marcel Dassault, the airplane manufacturer, is at the point of taking over the masscirculation afternoon newspaper FranceSoir, according to reliable sources here.

title: Design Notebook
description: LUGGAGE USED TO BE forever. It arrived almost of its own accord when people came of age, or got married, and it never went away again. To be seen with new luggage in middle life was thought of as pretentious and unbecoming. Luggage did not wear out, like shirts or shoelaces. It wore in, year by year.

title: O'NEILL SEES STRAIN ON KOREAN ALLIANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. told the House of Representatives today that a failure by South Korea to cooperate with the investigation into alleged influencebuying can only strain its relations with the United States.

title: Washington &Business
description: WASHINGTONWhen the Employee Retirement Income Security Act was enacted three years ago, one of its leading sponsors, Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York, called it the greatest development in the life of the American worker since Social Security.

title: ALICE CRIMMINS WINS PAROLE ON SECOND BID
description: Alice Crimmins, who was convicted in 1971 of the strangulation death of her 4yearold daughter after three years of highly publicized trials, was granted a parole yesterday after serving five years of a 5to20year sentence.

title: Our Irrelevant History
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.In a few days, college classes will begin again, and I am once more preparing new lectures on American history. For teachers this is always a time for selfscrutiny and selfdoubt, but this fall, as I begin my fourth decade of college teaching, I am even more troubled than usual in deciding what I ought to do in the classroom.

title: The Standings
description: Thursday. September 8, 1977

title: Public TV Foes Agree: We Don't Need a Law
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7  While conceding that the public broadcasting industry is beset with serious structural and philosophical problems, the leaders of noncommercial television told a Congressional committee today that their differences could be resolved through internal negotiations and that there was no need for legislative relief.

title: CHURCH GROUP SAYS F.B.I. INVADED IT IN HEARST CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (UPI)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation sent an agent into the Church of Scientology in 1974 to look for the kidnapped heiress, Patricia Hearst, and other members of the selfstyle Symbionese Liberation Army, officials of the religious group said today.

title: New Threat to Mine Peace Raised By Prospect of Health Fund Slash
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7 (AP)The prospect of further cutbacks in miners health and pension benefits raised a new threat today to the fragile peace reported in the Appalachian coal fields after a 10week wildcat strike.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended July 31 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock Is heeled en the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (0) 11counter.

title: House Narrowly Approves Budget Conforming to Requests of Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The House of Representatives gave its final approval today to a $459.5 billion budget that generally conformed to President Carter's spending request for the fiscal year beginning Oct. 1.

title: Utilities Push for Nuclear Power To Satisfy Energy Needs of State
description: NEWARK, Sept. 8New Jersey's two major public utilities said today that the expansion of nuclear power was the answer to the state's growing energy needs.

title: Major League Box Scores
description: FIRST GAME

title: Connors Routs Orantes, 62, 64, 63; Miss Wade and Gottfried Are. Defeated
description: Move over, world. Jimmy Connors is not ready to part with his United States Open tennis title just yet.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: To welcome New Yorkers back to the city and get them started on new season of indoor gardening, the Horticultural Society of New York, 128 West 58th Street, offers its Fall Flower Mart this weekend. Hours: 4 to 8 P.M. today, and noon to 8 P.M. tomorrow and Sunday. Growers from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut are trucking in their African violets, begonias, gesneriads, cacti, succulents, orchids, herbs and other species of indoor plants for this threeday sale. Horticulturalists will answer questions on the care of your new plants; and for additional information you can buy books on plants at a discount. The Horticultural Society will also hand out its fall calendar of events (workshops, seminars, trips) and sell apples and cider to give the atmosphere of a country fair. Information: 7570915.

title: The Pop Life
description: R11ROLL was born with whites imitating blacks, and that's by no means always bad. With all deference to the black roots of the music, rock has been built by too many talented whites for it to be dismissed as ripoff. That said, this observer has always harbored a prejudice against white blues singers. Certainly, everybody gets the blues, irrespective of race. Yet Delta and urbanelectric blues were such specifically black musical forms, so born of the inflections of black speech and black experience, that whites, almost always sounded artificial and imitative. Somehow the whites always seemed too well bred, too middle class, too slavishly devotional in their emulations.

title: Rehired Teacher, Back From Coast, Sums It Up: It's a Nice Feeling
description: A month ago Sheelia Malinowski was working parttime in an Oregon department store running the bridal registry. Yesterday she was doing what she had been trained to do, teaching second grade. She was one of more than 3,000 teachers rehired by New York City's Board of Education so far this fall.

title: Hot Year in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Texas., Sept. 8Fifteen months before the 1978 general election, Texas politics is boiling and bubbling in anticipation of one of the hottest political years ever, in a state that seldom has any other kind. From top to bottom, state offices and Federal, a real fruitbasketturnover seems possible.

title: Cautious Optimism on Course of Economy
description: The key annual test for the nation's economy is beginning, with the distortions of the summer, created by vacations, plant shutdowns and various other factors, largely over. A new auto year has just begun, and the general retail business has enterea The its normally bussiest season. The size of the harvest is Economic better, and prospects on scene the inflation front have become clearer.

title: F.B.I. Nominee Is Doing Fine
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Frank M. Johnson Jr., the Montgomery, Ala.,Feleral judge who is President Carter's choice to head the Federal Bureau of Investigation, was reported in satisfactory condition today at Methodist Hospital. Mr. Johnson underwent surgery Aug. 26 for an aneurysm, or balloonlike swelling, on his abdominal aorta. He's doing fine, said a hospital spokesman.Recovery is going exactly as it's supposed to. There are no complications at all.

title: Publishing: At Work in the Edmund Wilson Industry
description: THE EDMUND WILSON industry is assured for the rest of this decade. There will be letters, criticism, reissues of his works and even television programs based upon his views of the American scene.

title: No Way to Run a Railroad
description: When the Government created Amtrak, its purpose was to save the railroads from a vicious cycle of fewer passengers, reduced service, lower revenue, higher fares andinevitablystill. fewer passengers. Now, six years later, this quasipublic enterprise announces its program for the immediate future: reduced service and higher fares.

title: How the Voter Survey Was Taken Yesterday
description: The New York Tunes/Channel 2 News (WCBSTV) survey is based on interviews with a random sampling of voters as they left the polls yesterday. Fifty election districts throughout the city, including districts in each of the five borouelis were sampled.

title: refugees Find Haven and Grief Among the Thais
description: the small fithing boat carrying 44 Vietnamese refugees pulled ash ore just on the Thai side of the coastal border with Cambodia, its passengers were too hawy to be on a friendly shore, too seasick, hungry and thirsty after three days and nights on rough seas and too preoccupied with their 17 children to object when armed officials in civilian clothes came aboard and took all the bags in which they had stowed their belongings.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed In order of post positions.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In some editions of The Times yesterday, a front page headline on an article about Bert Lance said the budget director Received $3.5 Million Loans at Allied Bank. The phrase allied bank referred to the bank in Georgia with which Mr. Lance's Calhoun, Ga., bank had a correspondent relationship, and not to Allied Bank International, an international bank with headquarters in. New York. Allied Bank International had no connection with any of Mr. Lance's banking. or operations.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor.

title: At Least Five Incumbents Defeated In Contests for City Council Seats
description: Insurgent Democratic candidates for City Council seats defeated at least five Incumbents in yesterday's balloting, but more than 20 other incumbents survived lrimary challenges.

title: Graham Sees Hungarian Official
description: BUDAPEST, Hungary, Sept. 8 (Reuters) Billy Graham today had an unscheduled meeting with the Hungarian Deputy Prime Minister, Gyoergy Aczel. It was the American evangelist's highestlevel contact with the Government during his mission here. Dr. Graham said Hungarian churchstate relations were discussed.

title: Artists and Artisans Show Off Wares
description: Recognizing that the sprawling, sculptured plaza of Lincoln Center could be used for more than promenading or picturetaking, a group of artists and artisans will convert it today through Sunday into a huge exhibition mall for their talents.

title: Raider Defense May Offer Rams a Rush to Judgment on Namath
description: Joe Nemeth will get his last ultimate preseason test tonight when he starts at quarterback for the Los Angeles Rams against the Oakland Raiders, no less, at the Los Angeles Coliseum.

title: Truck Drivers Continue Strike As Talks Break Down in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8 (AP)  Striking drivers of the city of Detroit's 1,300 heavy trucks, ranging from garbage vehicles to those supplying gasoline to police cars, remained on strike today after breaking off contract talks. Supervisory personnel were transporting enough gasoline for police, fire and other emergency units.

title: Moluccans Battle Dutch Police
description: ASSEN, The Netherlands, Sept. 8 (AP)Gangs of South Moluccans set fire to two schools and wounded a policeman with a.burst of gunfire today in this town, where eight Moluccans are on trial for hijacking a train and seizing a school last May.

title: Television
description: 6:30(2)Stunmer Semester (7)Listen and Learn (11)The Little Rascals (5)Your Future IsNoW (4)Faces of Aging

title: Diet Suggestions for Women Who BreastFeed
description: For a woman concerned about the possibility that her breast milk is or will be contaminated; there are steps to take, although their effectiveness and necessity is still being debated. Food is the major source of such contaminants as DDT and PCB's, and modifying the diet is the major recommendation of La Leche League and the Environmental Defense Fund.

title: Klan Challenges Busing
description: TAMPA, Fla., Sept. 8 (UPI)Thirtytour Lakeland, Fla., parents, led by Robert A. Shelton, the Imperial Wizard of the United Klans of America, god writs of habeas corpus in a Federal District Court yesterday, contending that thtlr children were unwilling hostages of courtordered school busing.

title: SONY TO INTRODUCE 3HOUR VIDEO TAPE
description: The Sony Corporation announced yesterday that it planned to begin selling next spring a threehour video tape cassette for use with a new home television recorder, now limited to two hours, that carries a suggested list price of $1,300.

title: NEW ISKAELI SEI TTLEMENTS IN WEST BANK REPORTED
description: Who reported last weekend that he d a plan to settle two million Jews occupied Arab lands was quoted today having said several new settlements d been started secretly in the West nk in the last month.

title: Broadway
description: FOR THOSE balletomanes who think Judith Jamison is the only dancer in town, those bigband buffs who think Cab Calloway the only bopper in town and those theater people who think Billy Wilson is the only director in town, there is The Only World in Town, a large and lavish musical revue coming to the stage this year under Mr. Wilson's direction, with Mr. Calloway in a starring role and Miss Jamison making her debut in the Broadway theater. Robert Colby and Ramon Getzov, the songwriters who most recently produced Kennedy's Children, will produce the allblack show, which will go into rehearsals November and is scheduled to open in New York, after the usual Philadelphia and Washington runs, in the middle of March.

title: Brock Asks Congress to Uphold His Requirement for Air Bags
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Transportation Secretary Brock Adams urged Congress today to uphold his ruling that cars built after 1981 must have air bags or autrmiatic safety belts.

title: Restaurants
description: NO TYPE OF COOKING leaves less margin for error than that done in a typical steakhouse. The quality of the ingredients and the skill with which they are prepared cannot be corrected or disguised by spicedup sauces and attentiondistracting garnishes. With such stringent requirements it is not too surprising that there are very few truly firstrate restaurants for broiled steaks, chops, fish and the variety of potatoes, onions and salads that make the classic menu. Of these, certainly one of the best is Christ Cella, a steakhouse that has enjoyed a completely justifiable reputation for excellence for the last 51

title: In memnriam
description: THOMPSONGeraldine Livingston, 3/2/ 727/1/47. When, Dearest, I but think of thee, Methinks all things that lovely be are present, and my soul delighted.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In some editions of The Times yesterday, a 1page headline on an article about Bert Lance said the budget director Received $3.5 Million Loans at Allied Bank. The phrase allied bank referred to the bank in Georgia with which Mr. Lance's CaltIoun, Ga., bank had a correspondent relationship, and not to Allied Bank International, an international bank with headquarters in New York. Allied Bank International had no connection with any of Mr. Lance's banking or lending operations.

title: Red Sox, Fisk Clout Blue Jays, 72
description: The history of the Boston Red Sox is filled with Hall of Famers at almost every position. Catcher is not one of them. But with every passing season, Carlton Fisk is writing his name into the Red Sox book of greats.

title: People and Business
description: Margeret Thatcher, leader of the Consrevative opposition in the British Parliament, told a lunchtime gathering yesterday in New York that the top priority of the Conserative Party, if it comes to power in Britain's next election, would be to reduce the nation's direct tax rates.

title: IMPORTS OF CRUDE IN WEEK UP 500,000 BARRELS A DAY
description: Crude oil imports for the week ended Sept. 2 rose to 6.8 million barrels a day from 6.3 million, barrels daily in the preceding week, according to the latest weekly supply statistics released by the American Petroleum Institute.

title: Princess Souvanna Phouma Dies; Divorced Wife of ExLaotian Chief
description: ST.11RE, France, Sept. 8 (UPI)  Princess Souvanna Phouma, divorced wife of the former prime minister of Laos, died of a heart attack yesterday, friends reported today. She was 64 years old.

title: POLL FINDS PRESIDENT HURT BY LANCE AFFAIR
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 8There are growing indications that the American public is dissatisfied with President Carter's handling of the Bert Lance affair and, perhaps coincidentally, increasingly critical of Mr. Carter's general performance in office.

title: Zero Mostel Is Dead at 62
description: Zero Mostel, the actor who became legend on Broadway with his poignant portrayal of the woebegone dairyman Tevye in Fiddler on the Roof, died of cardiac arrest last night at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital in PhilaI delphia. He was 62 years old.

title: The New York Times/Jack Mamie,
description: From San Felipe Santiago, demonstrated the art of bedspread weaving. Guadalupe Campos, from Santa Maria Rayon, carved chocolate beaters, hanging in foreground.

title: CARTER AND TRUDEAU AGREE ON A PIPELINE TO CARRY ALASKA GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  President Carter and Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada announced today that they had reached agreement on a pipeline to carry Alaskan natural gas across Canada to the continental United States.

title: Los Angeles Schools to Use the Rev. Jesse Jackson'sPlantoImprove Black Students Academic Efforts
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8The nation's second largest school system has voted to spend $402,818 on a controversial program developed by the Rev. Jesse Jackson that seeks to improve academic performance of poor black students through moral contract between students, parents and the school.

title: Palmer, Elder Tied With 65's In B.C. Open
description: ENDICOTT, N. Y., Sept. (UPI)Arnold Palmer and Lee Elder shot sixunderpar 65's today to tie for the lead after the first round of the $200,000 B.C. open golf tournament.

title: Milwaukee Attendance Ott
description: MILWAUKEE; Sept. 8 (UPI)There was more confusion, and another low attendance yesterday on the second day of school in this city.

description: A special city task force yesterday began restoration of the flooddamaged Brooklyn Academy of Music in time for the Brooklyn Philharmonia Orchestra's opening concert Oct. 15.

title: Housing Costs and Investment Values
description: The affordability of singlefamily housing in this country is of considerable concern to Wall Street as well as to the average American.

title: Panel Acts on Minimum Wage
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 8 (UPI)  The Senate Labor subcommittee unanimously.apProved legislation today that would raise the minimum wage to $2.65 an hour nest year and provide automatic increases in the future geared to the prevailing pay in manufacturing. A similar bill is awaiting House action and prospects. appear good for Passage of an increase in the minimum wage horn the present $2.35 an hour before the end at the year.

title: Witness Paying. a Price for Federal Protection
description: On the surface, it is a life many would envy: He lives a $100,000 home, drives a latemodel car, and runs multimilliondollar business.

title: Money Supply, After Pause, Grew in Late August..
description: After slowing modestly for two weeks, the growth of the nation's money supply reaccelerated in the last week of August, the Federal Reserve disclosed yesterday.

title: Mexicans, Trusting in Tradition, Take Herbs for Their Ailments
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 8  The herb salesman kept up his soft patter as he deftly scraped the skin off a huge radish. This is the part with the medicinal properties, he told a score of enchanted Mexicans surrounding his stand. You soak it in alcohol for two hours, then it's ready for use.

title: Imaginative Play: What Is the Role of the Adult?
description: A father we know tells of how he would come home from work, tired and irritable, and then force himself to spend the next hour with his daughter, is if he were a nursery school teacher. Let's play with the blocks, he'd say, or let's nlav with the trucks.

title: A Leading Journalist Quits British Labor
description: LONDON, Sept. 8A wellknown British politicial journalist and historian resigned publicly from the Labor Party today with the assertion that it had adopted a philosophy of corporatism similar to Mussolini's Fascism.

title: Prices of Stocks Fall Amid Fears Of Credit Moves
description: Stock prices tumbled yeaterday as the specter of another possible 1tightening move by the Federal Reserve loomed over Wall Street.

title: Government Barred From Changing Status of Some Missing in Vietnam to Killed in Action
description: A Federal District judge issued a ternfiomry restraining order Wednesday evening barring the Government from changing the status of some military personnel, now designated as missing in action in Vietnam, to killed in action.

title: What It's Really Like to Be a Harpist
description: A harp is six feet high and weighs 75 pounds. Being a harpist means having to lug this heavy, awkward instrument around or, more likely, having someone do it for you. It is worse than being a cellist or doublebass player, and when it comes to air travel, the results can be a nightmare. A typical instance was experienced recently by Heidi Lehwalder, the 11old harpist who will appear at Fisher Hall tonight on her own and as soloist with the New York Philharmonic as one of last season's winners of the Avery Fishes. Prize.

title: ALBANY MAYOR WINS BY A 11I MARGIN
description: Mayor Erastus Corning 2d of Albany yesterday reaffirmed his strength and that of the Democratic Party machine in the state's capital, smashing a primary challenge from State Senator Howard C. Nolan Jr. by nearly a 11one margin.

title: Figuring Out Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8President Carter is now risking his prestige on the defense of his personal friend, Bert Lance, and is in danger of losing both. The question is why? What explains this divisive distraction from his other larger objectives at home and abroad? This is what Washington would like to know.

title: Crane Terminating Offer for Chemetron
description: The Crane Company, fighting a losing battle for control of the Chemetron Corporation, withdrew yesterday its offer to pay stockholders $48 a shareor $115 millionfor 64 percent of the shares outstanding.

title: A Sentimental Tourney on the BMT
description: Thera will be a change at Jamaica, Queens, tomorrow night, and it involves trains, but not the Long Island Rail Road. Rather, the Transit Authortwill end service over Jamaica Avee, and the city will soon begin taking awn the BMT elevated structure that tas overshadowed that shopping thoroughfare for 60 years.

title: Hirsch Is Victor In Brooklyn Race For Assembly Seat
description: Samuel Hirsch, a 11old lawyer, was the apparent winner last night of the threeman race for the Democratic Party Assembly nomination in the 48th Assembly District in Brooklyn, the only primary for state office in the city.

title: Kuwait Weighing Possibility of Cut In the Price of Its Heavy Crude Oil
description: KUWAIT, Sept. 8 (Reuters)Kuwait studying the possibility of reducing the price of its heavy crude oil, which has been badly hit by lower prices charged for similar crudes produced elsewhere, senior oil official said today.

title: Aldo. Mario Ermini Dies at 72; A Retired Investment Banker
description: Aldo Mario Ermini, an investment banker who retired in 1975 from Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis Inc., died yesterday at the age of 72 in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He lived on Ginkgo Lane in Greenwich.

title: Leo K. Martus, 82, Represented Clients in the Theatrical Field
description: Lco K. Martus, a lawyer, died Wednesday in Mount Sinai Hospital, after a lingering illness. He lived at 131 East 93d Street and was 82 years old.

title: A Racial Dispute Flares at Forest Hills
description: Racial controversy further divided the West Side Tennis Club and the United States Tennis Association yesterday. The controversy was stirred by a West Side official opposed to the planned move of the United States Open tennis championships next year to Flushing Meadow Park.

title: U. S. Trade Support Promised at Manila To 5 Asian Nations
description: MANILA, Sept. 8The United States pledged to the fivenation Association of Southeast Asian Nations today that it would remain an Asian and Pacific power fully committed to the economic development of its friends in the region.

title: MEANT URGES HOUSE PANEL TO PUT TEETH IN LABOR LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 8 (UPI)George Meany, equating collective bargaining with democracy, asked Congress today to put teeth into a 11old Federal law designed to protect workers right to organize.

title: U.S. Sues New York State Police, Charging Bias In Hiring of Women and MinorityGroup Members
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The Department of Justice charged today in a civil suit that the New York State police had illegally discriminated against women, blacks, and persons with Spanish surnames and asked a Federal court to order tilt police to recruit and hire more trooperg from these groups in the future.

title: Advertising
description: Neither weather nor disappointment slows down the pace of client pitches on Madison Avenue; neither did the 11old shift in the Datsun account, which proved such a cliffhanger and so traumatic to the losing agencies.

title: Senate Defeats Bid to Curb Fuel Ties of Oil Companies
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 The Senate rejected today, by a vote of 62 to 30, a measure that would have prohibited major oil companies from acquiring any more of the nation's coal and uranium reserves.

title: Music: Ani Kavafian
description: AGAIN there was a fine turnout for the Avery Fisher Winners concert. Last night in Fisher Hall it was the turn of the violinist Ani Kavafian. This is the week, in case you missed the news, during which the four recipients of the Avery Fisher awards are appearing in the hall, playing solos and concertos.

title: Books: Philadelphia Maestro
description: STOKOWSKI. What does the name mean to this generation, and what is it likely to mean in the future? Although at the improbable age of 95 he continues to be active in British recording studios, the conductor's significance has long been clear. The flowing white mane, the muchphotographed hands, the aloof and imperious manner, Fantasia, the Philadelphia sound, the flagrant disregard for the letter of the score, all these no doubt will linger in the public's mind for a few years.

title: Storm Turns to Hurricane
description: MIAMI, Sept. 8 (AP)  A store in the open Atlantic turned into a hurricane today, but forecasters said it posed no immediate threat to land. Clara's winds were just barely hurricane strength at 75 miles an huur. At 9 P.M., the hurricane was about 240 miles northnorthwest of Bermuda.

title: WestBank Voices
description: RAMALLAH, IsraeliOccupied JordanThe prosperous Arab businessman sat quietly puffing away at his waterpipe in the garden of a comfortable home overlooking the lights of Jerusalem, a few miles away.

title: William Trotter Newbold Marries Elise G. Blagden
description: Elise Grace Blagden of Lakeville, Conn., widow of Augustus S. Blagden Jr. was married at noon yesterday to William Trotter Newbold of Philadelphia, a widower. Msgr. George Lewis Smith performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the home of Mrs. William Russell Grace, mother of the bride, in Old Westbury, L.I.

title: Convicted Mass Killer Accused Of Threat to Woman Friend
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)A convicted Mass killer ??? as the Mad Jersey Gunman was held today on charges of threatening the life of a woman friend.

title: TEACHER STRIKE HITS BRIDGEWATER REGION
description: A strike by more than 600 teacher in Bridgewater and Raritan yesterday forced officials to close 13 schools as labor disputes intensified in three other New Jersey school districts.

title: AWACS for Iran, Continued
description: The case for selling Iran the sophisticated and vastly expensive Airborne Warning and Control System (AWACS)distended Boeing 707's packed with radardoesn't seem much stronger than it did the last time the President submitted it to Congress for approval. He withdrew that requesta few weeks ago because of Congressional concern that the Iranians might not be able sufficiently to safeguard AWACS sensitive electronic equipment from falling into Soviet hands, and because of a danger that Iran might be tempted someday to take advantage of AWACS capability to control offensive military actions.

title: MORE WHITES PICKET OVER CHICAGO BUSING
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8A number of noisy pickets greeted black students arriving at schools in white neighborhoods today, on the second day of a new desegregation plan here, but a school boycott by white students that was largely successful yesterday on the racially tense Southwest Side dwindled sharply.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the minor mysteries in the world of professional bridge writing is the ability of Albert Dormer of London to do the work of three moderately conscientious writers while holding down a fulltime nonbridge job.

title: Borg Reported Set to Play
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Sept. 8 (UPI)Bjorn Borg, the world's topranked player, will play in the World Invitation Tennis Classic from Sept. 26 to Sept. 30, despite his recent injury, tournament officials said today. A strained shoulder forced Borg to drop out of the United States Open this week. The World tourney will be played at the Sea Pines Racquet Club.

title: Tax Reform: How Not to Be a Sucker
description: Every spring, millions of Americans seek professional help with their tax returns, believing that Form 1040 and its attendant schedules are too intricate for an ordinary citizen. The nation pays a price for that belief. The expense is not the issue; it is, after all, deductible. What dismaying is that so universal an act of citizenship has become so complicated. What is even more dismaying is that this complexity has become an invitation cynicism. Many taxpayers have come to believe that only with professional assistance can they seize on all possible technicalities, pay the least taxand avoid being sucker.

title: 2 Get Jail Terms in South Africa For Silence on a Black Activist
description: BLOEMFONTEIN, South Africa, Sept 8 (Reuters)A woman journalist and the wife of an exiled antiapartheid worker have been sentenced to a year's imprisonment for refusing to give evidence 2.11 case against a banned black activisit.
