description: (In bushels, 000 omitted)

title: BEILENSON IS WINNER IN WHITE PLAINS RACE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 8Roger N. Beilenson, a lawyer who had never run for office before, defeated Michael Keating, a former White Plains Mayor, for the Democratic nomination for Mayor tonight by 112 votes. Mr. Keating conceded the election about an hour after the polls closed and said that despite the closeness of the vote he would not seek a recount.

title: Art: Late Matisses In a Capital Show
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  No painter of the 20th century is more admired today than Henri Matisse, and no phase of Matisse's long and influential career now commands a more excited response than the extraordinary pictures this great artist produced in his old age. The socalled cutout pictures that Matisse created when he was over 70, and physically ailing, are indeed one of the legends of modern painting, and yet until now they have remained for the public at least  one of the least familiar aspects of his magnificent oeuvre.

title: BRITAIN'S PAYMENTS GAP LARGER THAN EXPECTED
description: LONDON, Sept. 8, (Reuters)Britain's balance of payments deficit for the first half of this year was about $1.15 billion, a figure higher than anticipated, Government statistics showed today.

title: Soviet Centenarians Say It's Diet, Work and Family Not Yogurt
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R.A few years ago, pizzled patriarch in Soviet Aberbaijan looking forward to his 167th birthday was asked how he had managed to live so long.

title: States Oppose a Tax Treaty Clause They Say Favors Multinationals
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 8Several states carried to the Treasury and the White House today their protest that a provision of a pending tax treaty with Britain would make it more difficult for some states to collect all of the income owed them by multinational corporations.

title: Management
description: When I started in this business 10 years ago, the books on management I read advised that I could become chairman of a company if I stuck to it, said Roger M. Kenny. This is false. It's a timeworn adage.

title: Pop: Johnny Desmond at the Grill
description: When Johnny Desmond was singing with Glenn Miller's Army Air Forces Band during World War II and was being publicized as the Creamer, he seemed destined to challenge the popularity of such newly arrived singing stars as Frank Sinatra and Perry Como When he returned to civilian life. As events have turned out, Mr. Desmond has had a successful career as both an actor and a singer on television and in the musical theater, but he has never approached the kind of idolatry that Mr. Sinatra and Mr. Como achieved.

title: New Face: George Guidall
description: George Guidall likes to descibe himself as an 18year overnight success. The man who is captivating audiences as the star of the Quaigh Theater's revival of Elmer Rice's 1atLaw had worked through nearly two decades of repertory, touring companies, stock and soap operas before stumbling over a part that could bring him recognition.

title: South African Police Fire Shots To Break Up Soweto Demonstration
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 8The police fired rifle and pistal shots today to break up crowds of black students stoning police cars and setting up roadblocks during school boycott protests in the black community of Soweto, outside Johannesburg.

title: Met Opera Musicians Reject Final Offer on 3Year Contract
description: The Metropolitan Opera Company yesterday made what it called a firm, final offer on a new contract for musicians, but union representatives rejected it last night. Both parties, however, agreed to meet again this morning.

title: Chemical Contamination of Breast Milk Is Viewed With Concern
description: Discovery of contamination of human breast milk with dangerous chemicals ,uch as DDT and PCBs has raised questions about the wisdom of 1feeding, particularly for women living in certain parts of the country.

title: Mornion Leader Is Out of Hospital
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 8. (AP)The president of the Mormon Church, Spencer W. Kimball, was released from a Hospital here yesterday after, being treated for nausea and breathing difficulties. A spokesman said that the 11old M. Kimball was recovered from his illness, which struck during a church board of education meeting yesterday, but said he did not know when Mr. Kimball would return to work.

title: Counterfeiting Indictment on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8 (UPI)  A Federal grand jury has indicted three men on charges of counterfeiting $7 million worth of $20 and $50 bills and planning to distribute them in Mexico. Named in the three count indictment yesterday were Steven Bolack Blash Sr., 53 years old, of San Diego, Elvin Baker, 60, also of San Diego, and Robert Samuel Lewis, 54, of Panorama City. Theq were arrested Aug. 23 by Secret Service agents at a print shop in Los Alamitos, Calif. An agent said the raid occurred before the bills were passed to the public.

title: 40 New Cases of Cholera in Syria
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Sept. 8 (Reuters)More than 40 new cases of cholera have been reported in Syria during the last 24 hours in an epidemic that has already taken the lives, of 61 Syrians this summer. The Syrian Ministry of Health said 32 of the new cases were in Damascus and Aleppo. Cholera has also struck Jordan and Lebanon, but they have not reported any deaths.

title: Bergen Protests 1287 Extension, Asserting Road Would SrIrt a Park
description: HACKENSACK. Sept. 8The Bergen County Government has joined a chorus of protest against an extension of Interstate Route 287 because the proposed sixlane highway would skirt the entire eastern edge of a large, wooded, countyowned park.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)The Marine Corps ordered a suspension today of lowlevel flights by its Harrier attack aircraft after a series of accidents that have killed several pilots since 1971.

The synod, established after Vatican Council II, 196265, will review the subject of church teaching.

description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 8The South Korean Government made it clear today that it would not accede to the American demand for an early return of Tongsun Park to the United States.

title: Screen: Bunuers Mexican Western
description: IN HIS MANY YEARS of filmmaking for the commercial Mexican market, which he embraced without condescension, Luis BuiWel turned out just about every kind of movie there is, with the possible exception of the animated cartoon. He adapted classic novelsWuthering Heights and The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe. He made screwball comedies (The Great Madcap), films of social consciousness (Los Olvidados), socalled women's pictures (La Hija del Engello) and The River and Death, something that might qualify as Buftuels Mexican western, though like so many of his commercial films, it twists a genre to suit his view of things.

description: Well, at least now we, know who owns New York: the Philadelphia Phillies, who overpowered the Diets again yesterday, 82, before 3,186 lonecustomers and 53,000 empty seats Stadium.

description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Sept. 8  Billy Farrell of the Stanwich Golf Club in Greenwich, Conn., and Tom Joyce of the Ridgeway Country Club, White Plains, birdied the final two holes today and won the twoday $14,000 Metropolitan Professional Golfers Association propro tournament at Kutsher's Country Club. Their score was 166132.

title: Sutton Supporters Link Loss to Beatne Running Again and Vote Delay
description: Mayor Beame's decision to run for reelection and Governor Carey's insistence on a September primary were viewed by supporters of Percy E. Sutton the Manhattan Borough President, as basic reasons for his defeat in the mayoral race, a loss that leaves the city without black on the New York City Board of Estimate for the first time in almost auarter of a century.

title: COMPTROLLER TERMS OVERDRAFTS BY LANCE ABUSE OF BANK POST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8John G. Heimann, the Comptroller of the Currency, said today that Bert Lance and his family abused their influential positions in a Georgia bank by overdrawing their accounts to enhance their personal Rain.

title: Winner in Madison RapeCase Vote
description: MADISON, Wis., Sept. 8  Moria Mackert Krueger became a lawyer beckuse she believed that if they chose in they could make some differences.Woman in the News Yesterday she defeated Judge Archie Simonson and four other candidates for Dane County judge, leading Woman by 8,809 votes out of A total of 77,907 cast. The judicial in the recall election, Wisconsin's News first, stemmed from Mr.

title: Inflation Rose 0.4% During July In Big Western Industrial Nations
description: PARIS, Sept. 8(Reuters)Inflation in the major Western industrial nations rose 0.4 percent in July after a 0.6 percent increase in June, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development announced today.

title: Sapporo Shows Interest In 84 Winter Olympics
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8 (UPI)A Sapporo municipal assembly committee decided unanimously today to invite the International Olympic Committee (I.O.C) to stage the 1984 Winter Olympics in that city.

title: Letters
description: To WEEKEND: For what it's worth I thought I would put pen to paper, my subject being reflections on reading Mimi Sheraton's food review of The Ballroom [Weekend, Sept. 2].

title: PAKISTAN ATOM DEAL AFFIRMED BY FRANCE
description: PARIS, Sept. 8France today gave seemingly irrevocable pledge to proceed with the controversial sale of a nuclear fuel reprocessing plant to Pakistan, move many countries fear might enable that poor, populous and politically unstable nation to acquire atomic weapons.

title: At 77, Florida's Pepper, a New Deal Veteran, Is Still Going Like 38
description: WASHINGTON. Sept 8Representative Claude Denson Pepper suspects that if he were cast in a role on a television show, he would be depicted as a doddering, toothless old man. Claude Pepper was anything but doddering and toothless today as he celebrated his 77th birthday by conducting a House committee hearing into age stereotyping on television.

title: Memorial Hall Opens Today
description: PEKING, Sept. 8 (Agence FrancePresse) China has begun paying tribute to the memory of Mao Tsetung with the official inauguration of his Memorial Hall in Peking scheduled for the first anniversary of his death tomorrow.

title: Dollar Registers Gains in Europe, Gold Is Up 50c
description: The dollar improved against most currencies in foreign exchange dealings yesterday. Gold dropped 50 cents or more an ounce in the major bullion trading centers, The Associated Press reported

title: Eve and Griffin in a Close Contest In Primary for Mayor of Buffalo
description: State Assemblyman Arthur 0. Eve and State Senator James D. Griffin were all but tied for the Democratic mayoral nomination in Buffalo early today with 95 percent of the vote counted.

title: UGANDANS SAY MIN REMAINS IN A COMA
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 8 (Reuters)President Idi Amin of Uganda, still in a coma after undergoing surgery yesterday, was taken by helicopter tonight from Kampala to a special hospital on Lake Victoria, according to Uganda officials.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday, Sept 8, 1977 Petition Flied by:

title: For Children
description: THE INVISIBLE MAN (1933; 71 minutes), with Claud* Rains and Voris Stuart, noon, Saturday, at Films for Young People, at The Museum of Modem Art, 11 West and Sheet. Museum admission, 75 cents for children; $2 for adults, Includes movies. 9567078.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Senator Joseph L. Galiber pleaded not guilty to conspiring to defraud the Federal Government in a realestate deal in which a Bronx building was allegedly bought for $75,000 and then sold within hours for $350,000 to an antidrug agency.

title: Vaudeville Recalled In Marsh Sketches
description: Reginald Marsh's Huber's Museum at the Public Library at Lincoln Center One's curiosity about Marsh and the American theater is well satisfiedREGINALD MARSH was as lucky in the timing of his career as he was in the nature of his talents. When he began his professional life in the early 1920's there was still a market for what was then called the artist's impression'the quick sketch in pen or pencil that could go straight into a newspaper and have the immediacy of a news photograph.

title: Truck Leak Shuts Delaware Span
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Sept. 8 (UPI)The Delaware Memorial Bridge was closed for three hours last night after a truck loaded with a flammable chemical developed a leak. Four children were treated after they were overcome by carbon monoxide during the tieup. Eleven New Castle County fire companies brought the situation under control shortly after 11 P.M. The firemen moved the truck to a sandpit where the chemical was unloaded.

title: Slam Is Back, Fit As a Bass Fiddle
description: Last February, Slain Stewart, the bassist whO added a new dimension to the musical potential of the bull fiddle by humming in unison while he bowed, had a heart attack, followed by stroke. He was in the hospital for six weeks. But by July he was in France, playing at the Grande Parade du Jazz in Nice, and this weekend and next he is at Hopper's, Avenue of the Americas at 11 th Street, the first time he has appeared in a New York club in more than 30 years.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: IT IS the somewhat ambiguous distinction of Bennett Cerf to have portrayed himself exactly in these reminiscences. I say ambiguous because the problem with Bennett Cerf was that if you looked at him too closely you were likely to miss the true point of him. If you looked too closely you might see nothing but the clown in himthe atrocious punster, the gameshow panelist, the purveyor of showbiz celebrity, the man who fashioned of himself a caricature consisting solely of his spectacles, his pipe and his horselaugh. In person, he seemed to trivialize himself so extremely that he all but obscured his true accomplishment, which was to have been a founder of the publishing firm of Random House and to help build it into a vital commercial force in American letters.

title: Boyle's 2d Murder Trial Is Set For Wednesday in Media, Pa.
description: MEDIA, Pa., Sept. 8 (UPI)The retrial of W. A. Boyle, the former United Miners Workers president accused of arranging the murder of his union rival, Joseph A. Yablonski, will begin next Wednesday in the same courtroom where he was convicted In 1974.

title: Prefontaine Wins 4th In a Row at Belmont
description: Aaron U. Jones's Prefontaine continued to show a liking for Belmont Park as he won the $25,000 Dotted Swiss Purse yesterday, before 14,967 fans. It was his fourth victory in four races at the track.

title: PAKISTAN ATOM DEAL AFFIRMED BY FRANCE
description: PARIS, Sept. 8France today gave seemingly irrevocable pledge to proceed with the controversial sale of a nuclear fuel reprocessing plant to Pakistan, move many countries fear might enable that poor, populous and politically unstable nation to acquire atomic weapons.

title: Drinking Women Found To Risk Sickly Babies
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Women who drink heavily are twice as likely to bear sickly or abnormal, babies than are women who use liquor moderately or not at all, researchers say.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Federal officials have started computerized program in New Jersey to find government employees who are cheating on welfare. The United States Attorney, Jonathan L. Goldstein, said authorities had started using computers to match Federal, state, county and local government employees against list of New Jersey's foodstamp recipients.

title: Dr. Edgar E. Robinson Dies at 90; Professor of History at Stanford
description: Dr. Edgar E. Robinson, who founded the Stanford University Institute of American History to upgrade teaching of the subject at the nation's schools and colleges, died at Palo Alto, Calif., Wednesday after a brief illness. He was 90 years old and had been retired since 1952.

title: Reserve Report
description: WEDNESDAY FIGURES

title: H.EW.BIDS GOVERNORS AID WELFARE CHANGE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, asked the nation's governors today to help the Administration push its welfare legislation through Congress.

title: Rivers's Drag Bunt Helps Yanks Pull Out 43 Victory
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 8The Yankees, who have played an intergral part in baseball history, made some history on a personal level tonight as they edged the Cleveland Indians, 43.

title: Arthur M. Loew, 79, Former Head of Movie Empire
description: Arthur M. Loew, who headed and greatly expanded the international division of Loew's Inc. for more than three decades, died Tuesday night of cancer at his home in Glen Cove, L.I. He was 79 years old.

title: Islander Seats on Sale
description: Tickets for the first half of the New York Islander home hockey season go on sale today at the Nassau Coliseum box office in Uniondale, LI., and at all Ticketron outlets. New York Ranger tickets may be purchased at Madison Square Garden and through Ticketron beginning next Friday.

title: Armand Hammer Gets Olympic Coin Rights
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8The Soviet Union has granted an American and a French company the rights to distribute the commemorative coins and medals for the 1980 Moscow Olympics throughout the world.

title: Murdoch Delay Expected
description: Don Murdoch's Toronto attorney, Grant Kerr, said yesterday that court proceedings against the New York Ranger player on charges of possessing cocaine will be postponed for two years at a hearing to take place Monday in Brompton, Ontario. Hopefully the charges will be reduced nothing more than a misdemeanor by that time, Kerr said. They've charged him under a heavier section than they meant to. It's all been very embarrassing for them. Nothing's going to happen for another few years.

title: Witness Paying a Price for Federal Protection
description: At the age of 55, Herman Goldfarb was obliged to start a new life.

title: Project Rebound Widens Effort to Help ExConvicts.
description: The twostory brick building looks almost abandoneda grimy facade, windows covered over, no sign outside. But the door is open, and a message says:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Associated Press GUNMAN SURRENDERS: An unidentified man emerges from house in Milwaukee misere he hid after shooting and wounding a newspaper carrier, apparently for no reason. In an ensuing shootout with police, he wounded two officers before tear gas forced him out of the house. A woman and a girl he held hostage were freed, unhurt.

title: 3 Companies Score a Pipeline Triumph
description: Casting themsleves in the role or underdogs, three little known companies in the United States and Canada have come up winners in President Carter's support of the transCanada natural gas pipeline.

title: Faculty Strikes Over Contract as C. W. Post Opens
description: GREENVALE, L.I., Sept. 8Teachers, counselors and librarians struck C. W. Post College today following a breakdown in contract negotiations over a demand by the faculty for a meaningful voice in running the college.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8In line with the'20;state's increasing attention to the advent of casino gambling in Atlantic City, the director of the Division of Alcohol Beverage Control issued directive today superseding the authority of the Board of Commissioners of Atlantic City to issue liquor licenses and ruled that all such applications or renewals had to be first approved by his office.

title: Carey's Support Haunted Cuomo From the Senate
description: It seemed to bother Mario Matthew Cuomo less and less in the weeks just preceding last night's primary.

title: Koch Stressed Getting Out of Pack
description: Early in the race for the Democratic mayoral nomination, Edward Irving Koch, conceding that he was perhaps the least known of the announced candidates, said, If the election were held today. I would lose.

title: Donald Hatch Dead at 69; Architect Designed Work In Latin American Nations
description: Donald E. Hatch, a former New York City architect who worked extensively in Latin America, died on Monday in San Francisco, where he had practiced since 1959. He was 69 years old.

title: Jersey Education Official Warns Schools on Ignoring the Humanities
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)New Jersey's Education Commissioner, Fred G. Burke, says schools should not neglect the arts and, humanities in their desire to stress the basic or reading and arithmetic.

title: Pisarcik Not Likely to Play
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 8Joe Pisarcik's sore right arm, a result of a couple of Jet helmets in last Sunday's game, is sorer than previously announced, and Steve Ramsey is now expected to share the Giants quarterbacking duties with Jerry Golsteyn this Sunday against the Miami Dolphins.

title: STEIN BEATS WAGNER IN MANHATTAN RACE
description: Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein, narrowly beat City Councilman Robert.F Wagner Jr., son of the former Mayor, in yesterday's Democratic primary for Manhattan Borough President.

title: Associated Press
description: WHOSE GOODS THESE ARE I THINK I KNOW: O.K. so the baboons never read Robert Frost. At any rate, they put a bit of a chill on honeymoon plans of Mr. and Mrs.

title: Senate Passes Bill to Give Benefits To Some With Upgraded Discharges
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)  The Senate approved legislation today that would enable some Vietnam veterans'who receive upgraded discharges to receive veterans benefits.

title: 3,000 More Teachers Hired As New School Year Starts
description: With new lunch boxes in their hands, canvas knapsacks on their backs, much laughter and a few tears, 700,000 elementary and junior high school children in New York began a new school year yesterday with more time for classroom work and more teachers.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Preparatory committee for special session on disarmament10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: U.S. Leads Bermuda in Sail
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Sept. 8International Class skippers from Bermuda divided two races with rivals from the United States on Long Island Sound today, but the Americans held a 112 lead in the 111race sailing series for the 11old Amorita Cup.

title: Italian Treasures to Go On View at Columbia
description: An exhibition of Italian rare books, scores, drawings, coins and other treasures will.open Monday in the Rotunda of Low Memorial Library at Columbia University to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Casa Italiana. The Casa, housed in a Renaissancestyle structure at 117th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, is a center for the study and appreciation of Italian culture.

title: 2 REPUBLICANS CLOSE
description: Roy M. Goodman, the Republican organization candidate, won the party's nomination for Mayor of New York City last night.

title: Father of Berkowitz Seeking Role As Conservator of Son's Property
description: The father of David R. Berkowitz, the man accused of being the Son of Sam killer, has moved to become conservator of his son's property.

title: World News Briefs
description: LISBON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Time bombs demolished landreform centers in Lisbon and five southern towns today, destroying records of illegal land seizures by leftist farm workers and injuring five persons, including two children.

title: DEMOCRATS AWAITING VISITS BY PRESIDENT
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8The weatherman is forecasting rain, but Democratic leademare forecasting a turnout of thousands when President Carter enters New Jerseys political scene Saturday to campaign for Governor Byrne's reelection in November.

title: Public TV Assailed on Red Tape By Critics
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 8. Independeat television producers toad members of the House Communications Subcommittee today of their frustrations with public television's bureaucratic thicket in trying to get their programs on the air.

title: Curb on Automobile Imports Urged By Member of British Parliament
description: LONDON, Sept. 8 (AP)A member of Parliament today called for the Government to curb automobile imports, especially those coming from European affiliates of the four major Britishbased auto producers.

title: Blues,Weakfish Abundant OffJersey Coast
description: AREA AThere has been an abundance of blues and weakfish off the New Jersey coast, particularly at Ava,lon and Ocean City. The blues are in &the 111pound range and the weaks are averaging 6 pounds. Baby blues are being taken all along the Jersey shore with little lures. Night fishermen .at Ortlye Beach and Island Beach have been getting striped bass up to 27 ;pounds on plugs. In Hudson Canyon, offshore fishermen have been getting plenty of action with blue marlin, white marlin, yellowfin tuna and true alba,core. A 237pound swordfish was caught this week in Baltimore Canyon. There tare crokers in Great Egg Harbor Bay and at Surf City (for the first time since 1946).

title: Zero Mostel Dies of Heart Failure at 62
description: Zero Mostel, the elephantine actor who became a legend on Broadway with his poignant portrayal of the woebegotten dairyman Tevye in Fiddler on the Roof, died of cardiac arrest, last night at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 62 years old.

title: Guinea Frees 70 Prisoners
description: BAKAR, Senegal, Sept. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  President Ahmed Seicou Toure of Guinea has ordered the release of 70 prisoners, Guinea's official gazette received here said. The paper did not say when the 70 were jailed or why.

title: Mrs. Lambert Wins Surrogate Upset
description: Marie M. Lambert, a trial lawyer who waged a forceful campaign stressing her independence end the need for a woman on the Manhattan Surrogate's Court, yesterday upset Arthur E. Blyn for the Democratic nomination for that patronageladen post.

title: Liddy Says He Has No Remorse and Would Do a Similar Job if Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8On his first full day of freedom, G. Gordon Liddy invited some reporters in today to talk about prison conditions, and in the process was peppered with questions about Watergate.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MEXICAN CRAFTS DISPLAY: At an exhibition of Mexican arts and crafts yesterday at the Union Carbide Building at 270 Park Avenue, Elidia Ferrer, a weaver.

title: Labor Leaders Back Byrne for Reelection
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Labor leaders backing Governor Byrnes 1election campaign split today with the state A.F.L.C.I.O. president, Charles Maiciante, and asked union members to Support Mr. Byrne.

title: and a Yacht Race In the Harbor
description: It's being billed as the largest yacht race ever held in New York Harbor. But tomorrow's Battery Park City Governor's Cup Race also promises to be a visual feast as the sails of more than 100 racing yachts grace the waters from the mouth of the Hudson River to Gravesend Bay in Brooklyn.

title: Antiques
description: Ironically, most of today's nostalgia enthusiasts are too young to remember the collectibles they now ogle when these items were new. And that includes the preWorld War II comic bobks and the character toys they spawned.

title: Jets Looking For Answers Against Skins
description: Some of those questions the Jets are afraid to ask their coach may be answered tonight in Washington in the preseason finale, against the Redskins.

title: 40 Are Killed in Egypt As Train Jumps Rails
description: CAIRO, Sept. 8 (UPI)A speeding passenger tram whose locomotive crew ignored warnings to slow down went off the rails 220 miles south of Cairo today, trapping hundreds of passengers under overturned cars.

title: People in Sports
description: Jerry Tarkanian has been suspended as basketball coach by the University of NevadaLas Vegas, but he is fighting it. Donald Baepler, the university president, informed Tarkanian of the board of regent's decision on Wednesday. The suspension was recommended by the National Collegiate Athletic Association when it put the university on two years probation two weeks ago, charging a score of violations.

title: Lively Street Fairs To Turn Manhattan Into an Isle of Joy
description: ATER LABOR DAY, the city, oblivious to calendar designations, usually settles down to busy autumn routine. But this weekend, the summer mood will be sustained and, for those who were away, held over in the form of three ambitious street festivals.

title: Cowboys Crush Steelers, 300
description: IRVING, Tex., Sept. 8 (UPI) Efren Herrera kicked three field goals last night and a rejuvenated Dallas defense contained Pittsburgh's offense as the Cowboys routed the Steelers, 300, in the final preseason game for both clubs.

title: 2 Share Lead in England
description: OTTERSHAW, England, Sept. (Reuters)Mark James of Britain and Liam Higgins of Ireland shared a onestroke lead at 11par 144 after 36 holes of the $70,000 British Tournament Players golf championship. James had rounds of 71, 73 and Higgins had 73, 71.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Great Western United Corporation said in Dallas yesterday that planned to go ahead with its tender offer for shares of the Sunshine Mining Company as soon as practicable after Sept. 16.

title: RUNOFF SEEMS LIKELY
description: Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo and Representative Edward I. Koch narrowly led the Democratic mayoral primary with half the votes counted last night, but Mayor Beame was so close behind that the final outcome was in doubt.

title: PURCELL IS LEADER IN NASSAU ELECTION
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 8  Nassau County's Republican voters appeared tonight to have selected their party's regular candidate, Francis T. Purcell, over the incumbent, Ralph G. Caso, in the race for nomination for County Executive.

title: U.S. Books Sell at Moscow Fair
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8 (UPI)  The sound of cash register bells today came close to drowning out the controversy over censorship at the first Moscow International Book Fair.

title: Tangled, 7Way Race for Mayor Splinters the Clubhouse Loyalties
description: Yesterday's sevenway primary fight for Mayor on the Democratic line was a day of anguish at many of New York's Democratic clubs with strong reformist inclinations.

title: First Thoughts on the Primary
description: And now there are four candidates for Mayor of New York. More important, the Democratic field has dwindled from seven to two, and for ten short days attention will focus on their runoff.

title: Old Couple, Inseparable in Life, Die Within Hours of Each Other
description: With the man who had been her husband for 62 years at her bedside, 11old Cecile Kamholz Tischler died of a heart attack shortly before 9 o'clock Wednesday night at the DeWitt Nursing Home, 211 East 79th Street.

title: At the Movies
description: BLITTONEYED, about to burst into tears, the trembling, pigtailed refugee tugged the sleeve of a conspicuously expiring, modestly plump Orson Welles. That was 31 years ago, when Natalie Wood, the 11old daughter of a Russian set designer and ballet dancer, began her Hollywood career by stealing scenes from the unsuspecting Welles and a weepy Claudette Colbert in the immortally schmaltzy Tomorrow Is Forever.

title: Federal Limits Are Set on SterilityCausing Pesticide
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Three Federal agencies announced a joint action today to restrict the use of a widely used pesticide that has caused sterility among workers who produce it and may cause cancer among people exposed to it.

title: 8 Workmen Are Injured in Blast At a Metals Plant in Connecticut
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Sept. 8Eight workmen were injured here today, none of them seriously, in an explosion at a precious metals refining plant.

title: Elephants And Alligators On the Block
description: Among the 70 floats and figures from past Macy's parades that will be auctioned by Christie's at the Seventh Avenue Armory at 2 P.M. Oct. 2 are a 9foot elephant with ears that flap and a trunk that wags (it once transported Jimmy Durante); a 11long hippo in a pink beret, checked shirt and daisytrimmed pants; Alli, a wood, steel and fiber glass alligator (it's 45 feet long and comes mounted on jeep), and a bobbling Humpty Dumpty (the castle and castle wall are included).

title: Richard Wiley Resigns as Head of the F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Richard Wiley announced his resignation today as head of the Federal Communications Commission and said he would be leavine within the next month.

description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 8The South Korean Government made it clear today that it would not accede to the American demand for an early return of Tongsun Park to the United States.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Five New York State Congressmen and one each from New Jersey and Connecticut were named today to a special 29member House subcommittee to handle the Carter Administration's legislation on revising the welfare system.

title: Jury Gets Testimony on Alleged Effort to Bribe Judge
description: At the opening yesterday of the trial of a Florida lawyer accused of trying to bribe a Manhattan judge to lower the bail in a narcotics case, the jury was told that the judge had been given $4,900 in cash and was promised $10,000 more after fulfilling his part of the bargain.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Supreme Court Justice William J. Brennan Jr.today removed the legal hurdle he posed earlier in the week on construction of a gymnasium at Kent State University in Ohio.

title: ODonnell Still Seriously Ill
description: BOCTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Kenneth P. O'Donnell, 53 years old, an aide to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, remained in critical condition today at Beth Israel Hospital. The hospital has not released information about his ailment at the request of Mr. O'Donnell's family, but said today that he remains seriously ill.

title: CANAL TREATY FIGHT HEATS UP IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The battle over ratification of the Panama Canal treaties began in earnest on Capitol Hill today, involving both the Senate and the House and dramatizing sharp divisions on the issue among leaders of both turtles.

description: BONN, Sept. 8The West German police urged anew today that the terrorists who kidnapped a leading industrialist in Cologne on Monday agree to a 1between for negotiations.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: APPARENTLY exhausted over the new season, network executives have stitched together a crazy quilt of programming for this weekend. Several shows are live, and just about all of the new or returning series were unavailable for screening until the last possible minute before air time. Perhaps the cards are being held closer to the vest as the hands dealt by the studios become mom miserable.

title: Marshall Field Presidency Reported Offered to Arena
description: Marshall Field & Company, which has sought a new president since last April, has reportedly offered the post to Angelo Arena, now chairman of NeimanMarcus in Dallas.

title: News Summary
description: Representative Edward I. Koch and Mario Cuomo, New York's Secretary of State, led a field of seven Democratic contenders in New York City's mayoral primary and qualified for the Sept. 19 twoway runoff. Mayor Beame, running third, conceded shortly before 2 A.M. in a brief and sometimes emotional speech. Bella S. Abzug, wno had run fourth, conceded at about midnight. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: About Real Estate
description: In January 1975 Sheldon Solow, the builder, blew the whistle on his own construction project on Second Avenue. The foundation had gone in for what was to have been a 45story building with 301 apartments. The concrete men had gone so far as to pour the underside of the lobby. Then construction stopped. The whole atmosphere in the city was terrible. Mr. Solow said in an interview this week.

description: GRIFFITHRex. Memorial service Sunday, 12 noon, September 11, 1977 at Ave tar 8. cooks Funeral Home, Third Ave, at 15 St. N.Y.C.

title: New Films of apan Due in Series
description: A series of nine films from Japan, including The Gate of Youth, a threeand1half hour epic that played only to a private, limited audience in New York shortly after its 1975 release, will begin tonight at Japan House and continue for eight additional Friday evenings.

title: EXU.S.AIDE EXPECTED TO AIR LANCE CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8John Stokes, the former United States Attorney in Atlanta who in December terminated a Justice Department investigation into campaignrelated hank overdrafts of Bert Lance, then the directordesignate of the Office of Management and Budget, plans to charge at a news conference tomorrow that the investigation into Mr. Lance's financial background was improperly handled, an associate said today.

title: Joseph W. Golinkin, Retired Admiral Who Was an Accomplished L.I. Artist
description: Joseph Webster Golinkin, retired rear admiral of the Navy, died yesterday at the Glen Cove Community Hospital on Long Island. He was 80 years old and lived in Center &and, Oyster Bay, L.I.

title: CHINA GIVES DETAILS OF 74 ANTIMAO PLOT
description: TOKYO, Sept. 8 (AP)The late Defense Minister Lin Piao used warships, bombers and flame throwers in an attempt in 1971 to assassinate Mao Tsetung and seize power in China, a bureau that guarded Mao said today.

title: W aldheim, in Report On State of World, Sees Rising Anxiety
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 8Secretary General Kurt Waldheim said today in his annual state of the world message to the United Nations membership that 1977 was a year of growing anxiety for the international community.

title: Up for Auction, the Clowns and Fantasies of 50 Thanksgiving Parades
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.In an old Tootsie Roll factory on the Hoboken shore toil the roustabouts and vagabonds of world of wonderthe artisans who come from as far away as Texas and California every year to design and build Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade.

title: Notes on People
description: A 11old Canadian resoundingly broke the world record yesterday for nonstop, roundtrip swim in the English Channel, completing the trip in less than 20 hours. The swimmer, Cindy Nicholas, staggered ashore at Dover, England, at the end of the grueling swim and Audrey Scott, secretary of the Channel Swimming Association, announced that she is in very good shape she made it in a total of 19 hours and 55 minutes, which is 10 hours better than the previous fastest twoway crossing. Miss Nicholas, a student from Scarborough, Ontario, swam from Dover to the French coast in 8 hours and 58 minutes, turned around and returned to England. She became the first woman to complete a twoway nonstop crossing of the channel. The feat had been accomplished earlier by four men.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: M S KUNGSHOLM (Flagship Cruises). Left Bar Harbor Sept. 7; duet A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: This Sandman Will Keep Them Awake
description: I was born dancing, Sandman Sims says. He means it. He dances everywhere, whether walking down the street or driving his car. There have been days, he says, when he has to get off the subway because the rhythm of the wheels interferes with the rhythms going through his head.

title: Comptroller Says Lance Abused His Post at Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8John G. Heimann, the Comptroller of the Currency, said today that Bert Lance and his family abused their influential positions in Georgia bank by overdrawing their accounts to enhance their personal gain.

title: MUSE REJECTS MOVE TO REDUCE KOREA AID
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The House rejected today by a tight margin an amendment that would have cut off United States economic aid to South Korea.

title: Civil War in the Megalopolis
description: By sundown, New Jersey cars are creating traffic problems at the bridge and tunnel approaches to Manhattan. Most of the cars are heading for the midtown area, where New. York City's third dog track is about to stage its gala 1982 opening. The new gambling palace, built on landfill in the Hudson River, can't begin to compare in comfort to the onceprosperous Meadowlands track across the river in East Rutherford, N. J. It has no video Matrix board. no Dancing Waters display, no airconditioning, not evenSports of The Times

title: Two More City Brokerage Firms Join in Exodus to New Jersey
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 8 (AP)Two more brokerage firms will abandon New York City and set up operations in New Jersey, officials for the firm's said yesterday..

title: ORAL C. HILDEBRAND
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 8 (AP)Oral C. Hildebrand, whose 10year major league baseball career was highlighted by selection in 1933 to the American League team in the first allstar game, died at his home in suburban Southport yesterday. He was 70 years old.

title: CONSUMERS CONFIDENCE REPORTED UP IN AUGUST
description: Consumer confidence, as measured by a monthly survey conducted for the Conference Board, was slightly higher last month than in July. The board's Consumer Confidence 1170 equals 100reached 89.8 last month. This was up about a point from July.

title: Dollar Slips Against Yen But Is Generally Stronger In Trading on Continent
description: The dollar lost more ground to the Japanese yen in foreign exchange trading yesterday but gained against most other foreign currencies, the Associated Press reported.

title: Judge Clears Way for Building Of Garbage Baler in Hackensack
description: NEWARK, Sept 9 (AP)A Federal judge has cleared the way for the construction of a 1,000tonaday garbage baler in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Energy Chief Says Federal Panel Neglects Interests of Consumers
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9Joel R. Jacobson, the State Energy Commissioner, described the Federal Power Commission as paper tiger today because, he said, bad neglected the interests of consumers and failed to assure the state of energy sources at a price it can afford to pay.

title: Copper Glut Is Forcing Producers To idle Mines in. Bid to Cut Costs
description: Faced with a veritable mountain of copper that has caused prices to tumble, the nation's producers have begun to idle their workers and mines in an attempt to cut costs and whittle inventories.

title: 25 Years Later It's Still, There She Is
description: MACON, Ga.  A few days ago I pulled up to the drivein window of a bank to cash a check and was mildly astonished when the teller blurted out, Oh, you're Neva Jane, aren't you?

title: U.S. JUDGE DECRIES RISE IN CIVIL SUITS, SLOWNESS AND COST
description: BUCK HILL FALLS, Pa., Sept. 9  Warning that civil litigation has become so painfully slow, so prohibitively expensive and so widespread, Judge Irving R. Kaufman said today that Federal courts faced two choices: reform or disaster.

title: Transcript of Beame's Concession
description: I'm sure you know that the vote is extremely close, but with 99 percent of the vote in, it appears that I should offer my congratulations to Ed Koch and Mario Cuomo.

description: The company of The Merchant was. still in shock yesterday over the sudden death Thursday of Zero Mostel, its star.

title: Morgan 132 Leads Golf; Palmer Is 2d
description: ENDICOTT, N.Y., Sept. 9 (UPI)Gil Morgan overcame blustery winds today and shot a sixunderpar 65 today as he took a twostroke lead after two rounds of the $200,000 B.C. open.

title: Stein Says Let Him Dream as W agner Vows to Fight on Liberal Line
description: City Councilman Robert F. Wagner Jr., who finished a close second to State Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein in Thursday's Democratic primary for Manhattan Borough President, insisted yesterday that the battle was not yet over.

title: People in Sports
description: Fifty years after the Four Musketeers of French tennis began a run of six straight years in which Fratice'won the Daivs Cup, the four players were honored yesterday in Paris.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An Associated Press caption on photograph that appeared in The Times on July 13and an article that accompanied the pictureincorrectly identified a demonstrator arrested at Kent State University on July 12 as Martin Scheuer, whose daughter was killed at Kent State in 1970. The person pictured was Albert Canfora, whose son was wounded on the same occasion.

title: Briiishh Pay Accord:Decisive Vote, Unclear Outlook
description: BLACKPOOL, England, Sept. 9This year's longawaited convention of Britain's union leadership slogged to an end here today, the last agenda item a vote of thanks to the press that,, many speakers had complained, tends to pay too much attention to Britain's industrial disputes.

title: New York Times/George Tames
description: Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, right, talking before the start of yesterday's Washington hearing. Others are, front left John G. Heimann, Comptroller of the Currency, and Senators William V. Roth Jr. and Charles H. Percy.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Dorothy Dunbar Bromley in her Aug. 29 letter objects to the calling of constitutional convention for the purpose of recommending to the states for ratification an amendment to the United States Constitution to protect the unborn. She quotes two professors who express opinions in opposition to a constitutional convention as her principal authority for this opposition.

title: 9 Days for a Shift in Strategy
description: In just nine days, the length of New York City's minicampaign for the Democratic mayoral primary runoff, Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo and Representative Edward I. Koch will have to shift political gears and, attempt to broader News their bases by appealing tc the 559,000 Democrats whc Analysis did not vote for them Thurs. day. Neither side seemed sure yesterday how it was going to do this, although some shifting leftward seemed likely since liberals are a substantial bloc in a Democratic primary and since both candidates, judging by the constituencies who voted for them Thursday, appealed most to moderates and conservatives.

description: Amid talk of Russian interest in buying American grain as well as heavy buying in wheat and corn futures, prices of those commodities rose sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

description: When it comes to thoroughbred racing does money talk even if it helps competitor's cash register ring?

description: Roy M. Goodman yesterday challenged his three opponents in the New York mayoral race to discuss campaign issues in six televised debates.

title: The Standings
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES New York 2, Toronto 0.

title: Blacks Urge Carter to Back Affirmative Action
description: A group of black leaders called upon President Carter yesterday to put his Administration on record as favoring affirmative action programs when it discloses its position on a major civil rights case pending before the United States Supreme Court.

title: F.C.C. IS QUERYING COMSAT ON STATUS OF ESCROW FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)The Communications Satellite Corporation said today the Federal Communications Commission is asking Comsat to say whether it is keeping an escrow account properly pending the outcome of a court appeal of an F.C.C. decision involving Comsat's rates.

title: Tentative Pact Reached to End Detroit's 3Day Garbage Strike
description: DETROIT, Sept. 9 (AP) A tentative contract settlement was reached today in Detroit's threedayold garbage strike, teamsters union officials said.

title: WOMEN, MINORITIES GAIN IN CITY COUNCIL
description: Women, blacks and Puerto Ricans will be more heavily represented in the City Council next Jan. 1 than at any time in the past as a result of Democratic primary victories in Thursday's election.

title: !RULING IN TENNESSEE HITS LOAN COMPANIES
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Sept. 9 (UPI)Two major smallloan companies today announced cutbacks in branch operations in Tennessee and the state's largest bank, said it would reduce consumer loans by 75 percent because of a Tennessee Supreme Court decision barring interest rates over 10 percent.

title: Wendy Turnbull's Dream Come True
description: A woman with crimson lips anct attired in a haute couture gypsy dress slunk through the scribbling crowd of journalists around Wendy Turnbull and stuck her face inches from the tennis player's. Startled, Miss Turnbull turned to stare at her.

title: I.R.S. Describes Halt to Earlier Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9Affidavits in an Internal Revenue Service investigation released today indicate that Bert Lance's banking problems disappeared into a bureaucratic haze between the time he was nominated and the time he was confirmed as Director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Baby Rescued From Her Father
description: Jorge Monsalve, beset by financial difficultirs, climbed atop a construction canopy opposite Chicago's Cook County Building with his eightmonthold daughter, Carmen, and threatened to throw her to the street. Police and fire officials managed to calm him enough to surround him and seize the baby unharmed. Mr. Monsalve was taken for psychiatric examination.

title: Rising Joblessness Bewilders Young Blacks
description: Sitting around on a bench, waiting for the welfare check, watching TV, running back and forth to the liquor store. Got to be something better than that, said Davida Williams, 17 years old, black, a high school dropout from BedfordStuyvesant in Brooklyn. She is looking for a iob.

title: About Newyork
description: The state of American politics is bit clearer on election night at the Kanawha Democratic Club in East Harlem. where Frank G. Rossetti sweats out votes to survive and Richard M. Nixon sweats out memoir money on the TV set that drones over in the clubhouse corner at the convergence of two walls of timewarped momentoes.

title: U.S. Beats Bermuda For Amorita Cup
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Sept. 9  The United States completed a successful defense of the Amorita Cup today, defeating Bermuda on Long Island Sound, 2628.

title: JOHN WUMMER, FLUTIST; PLAYED UNDER TOSCANINI
description: John Wummer, a retired flutist, died of cancer in a hospital in San Francisco last Tuesday. He was 78 years old and made his home in New York.

title: Congressman Is Out and Campaigning in Brooklyn After 3 Hours Sleep
description: At 7:30 yesterday morning, having caught barely three hours of sleep, Edward I. Koch, blearyeyed and wearylooking but freshly showered, was walking up and down the platform of an elevated subway station in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn urging commuters to vote for himagain.

title: World News Briefs
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Sept. 8 (Reuters)The Turkish Government sharply increased the prices of basic goods and services today in an effort to bail the country out of an economic crisis.

title: 3Hitter Backed by Johnson's Homer
description: The leading participant in what is the only clime race left m the major leagues, the Yankees, have no time to laugh at rookieladen, expansion clubs like the Toronto Blue Jays.That may have been all right early in the season altho ugh it cost them when they lost four of the eight games with Toronto in April and June.

title: Suitcases Full of Whoopee
description: During my recent Korean visit called upon Whoopee Bag Blak, whose generous cash donations to Congressmen over the years have made him notorious figure in Washington. Blakbag Whoopee, to give him the Americanized name by which all Washington knew him in those days, had been neighbor of mine for several years in the nation's capital, and I found him hurt and astonished at the allegations now being leveled against him.

title: ENERGY BILL CALLING FOR SWITCH TO COAL PASSES AMID DOUBTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9  The first portion of the President's energy programthat dealing with coal conversionhas now cleared both Houses of Congress but there is uncertainty over whether it will do what it is supposed to do.

title: Five Killed in Jet Explosion
description: SANFORD, N.C., Sept. 9 (AP)Three officers of a Michigan construction ccern and two other persons were killed last night when their business jet exploded and crashed shortly after takeoff here, the authorities said. The dead were identified as the plane's owner, Henry George, 51 years old, and his wife, Effie, of Dryden, Mich.; Phillip Nester, 47, of Elkhart, Ind.; Leroy Southerland, 61, of Flint, Mich., and the pilot, Jimmy Taylor, 35, of Flint. Mr. George was chairman of the board of Champion Home Builders of Dryden, and Mr. Nester and Mr. Southerland were executives of the concern.

title: TRIAL OF MOLUCCANS COMPLETED BY DUTCH
description: ASSEN, The Netherlands, Sept. 9After several days of tension and intermittent violence, a trial ended today for eight Moluccans involved in the June seizure of a train and elementary school that left six terrorists and two hostages dead.

title: Patents
description: A Swiss inventor will receive a patent next week for a deck chair with a parasol, both of which fold into a small carrying bag. Page 35.

title: Three Persons Die, 12 Firemen Injured In East Side Blaze
description: A woman and two men were killed, dozen firemen were injured and four tenants were plucked to safety from fireescape balconies early yesterday when a fire believed set by an arsonist ravaged part of a sixstory tenement on the Lower East Side.

title: $4592 BILLION BUDGET APPROVED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)The Senate approved a 1978 Federal budget of; $459.2 billion today after rejecting Republican efforts to make room for an acrosstheboard tax cut.

title: ExU.S. Attorney Charges Report On Lance Case Was Concealed
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 9A former United States Attorney charged today that some officials of the Carter Administration had concealed a long Federal report on Bert Lance's background from the Senate committee that approved his nomination to be director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Dow Drops 11.09 as Fears On Interest Rates Persist
description: Investor fears that interest rates would climb shortly persisted yesterday, sending stock prices spiraling downward in the biggest singleday break in six weeks.

title: New Plague Case in New Mexico
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Sept. 9 (UPI)A 6yearold boy has contracted bubonic plague, the state's chief medical officer, Dr. Johnathan Mann, said yesterday. The child, the seventh bubonic plague victim in New Mexico this year, was placed in an Albuquerque hospital. He is a pretty sick kid but I can't call his condition serious, Dr. Mann said, because of a quick diagnosis by his doctor.

title: Brezhnev Confers With Burger
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 9Leonid I. Brezhnev today received Chief Justice Warren E. Burger for a conversation dominated by Mr. Brezhnev's criticism of the Carter Administration's stand on strategic arms limitation.

title: Many Call Medical Report Hoax
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 9A belief was growing here today among diplomats and other experienced Uganda watchers that the reports of President Amin's health constituted another hoax.

title: Senator Hints 3 Checks Were Backdated
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9New problems for Bert Lance arose today when Senator Charles H. Percy suggested that the budget director may have backdated $196,426 worth of checks this year in order to improperly take a tax deduction for last year.

title: Associated Press
description: NAVY'S MATERNITY DRESS: The winter blue, left, and service dress blue uniforms designed for pregnant women officers and enlisted women have been approved by the Navy. Prior to August, 1975, pregnant women in the military services had been dismissed. Subsequently they have had to wear civilian clothing when their regular uniforms no longer fit.

title: O'Dwyer and Senator Bellamy Girding for Runoff
description: The two surviving candidates for the Democratic nomination for City Council President had mostly nice words for each other on the first day of their runoff campaign yesterday. But one was bouyant; the other more guarded.

title: ESSEX COLLEGE PRESIDENT WON'T SEEK A NEW TERM
description: NEWARK, Sept. 9 (AP)Essex County College's president, J. Harry Smith, the first black college president in New Jersey, says he will not seek another term when his contract expires next June.

title: U.S. Restricts Import of Horses From 3 Nations. Citing Disease
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)The Department of Agriculture Friday announced a temporary ban on direct imports of most horses from Britain, Ireland and France because of an outbreak of contagious breeding disease, equine metritis.

title: Britain Is Awarded Ford Engine Plant In Stiff Competition
description: LONDON, Sept. 9The Ford Motor Company announced today that it would build a $435 million engine plant in southern Wales. The Government hailed the decision as a mark of confidence in Britain.

title: Elderly Motorist Kills 2 People And Injures 21 at Nursing Home;
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 9 (AP)A car driven by an 81yearold man crashed into a group picnicking on the back lawn of a nursing home today, killing two persons and injuring 21 others, the police said.

title: ISRAELIS DENY REPORT OF NEW SETTLEMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The State Department said today that Israel had assured the United States that despite an Israeli press report to the contrary, it has not begun any new Jewish settlements in occupied Arab land.

title: Folger Unit of P.&G. Cuts Prices of Coffee
description: The Folger Coffee Company of Cincinnati, a Procter & Gamble division, has reduced the wholesale price on vacuumpacked coffee by 10 cents pound, to $3.38, effective immediately, it announced yesterday.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: UV Industries, which reported about a week ago that it held nearly 500,000 shares, or 16 percent, of the stock in GlobeUnion, the auto battery makerdisclosed yesterday that it had no present intention to take over the company.

title: Commodity Mart Still Trading Shouts Along With Commodities
description: They were going bananas over potatoes down at the Commodities Exchange Center this week, but that was nothing compared to the scene at orange juice.

title: U.S DEFIES A.F.L.C.I.O, AND APPROVES VISIT BY SOVIET UNIONISTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9In a break with a policy of long standing, the Carter Administration decided today to allow four Soviet trade union representatives to visit the United States, despite the opposition of the A.F.L.C.I.O:

title: Students Seeking Reassignments Crowd Into School Headquarters
description: Hundreds of teenagers and their parents lined up yesterday at the Board of Education headquarters in Brooklyn for what has become an annual event: the reshuffling of students to schools other than those to which they had been assignedf.

title: NATIONS ADOPT PLAN TO CONTAIN DESERTS
description: NAIROBI, Sept. 9The United Nations conference on desertification adopted today a wideranging plan of action for combating the creation and spread of deserts, and established a special account in the United Nations to collect donations to pay for the plan.

title: Frederick W. I. Lundy Of Seafood Restaurant In Sheepshead Bay, 82
description: Frederick William Irving Lundy, founder and owner of the seafood restaurant bearing his name, at 1901 Emmons Avenue, in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn, died Tuesday at his apartment at that address after long illness. He was 82 years old.

title: Senator Hints 3 Checks Were Backdated
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9New problems for Bert Lance arose today when Senator Charles H. Percy suggested that the budget director may have backdated $196,426 worth of checks this year in order to improperly take a tax deduction for last year.

title: REGISTRATION AT THE POLLS OFF HOUSE AGENDA FOR 77
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. said today that the House would not act this year on a proposed program to let voters register at the polls on Election Day, the key feature in President Carter's election revision package.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TONES AND TEAMSThere is a rewarding cornucopia of vintage screen music over the weekend and into next week, some of it going back to the early days of the talkies in the exceptional array of Universal revivals now at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Motorists whose automobile insurance is up for renewal can demand that the company issue the new policy for the same length of time stated in the expiring one, the state's Insurance Commissioner, James. 1. Sheeran, said yesterday.

title: Ailing Prisoner Transferred.
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Sept. 9 (UPI)Bill L. Campbell, serving a prison term for embezzlement at a bank once headed by Bert Lance, has been moved from the Federal Penitentiary at Atlanta to the Federal. Correctional Institute here in Lexington.

title: Britain Offers BillionPound Issue Of Bonds to Absorb Foreign Cash
description: LONDON, Sept. 9 (AP)The Bank of England today announced a new bond ssue cf nearly $1.75 billion maturing in 1995 and paying interest of 12 percent annually.

title: More ExpenseAccount Padding Reportedly Found at Port Agency
description: Auditors have uncovered new cases of apparent expenseaccount padding by officials of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, sources close to the widening investigation reported yesterday.

title: City Opera Puts Brawls In Carmen
description: The New York City Opera's version of Bizet's Carmen, given its first performance of the season Thursday night, has had a big facelift at the hands of the company's new stage director, Cynthia Auerbach. The results are exceptionally lively, with some brawls that would do justice to an oldstyle western saloon fight.

title: Shirley Bassey's Slow Songs Prove to Be Vaguely Touching
description: Shirley Bassey returned to concert performing Thursday night at the Westchester Premiere Theater in Tarrytown, N.Y., after a fivemonth layoff. She will be appearing there through tomorrow and then again from Wednesday through Sept. 18. The theater was full except for the extreme side sections, and much of the crowd seemed to be in an adoring mood. That said, this reviewer finds himself at something of a loss as to what to add.

title: U.S. Military Analysts See Risks In Israel's Settlement Projects
description: United States and allied military analysts are concerned over Arab reaction to an expansion by Israel of settlements in occupied Arab territories, warning that this might result in an acceleration of military preparations and increased unity of Arab command.

title: Postal Service Reports A Deficit of $400 Million
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)The Postal Service said today that its deficit for the fiscal year ending Sept. 30 would be $400 million, a third of the loss of the previous fiscal year.

title: Chris Evert, a Shoulder Ailing,: And Miss Turnbull Gain Final
description: Chris Evert has a painful pinched nerve in her left shoulder. Her biorhythms are changing for the worse. And today she plays Wendy Turnbull in the women's singles final of the United States Open tennis championships.

title: 9 Days for a Shift in Strategy
description: In just nine days, the length of New York City's minicampaign for the Democratic mayoral primary runoff, Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo and Representative Edward I. Koch will have to shift political gears and attempt to broaden News their bases by appealing to the 559,000 Democrats who Analysis did not vote for them Thursday. Neither side seemed sure yesterday how it was going to do this, although some shifting leftward seemed likely since liberals are a substantial bloc in a Democratic primary and since both candidates, judging by the constituencies who voted for them Thursday, appealed most to moderates and conservatives.

title: SurrogateRace Upset Tied to Trend
description: Marie M. Lambert won her solid upset victory in the Democratic primary for Manhattan surrogate by waging a campaign that took advantage of the apparent trend toward women candidates below the top spot of the ticket in Thursday's voting.

title: U.S. AND PAKISTAN AGREE TO SWAP LOCKHEED DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)The United States and Pakistan agreed today to trade information about possibly illegal sales activities by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation and the Boeing Company in Pakistan.

title: Schlesinger Sees Akan Gas Line Costing Up to 37% Over Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)  The new natural gas pipeline from Alaska may cost $13 billion or $14 billion to build. a 37 nercent increase over the current estimate of $9.6 billion, Energy Secretary James R. Schlesinger predicted today.

title: Carter Moves to Bypass House In Transfer of Canal Properties
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9In its drive for Congressional approval of the new Panama Canal agreements, the Carter Administration has made a decision to bypass the House of Representatives in way that could cost it some support for the trea tipc.

description: NONREFILLABLE: A giant 520,000gallon fuel tank for the U.S. Space Shuttle being rolled out at the Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three men, who were allegedly involved in a shootout with security guards on Tillery Street in front of the Brooklyn Post Office during a holdup Aug. 27, have been indicted on charges of armed robbery of a postal employee and the seizure of property belonging to the United States.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: CUNARD PRINCESS(Cunard). Left Bermuda Sept. due 8 A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: Mets Loss Spurs Torre's Anger
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 9Even a patient man like Joe Torre couldn't grin or bear it after what happened to the Mets today in Wrigley Field.

title: MET AND MUSICIANS AGREE ON CONTRACT
description: The Metropolitan Opera Company and its musicians, after months of stormy bargaining, yesterday reached an agreement on a new threeyear contract, thus virtually assuring that the Met's 93d season will start on schedule next month.

title: People and Business
description: Hans Friderichs,the West German Finance Minister, ennounced yesterday in Bonn that he would resign to become head of the Dresdner Bank, one of West Germany's largest commercial banks. He will replace the late Jurgen Ponto, who was murdered by urban guerrillas in July.

title: 60 Officers Attend a Cops for Christ Rally
description: Cops for Christ came to New York yesthrday at noon and turned City Hall Park into a gospelsinging gathering of born again Christians. about 60 police otticersmany out of uniform and all members of the relatively new organizationalong with 100. wives and relatives and 100 lunchtime passersby clapped In rhythm as the'Rev. Ross Davi and his Gospel Singers sang Jesus Got aHold of My Life antl,'He Won't Let Go and Changes, the chorus of which went, Leaving all my emptiness behind.

title: Proposal for Job Security Is Weighed in Dock Talks,
description: Dockworkers and the North Atlantic shipping associations continued contract talks yesterday, discussing ways of improving a job security proposal made by the employers group.

title: Bridge:
description: A player who feels no responsibility whatever to his partner or his pocketbook can afford to bid with reckless abandon. If he does so, he will suffer a series of disasters interspersed with an occasional success that will make all the rest seem worthwhile.

title: Boy, 16, Backs Woman's Account In New Rochelle Police Inquiry
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. Sept. 9A sure prise witnessa 16yearold boyyesterday corroborated the testimony of woman who had said that Frederick W. Cowan threatened her with a rifle on the street where both had Iived some 18 months before he killed six persons and himself at a movingvan company here.

title: Other Winners, Other Losers
description: If 3,476 people who voted for Mario Cuomo had voted for the Mayor instead, it would be Abe Beame who'd be out on the streets now, battling Edward Koch in the Democratic mayoral runoff campaign. But they didn't, and so, by a hair, after 31 years in municipal affairs, the Mayor is a loser and Mr. Cuomo and Mr. Koch are winners.

title: BEGIN STIRS CONTROVERSY WITH PARDON FOR BANKER
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 9Prime Minister Menahem Begin became the center of a controversy this weekend after he recommended the presidential pardon of a banker who served two and a half years of a twelveyear sentence for Israel's biggest embezzlement.

title: Fashion Shows Pop Up All Over As Fall Puts Summer Behind It
description: Fashion, as most everybody knows, isnot simply silk and a seam. It's also astate of mind. A little hoopla doesn't hurt in establishing the proper mental climate. The drum beating for fall began almost the instant Labor Day signaled the end of summer. Fashion shows, big and small, covered a variety of clothes, conservative and advanced. Often they were sparked by the designer''s presence. Often the designer was from Europe, taking a close look at American fashion preferences, before finishing up his next collection.

title: Candidate Says Issues in Runoff Will Be Unmistakably Clear
description: In the next 10 days, Mario Cuomo said yesterday, the philosophical differences between him and his mayoral runoff opponent, Representative Edward I. Koch, will become so clear that Democratic voters will have no problem choosing between them.

title: MORTGAGE RATES REACHED 9.02% IN EARLY AUGUST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)Mortgage interest rates advanced again in August, but appear to have stabilized at about 9 percent, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today.

title: Railroad Freight Traffic Down 1.5% During the Latest Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The Association of American Railroadsreported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.1 billion tonmiles, 1.5 percent below a year ago. A compination of labor problems in the ironore industry had a depressing effect on total traffic.

title: The New York Times/Frank C. Dougherty
description: WITH THE GREATEST OF EASE: Eddie Green, top, riding on wing of the Black Baron, one of planes in the Air Show America Team, during special preview of this weekend's show at Solberg Airport in Readington. Troupe of daredevil pilots will perform today and tomorrow from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M.

title: Tokyo Greets Pele Brigade As Superstars
description: TOKYO, Sept. 9  Typhoon No. 9, packing.winds of more than 125 miles an hour, was bearing down on the Japanese islands today. But it is hard to believe That any winds could sweep this city the way Pete and the New York Cosmos have, even before their two exhibition games against Japanese teams.

title: And Now, a Few Words From the Emcee
description: In my role as master of ceremonies of the Miss America pageant for 23 years, I've been asked many questions by many interviewers about many aspects of the pageant: How has the pageant changed over the years? How much longer do I think that I will be the emcee of the pageant? Tell me some of the interesting or unusual events that have occurred in your years as emcee. And many other very unusual questions.

title: Political Gains Cited at Opening of Women's Caucus
description: SAN JOSE, Calit., Sept. sMore than 1,000 women pledged to the goal of enlarging the political power of women began a threeday meeting here today amid an atmosphere of optimism for their cause. They cheered the news that more and more women were being elected to public office, jeered reports of bias in government, and /hunderously encouraged passage of the Equal Rights Amendment.

title: Zero Mostel Dies of Heart Failure at 62; Star of riddler'WasTrying Out New
description: Zero Mostel, the actor wno oecame legend on Broadway with his poignant portrayal of the woebegone dairyman Tevye in Fiddler on the Roof, died of cardiac arrest Thursday night at Thomas Jefferson University Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 62 years old.

The Russians were invited by a ChiPipbased organization known as Trrde Union for Action and Democracy. ey will arrive Tuesday and will (spend twoweeks visiting Chicago, Delimit, Cleveland, Pittsburgh and New York. title: Death of South African Black At Police Station Ruled Suicide
description: KIMBERLEY, South Africa, Sept. 9 (AP) A magistrate ruled today that a black Iman who plunged to his death from sixthfloor window of a police station July 7 committed suicide.

title: 2 More in Congress Bid Lance Step Down
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 9 (UPI)  Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d, Democrat of Illinois, called today for the resignation. of Budget Director Bert Lance, terming the controversy an impediment to the Carter Admnistration.

title: The City Under the Manhole Covers
description: When that water main broke and flooded the Brooklyn Academy of Music last week it left sodden costumes, soaked sets, and $1 million worth of damage. It was also a muddy reminder of the city's antique infrastructurethe world of pipes and conduits that make up New York's underground life support systems. The Academy, BAM, is a 19thcentury landmark that has been painstakingly restored in recent years to become a lively focus of the city's culture. It will need all the help that it On get now, from all its friends, to open its scheduled fall season. Eighteen feet of dirty water was not part of the scenario.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONA deck chair with parasol, both of which fold into a small carrying bag, has won its inventor, Eduard Rohr of Magenwil. Switzerland, Patent 4,047,752, which will be issued next week.

title: Personal Investing
description: Crime has always paidana pats handsomelyfor Pinkerton's Inc. and other suppliers or protection. Thanks partly to rising crime rates, Pinkerton's sales in the last five years have expanded to $214.4 million from $162.2 million while earnings have risen to $2.90 from $1.98 a share.

title: Beame Says City Will Not Drift In Last Months of His Mayoralty
description: Declaring that he would not be sitting around between now and Jan. 1 as a lame duck, Mayor Beame yesterday exhorted his commissioners to continue their work in progress and not let city government drift as it awaited the leadership of a new Mayor.

title: Plan to Streamline Administration of House Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)Recom mendations to streamline the administra. tion of the House are considered likely to win approval on the floor following their approval yesterday by the House Commission on Administrative Review.

title: Black Activist Confounds Experts In Upset in Buffalo Mayoral Race
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 9Assemblyman Arthur 0. Eve, a militant civilrights leader who had never been given more than an outside chance to win, confounded both pollsters and political experts by winning the Democratic primary here yesterday to become the first black ever nominated for Mayor of Buffalo by either nartv.

title: Black Heads Jersey Legion
description: WILDWOOD, N. J., Sept. 9 (AP)Eugene Howell of Hackensack was elected today as the state commander of the New Jersey American Legion. He is the first black man to head the 75,000member organization. Margaret Malone of Trenton today became the first woman elected to the post of state vice commander.

title: PARK BARS A RETURN; ASSAILS PRESS OF U.S
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 9Tongsun Park, the South Korean businessman charged with illegal lobbying in the United States, said today that he had no intention of immediately returning to Washineton.

title: News Summary
description: Breaking a longstanding policy,the Carter Administration will allow four Soviet trade unionists to visit the United States despite the opposition of the strongly antiCommunist A.F.L.C.I.O. The Russians were invited by a Chicagobased organization known as Trade Union for Action and Democracy. They will arrive Tuesday and will spend two weeks visiting Chicago, Detroit, Cleveland, Pittsburgh and New York. [Page 1, Column 3.]

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (Reuters)The United States has proposed $398 million in military sales to seven countries, including Britain, Israel and Pakistan, the Pantnann cam indav.

title: Taiwan Economic Growth Up 9%
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Sept. 9 (Reuters) Taiwan's economic growth was about nine percent during the first half of 1977 and per capita income rose by more than seven percent, a cabinet report said today.

title: Skins Beat jets, 14 to 7; Caster Hurt
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9  The Jets drive toward respectability narrowly missed a successful preseason finale tonight as the Redskins set up two touchdowns with pass interceptions and won. 147.

title: Mariana Niculescu a Hit in Debut
description: For people who go regularly to concerts and operas, the debut that turns unexpectedly into a triumph is one of the rarer pleasures. To see a heretofore unknown artist start out confidently into a performance, to hear a new individuality and artistry fill out the lines of a work familiar in other interpretations and, above all, to know the excitement that comes with encountering something really superiorall of this can be heady indeed.
