description: Barbara Helene Pelley of Washington and George Harold Harder 3d of Alexandria, Va., were married yesterday in Christ Episcopal Church in Alexandria by the Rev. John Skain FrancisMason.

title: Janacek's Burst Of Brilliance Captured on Disk
description: On Saturday night the San Francisco Opera will present a new production of Leos Janacek's Katya Kabanova, a work regaded in many quarters as the composer's masterpiece and one pf this century's most significant contributions to the lyric theater. For Janacek Aficionados unable to see this Katya onstage, London has thoughtfully released a recording of the opera on two Itlisks starring the same soprano of San Francisco's production, Elisabeth Shderstrom. The performance, the first recording of a Janacek opera to be made outside of Czechoslovakia, is nothing short of a revelation and should win many more friends for this deeply movand beautiful score.

title: News Summary
description: Exports of technology to China may foltow theeasing ofrestrictions on the sale abroad of some Americamdefenserelated equipment by Defense Secretary Harold Brown. The transfer of technical design and manufacturing skillsas distinct from end productiwill be restricted, however. The Secretary's decision mentioned no country by name, but it was interpreted by specialists within and outside the Government as a signal that the United Stites Would act favorably on the sale of some military products sought by the Chinese. !Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: Weddings
description: Patil Caton and Lou Marini were married on Sept. 6, 1977 and reception followed at the Windows of the World Restaurant, World Trade Center. They will reside In New York.

title: Deaths
description: ARMANDEdna (nee Colligan). Beloved wife of the late Frank. Devoted mother of John. Loving grandmother of Patricia Ann and Jeanne Marie. Dear sister of John Cattigan. Reposing at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave el 81 St, Saturday and Sunday 24 and 79PM. Funeral mass Monday 10AM al St John The Martyr Church, 250 East 72 St.

title: Last Week They Met and Did So
description: DETROITWhen the nation's governors get beyond the fact that it sounds a bit tacky, and beyond noble arguments like your problems are our problems, they express their regionalism in a very straightforward American way. They talk about money.

title: Ruth H. Raser Is Betrothed To Carey Harding Timbrell
description: Mr., and Mrs. George Bernard Raser of Pembroke, Me., and New York; have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ruth Hubbard Raser, to Carey Harding Timbrell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clayton C. Timbrell of Tenafly, N. J. and Blue Hill, Me. The wedding is planned for Nov. 19.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Fifty years ago Reuben left Bridgeport, Conn. where his former wife and three chiklren were living. He told none of them where he was Boring

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: On Overbuilding And Provincialism

title: TRAEL TRAVEL TRAVEL TRAVEL
description: TRAEL TRAVEL TRAVEL TRAVEL

title: DOUBLES RESULTS WOMEN'S SEMIFINAL ROUND
description: Martina Navratilova, United States, and Betty Stove, the Netherlands, defeated Kerry Reid, Australia, and Kristien Shaw, United States, 64, 64.

title: SHOP TALK
description: KENT ANYONE who believes the pioneering spirit is a thing of the past should consider Olga Kennedy and her husband John. When they started their married life he was a doctor in general practice in Bloomfield, a small town outside Hartford where they remained for seven years. Now, seven children, 23 years and many public healthadvisory posts later, they live in Africa, in Zaire.

title: Heavy Floods Strike Central Burma
description: RANGOON, Burma, Sept. 10 (Reuters)Some of the worst floods in a century have struck central Burma, taking at least three lives and leaving 3,000 people homeless. One of the most seriously affected areas was around the town of Myingyan.

title: Chris Evert holding a rose presented to her after she won women's title in U.S. Open at Forest Hills. At right, Jimmy Connors defeating Corrado Barazzutti in semifinal match yesterday.
description: Forget Wimbledon. Chris Evert is still the queen of women's tennis, as she again showed yesterday by winning a third consecutive United States Open singles title.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: IT could easily be argued that of all the sports written about in this country baseball has inspired the best writing. The period of the 1910's and 1920's was a golden age, with such press box literati as Grantland Rice, Heywood Broun, John Kieran, Damon Runyon and Ring Lardner, all of whom went on to wider literary attainments.

title: ART
description: EAST HAMPTON THE Hamptons have exerted a special attraction for artists because they are picturesque and serene and have a distinct landscape and people. Painters, sculptors and photographers of all types flock to this area of the Island's South Shore, more because of the seductive environment than because of a shared esthetic or ideological purpose.

title: Mental IllsPlea for Help
description: THIS is the age of public concern for the battered. We agonize over battered children, battered wives and other abused women, battered animals and even a battered environment. Tens of thousands of us display our commitment to the elimination of these social horrors by financial support, picketing, protest marches and sitins, and by filing public interest lawsuits.

title: Some Institutions Are at the Breaking Point Over Theology and Practice
description: Under the influence of several comparatively new religious impulses, a number of realignments are taking shape both within American church bodies and across denominational lines. The results of any might extensively change the face of the nation's institutional religion.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The United States Railway Association completed its main task when it created Conrail out of six bankrupt railroads last year. But the agency, in the style of Washington, may well develop a life of its own.

title: Miss Yapdell, Klaus Rother, Banker, Wed
description: The marriage of Christine Yandell of New York, an interior designer, to W. Klaus H. Rother, an assistant vicepresident of the Crocker International Bank, took place yesterday morning at the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church. The cerem..ny was perfonne I by the Rev. Dr. Bryant M. Kirkland A reception was treat itt the Plaza.

title: Club Out as Backup
description: The 1978 United States Open tennis championships will not held at the West Side Tennis Club if the new facility in Flushing Meadow Park is not completed on time, W. E. (Slew) Hester Jr., president of the United States Tennis Association, said yesterday.

title: MANILA IS CONFIDENT ON U.S. ROLE IN ASIA
description: MANILA, Sept. 10  Foreign Secretary Carlos P. Romulo, speaking on behalf of the five members of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, declared himself fully satisfied that the United States would remain present in this region in a manner that will be helpful.

title: Open Season on Trouble
description: Down With Drink

title: HOW WOMEN ARE FARING AT WEST POINT AND ANNAPOLIS
description: The Air Force Academy, the United States Military Academy at West Point, and the United States Naval Academy at Annapolis admitted women last year for the first time. While the dropout rate at the Army and Navy service schools was higher than the Air Force's, the female students who remained performed admirably.

title: CAPTAIN GREY
description: Thisis a robust pirate adventure with a neat twist. Instead of piling his raggletaggle hand abuard a standard pirate ship, Avi has his crew living as a Free Nation on the wild, uninhabited coast of New Jersey (this is 1783, remember).

title: Joyce Nugent Is Married
description: Joyce Anne Nugent, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Collins Nugent of Morris Township, N.J., was married yesterday to Philip Lee Saffer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Leon Saffer of Jackson. Term. The Rev. George A. Vorsheim performed the ceremony in the Morris. Plains (N.J.) Presbyterian Church.

title: Today's Matches
description: 11 A.M.Women's Doubles Final: Betty StoveMartine Navratilova vs. Renee RichardsBettyann Stuart.

title: Rabbi Max D. Davidson, Is Dead in Perth Amboy; Led Rabbinical Assembly
description: Rabbi Max Davidson, rabbi emeritus of Congregation Beth Mordecai of Perth Amboy, N.J., and an important figure in ecumenical affairs, died Friday at his home in Perth Amboy. He was 78 years old.

title: Margaret Peck Is Married To Peter Anthony Iovino Jr.
description: Margaret Peck, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Edward Peck of Perrysburg, Ohio, was married in New York yesterday to Peter Anthony Iovino Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Iovino of Los Angeles. The Rev. Richard Cosnotti performed, the ceremony in the Brick Presbyterian Church.

title: TRENTON NOTEBOOK
description: THE quality of government in New Jersey is sometimes strained. Quite often, the people elected to run the government will discern that particular problems exist and will propose, debate and eventually effect solutions.

title: The New York Times/D. GerNo
description: FLAMING SAIL billowing in the wind, Wildfire crosses starting line of fourth annual Battery Park City Yacht, Raceformerly the Governor's Cup racearound New York Harbor. This year, 105 yachts 24 feet long or longer entered the competition in eight different divisions, making it largest racing event in the harbot.

title: GARDENING
description: REPTILES have made themselves disappointingly scarce in my garden this year. In late spring, I came upon a slender, 16inch garter snake with three longitudinal, yellowish stripes down its darkercolored body. In June, a wood or sculptured turtle and a box turtle came wandering around the garden in search of a suitable sunny site for egglaying. My garden has served as a hatchery for the eggs of these slowpaced reptiles for years.

title: How to Get There
description: To get to the White Memorial Foundation headquarters (5678217), take Route 202north from New Milford or south from Torrington. The entrance just off Route 202 between Bantam and Litchfield, and it is marked. The Litchfield Nature Center and Museum (5670015) is open Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M., all year except Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New tear's Day. It is also open Sundays, 2 to 5 P.M., from May through November.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor.

title: A Primer for Cooks
description: EVERYTHING you ever wanted to know about food and cooking will be taught in Connecticut this season, or so it seems. There is an astonishing range of programs, inchiding the cuisines of many countries, instruction in using food processors and crock pots, cooking to save money or calories, lavish party foods, simple breads and natural foods, cheese selection, how to perfect some classic techniques, pickling and preserving, and classes for children. Chinese is perhaps the most popular of the ethnic cuisines on the agenda.

title: NANTUCKET THEN AND NOW
description: What's most remarkable about Nantucket, Mass., as clear photos of landmark houses and churches and lighthouses point out, is that Now isn't so terribly different from Then. In a brisk tour of the island, Williams proves to be a genial guide with a ready grasp of whaling history, Nantucket blood lines and the like. And although his delivery suffers at times from excessive boosterism, his love of Nantucket is so disarming that he may even induce some readers to try to catch the next ferry.

title: Chancellor Named for University
description: EAU CLAIRE, Wis., Sept. 10 (AP)Irving Shain, second in command at the University of Washington in Seattle, has been selected as the new chancellor for the University of Wisconsin at Madison. He was vice chancellor at the Madison campus from 1970 until 1975, when he became, provost and vice president for academic affairs at the University of Washington.

title: Ann Creamer Married
description: Ann Hays Creamer and John J. Muller were married yesterday in St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church in Middletown, Conn., by the Rev. Vincent Sematore. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerard J. Creamer of Scarsdale, N. Y. Her husband is a son of Mr. and Mrs. John G. Muller of Dowdoin ham, Me.

title: Sri Lanka Making Important Progress In Reducing Births
description: COLOMBO, Sri LankaUnlike most of its neighbors, this island republic in the Indian Ocean has made important progress in an area that many experts consider the key to the region's developmentbirth control.

title: Cuomo Wins Cheers at P.B.A. Meeting
description: TANNERSVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 10Mario M. Cuomo told a cheering, whistling crowd of New York City police officers here today that tough economic cutbacks proposed for the Police Department burdened only the policemen and not the politicians, without whom the cops wouldn't be in this mess.

title: American Conference: Raiders, Bengals and Patriots Favored
description: Eastern Division

title: MarieLouise Fulweiler Is Bride
description: In the chapel of St. James' Episcopal Church yesterday afternoon, MarieLouise Fulweiler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Biddle Fulweiler of New York and South Norwalk, Conn., became the bride of Douglas Finlay Allen Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Allen of Swamds Cott. Mass.

title: Frederick O'Rourke Weds Elizabeth Breul
description: Elizabeth Rennell Breul and Frederick Haller O'Rourke were married yesterday in Washington. The Right Rev. John T. Walker, Bishop Coadjutor of Washington, performed the ceremony in the Nave of the Episcopal Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul.

title: FILM MAILBAG
description: To the Editor: In her article on Gary Cooper and James Stewart (Did Cooper and Stewart Have to Be So Stupid?, Aug. 7), Nora Sayre is like a lawyer who presents only that evidence which will support her case. One suspects that she chose to forget the roles played by James Stewart in The Fbiladelphia Story, Rope, Winthester 73, Bend of the River d Anatomy of a Murder.

title: Hackettstown: Death
description: HACKETTSTOWN TWO weeks have passed since Emile Pierre Benoist, the 20yearold son of a former Councilman here, ran out of his parents frame house on Valentine Street, gunned down six people as they rode, walked or jogged along a threemile stretch of railroad tracks and then took his own life.

title: Black Walnut Toxicity
description: Within the month a nurseryman and owner of a landscaping service asked for information on plants that can be used as a hedge near or Under black walnut trees. This question relates to a problem that has plagued horticulturists for centuries.

title: DEWEY FRAGETTA
description: Dewey Fragetta, an internationally known boxing promoter died of a heart attack Friday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 140 West 57th Street.

title: 2 Blend Construction And Architecture
description: BEDFORD A._ DR EW BURNS and Fred Ferriola are challenging the rules of the American Institute of Architects. The two designers refuse to separate architecture from building, an issue that has divided the architectural profession for years.

title: Intercepted Pass Helps Georgia Defeat Oregon
description: ATHENS, Ga., Sept. 10 (AP)A 28yard interception return by Jeff Lewis, a linebacker, set up the goahead touchdown and Willie McClendon added a clinching score in the fourth quarter as Georgia trimmed Oregon, 2716, today.

title: A Sailboat Glossary
description: BEATTo sail into the wind in a series of zigzag maneuvers.

title: INVESTING
description: Gold fever has quietly broken out for the second time this year. It is being spread by refugees from a lethargic stock market and carried in gloomy economic indicators. The current outbreak may also be traced to a number of lesser infection points.

title: The Artistic Success of Talking Heads
description: Ever since the Beatles Sargent Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band album of 1967, people have been wondering about the relationship between rockandroll and art music. There are those who argue that all music is one, and that rock at its best (which is hardly the same as rock at its fanciest) represents an abrupt, vital populist surge of energy into an ongoing but momentarily moribund musical tradition. Yet some classicalmusic devotees recoil with horror at the very notion of rock as art, and some rockers respond with equal disdain to the idea that their innocent entertainment be burdened with elitist associations.

title: Sailboat Show In Stamford Will Kick Off Fall Season
description: The fall boat show season gets under way Thursday when the North Atlantic Sailboat Show opens a fourday run at Yacht Haven West in Stamford, Conn.

title: Mrs. Perkins Is Remarried
description: The marriage of Adaline Havemeyer Perkins of New York to Laurance B. Rand of Southport, Conn., and New York, took place yesterday in the chapel of St. James Episcopal Church. The Rev. Hayes Rockwell performed the ceremony.

title: Miller Leads Oklahoma State Victory
description: TULSA, Okla., Sept. 10 (AP)Terry Miller opened his bid for national honors today by leading Oklahoma State to a 3417 victory over Tulsa. Miller raced for 189 yards and scored twice as the Big Eight defending cochampions ran over the outmanned Hurricanes.

title: Hypnosis Rated Big Help To Soviet Performances
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Sept. 10 (UPI)Russian athletes will probably leave United States Olympic team members in the dust in 1980 as a result of the Soviet Union's use of hypnosis and autogenic training, according to a noted psychologist and expert in behavior modification.

title: YONKERS TEACHERS TO RESUME TALKS
description: YONKERS, Sept. 10Negotiations to end a fourdayold teachers strike here are scheduled to resume tomorrow.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MONZA, Italy, Sept 10 (AP)James Hunt gained the pole position for tomorrow's Italian Grand Prix auto race by clocking the fastest time in the final 15 minutes of trials today.

title: World News Briefs
description: MARSEILLES, France, Sept. 10 (Reuters)A Tunisian convicted of murdering his 20yearold woman friend was executed by guillotine at dawn today.

title: Temple Loses by 2420
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 10 (UPI)Clarence Robison scored three touchdowns today as Southern Illinois won its first game, 24.20, from Temple. Robison's gamcwinning touchdown came early in the fourth period after Temple had stopped a Southern Illinois drive at the Owls 5yard line.

title: Duryea Calls for Tax Cut to Halt Flight of Business
description: Perry B. Duryea, the Assembly minority leader, yesterday called for a cut in income taxes to halt the flight of business from New York and delivered his second attack in a week against Governor Carey, stopping just short of formally declaring his own intentions to run for Governor next year.

title: Lilco Will Put 900 Major Users Of Power on New Rate Schedule
description: Sometime next fall; the Long Island Lighting Company will begin charging its 900 residential customers who use the most electricity higher rates during peak hours and lower rates for offpeak times.

title: Has TV Killed the Goose That Laid the Golden Tennis Ball?
description: Starting at noon today, CBS television will carry seven straight hours of the tennis finals from the U.S. Open at Forest Hills, thereby topping the unprecedented sixandahalfhour NBC broadcast last July, 2 when covering the finals at Wimbledon. That appears to be the networks counter to falling ratings for televised tennis: stretching out the coverage of major matches. But the question arises: Has television killed the goose that laid the opticvellow ball?

title: BOULDER,COLO.,MOVES TO CURB ITS GROWTH
description: BOULDER, Colo., Sept. 10 (AP)Residents of this handsome university town snuggled against the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, which grew rapidly in the 1960's, have applied the brakes with vengeance.

title: College Searches for Italian Heritage
description: IF Verrazano were to sail into New York Bay and rediscover the Hudson River today, he might find some college students rediscovering their Italian heritage. These students are enrolled in the Verrazano Institute at Mercy College in Dobbs Ferry, a new center for Italian Renaissance and Mediterranean cultural studies.

title: Youth and Sports: Beware of Child Abuse
description: Organized sports may be a form of child abuse. Consider the following scenes.

title: Navy Beats Citadel, 212, On 3 Late Touchdowns
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Sept. 10 (AP)Navy, bottled up on offense for most of three quarters, broke loose for three touchdowns in the final 20 minutes today for a 212 victory over the Citadel. A blocked punt in the end zone by Dale Williams with 45 seconds left in the first half gave the Citadel a 20 halftime lead, and it looked for a while as if the Bulldog defense would make it stand.

title: Campaign Seeks to Attract Young Blacks to the Land
description: GREENVILLE, Ala.I was born a farm boy within yelling distance of this place, said 68yearold Paul Bennett, relaxing in a wroughtiron rocker under an arbor in the front yard of his brother's home.

title: HONE CLINIC
description: SINCE repairing or replacing a windowscreen mesh is a fairly simple job that requires only or. dinary hand tools, there is no reason why anyone should tolerate tears or holes for any length of time. Small holes or tears can usually be patched, but if there are many, it pays to install new screening over the existing frame.

title: SUICIDE NOTE
description: A Peep into the 20th Century, by Christopher Davis, is one of the best American novels I have ever read. Suicide Note is not nearly so good, except in the sense that Mr. Davis always writes well. It is one of those instances of a highly talented man casting about for something that will not dissolve under his scrutiny.

title: Eat, Drink and Be MerryPlease
description: MY FRIENDS are delightful, charming people, of course, but lately more and more of them have become problems. They get wheat germ and bean sprouts, at the healthfood store, they discard the cherries in their whisky sours (Red Dye 90, you know) and entertaining them has become equivalent to runninct an obstacle course.

title: New York Schools Told to Speed Processing of Disabled Students
description: The New York City Board of Education has been ordered to speed the diagnosis and placement of pupils with handicapping conditions, such as neurological impairment, in suitable public school programs or else pay for their education in approved private schools.

title: Israeli Asserts the Press Misinterpreted Remark On Secret Settlements
description: TEL AVIV, Sunday, Sept. II Ariel Sharon, the Minister of Agriculture who created an international stir Thursday with a reported statement that Israel had established secret Jewish colonies in the occupied West Bank of the Jordan, said tonight the issue was ridiculous.

title: Reprise
description: WHY did it take Cole Porter so longnearly two decadesto establish himself in the front ranks of American composerlyricists in the most glamorous era of the musical theater? Others, Richard Rodgers, George Gershwin and Vincent Youmans, rose meteorically. Alone among them Porter did not follow the traditional up from Tin Pan Alley routegoing from songplugger to rehearsal pianist to vaudeville accompaniston his way to success. Alone among his professional peers, Cole Porterwealthy, Middle Western, with the polish of Yale and the Harvard Law Schoolwas also a part of the famed lost generation of American expatriates who went abroad after World War I.

title: John Hawley Fiance Of Barbara Jo Hale
description: Mr. and Mrs. William B. Hale of Rochester have announced the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Jo Hale, to John Follen Hawley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip M. Hawley of Los Angeles.

title: A Question of Timing
description: MILITARY history is a great deal more than the Valor and horror of battles. Behind the battles, large and small, lie military politics the forces that hammer out, often in violent argument, the strategies and weapons to be used. Military politics aro the inside history of wars. For example, there was the struggle waged within the Allied command in 1944 over the strategy of the final offensive against Germany. The broadftont approach, favored veiled over the single throat advocated by General Patton and Field Marshal Montgomery, with consequences that have affected Europe for a third a century.

title: HONE CLINIC
description: SINCE repairing or replacing windowscreen mesh is a fairly simple job that requires only orA dinary hand tools, there is no reason why anyone should tolerate tears or holes for any length of time. Small holes or tears can usually be patched, but if there are many, it pays to install Ow screening over the existing frame.

title: An Area of Darkness
description: TODAY every book on Cambodia is welcome, no matter how tendentious, even if it is based on insufficiently verified sources. Any attempt whatsoever to shed a bit of light on that imprisoned countrywalled in, cut off from the world since April, 1975 to an extent that Russia, China or even North Korea have never beenis worthwhile. When a government defies the world and the international communityEast as well as Westwhen it shows such utter contempt for the inviolable right to knew, every speck of information is valuable. Infermation draws criticism, provokes counterexands. ation, debate. It breaks the silence and redeems Cambodia from oblivion.

title: United Press International Associated Press
description: Yankees' Billy Martin, manager, at left, and Catfish Hunter watch as the Blue Jays put run after run on the scoreboard at Yankee Stadium yesterday. Hunter, the starting pitcher, was relieved after giving up six runs.

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are sof tcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores, supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This analysis is based on reports from bookstores and representative wholesalers with more than 40,000 outlets across the United States.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE HAMPTON'S INN in Water Mill might be described as two restaurants: one with very good Greek specialties, the other serving steaks and seafood dishes that are just about acceptable. If you go, go Greek. The Greek antipasto platter for two is a tasty sampler. It combines homemade cheese pie and spinach pie (two of each), the generous triangles of flaky phyllo enclosing creamy, wellseasoned fillings; an ample serving of smooth, richly salty taramasalata, the Greek carp roe paste; oily riceand herbfilled grape leaves that needed wedge of lemon; Kalamata olives; anchovies; lettuce, and tomatoes.

title: DTW Smoothes the Way for Small Troupes
description: Iinpatient choreographers, in their headlong creative thrust during the 1960's, eschewed any infringement of independence no matter what the cost or practicality. But the financial realities of the 1970's have tended to dictate a more structured approach to the managing of small dance companies. One indication of this change has been the number end variety of nonprofit organizations that have come into existence to help such companies solve mutual problems. Among these, Dance Theater Workshop, headed by David White, has emerged as one of the most industrious and efficient of the Off Broadway service organizations.

title: Billy Graham Ends Hungary Visit After Sermon in Baptist Church
description: BUDAPEST, Sept.10 (Reuters)Billy Graham left Hungary today after preaching to a congregation of 3,000 people last right to mark the end of his first mission to Communist Eastern Europe.

title: Major League Averages
description: National League

title: Heavyweights Set For 5Bout Card
description: LAS VEGAS, Sept. 10 (AP)Las Vegas is attracting gamblers and hardcore boxing fans because of Wednesday night's television spectacular from Caesars Palace, which will present Ron Lyle, Ken Norton, Jimmy Young and Larry Holmes.

title: Article 5  No Title
Taxable Property per Pupil
EDUCATION
description: ALL OUR CHILDREN The American Family Under Pressure. By Kenneth Keniston and the Carnegie Council on Children. 255 pp. New York: Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $10.95.

title: A First for Private Schools
description: FOR the first time, students in New Jersey's private and parochial schools are receving direct state aid in programs linked specifically to classroom work.

title: Indoor Tennis: AllYear Sport
description: WOODBRIDGE THE indoor tennis club, once primarily an exclusive, winteronly haven for the truly dedicated tennis buff, has now become a yearround social as well as sports fixture on the suburban scene. With more than 100 indoor racquet clubs in New Jersey (most of them were constructed in recent years), competition among them has resulted in more and more luxuries to entice the public all year.

title: Fair in Chester
description: CHESTER KATHLEEN CAULFIELD was 20 years old when she was diagnosed as a victim of multiple sclerosis, an incurable neurological disease that attacks and destroys the insulating layers of the central nervous system.

title: 3 London Newspapers To Resume Printing
description: LONDON, Sept. 10 (AP)  A labor dispute that crippled production of the Daily Express of London and two sister papers for the past week was resolved tonight.

title: Susan Shellenberger Wed to Terry S. Nagel
description: Susan Howard Shellenberger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Adamson. Shellenberger of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Terry Scott Nagel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Wendell Nagel of Cincinnati.

title: National Conference: Cowboys, Bears and Rams Are Formidable
description: Eastern Division

title: DINING OUT
description: IVORYTON SOW:. estauran.s serve food respectfully in natural and unaffected way. Others with similar aspirations never quite make it: too selfconscious or selfimportant, they manage only to:create a feeling of phony elegance. The Copper Beech Inn belongs to the latter category, I'm afraid. Although we found the place pretty, the menu interestin* and the food generally good, it was not very pleasant to be there. And, after all, there's little point if the nitnnricanna is aninuahl.

title: CAROL BELLAMY FINDS NEW VOTER RESPONSE
description: State Senator Carol Bellamy, whose surprisingly strong primary showing won her a spot in the Democratic runoff for New York City Council President, was buoyed by the new recognition she found among voters while campaigning yesterday. Her opponent, the incumbent Paul O'Dwyer, addressed a convention of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association in Tannersville, N.Y., where he was enthusiastically received.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Silver coin collectors, who don't see much new legal tender that they can buy these days, may be interested in a set of three pieces from Haiti. Two of them are of 50gourde value and the other is a 25gburde coin. (A gourde is equivalent to 20 cents.) They were struck at the San Francisco Mint, and each set will be packaged in a wallet along with a Certificate of Authenticity from the Republique d'Haiti and a Certificate of Minting signed, by Mary Brooks, erstwhile Director of our Mint.

title: Nearly Every Nation Is Looking to the U.S. for Aid
description: HONG KONGTwo years ago, when new governments came to power in Vietnam Cambodia and Laos, it was widely predicted in the Westnotably the United States, which had been flung out of the areathat the three would form an aggressive new Indochina, bound together by Communist ideology and determined to spread revolution throughout Southeast Asia. The predictions have not come true, illustrating yet again Western misperceptions of the East. Instead, the Indochinese nations have developed quite differently, relating to each other and to outsiders in ways that reflect national peculiarities and interests more than a supposed common ideological base.

title: Jets Are Not Depressed By Preseason Record
description: It is a standing that doesn't count, that will never even see print, but it makes the Jets feel respectable.

title: Photos by Sybil Shelton I Paul ConklIn/Monkowyor
description: WASHINGTONIt was supposed to be a revolution. Equalemployment laws, court cases ending discriminatory job practices, affirmative action and outreach programs, goals and timetables and a broad sweep of other civil rights actions since World War II were supposed to lead to job equality and economic justice for America's black minority.

title: In Memoriam
description: COOKMildred. We miss you very much a shall never forget you. You are always in our hearts. Irving, Janet, Sue, Larry, Reger & Meg.

title: Small Claims May See the Dawn of Night
description: A PROPOSAL for a Nassau County Small Claims Court that would offer nighttime arbitration to settle disputes between consumers and merchants seems likely to be adopted, but it must first be approved by the State Supreme Court.
