There had been no reports of ill health, and she should have been around for many years moreteaching, perhaps directing opera, living the legend that she had so richly earned during her great years as the most exciting opera singer of her time.

title: Sanders First In Muddy Run With a 15:16.5
description: O??? ??????? of ??report, L.,I., posted a strong performance for the second straight week as scholastic crosscountry trails in the metropolitan area were flooded by rain yesterday.

title: Back to the Land
description: As I look out the window I see wasted land. My greatgrandfather bought this farm in 1865. After he died In 1913, my grandfather continued to farm it: he grew vegetables and raised pigs and chickens to feed a family, and milked seven Holsteins and sent themilk to Boston. When I hayed with him in the summers of the 1940'sas late as 1950he met me at the depot with horse and buggy. As we drove the slow mile back to the farm, I looked to left and right at working farms. Stone walls at road's edge reminded you that these fields had not always been clear; not only had they been littered with the glacier's rubble, they had been thick with trees. Thirty years later they are thick with bushes, and the stone walls no longer pen sheepor even field corn. Walls keep weed trees from escaping into ditches. The farmers have gone from their hilly New Hampshire land, and their husbanded land grows slack and slovenly.

title: Utility Commissions Put Away the Rubber Stamps
description: The recent announcement that a hearing examiner for the New York State Public Service Commission had recommended a $245.2 million rate increase for the New York Telephone Company, including a rise in the coin box rate from 10 to 20 cents, brought the standard public reaction: outrage, gritted teeth and a cynical sowhatelseisnew? But the fact is that a lot is new, not only in New York, but in New Jersey and Connecticut as well. The days of rubberstamp utility commissions have passed.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A prison guard who allegedly admitted smuggling drugs and liquor to inmates is being held on $50,000 bail in an investigation of smuggling at the Federal Correctional Center at 150 Park Row in Manhattan.

title: Passengers Line Up Near London For New Laker Flight to New York
description: LONDON,Sept. 24 (Reuters)The first passengers began lining up today for Monday's maiden flight of Laker Airway's inexpensive Skytrain transAtlantic air service.

title: Michigan State University Plans to Build a Super Atom Smasher
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.A facility for research into a new area of nuclear science that could, it is said, result in the release of 10 times as much energy as known nuclear reactions, is to be built at Michigan State University under a grant awarded by the National Science foundation.

title: They All Jump At the Chance
description: MIKE EFSTRATION is a 52yearold engineer from Coram who favors bushy muttonchop sideburns and diving out of airplanes. His friends Jerry Thompson, a 44yearold restaurateur from Hewlett, and Larry Corderia, a 41yearold crane operator from Wantagh, are beardless. But they have the same habit when airborne.

title: Toms River Man Killed in Crash
description: TOMS RIVER. N.J., Sept. 24 (UnAn elderly Toms River man was killed today when his car went out of control on a rainslicked highway, hit a utility pole and burst into flames, authorities said. The police said Raphael Doria, 75 years old, was driving on Route 37 when he lost control of his car about 1:25 A.M. Mr. Doria, who was trapped inside his burning car, was severely burned and was pronounced dead at Community Memorial Hospital in Toms River.

title: New Jersey/This Week;
description: THEATER

title: Four Fashionable Families
description: ALONG ISLAND teenager claims that she can walk perfectly well on her towering platform shoes and, when no one is looking, releases her feet to the security of the ground. . . .In Westchester, one of the country's largest markets for the pinstripe suit, a cartoonist proudly admits to owning only one jacketalthough it is a Cardin. . . A newcomer to rural Sussex County, N.J., mourns the lack of fashionable stores. . . .A Greenwich woman keeps a long dress for social emergencies in her Manhattan piedaterre.

title: Exit Ad Men as the Club Scene Shifts
description: The atmosphere is pure clubvery private and very sure of itself. In the dining room, plush with thick carpets and heavy brocaded curtains, the service is deliberate and the diners, mostly men, seem relaxed and at home.

title: JOSEPH SCHWARTZ
description: Joseph Schwartz, senior partner in the law firm of Barnes, Richardson & Colburn, died Thursday of cancer at New York University Medical Center. He was 74 years old and lived at 60 Sutton Place South in Manhattan.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TRENTON, Sept. 24  Rain today postponed until tomorrow the Machinists Union 150 auto race at the Trenton Speedway. The event, the nexttolast event on the 1977 United States. Auto Club's Citicorp Cup originally was scheduled for Sunday but was shifted to today for television purposes.

title: The Generation Gap in Schumann
description: By far the major portion of Robert Schumann's piano compositions are the work of a very young man. Between 1830 and 1840, when he was in his 20's, Schumann directed almost all of his creative energies toward the keyboard and wrote at least twodozen largescale pieces, mostly in the form of suites, that are a basic ingredient of every serious pianist's repertory today.

title: Hackensack Coach's Goal: To Erase RunnerUp Image
description: When Gus Migliore took over for Jerry Lewis as soccer coach at Hackensack five years ago he found that, like the entertainer, this Jerry Lewis's act was a hard one to follow.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote to table amendment setting $1.45 per thousand cubic feet at the regulated price on new natural gas in lieu of current $1.75 per thousand cubic feet, passed, 73 to 21, Sept. 21.

title: A Life of Poetry
description: It is very hard to write the way Muriel Rukeyser does, using your life as the direct vehicle of  apprehension, the poems the same thing as closest attention to your daily life. The old poetic task is we have to invent our own lives, Allen Ginsberg put it.

title: Quebecers Discern an Uphill Struggle to Win American Understanding for Their Nationalist Aspirations
description: QUEBEC, Sept. 24In foreign dealings the provincial government has given priority to cultivating opinion in the United States, hutit acknowledges that it has an uphill struggle to elicit American understanding and sympathy for Quebec's nationalist aims.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 24 (AP)  A San Diego hospital has been conducting for two years experiments for the Central Intelligence Agenney on how the human brain reacts to what the eye sees, a spokesman for the agency said today.

title: Just How Good Is an Endorsement?
description: WHITE PLAINS

title: Steven O'Connell, Bank Aide, Marries Gloria Anne Yates
description: Gloria Ann Yates, a flight attendant on the international routes of American Airlines, was married yesterday afternoon to Steven Morison O'Connell, who is in the trust group of the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company. The Rev. T. Guthrie Speers Jr. performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church of New Canaan. Conn.

title: BritishSpanish Meeting Due Next Month on Gibraltar
description: MADRID, Sept 24A constructive atmosphere has started to envelop one of the thorniest and seemingly most unresolvable diplomatic disputes in Europe British possession of the strategic ??iver or land known as Gibraltar.

title: Two Tied For Lead In Ohio Golf
description: MASON, Ohio, Sept. 24 (AP)Mike Hill sank a 25foot birdie putt on the 18th hole today to tie the defending champion, Ben CrenJhaw, for the third round lead in the windplagued $150,000 Ohio Kings Island Open golf tournament.

title: Inquiry Under Way On Charge Officer Beat 7 Prisoners;
description: Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold's staff yesterday began an investigation into allegations that a Brooklyn police officer beat seven prisoners who later were treated for cuts and abrasions at Cumberland hospital, police officials said yesterday.

title: Easy Does It For the Fall
description: Fall clothes are softer, looser and more comfortable than they've been in years. Easytomovein big skirts and shawls that cover the shoulders indoors or out are two important components. They are shown here in printed challis, the season's most important fabric. Other new fashions on Page 6.

title: Hnuriling
description: BRETTLER, JACOB.A monument to the memory of the late Jacob Breiller will be unveiled at King Solomon Memorial Park, Clifton, NJ, today, September 25 at 2:30 P.M.

title: A Lynching in Georgia
description: RICHARD KLUGER has written the best novel yet about the Jews who settled in the South. Using the actual 1913 murder trial of Leo Frank as the critical event, he traces the history of the Jews of Savannah, Ga. from the viewpoint of Seth Adler, a German Jew who arrives from New York in 1878 wearing the Congressional Medal of Honor his father won for dying for the Union in the Civil War. Adler apprentices as a lawyer and eventually becomes one of the defense counsel in the trial of Noah Berg, who is accused of murdering a 14yearold girl found strangled in the basement of the factory he manages.

title: Longtime Allies On Rights Split By Bakke Case
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 24A case now before the Supreme Court that could determine the fate of programs that favor racial minorities in education and employment has sharply divided chit rights and political action groups. As a result, a coalition that has pushed progressive social and economic legislation for many years could be seriously threatened.

title: Chess Matches
description: Solution to last week's puzzles appear on Page 113. A new puzzle tomorrow and every Weekday.

title: Elizabeth C. Lord Is Married
description: Elizabeth Crary Lord, daughter of Edward C. Lord 2d of Syosset, L.I., and the late Elizabeth McVitty Lord, was married yesterday in Cold Spring Harbor, L.I., to Robert Blackburn Gray, son of Mr. and Mrs. James G. Gray of Salisbury, England. The Rev. Thomas Carleton Lee performed the ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church.

title: A Tale of Two Shores
description: LIKE fraternal twins, Nassau County's two prime shopping areasthe South Shore's Five Towns and the North Shore's Miracle Milehave a common commitment to fashion, but with different features and flavor.

title: A $1 BOUNTY FOR RATS IS OFFERED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 24The problem of rats infesting densely populated neighborhoods here has grown so severe that West Side alderman is offering his constituents a $1 bounty fo each rat killed, and Mayor Michael A. Bilandic has established a new agency to supervise rodent control.

title: Greenport Is Too Much for Stony Brook
description: A powerful Greenport team defeated Stony Brook, 288, yesterday, for its second League A2 victory. The Porters picked up 266 yards, 254 on the ground, in handing Stony Brook its second straight loss.

title: His Business Is Smooth Sailing
description: LAST month, a photographer rushed his crew to a deserted stretch of the Long Island Sound to catch the fog, while somewhere in the Pacific a captain avoided a squall by suddenly changing the course of his vessel. For these men, weather means money, and that is why they have come to depend upon the predictions of Bill Kaciak.

title: PRESS IN SOUTH BACKS LANCE'S RESIGNATION
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 24The reaction of Southern editorial writers to the resignation of Bert Lance has generally been favorable, although several newspapers, most notably The Atlanta Constitution, and a segment of the general public con tend that the former budget director was hounded out of office and should not have quit.

title: For Children: Chic
description: CHILDREN's clothes have always reflected the fashions of their elders, but seldom to the degree they do now. The trends that are sweeping adult markets are paralleled in sizes 3 to 6X and 7 to 14, children'swear buyers report.

title: Oct. 3 Is Child Health Day
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP)President Carter declared this week that Oct. 3 would be Child Health Day and urged Americans to support activites in the field.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMSMorris. Devoted husband of Miriam. Beloved father of Gerald and Sa muel. Dear brother of Ann Tucker and Gertrude Rutenberg. Darling grandfath. er. Services, Sunday 11 A.M. Parkside Chapels, 2576. Flatbush Avenue (opp. Kings Plaza) Brooklyn.

title: Births
description: Cohen

title: Orantes, Dibbs Reach Coast Tennis Semifinals
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 24 (AP)Secondseeded Manuel Orantes of Spain and fourthseeded Eddie Dibbs of Miami advanced to the men's singles semifinals of the $100,000 Southern California open today.

title: The Summer People
description: THE summer people have departed our shores. (We who make our homes permanently along the beaches and rivers of the Jersey Shore have always referred to the vacationers as the summer people.) We watch them go, their car roofs piled high with their effects, bicycles hitched with wheels still spinning, cars trailing boats behind them.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Beaverkill After Drought
description: ROSCOE, N. Y.A gentle but persistent rain greeted me as I drove west from the Hudson River's Bear Mountain Bridge to the Catskills a short while ago. I was delighted, for it was the first such gift from heaven to the droughtstricken Beaverkill and Willowemoc Rivers since early summer,

title: E. S. TYLER, TEACHER OF JOB SKILLS, AT 73
description: Elias S. Tyler, a teacher and author of textbooks and courses designed to train students for skilled and commercial occupations, died yesterday at his son's home in East Northport, L. I. He was 73 years old and lived in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Colorado Overwhelms New Mexico by 427
description: BOULDER, Colo., Sept. 24 (AP)Jeff Knapple ran for two touchdowns and threw for a third today as eighthranked Colorado crushed New Mexico 427.

title: A Young Designer Eyes Suburbia
description: WHEN Frances Plonka was a student at St. Aloysius Academy in Jersey City, she wore a navyblue blazer, pleated skirt, navyblue knee socks, a white blouse and brown loafers every day.

title: Transit Union Says It Is Essential To Obtain Solid Gains in Contract
description: Delegates to the Transport Workers Union convention in New York City last week said the continuing inflation made it imperative that the union get substantial improvements in wages and benefits in negotiations with airlines, railroads and the local Transit Authority.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: Article 12  No Title

title: THE SOUND THAT SHOOK HOLLYWOOD
description: On the 50th anniversary of the talkies, survivors of the silentfilm era recall the panic of 27.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: Whatever happened to British art? It's a good question. British art in the 1950's and early 1960's flourished as never before. It was the guardian of the national conscienceor so it then seemedand the admired of all admirers (above all. if they came from abroad).

title: HOME CLINIC
description: NOW THAT summer is officially over, it won't be long before homeowners in this area activate their heating systems againand at today's high prices for fuel and electricity, they'll want to insure full value for every dollar's worth of fuel consumed. This not only calls for additional insulation and weatherstripping where needed, but also requires a heating system that is operating at maximum efficiency.

title: Florida Utility Panel Reaffirms Rate Plan Aiding Small Users
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Sept. 24Florida's Public Service Commission has voted, 2 to 1, to continue a controversial utility rate structure that rewards those who use small amounts of energy at the expense of large residential consumers.

title: Four Novels
description: This is a strange and powerful novel about incest between brother and sister, written in the form of a journal. It is 1900 in England. Catherine, an intelligent and strong  minded woman of 30, is trapped in a marriage to a man she does not love and cannot bear to be touched by, her emotions frozen. In the condescending manner of the time her husband calls her Child and gets angry when she does not wear her bonnet: when she asks him about Africa he replies: Why, what possible interest could it be to a woman? You should have a child. Her past haunts her, and so she begins this secret journal about her passionate childhood love affair with her brother Christopher.

title: Yonkers
description: (OTB Payoffs subject to 5% Municipal surtax) FIRST$6,500, pace, mile.

title: Druid Ceremony in Britain
description: LONDON, Sept. 24 (Reuters)Forty druids in traditional white robes climbed Primrose Hill in north London yesterday to mark the autumn equinox. The druids, followers of an ancient Celtic cult that believed all life comes from the sun, were continuing a tradition that began when druidism was revived in 1717. The ceremony began with a procession to the top of Primrose Hill, where the druids formed a circle and chanted a call for universal peace and understanding.

title: Teaching Horse Sense
description: RONKONKOMA

title: STAGE VIEW;
description: I have an impossible dream, too. Several, in Tact. One is that some day, by some alchemy, I shall come to truly like Man of La Mancha, the Cervantesbased operetta that originated at the Goodspeed Opera House in 1964 and then went on to become the fourth, longestrunning musical in Broadway history. Another is that I shall like everything I see when I go up to East Haddam, Conn., to visit the Goodspeed, because the house is so pretty, the productions are so intelligently and engagingly unpretentious, the river air is so summertime soothing even as autumn marches on.

title: 32 Magazines Held Not Obscene; Judge Cites Educational Value
description: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 24 (UPI)The educational value of magazines containing sexually explicit pictures must be weighed in determining whether magazines are legally obscene, a judge has ruled.

title: Louise Pate Bride Of R. B. Perdew Jr.
description: The marriage of Louise Acker Pate, daughter of Mrs. Carlton Overton Pate Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., and the late Mr. Pate, to Robert Beasley Perdew Jr. took place yesterday in Christ Episcopal Church in Greenwich. The Rev. Samuel Walker performed the ceremony.

title: GARDENING
description: THIS is the time when all good gardeners should be busy planting bulbs. Best efforts now will reward bountifully with glorious splashes of flowers next spring. Depending on what kind of bulbs are planted, the flower parade can begin soon after the last patches of snow melt until the balmy days of May when it's time to shed heavy winter coats.

title: TV VIEW
description: The heart of the matter of distortion in television dramatization is embedded in the concept of dramatic license. Most dramatizations demand adjustments in the original material. A book is not a play. It must be molded into a form that demands different modes of exposition and pacing. Certain changes are required. At issue is where those changes begin and end. When, for example, Eric, a true story by Doris Lund about her son dying from leukemia, is transposed from settings in New England and New York to a small town hospital near Seattle and still advertised as a true story the changes verge on downright fraud.

title: ART VIEW
description: Last month the American sculptor Reuben Nakian observed his 80th birthday, and to mark this event a small, wellchosen exhibition of his work has been mounted by Robert P. Metzger at the Stamford Museum in Stamford, Conn., where Mr. Nakian has lived and worked since 1948.

title: CRIME
description: Now that we no longer have Watergate to kick around, suspense novelists are turning to other aspects of the contemporary malaise, and it seems that the favorite topic  judging from the number of books that have been published recently on the subjectis terrorism. When you couple terrorism with a nuclear device, as is almost de rigueur, still another worrisome subject is encompassed.

title: Natalie Wilmer And P. C. Blenk To Wed Dec. 3
description: The Rev. Dr. Richard H. Wilmer Jr. of Pittsburgh and Mrs. Piera Blua of New York and Fishers Island, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Natalie Wheeler Wilmer, to Peter Christian Blenk, son of Walter Blenk of New York and the late Edith Hagstrom Blenk.

title: Into the Arena With Tax Reform
description: WASHINGTONA stockholder receives dividends. A songwriter collects royalties. Each pays Federal tax on the income from these valuable assets, A house owner also holds a valuable asset. If he rented it to someone else, he would have to pay taxes on the rental income. If he pays the rental income to himself, in effect, by living in the house, he incurs no tax liability.

title: The Campus Look Is Mainly Easy
description: THE prevailing attitude toward clothes on college campuses today is casual. Whether the school is Douglass, Manhattanville, Sarah Lawrence or Vassar, freedom of choice is dominant. A couple of pairs of blue jeans will see anyone through the school year, yet there is no discrimination against those who want to be more adventurous.

title: First Pennsy's Golden Boy
description: PHILADELPHIAWhen John R. Bunting Jr. took over as president of the First Pennsylvania Bank in 1968, he set out to erase its stodgy image as the oldest trust companyand perhaps one of the most conservativein the United States.

title: Sunday Observer
description: I wish I were television people. I'd he cool and have great hair. When I had to shoot somebody with a pistol, I would get him with the first shot, instead of missing him with all six, the way I do now.

title: Deborah Foster Wed To Brian J. Whalen
description: Deborah Jean Morgans Foster and Brian James Whalen were married yesteday in St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Andrew J. W. Mullins.

title: Betty Ford in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 24 (UPI)Betty Ford arrived in Moscow today to tape a joint SovietAmerican television program. She will be the hostess for a National Broadcasting Company presentation of the Bolshoi Ballet performing The Nutcracker.

title: FEDERAL AID TO RELOCATE JOBLESS IS URGED BY REUSS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24 (AP)The chairman of a powerful House committee unveiled today a blueprint for urban reform that calls for Federal relocation aid for jobless Americans who want to move from depressed cities to areas where work is available.

title: Princeton's Stores Still Show The Ivy League Look
description: PRINCETON TRIANGLE SHOW, 1957 THE Ivy League look. Nothing could more aptly describe the clothing sold in shops on Nassau Street, the main strip in this college town.

title: Island Journal
description: HOLY THE FIRM is a book of great richness, beauty and power and thus very difficult to do justice to in a brief review. On one level it is a 76page journal of several November days spent on Northern Puget Cound by the author of Pilgrim at Tinker Creek. Nothing is going to happen in this book, Annie Dillard writes. There is only a little violence here and there in the language, at the corner where eternity clips time. She sells herself short.

Elis Triumph, 2312, With Ground Game on Drenched Field
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept 24 (AP)Yale narrowly continued its dominance over the University. of Connecticut with a 2312 victory today as Rick Angelone, a junior fullback, scored his first varsity touchdown in a tumblemarred game at raindrenched Yale Bowl.

description: NEW LONDON

title: Johnson Helps Jackson Twp. Rally to Win
description: Len Johnson's two fourthperiod touchdowns helped Jackson Township rally to a 218 victory over Freehold Township yesterday at Jackson. Johnson caught a 23yard touchdown pass from Kevin Ruddy and raced 25 yards with four minutes remaining to close the scoring. Ruddy scored earlier on a 1yard burst. Rich Hoffman had gone six yards early in the fourth quarter to give Freehold an 87 edge.

title: Koreans Begin Celebrating Thanksgiving Holiday
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 24With a bountiful harvest in the offing, the world's tallest mountain just conquered by a native son and hints of creeping changes in the cooling autumn air, millions of citizens here began celebrations this weekend for Chusok, Korea's traditional thanksgiving day.

title: Yesterday's Results in Scholastic Sports
Headliners
description: A suspended Port Authority official, Caesar B. Pattarini, has been reinstated. Mr. Pattarini, the agency's director of aviation, was suspended Sept. 3 for falsely padding his expense account for meals and entertainment, and for charging helicopter trips unrelated to agency business. Though agency officials say he has repaid the money, some investigators believe the repayment$1,900 in allis too low, and that the reinstatement is premature.

title: Wilton May End Dry Spell
description: WILTON

title: Kristofferson's Show Is a Delight
description: Kris Kristofferson, the Rhodes scholar turned country songwriter turned country singing star turned pop star turned movie star, has let his musical career, take something of a back seat to his film career during the last few years. Speculation was rampant at the beginning of his current tour, which features his wife, Rita Coolidge, as coheadliner, that he might have trouble. He has always been somewhat stageshy andby his own admissionthis was to be his first stonesober tour minus the crutch that alcohol had traditionally provided him.

description: MONTESANO, Wash., Sept. 23The trees are not the only things that rustle here in the area southwest of Olympia, the state capital.

description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept 24 (Reuters)The ruins of a town dating from 4000 B.C. have been uncovered in the village of Saheb, 13 miles south of Amman, according to the Jordanian Archeology Department.

description: COHNORENT

title: Frank S. Farley, 75, ExLegislator And G.O.P. Leader in Jersey, Dies
description: Frank S. Farley, a former New Jersey State Senator who served 34 years in the Legislaturelonger than anyone in New Jersey historyand was regarded as one of the state's most influential politicians, died yesterday at his home in Ventnor, N.J. He was 75 years old.

description: THE prevailing attitude toward clothes on college campuses today is casual. Whether the school is Douglass, Manhattanville, Sarah Lawrence or Vassar, freedom of choice is dominant. A couple of pairs of blue jeans will see anyone through the school year, yet there is no discrimination against those who want to be more adventurous.

title: Palmer Posts 19th3Run 9th Hands Indians 41 Loss
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 24Ken Singleton and Eddie Murray belted consecutive homers with one out in the ninth inning today and staked Jim Palmer to his 19th victory as the Baltimore Orioles kept their pennant hopes alive with a 41 triumph over the Cleveland Indians.

description: THE SYSTEM WORKS by Hank Virgona (Da Capo Press, $17.50) is a collection of satirical etchings that assault our cherished institutions with all the wit and force of a latterday Daumier.

title: Vera Creates Pure and Simple Lines

description: SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 25, 1977

title: JetsColts Statistics
Susan Webber Married To H.N. Christensen Jr.
description: Susan Anne Webber and Henry N. Christensen Jr. were married yesterday in the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City, L.I. The Very Rev. Harold J. Lemoine, dean of the cathedral, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Ralph. F. Ferro of St. Anne's Roman Catholic Church in Garden City.

title: Looking Easy And Stylish This Fall
description: IF it fits too snugly, don't buy it. If it feels too heavy when you hold it on the hanger, put it back on the rack. Fashion is launched this fall on an absolute sea of comfort.

title: South African Forces on Alert for Black's Funeral
description: KINGWILLIAMSTOWN, South Africa, Sept. 24Police and army reinforcements were on the alert in this quiet South African town tonight in preparation for the funeral here. tomorrow of Steven Biko, the country's foremost young black leader, who died in police custody on Sept. 12 of as yet unexplained causes.

description: Today

title: Carter's Flexible Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 24When Jimmy Carter came to Washington proclaiming the essential goodness of human nature, even his closest friends wondered how he would react when his ideals were challenged by the brutal political facts.

title: Dr. Kathleen Shepard Wed to Nicholas Cafardi
description: The marriage of Dr. Kathleen Ann Shepard, a secondyear resident in pediatrics at the Upstate Medical Center in Syracuse, to Nicholas Patrick Cafardi, assistant dean of the University of Pittsburgh Law School, took place yesterday in Guilford, Conn. The Rev. Lawrence G. Wren performed the ceremony in St. George's Roman Catholic Church and concelebrated the nuptial mass with the Rev. Adam J. Maida and the Rev. Thomas Shepard, cousin of the bride.

title: U. S. Asking Moscow to Stabilize Naval Activity in the Indian Ocean
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25  The United States is asking the Soviet Union to agree to stabilize naval activity in the Indian Ocean a its present level as first step in achieving President Carter's goal of demilitarzng the ocean.

title: Approval Is Subject to Several Conditions
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 25Prompted by Prime Minister Menahem Begin, the Israeli Cabinet today approved an Americen proposal calling for a single unified Arab delegation, including Palestinians, at the opening session of a Geneva peace conference.

title: 3 Home Runs by Boston Too Much for Tigers
description: DETROIT, Sept. 25 (AP)The Boston Red Sox, fighting to stay alive in the American League East race, defeated the Detroit Tigers, 125, today with the help of homers by Carlton Fisk, Carl Yastrzemski and Butch Hobson.

title: George Bush Visiting China
description: PEKING, Sept. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)The former head of the United States Liaison Office in Peking, George Bush, arrived here today for a visit to China that will include a trip to Tibet. Mr. Bush, a former head of the Central Intelligence Agency, was accompanied by journalists and a dozen Texas businessmen.

title: Rangers Are Given Ultimatum by Gilbert
description: PROVIDENCE, , R.I, Sept. 25Demanding that the New York Rangers either exercise an option. to extend his contract through the next three seasons air trade him, Rod Gilbert remained truant today from the team. He was scheduled to play in tonight's rookielaced exhibition game here in which the Bruins defeated the Rangers, 42, but he did not make the trip. Gilbert walked out of the Ranger training sscamp in Long Beach, L.I. on Friday.

title: Many Rail Commuters Facing Loss Of Service in Amtrak's Cutbacks
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25A new crisis looms for thousands of New Jersey rail commuters along the busy New YorkPhiladelphia main line as Amtrak mulls over the elimination of socalled clocker trains, which are quasicommuter services.

title: Mr. Carter's Confession
description: WASHINGTONPresident Carter, in his muchdelayed fifteenth press conference, made an admission that seemed to confirm the worst suspicions of a few of us: that during corrupt interregnum, the Presidentelect and others conspired to lift an embarrassing cease and desist order, kill a criminal investigation, and clean up Bert Lance's financial affairs so that Mr. Lance could become the new President's key aide.

title: Police Greet Koch and Cuomo in Varying Degrees
description: For the first time since Edward I. Koch defeated Mario M. Cuomo in the Democratic mayoral runoff, the two men met yesterday, both still rival candidates for Mayor of New York.

title: U. S. IS HELPING STATE EASE UNEMPLOYMENT
description: TRENTON, Sept. 25New Jersey is scheduled to get more than $600 million from Washington to help ease the state's chronic unemployment during the Federal Government's fiscal year, which begins Saturday.

title: New Tropical Depression Forming
description: MIAMI, Sept. 25 (AP)A tropical depression moved into Venezuela today as another weather system over the Bahamas shaped up as a potential depression, the National Hurricane Center said. Depressions can develop into storm systems and later into hurricanes.

title: A Predawn Tour Looks for Newark's Past
description: NEWARK. Sept. 25At 3:30 this morning, they were still roaming the streets. The plucky group of 40 people had met at midnight at Pennsylvania Station here and voted to march through the murky downtown area despite heavy rains and wind. As down approached they were still shuffling through deserted parks and treacherous alleys, slipping in and out of oncegrand town houses and casting glances at Art Deco skyscrapers.

title: Music: Two Beethoven Rarities
description: The Beethoven Society will be presenting 10 concerts this season at Hunter College, exploring various aspects of the composer. In addition to some of the more familiar works, such as a complete cycle of the string quartets, the society has planned a few rarities, two of which appeared on yesterday afternoon's opening program.

title: Maddox Hospitalized Alter Heart Attack
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 25Lester G. Maddox, the former Georgia Governor who gained national attention as a segregationist restaurant owner, suffered a heart attack at his home tonight and was taken to a nearby hospital where a spokesman said he was in critical condition.

title: CHINA'S TENG RULES OUT THAW WITH SOVIET UNION
description: PEKING, Sept. 25 (Reuters)China's Deputy Prime Minister, Teng Hsiaoping, today told a visiting West German group there was no chance that ChineseSoviet relations would warm up again for a generation or more, sources close to the group reported.

title: New Listing for Books
description: A MidsummerNight's Dream, by William Shakespeare with illustrations by Arthur Rackham (Viking, $12.95). Illustrated version of the play.

title: TV: Karen Ann Quinlan Drama Is Sensitive to Parents Ordeal
description: In another factbased project for television entertainment, NBC is offering, at 9 this evening, In the Matter of Karen Ann Quinlan. The Quinlan case attracted international attention in 1975 When Karen Ann fell into a coma and was supposedly being kept alive by extraordinary means in a Roman Catholic hospital. Concluding from medical reports that their daughter's physical condition had deteriorated well beyond any hope of reasonable recovery, the Guinlans made the painful decision to pull the plug on the hospital's sophisticated machinery and put the fate of Karen Ann in God's hands.

title: Market Place
description: LONDONTired of watching the Dow Jones industrials stumble along more than 200 points below their peak?

title: Orthodox Jews Search for Missing Diamond Broker
description: More than 100 Orthodox Jews, many dressed in black felt hats and long coats, conducted a buildingbybuilding search of the diamond district in midtown Manhattan yesterday for a 25yearold diamond broker who disappeared there last week while reportedly carrying a wallet containing between $100,000 and $1 million in gems.

title: Nurses at Pascack Valley Hospital Strike for Higher Wages
description: WESTWOOD, Sept. 25 (AP)Nonsupervisory registered nurses struck Pascack Valley Hospital here today, leaving the hospital open to admit only emergency cases and care for a reduced number of patients already admitted.

title: The Standings
description: Monday, September 26, 1977

title: Golf
Opera:`Boheme
description: Judging from the hearty bravoes she received at the conclusion of the City Opera's performance of La Boheme Saturday night. Mariana Niculescu has. in a very short time, become a favorite with New York operagoers. The Rumanian soprano made her debut as Violetta in La Traviata earlier this month, later consolidated the fine impression she had made in that role by singing Liu in Turandot, and this was her first Mimi with the company.

title: Volunteer Military Called Success; Pay and Pension Overhaul Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25While the volunteer military has been a success, outdated policies are costing $5 billion to $10 billion annually, according to detailed study of the nation's fouryearold shift from drafted to voluntary military personnel.

title: 14 Die in Crash in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD. Pakistan, Sept. 25 (AP)Fourteen people were killed last night when the bus in which they were riding veered off the road while making a sharp turn and plunged ino a ravine, the police reported today., The accident happened near Dera Ismail, 200 miles southwest of here, the police said.

title: Leonard Silk
description: WASHINGTONA mood of anxiety hangs over the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank. But that anxiety has brought on a growing willingness to face up to the threats of economic slowdown, rising unemployment, a worsening of world trade, and the continuing buildup of international debt that results from the disordered worldresultsbalance of payments. There is little optimism that these problems will disappear for years to come.

title: Radioactive Releases Reported at Colorado Plant
description: DENVER, Sept 25 (AP)Operations at the Rocky Flats nuclear weapons plant northwest of Denver produce unavoidable releases of radioactive materials that present a potential danger, according to a report of the Energy Research and Development Administration.

title: HEALTH PARLEY TOLD OF UNUSUAL REMEDIES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25Can you imagine God waking up in the morning with lumbago and sneezing all over heaven? He is healthy and He wants us to be healthy, that's why bionic ionization is neededto develop body energy.

title: A Broader Horizon Is in the Offing for Roosevelt Island
description: The New York State Urban Development Corporation, which has not begun any major construction projects since its financial structure collapsed in 1973, has leased a major site on Roosevelt Island to Starrett Housing Corporation, which plans to erect 1,000 units of luxury, middleincome and moderateincome housing on it next year.

title: Underground Book Brings Fame to a Lesbian Author
description: If feminists hadn't banished such adjectives as peppy, perky and pert from the language, those words could be used aptly today to describe Rita Mae Brown. She has a short, flippy hair style, smiling brown eyes, a girlish, Southern drawl, and the kind of high voltage energy that reminds you of a varsity cheerleader.

title: SENATE DISMANTLING CARTER'S ENERGY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25After gliding through the House easily in the early summer, the President's energy program has come upon hard times at the hands of the Senate and the survival of any major legislation is in question.

description: The St. Louis Cardinals defense stopped Walter Payton, the National Conference's leading rusher last season, and the aging arm of Jim Hart and the fieldgoal kicking of Jim Bakken took care of the Chicago Bears.

title: Robert Lowell's Poetry Is Read In Memorial Service at Theater
description: Drawn less by the fame of the poet than by their affection for the man, 125 friends, relatives and admirers of the late Robert Lowell gathered at the American Place Theater on West 46th Street last night for a quiet evening of poetic tribute and personal remembrance.

description: TAMA NEW TOWNA revolutionary new home television system that allows viewers to compose their own programs and communicate directly with the studio has been enthusiastically received in a test program in this Tokyo suburb.

title: Grace Jones, Cult Darling, Returns, Miming Tableaux of Dominance
description: One has to be careful criticizing cult objects when one isn't part of the cult. Grace Jones, who made a return appearance at Les Mouches, the discotheque and restaurant at 260 West 11th Street early Saturday morning, is the, current darling of Manhattan's homosexualdisco crowd. To this observer, she was pretty terrible. But perhaps that's because one needs the rosecolored glasses that cult membership provides.

title: Commodities
description: Frozen orange juice concentrate has suddenly become the hottest commodity traded in the futures market. Not only did prices reach an historic high last week, but so did the open interest or number of outstanding contracts available for trading.

title: Witness Connects Oilman to Murder Of His SoninLaw
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 25The vivid testimony of a 27yearold former prostitute has linked a Texas oilman, Davis Ashton Robinson, to the murder of his soninlaw, Dr. John Hill, in the foyer of Dr. Hill's Houston mansion five years ago.

title: Around the Nation
description: DURHAM, N. C., Sept. 25 (UPI)Duke University officials said that the school might forgo almost $1 million in Federal funds rather than admit medical students it felt might be unqualified.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25The threeday interrogation of former Representative Richard T. Hanna by the House ethics committee last week underscored a point In the investigation into alleged South Korean influence buying that may have been lost in the publicity about attempts to get Tongsun Park back to the United States

description: The director of the Federal Office of Civil Rights defended the controversial New York City plan to assign teachers on the basis of race as the best agreement we've had in the Federal effort to end discrimination in bigcity schools.

description: STRASBOURG, France, Sept. 25 (Reuters)  Roman Catholic traditionalists today occupied the St. Jean Church here to celebrate the Latin Tridentine Mass.

title: `That's What Happens When You Hit
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Sept. 25  Progress is not always measured on the scoreboard. In their regularseason National Football League unveiling at Giants Stadium today, the New York Jets lost to the Baltimore Colts, 2012, but the progress of the Jets under their new coach, Walt Michaels. was best measured in the Colts injury list. Roosevelt Leaks, bruised knee, a Colts official was saying quietly in their locker room. Lloyd Mumphord, leg strain. Ray Oldham, ankle strain. Raymond Chester, calf cramp. Joe Ehrmann, broken bones in his hand. David Taylor, pinched nerve in his neck. In other years, the Jets always seemed to be the team that got banged up. But today the Colts got banged up, the Colts who were the American Conference East champions last season, the Colts who were 14point favorites over the Jets today, the Colts whose victory didn't deflate Walt Michaels because the new coach realized that his young players had let the Colts know they had been in a football game. And only one of the Jets had limped offShafer Suggs, the strong safety, with a damaged knee.

title: E. R. Beckwith Jr., A Drug Consultant And Publisher, 58
description: Edmund R. Beckwith Jr., the president of Squibb Pharmaceutical Company from 1966 to 1968, died Saturday of lung cancer at Princeton (N. J.) Medical Center. He wag 58 years old and lived at 1888 Stuart Road, West in Princeton.

title: SNAG SEEN IN BID TO ALTER ATTORNEY GENERAL'S POST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (AP)President Carter's campaign pledge to remove the Attorney General from political pressures is running into constitutional problems, according to the President's chief legal adviser, Robert J. Lipshutz. The White House lawyer said that Justice Department researchers had found that the plan to separate the Attorney General from the President could not be carried out under current law.

title: Miss Loren and Mastroianni Light Screen as a Team in 'Special Day'
description: Antonietta and Gabriele make an extremely unlikely couple. She's an overworked, barely literate housewife, the mother of six, a woman with a drawn face and the haggard expression of someone who's long since given up on what she looks like, but she accepts her lot, which includes a talking mynah bird that can't even get her name right. She is, however, an enthusiastic supporter of Mussolini, who is, for Antonietta, both a savior and a sex symbol. She keeps a scrapbook on his life.Gabriele is a fastidious bachelor, intelligent, sensitive and sardonic, and he's at the end of his rope. He's been cashiered from his job as an announcer on the government-sponsored radio station because he's suspected of being degenerate, that is, homosexual, which he is. In Italy in 1938, homosexuals were rounded up and packed off to Sardinia, where they couldn't contaminate the Fascist culture.In Ettore Scola's funny, humane "A Special Day"an acting tour de force for Sophia Loren and Marcello MastroianniAntonietta and Gabriele are never really a couple, but their brief encounter lights up the screen with the kind of radiance you get only from great movie actors who also are great stars."A Special Day," which opened yesterday at the Beekman Theater, takes place on the day of Hitler's 1938 state visit to Rome, where he was given a gigantic, hysterically enthusiastic reception by Mussolini, the King, the diplomatic corps, leading Italian industrialists (whose names are still familiar) and 90 percent of the city's population and a military parade that lasted almost as long as Mussolini's campaign in Ethiopia.After packing off her six children and her husband (all properly uniformed) to attend the rally, Antonietta sets about to clean up the debris within the cramped apartment when Rosamunda, the mynah bird, escapes and flies to the other side of the courtyard of the now-empty apartment block. This is the device that brings Antonietta and Gabriele together for almost two hours of comic and touching confidences, arguments and self-searching that lead, eventually, to a love scene that is simultaneously ecstatic and forlorn. It's something, I suspect, that only Miss Loren and Mr. Mastroianni could bring off so triumphantly."A Very Special Day" is pure theatrical contrivance, and this is part of the pleasure as we watch two extraordinary performers test themselves, take risks, find unexpected pockets of humor and pathos in characters that one doesn't easily associate with the public personality.Miss Loren is magnificent in the best role she's had since "Two Women," for which she won an Academy Award. Of the two stars, she has a slightly easier time of it in that in the film's earlier scenes the character is presented to us in context, within the bosom of her uproarious family and in relation to her self-important, macho, peanut-brained husband, played by John Vernon.Mr. Mastroianni has a somewhat more difficult time of it if only because we seem him isolated from any social-psychological landscape that might define the man he is. We have to take him at his word, but because we bring to any Mastroianni performance the memories of so many earlier ones, it's initially difficult to accept Gabriele as the distraught, suicidal homosexual he is supposed to be.Once the two characters have been brought together, though, and the revelations revealed, the movie takes off in the sort of breathtaking display of teamwork I associate with Hepburn and Tracy, Lunt and Fontanne and, of course, Loren and Mastroianni in "Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow" and "Marriage, Italian-Style."They don't do it all by themselves. Mr. Scola, who was responsible for "We All Loved Each Other So Much" earlier this year, has provided them with good, sometimes quite extravagant material to work with. The screenplay, which he wrote with Ruggero Maccari and, say the credits, "in collaboration with Maurizio Costanzo," is full of wit and feeling even when we're aware of facile ironies.But for all the facility, which certainly isn't bad in itself, "A Special Day" has a solid foundation in honesty. This is no middle-aged "Tea and Sympathy." The encounter doesn't turn Gabriele into a straight or Antonietta into an anti-Fascist bomb-thrower. It enriches their lives, which, on a somewhat smaller scale, is what this film does.

title: Faring Well On the New London Flights
description: ALL'S FARE in travel today, with the focus on the 11 P.M. takeoff of the inaugural flight of Skytrain service of Britain's Laker Airways. Rock bottom is the price ($135 oneway from Kennedy Airport to Gatwick, with a train leaving every 15 minutes for London); and equally downtoearth is the service up in the air. The 345 passengers who may fill the planes on a firstcome, firstticketed basis can buy food once aboard, but are also welcome to bring their own. The four other airlines that have been permitted since Sept. 15 to take standby passengers to London on regular flights for $146 ($256 roundtrip) are Trans World Airlines, Pan American World Airways, British Airways and Air India. They serve the standbys the same menu they serve regular passengers. For those who are interested in eating high on the hog while aloft on a low budget, here are some suggestions from Craig Claiborne, as well as some tips for getting the most at journey's end in London.

title: MARCHAIS SAYS REDS STILL WANT ALLIANCE
description: PARIS, Sept. 25Aware of widespread disappointment among voters on the left at the breakdown of the SocialistCommunist alliance, the French Communist Party leader, Georges Marchais, insisted tonight: We still want an agreement, we still want to win the elections, we still want Communist ministers in the government.

title: Carey and Marchi Ask Laws to Avert Willowbrook Crisis
description: Both Governor Carey's Democratic state administration and a key Senate Republican leader are urging new legislation to widen the hiring power of the Commissioner of Mental Hygiene. The aim is to Avert any layoffsand a possible strikeat the Willowbrook Developmental Center on Staten Island.

title: Better Business Unit Says Graham Group Did Not Send Data
description: WASHINGTON,Sept. 25 (UPI)The Council of Better Business Bureaus has been trying unsuccessfully for four years to get financial information about the Billy Graham Evangelistic Association, council official said today.

title: The Pennant Race
description: REMAINING GAMES

title: Film Festival Brings Animation Into a Needed Sharper Focus
description: In adding an animation festival to its offerings for the first time, the New York Film Festival is not so much breaking new ground as it is bringing a fuzzy scene into sharp focus. The move is logical. After all, a variety of short subjects were. scattered through previous festivals. And the Film Society of Lincoln Center, sponsors of the showings, also have had gratifying, experiences with programs, of shorts in our public parks in the last few years.

title: ContraryMinded Meet In Vermont This Week
description: VERGENNES, Vt., Sept. 25 (AP)A group that calls itself the Contrarians will be descending on Vermont later this week from all parts of the United States and Canada for the 15th annual Contrary Opinion Forum. Their credo is When everybody thinks alike, everyone is likely to be wrong.

title: Suspect in Israel Asks Extradition
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 25 (Reuters)A West German on trial in Israel for complicily in an alleged abortive missile attack on; an Israeli airliner at Nairobi airport in January 1975 has appealed to German courts for extradition to West Germany the newspaper Maariv reported today. Itsaid two Israeli lawyers briefed by the: German, Brigitte Schultz, 24 years old were in Bonn to file the appeal.

title: Vesco Still in Costa Rica, 3 Months After Being Requested to Leave
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Sept. 23More than three months after President Daniel Oduber Quires asked him to leave Costa Rica, the fugitive American financier, Robert L. Vesco, is showing no sign of preparing to move out of this tiny Central American republic.

title: KATHERINE BEALL REYNAL, PHOTOGRAPHER, WAS 72
description: Katherine Beall Reynal, photographer, painter and former associate fashion editor of Vogue magazine, died Saturday at her home in Manhattan after a short illness. She was 72 years old.

title: Film Festival Today
description: MIXED MOODS AND MINDSCAPES. 15 shorts, running from 1 to 10 minutes each. characterized by Surrealistic and dreamlike effets. 3:15 at Alice Tully Hall. $2, $1.50 by subscription.

title: Soviet Joins the U.S. in Pledging Observance of Lapsing Arms Pact
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 25The Soviet Union today pledged tacit observance of the 1972 treaty on the limitation of strategic arms even after it expires on Oct. 3.

description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: The Senate Gambles on Energy
description: The President's energy programadopted with modest changes by the House last monthrelies primarily on conservation. But the Senate has other ideas. The Senate bill, emerging from various committees, discards a number of proposed conservation incentives in favor of a strategy to expand domestic oil and gas supplies. This may prove politically popularconservation, after all, would mean sacrifice. But it is risky. If new energy supplies fail to materialize, avoiding sacrifice today will mean even greater dependence on Arab oil tomorrow.

description: Percentage gains in prices for the components of The Financial Times's 30share index since the market's low, Jan. 6, 1975:

title: Rams Roll, 200, Over Eagles; Namath Shines
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 25Peace of mind, at least for a while, was restored to the Los Angeles Rams today as their famous defense overwhelmed the Philadelphia Eagles and Joe Namath directed a crisp offense to a 200 victory.

title: Events Today
Lance, Disclaiming Bitterness, Says His Plans Are Uncertain
description: CALHOUN, Ga., Sept. 25Bert Lance said today that he had not thought about his longrange future and had made no plans beyond a return trip to Washington tonight, a party there tomorrow for the staff he led as director of the Office of Management and Budget, and two speeches later this week.

title: OverCounter Supplementary Listings
description: Week ended Sept. 23, 1977

title: John Wood Dominates A Lopsided 'Tartuffe
description: Not until nearly halfway through Tartuffe does the protagonist appear amid the wreckage of the household he has taken over. It must be one of the most thoroughly prepared entrances in stage literature. Up to that point the othe characters have done little but talk about him.

title: Sunbelt Boom Reported Matched By Intermountain State Growth
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Sept. 25 (AP)The population and economic boom in the Sunbelt is being matched by recent gains in the intermountain states that straddle the Rocky Mountains, experts on regional development say.

title: Peter Evans Is Cast In Mamet's New Play
description: Peter Evans, who was warmly praised for his performance as Richie, the young soldier unsure of his sexual identity in David Rabe's Streamers, has been signed to act with Ellis Rabb in David Mamet's twocharacter play A Life in the Theater. He will portray an eager, novi?? actor to Mr. Rabb's older, cynical trouper.

title: Rites for Black South African Turn Into Protest by 10,000
description: KINGWILLIAMSTOWN, South Africa, Sept. 25Stephen Biko was buried in muddy plot beside the railroad tracks here today after a marathon funeral that was as much a protest rally against the white minority Government's racial poli cies as a commemoration of the country's foremost young black leader.

title: Yankees Records
Sherman Lollar, an ExCatcher For White Sox, Is Dead at 53
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo. Sept. 25 (UPI)Sherman Lollar, a standout catcher for 18 major league seasons, most of them with the Chicago White Sox died last night of cancer. He was 53 years old.

title: 17 Attend Convention Of Antitax Coalition
description: LYNDHURST, Sept. 24  Only 17 delegates attended today what was billed as the first state convention of the new Independent Party, formed by a coalition of the Tax Revolt Association and other New Jersey taxpayer groups that are antitax and antispending.

title: NEW YORK REJECTED IN EFFORT TO BE HOST FOR 1984 OLYMPICS
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Sept. 25Los Angeles, withstanding a strong challenge by New York, was selected today as the American city to bid for the 1984 Summer Olympics. The selection virtually assured that the games would be held there.

title: Kin of Selassie, Torn by Fears, Resettle in U.S.
description: Sadness plagued the greatgrandchildren of the late Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia yesterday as they prepared to continue a journey that had brought them from their homeland, once their ancestor's opulent seat of power, to a dingy hotel on the East Side of New York.

title: Nancy Feingold Is Bride
description: Nancy Fay Feingold, a child psychologist at the Marlboro (Mass.) Mental Health Center,. was married yesterday to Dr. Allen Jay Palmer, a child psychiatrist at the Judge Baker Guidance Center in Boston. The ceremony was performed in Temple Emanuel in Worcester, Mass., by Rabbi Stanley M. Davids. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Saul S. Feingold of Worcester. Dr. Palmer's parents are Charles Palmer of Flushing, Queens, and the late Dora Palmer.

title: TURKS SAID TO BUY U.S. ARMS THROUGH A NATO AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (UPI)Representative Les Aspin said today that Turkey had been able to circumvent Congressional arms limitations and buy millions of dollars worth of Americanmade military equipment through an obscure NATO agency in Europe.

title: Books of The Times
description: Rebecca West has accomplished the difficult, and I should have thought the impossible: She has sent me back to the Confessions of St. Augustine, back, as it were, to that wretched pear tree, looking for the partridge I never found in my youth. Dame Rebecca is now 85 years old; her short book, St Augustine, was published in 1933, long before it occurred to anybody to hoke up a new category of letters called psychobiography. As usual, she was ahead of her times. St. Augustine is psychobiography with style. It suggests that when Augustine abandoned his mistress for the monastery, the West lost a great imaginative writer and gained a lot of unnecessary guilt about sexual and other matters.

title: Boy Killed and 35 Injured as Bus Crashes
description: NEWTOWN, Conn., Sept. 25 (AP)A 4yearold boy was killed and 35 persons were injured today when a chartered bus carrying a Brooklyn group to a religious shrine ran off a highway near here, the state police said.

title: Advertising
description: On Oct. 18. Archa O. Knowlton, director of media services of General Foods, and David Braun, who will replace him in that job on Nov. 1, will give a joint presentation to the Advertising Research Foundation's fall conference here.

title: Indians Stun Baltimore as Griffin, Carty Star
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 25 (UPI)Alfredo Griffin doubled home two runs in the fifth inning and Rico Carty hit a threerun homer in the seventh as the Cleveland Indians defeated Baltimore, 94, today, damaging the Orioles hopes in the East Division race.

title: Malfunction Closes Nuclear Plant
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Sept. 25 (AP)A valve malfunction in testing at a new Toledo Edison nuclear power station near Oak Harbor, Ohio, has suspended operations at the installation for about two weeks, an official said yesterday. James Grant, the spokesman, said that a relief valve failed to close last night in a test of equipment at the DavisBesse Nuclear Power Station. Plant safety systems functioned as designed, and there was no personnel ??osure to or release of radioactwo materials into the environment, Mr. Grant said.

description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 25Well, said the Jets new president, Jim Kensil, 'last year it would have been 400.

description: To the Editor:

title: High Court Justices Begin Deciding This Week Which of 1,500 Cases They Will Take
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 25The nine Justices of the Supreme Court will begin deciding tomorrow which of 1,500 pending legal disputes are important enough for them to review and resolve in their 197778 term.

title: Skytrain Ride to London Begins With Bedrolls on a Queens Corner
description: The new air war over the Atlantic opened at 8:30 Friday night, when a California teenager unrolled his sleeping bag on a sidewalk in Queens in front of Laker Airway's Skytrain ticket office and settled in to wait almost 56 hours to buy a $135 ticket to London.

title: P. Shaw Sprague, ExChairman Of Coal and Oil Firm, Dies at 76
description: P. Shaw Sprague, who retired in 1969 as chairman of C. H. Sprague & Son, coal and oil wholesalers in Boston and New York City, a company established by his grandfather, died Friday in Portland, Me. He was 76 years old and lived in Paim Beach, Fla., and Cape Elizabeth, Me.

title: Failure to Attract Olympic Games Is Tied to Stand by Grant of Mets
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Sept. 25A number of factors contributed to the decision by the United States Olympic Committee to select Los Angeles over New York City as its choice for the 1984 Olympic Games'New York's uncertain financial situation, conflict over leasing Shea Stadium, a low budgetary projection by the West Coast city and its clearcut edge in training facilities.

title: The U.N. Today
World News Briefs
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Sept 25 (Reuters)Rhodesian guerrilla leaders said today they would go on fighting if the latest BritishAmerican peace plans were put into force in their present form.

title: Approval Is Subject to Several Conditions
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 25Prompted by Prime Minister Menahem Begin, the Israeli Cabinet today approved an American proposal calling for a single unified Arab delegation, including Palestinians, at the opening session of a Geneva peace conference.

title: U.S. Official Ends Soviet Visit
description: MOSCOW, Sept 25 (Reuters)The United States Housing and Urban Development Secretary, Patricia Harris, left for New York today after a weeklong visit to attend a session of the SovietAmerican Joint Commission on Housing Development.

description: Article 2  No Title

title: Number of Adults Who Live Alone Reported at 15.5 Million in Census
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (UPI)  The number of men living alone has increased 60 percent in the last seven years and the number of women living by themselves is up 35 percent, the Census Bureau reported today.

title: Byrne Preparing Response to Plan By Bateman to Eliminate State Tax
description: TRENTON, Sept. 25 (UPI)Governor Byrne met with his advisers and top campaign officials this weekend to draft a response to the tax plan proposed last week by his Republican opponent in the gubernatorial race, State Senator Raymond H. Bateman of Somerville.

title: Scarcity of Fishin New York Waters Tied to High Level of Metal Pollution
description: A study by marine biologists has found that a season for the scarcity of fish in the fishing grounds of two bodies of water in the metropolitan New York area the apex of the New York Bight and Long Island Soundis contamination by extraordinarily high levels of heavy metals.

title: A RHODE ISLAND TERMINAL  FOR LNG IMPORTS OPPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (UPI)  The Federal Power Commission staff has formally recommended making Rhode Island the site of a major liquefied natural gas import terminal, drawing a shocked response from the state's governor.

title: F.E.A. to Report Gas Supply Good, But Analysts Stress Underlying Ills
description: The Federal Energy Administration is expected to release today a report saying that residential customers can expect sufficient supplies of natural gas throughout the coming heating season, even if the winter develops into another exceptionally cold one.

title: THOUSANDS WELCOME VIETNAM DELEGATES
description: With an explosion of emotion yesterday, Vietnam's new delegation to the United Nations was greeted by thousands of its American friends and supporters, many of whom had opposed the United States involvement in Indochina. In songs and speeches they suggested that a new, more harmonious, era between the two countries was about to begin.

title: CHARLES A. STONEHAM
description: EATONTOWN, N.J., Sept. 25 (AP)Charles A. Stoneman, a former scout and general manager for the San Francisco Giants farm system, died today at Riverview Hospital in Red Bank. He was 64 years old.

title: Right to Clean Air Is at Stake In Case of a Malodorous Business
description: One of the newestyet oldestenvironmental rights, the right to breathe air uncontaminated by foul odors, is at stake in an unusual pollution case that began winding its way through the New York court system last week.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An audit by state Comptroller Arthur Levitt's office found that Jamie Towers, a 624unit MitchellLama cooperative in the Bronx, was faced with problems so serious as to place in doubt its continuing financial viability. The report said that like similar housing developments around the state, Jamie Towers was in trouble because the state's Division of Housing and Community Renewal failed to authorize adequate rent increases and failed to explain to the cooperators just how serious the situation had become.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Major League Scores
description: By The Associated Press (Based on 450 or more times at bat)

title: EaglesRams Scoring
Rain, Rain, Rain and More Is on the Way
description: Steady rains drubbed a daylong tatoo on an already rainsoaked New York metropolitan area yesterday, flooding highways, snarling traffid and washing out street festivals, concerts and other outdoor events on a gloomy first weekend of autumn.

title: Commercial Paper Futures Join a Surging Market
description: The Chicago Board of Trade, the world's oldest and largest market for commodity futures, deals in contracts for such traditional commodities as wheat, soybeans, gold, plywood, and iced broilersor fresh chickens packed in ice.

title: TwittyLynn Show Offers Pure Country Music
description: The Conway TwittyLoretta Lynn show, which gave five performances at the Westbury (L.I.) Music Fair over the weekend, made the best possible case for the durable charms and broad appeal of country music. The Music Fair, which is usually given over to performers of the Las Vegas persuasion, became a kind of country music shrine as fans drove in from as far away as Canada.

title: Boston Group Plays the Music of Paris in 1920's
description: A program of music from the Paris of the 20's might seem like a bright idea. and indeed there were a number or things to enjoy Saturday night when the Boston Group, a chamber ensemble from that city, made its New York debut at the Truck and Warehouse Theater, 79 East Fourth Street (the program will be repeated tonight).

title: RULES FOR PRESCRIPTION ON SOME VITAMINS ENDED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (UPI)After four years of public dispute and court battles, the Government has dropped its attempt to require a doctor's prescription for high potency doses of vitamins A and D. The health food industry, which had fought the Government, hailed the decision as a victory for consumer freedom of choice.

title: GiantsCowboys Scoring
Lillian Carter Gets Peace Prize Of American Syna4oue Council
description: Lillian Carter's contributions to the furtherance of international understanding, justice and peace were cited last night when she became the first woman to receive the Covenant of Peace Prize of the Synagogue Council of America.

title: Chess:
description: The late Paul Keres promulgated a method for combating the Ruy Lopez that is still in dispute. Beginning with such close defenses as the Tchigorin or the Steinitz deferred, which are based on maintaining the black pawn at K4 as a solid bulwark, the Estonian grandmaster would pick a surprising moment to reverse his strategy.

title: American Cyanamid Completes Waste Water Treatment Plant
description: The American Cyanamid Company has completed its $22.4 million waste water treatment plant at its Bound Brook, N.J., organic chemicals production complex. Incorporating modern technology for pollution abatement, the new plant is according to James G. Affleck, president, the largest of its kind for chemical waste treatment in the United States.

title: Motorists in Nigeria Again Face the Whip
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Sept. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)Traffic authorities here are reintroducing roadside whippings for traffic offenders, the chairman of the city's traffic committee announced. The practice was discontinued nine months ago.

title: Jane Blalock Takes Coast Golf on 282
description: ALAMO, Calif., Sept. 25 (AP)Jane Blalock, who had been questioning her ability to win again, rallied from two shots off the pace today and won the $100,000 women's pro golf tournament here.

title: PAUL RONDER, FILM MAKER AND BROOKLYN PROFESSOR
description: Paul Ronder, a film maker and an associate professor at Brooklyn College, died Saturday in his home at 78 Riverside Drive. He was 37 years old.

title: SOMALI FORCE REPORTED FIGHTING AROUND HARAR
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Sept. 25 (UPI)A Somali communique reported today that Somali insurgents had inflicted heavy losses on Ethiopian troops in heavy fighting around the ancient walled city of Harar, one of Ethiopia's major strongholds north of the contested Ogaden region.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 26, 1977

title: Rites for Black South African Turn Into Protest by 10,000
description: KINGWILLIAMSTOWN, South Africa, Sept. 25Stephen Biko was buried in muddy plot beside the railroad tracks here today after a marathon funeral that was as much a protest rally against the white minority Government's racial policies as a commemoration of the country's foremost young black leader.

title: Belmont Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Catholics Are Reported Matching NonCatholics on Birth Control
description: Married Roman Catholic women have moved farther away from Church doctrine on birth control in recent years and now show little difference from nonCatholics in their contraceptive practices, according to the latest national fertility study.

title: State U. Accused by Professors of Unfair Dismissals
description: The American Association of University Professors has accused the State University of New York of dismissing more than 100 faculty members without demonstrating that the dismissals were necessary for economic reasons.

title: Carey Torn by a Problem of His Design: Koch or Cuomo?
description: State Senator John D. Calandora, a Republican who is known for his bluntness, told Mario M. Cuomo publicly at a meeting of ItalianAmericans For Political and Educational Action last week what many politicians had been saying privately:

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 26, 1977

title: The Conflict in Southern Lebanon: Israel Seems on the Offensive Against Palestinian's
description: BEIRUT, Sept. 25Southern Lebanon is a strange land with contiguous pockets of war and peace, pockets of Palestinian control and Israeli control.

title: Vilas, Tested By Proisy, Gains Final.
description: PARIS, Sept. 25 (AP)A mistakeprone Guillermo Vika, the United States and French open champion, overcame France's Patrick Proisy today, 36, 62, 57, 61, 62 in the semifinals of the Poree Cup.

title: Deborah Wolf Wed to Lawrence Waxman, Lawyer
description: Deborah Marilyn Wolf, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry J. Wolf of Fresh Meadows, Queens, was married yesterday to Lawrence David Waxman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Waxman of Great Neck, L.I. Rabbi Ephraim Wolf performed the ceremony in the Great Neck Synagogue.

title: In Memoriam
description: SCHWARTZMaurice & Beniamin. Happy, birthday in heaven. All our love. Ada and Paul

title: Meryl Nadel Is Bride on L.I. Of Dr. Melvin K. Spigelman
description: Meryl Nadel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Nadel of Greenvale, LI., was married yesterday in Temple Beth Sholom in Roslyn Heights, L.I., to Dr. Melvin Kalman Spigelman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Izak Spigelman of Providence, R.I. Rabbi Joseph P.. Sternstein perlormed the ceremony.

title: DISSIDENT TEAMSTERS SEEK VOTING CHANGE
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 25Teamsters for a Democratic Union, a small, reformminded group, plans to make the direct election of international officers a major issue in its effort to win attention from the two million members of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Credit Markets Expect Trend Of Rising Rates
description: The Federal Reserve, continuing to respond to explosive growth in the nation's money supply, pushed interest rates higher last week, and Wall Street's bond dealers expect the trend to continue.

title: Soviet Launches 4Nation Satellite
description: MOSCOW, Sept 25 (Reuters)The Soviet Union, in cooperation with three other Communist countries, has launched a new research satellite to study streams of tiny meteorites that pass through space near the earth, the Tass press agency reported today. The satellite, Intercos mos17, was put into earth orbit yesterday from a Soviet launching site carrying scientific equipment of the Soviet Union, Czechoslovakia, Hungary and Rumania.

title: Repairing Egypt's MIG's
description: The Administration's proposal for American technicians to help service some 200 Sovietbuilt MIG21 interceptor planes now wasting away on Egyptian airfields is a symbol of the increasing complexity of this country's involvement in the politics of the Middle East. It also makes good sense.

title: DEVELOPING NATIONS EXPECTED TO PRESS FOR TOP I.M.F. POST
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 25Developing countries, expressing grievances over the way world monetary and trading arrangements seem tilted against them, are trying to make their weight felt in the councils that coordinate the world economy.

title: Where to Go In London
description: LONDONAnnabel's is in decline. Biba's has closed its doors. Beauchamp Place is overrun with pantssuited tourists. Where does London swing in 1977? And how can the visitor, disgorged by Skytrain at Gatwick airport, get clued into London fast?

title: Two Escaped Trusties Abduct A Woman From Virginia Farm
description: WAVERLY, Va., Sept.25 (AP)Tw prison trusties abducted a woman from her farmhouse after they tied up two men with ropes and locked her children in a granary, the police said.

title: Yanks Win, 150, 20, And Lead by 3 Games.
description: TORONTO, Sept. 25Overcoming rain, fog and the pestiferous Toronto Blue Jays, the Yankees stormed to a double shutout today and jumped to within sight of their second straight division title.

description: Horses listed In order of post positions

title: Yankees Box Scores
Raiders Pin A 167 Loss On Steelers
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 25The Raiders and the Steelers, who had slugged each other in the figurative alleys of the National Football League in the past, played standard football here at Three Rivers Stadium today, and the Oakland team, the champions, played that brand the best.

title: 50 on Boat in Nile Drown
description: CAIRO, Sept. 25 (Reuters)About 50 people, including 20 children, drowned when a ferryboat capsized after colliding with a barge on the Nile River near Cairo yesterday, the semiofficial newspaper A1 Ahram reported today.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list scheduled for weak follows:

title: Chance In Rhodesia
description: The BritishAmerican peace plan for Rhodesia is likely to pass a first test this week, limited but potentially significant. The United Nations Security Council will probably agree to send a special representative out to try to arrange a ceasefire between the Rhodesian Army and African guerrillas.

title: ARMED MAN SURRENDERS AFTER 2 HOSTAGES FLEE
description: NEWTON, Mass..Sept. 25 (AP)A man armed with two rifles and a handgun sur; rendered to the police today after two women, one of whom had been bound,! escaped from him in an apartment building, the police said. The women, who the police declined to identify, were not hurt.

title: HERZOG PLANS TO OPPOSE ATTACKS IN U.N. SESSION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 25 Chaim Herzog, Israel's chief delegate, says he expects a bumper crop of resolutions against Israel to be produced at the current General Assembly session that could spoil prospects for a renewed Middle East peace conference in Geneva.

title: NEW YORK REJECTED IN EFFORT TO BE HOST FOR 1984 OLYMPICS
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Sept. 25LOs Angeles, withstanding a strong challenge by New York, was selected today as the American city to bid for the 1984 Summer Olympics. The selection virtually assured that the games would be held there.

title: ITALIAN FAR LEFTISTS HOLD ANTIRED RALLY
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Sept. 25Tens of thousands of young demonstrators today ended a threeday peaceful protest here against the Italian Communist Party's cooperation with the country's capitalist Government.

title: Debbie Ellen Schwartz Wed to Stephen Honig
description: The marriage of Debbie Ellen Schwartz, daughter of Judge Louis Schwartz of the Superior Court of New Jersey and Mrs. Schwartz of Clifton, N.J., to Steven Honig took place yesterday in the Tavern on the Green in New York. Rabbi A. Bruce Goldman performed the ceremony.

title: Youth Drowns Off Long Branch
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., Sept. 25 (UPI)A Tarrytown, N. Y., teenager attending a weekend religious meeting apparently drowned while swmming with friends, authorities said. The polic.e said Luke Arduilo, 19 years old, was about 50 yards off shore when he cried for help and disappeared into the surf yesterday. Mr. Arduilo, a student at the College of St. Vincent in Riverdale, the Bronx, was among 40 students attending a weekend religious meeting in this shore community.

title: Issue and Debate
description: More than 40,000 nickels, plus an alleged threat by two major corporations to withdraw their employees from Blue Cross and Blue Shield plans, are weapons in the skirmish over legislation to create a Federal Agency for Consumer Protection.

title: Recital: Schubert, Pianist, Excels
description: Lawrence Schubert, a pupil of Morton Estrin. who performed Saturday afternoon at Town Hall. proved to be a skilled Romantic pianist with a distinctive lyrical gift and an active intelligence.

title: The issue: How is history relevant?
description: spiritual national characteristics. But it is significant that the fortunate immigrants who spread across this conti nent built not only factories but schoolhouses, free and public, not only mills butof the same brickindependent colleges, not only jails butof the same granitecourthouses, however troubled and beset with doubt these institutions may now be.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 (UN)  The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence will look into the reported disappearance of a former sergeant of the United States

title: Abstract 'Romeo' Danced in Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH,Sept. 25  A writer of detective fiction would possibly call it The Case of the Missing Director. But John Gilpin, the artistic director of the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater, was not exactly missing this opening weekend of the company's season at Heinz Hall, as much as he was Mysteriously absent.
